Once spotted the Pech'ra alerts its handler to their prey's presence with shrill cries and low swooping dives ensuring its handler can quickly dispatch the target and preventing them from being able to seek shelter.
skills: Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Stealth 8, Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Good Omen
bonuses.description: Threats with the KROOT Keyword within 2m of the Kroothawk gain +1 bonus dice to all Tests.

bonuses.name: Skirmisher
bonuses.description: Reflexive attacks made against this Threat suffer a +2 DN Penalty.

name: KNARLOC
description:
Sinuous muscles ripple beneath the smooth skin of the Knarloc, and every part of its anatomy seems designed for one purpose: to kill. Their fearsome beak can crunch through Space Marine armour, their talons rip Imperial guardsmen limb from limb, and their muscular legs propel them into battle even across the roughest of terrain. Their cunning makes these predators even more terrifying, as they are perhaps second only to the Kroot Carnivores and their shapers in intelligence among the myriad Kroot lines. Finally, as if one Knarloc wasn't a grim enough prospect, they typically hunt in packs of half a dozen or more.

Knarlocs fulfil a role that would be taken up by light tanks in other forces, and due to them having evolved as apex predators in the jungles of Pech, can traverse difficult terrain more easily and stealthily than any mechanised vehicle.
skills: Athletics 8, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Bonded Rider
bonuses.description: A Knarloc is typically ridden by a bonded rider, who uses the statistics of a Kroot Carnivore. The bonded rider may take actions as normal while mounted, and can be targeted separately to the Knarloc. If the bonded rider is killed or otherwise removed from the Knarloc during combat, COMPLICATION: Riderless immediately activates.

bonuses.name: Loping Stride
bonuses.description: When this Threat runs or charges, they have Speed 20 instead of Speed 14.

bonuses.name: Second Strike
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

bonuses.name: Thunderous Pounce
bonuses.description: This Threat gains +2 Strength when it charges.

abilities.name: Riderless
abilities.description: The Knarloc must make a DN 1 Willpower Test. If it fails, it throws off its rider if it has one, and immediately becomes Frenzied, attempting to violently destroy all enemies in sight. The Frenzied Condition ends if all the Knarloc's enemies are destroyed or no longer visible, or if an individual with the KROOT Keyword succeeds on a DN 4 Leadership Test, at which point the Kroot may mount the Knarloc using their movement.

name: GREAT KNARLOC
description:
What could be more terrible to encounter in battle than a Knarloc? To the dismay of the Imperial guard, the Kroot bloodlines provide an answer: the Great Knarloc, four-times the size and ten-times the weight of its smaller cousin. Fortunately, these beasts don't form hunting packs as their smaller brethren do.

Kroot handlers don't shy away even from taming these distant evolutionary relatives, and young Great Knarlocs reared in captivity are surprisingly docile. To the Kroot, they are often most useful as beasts of burden — with their enormous strength and seemingly endless endurance, they can carry entire Kroot encampments from place to place, through even the roughest terrain. Great Knarlocs are thus central to the amazing self-sufficiency and mobility of Kroot armies on campaign.

This is not to say that Kroot wouldn't unleash the terrible fury of Great Knarlocs. Even tamed ones are prone to unpredictable bouts of aggression, which is why they are always kept muzzled and chained — right up until battle, when they are goaded towards the enemy. For these occasions, the Kroot mount heavy weapons on their backs — even though they can rip open battle tanks perfectly well with their beaks.
skills: Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Weapon Skill 8

bonuses.name: Baggage Harness
bonuses.description: Threats within 2m of the Great Knarloc can gain 1 Reload for a weapon with the KROOT Keyword as a free action by pulling them from the Great Knarloc' Baggage Harness.

bonuses.name: Crushing Strike
bonuses.description: When this Threat charges, all individuals within 2m must make a DN 3 Initiative Test or suffer 1d6 Mortal Wounds.

bonuses.name: Handlers
bonuses.description: The Great Knarloc is typically ridden by two handlers, who use the statistics of Kroot Carnivores. One handler may take actions as normal, while the other operates the Kroot Bolt Thrower. The Kroot Carnivores can be targeted separately to the Great Knarloc. If both handlers die or are otherwise removed from the Great Knarloc, COMPLICATION: Lost Control immediately activates.

bonuses.name: Loping Stride
bonuses.description: When this Threat runs or charges, they have Speed 20 instead of Speed 14.

abilities.name: Great Knarloc Roar
abilities.description: All opponents of the Great Knarloc must make a DN 5 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Kroot Bolt Thrower
abilities.stats: 16 +3 ED / AP -1 / Range 18 - 36 - 54 / Salvo 1 / Assault, Brutal, Heavy (10)

abilities.name: Lost Control
abilities.description: Whenever the Greater Knarloc or one of its handlers rolls a Complication, the Greater Knarloc becomes Frenzied. While Frenzied, the Great Knarloc will attempt to kill and eat everything in sight, including its own handlers if there are no other suitable individuals within 10m. An individual with the KROOT Keyword can attempt a DN 8 Leadership Test to calm a Frenzied Great Knarloc, and may then mount it using their movement.

name: VESPID STRAIN LEADER
description:
Vespid society is organised along typical hierarchal lines and further subdivided into so-called 'strains', each of which is controlled by one individual: the strain leader. This highly hierarchical structure serves the T'au well, as it means that not every individual has to be convinced separately of the Greater Good — once a strain leader is on their side, so are all the other Vespid under their direction. This also means that the T'au only have to provide their high-tech communion helmets to the strain leaders — a good thing, as they are difficult to produce.

The strain leaders guide other Vespid in battle, relaying the wishes of T'au commanders to every individual in their own language, which has proven so impenetrable to outsiders. Except for this communion helmet, strain leaders are not better equipped and are indistinguishable from other Vespid — for all their strict hierarchy, the Vespid seem to be a strangely egalitarian society. This, if true, is something they share with the T'au, and it is perhaps the basis of their mutual understanding. What strain leaders provide, however, is a vastly improved level of coordination and reliability to the troops under their command.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 6, Leadership 6, Pilot 6, Survival 6, Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Communion Helmet
bonuses.description: The Vespid Strain Leader can communicate with and receive commands from any Troop with the [T'AU] Keyword. It never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting while there is a Threat with the [T'AU] Keyword within 10m. This bonus also applies to any Vespid Stingwings within 10m of the Vespid Strain Leader.

abilities.name: Neutron Blaster
abilities.stats: 12 +4 ED / AP -3 / Range 9 - 18 - 27 / Salvo 1 / Arc (2), Assault, Melta

abilities.name: Sonic Feedback
abilities.description: Any Vespid Stingwing within 10m of the Vespid Strain Leader becomes Frenzied.

name: VESPID STINGWING
description:
The staple force of the Vespids in T'au war complements, Stingwings are highly mobile, by virtue of their hyper-sonic beating wings. They are deployed in support of T'au units who can keep up with them, such as Crisis Battlesuits, or those in desperate need of mobile anti-armor firepower, such as Pathfinder teams. The Vespid's signature weapon is the neutron blaster, based on their unique crystal technology and blended with T'au ingenuity. This exotic weapon literally strips atoms off its target and while it may slow-acting, its effect is reliable and constant, and neither ceramite nor flesh can withstand it. The neutron blaster is surprisingly light for a weapon with such devastating effect, but can only be operated by Vespid, due to the constant harmonic feedback modulation the crystals require.

A distinct and severe potential difficulty with Stingwings employed in the service of the T'au is the complete and utter impossibility of direct communication with them. Only Vespid Strain Leaders are equipped with the rare Vespid communion helmets, which facilitates understanding. Vespid Stingwings who become isolated from their strain leader can become very confused and, worryingly, even hostile to their allies.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Pilot 6, Survival 5, Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Alien Mind
bonuses.description: When anyone attempts to communicate with or issue a command to a Vespid Stingwing without a Vespid Strain Leader within 10m, they must succeed on a DN 10 Leadership (Wil) Test. On a failure, the Vespid Stingwing is unresponsive. A Complication on the Test causes the Vespid Stingwing to attack whoever made the communication attempt.

abilities.name: Neutron Blaster
abilities.stats: 12 +4 ED / AP -3 / Range 9 - 18 - 27 / Salvo 1 / Arc (2), Assault, Melta

name: DREADNOUGHT
quote: Even in death I still serve.
description:
Rampaging across war zones, Dreadnoughts carve out great swathes of destruction from the enemy ranks, wielding an array of brutal weaponry.

To be interned within the sarcophagus of a Dreadnought is both a great honour and a terrible fate. Returned from the very abyss of death, the remaining biological matter is bonded with the machine spirit of these mighty war machines, allowing them to wage war on the enemies of the Chapter for centuries to come.

The immense size and destructive capabilities of a Dreadnought mean that they are usually reserved for the most fierce and deadly battlefields, however a Player and GM may decide that the return of a deceased Space Marine Agent in the role of a Dreadnought could serve as a poignant and vengeful ending.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Athletics 10, Ballistic Skill 10, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Second Strike
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

abilities.name: Furioso
abilities.description: Whenever this Threat fails a Resolve Test roll 1d6. If you roll an icon, the Dreadnought becomes Frenzied, ignoring any penalties and taking an additional Action.

abilities.name: Plasma Cannon
abilities.stats: 15 +2 ED / AP -3 / Range 18-36-54 / Salvo 3 / Heavy (8), Supercharge

abilities.name: Heavy Bolter
abilities.stats: 12 +2 ED / AP -1 / Range 18-36-54 / Salvo 3 / Brutal, Heavy (4), Rapid Fire (4)

abilities.name: Twin-Linked Lascannon
abilities.stats: 18 +3 ED / AP -3 / Range 24-48-72 / Salvo 1 / Heavy (8), Reliable

abilities.name: Multi-Melta
abilities.stats: 16 +3 ED / AP -4 / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 1 / Heavy (8), Melta

determination: Lightning Reflexes. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: REDEMPTOR DREADNOUGHT
description: It means that the few remaining Absolvers Dreadnoughts are generally deployed well away from other Imperial assets, as they can barely discern friend from foe as they unleash their unbridled fury upon the battlefield. Only once they have rampaged and destroyed everything in sight does their rage subside somewhat, and the Techmarines can begin to attempt the soothing rites that will return these metal leviathans to slumber. When a Dreadnought falls in combat, the Chapter carefully recovers and repairs the chassis, ready for a new occupant. However stoic the next marine proves, it will not be long before they, too, descend into berserker madness.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Athletics 10, Ballistic Skill 10, Weapon Skill 12

bonuses.name: Second Strike
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

abilities.name: Raging Redemption
abilities.description: The Redemptor Dreadnought Seizes the Initiative without spending a point of Ruin and Charges. It gains an additional +2 bonus die to its attack Test as part of the Charge.

abilities.name: Macro Plasma Incinerator
abilities.stats: 18 +3 ED / AP -3 / Range 18-36-54 / Salvo 2 / Heavy (6), Supercharge

abilities.name: Heavy Flamer
abilities.stats: 12 +2 ED / AP -1 / Range 4-8-12 / Salvo 2 / Flamer, Heavy (6)

abilities.name: Storm Bolter
abilities.stats: 10 +1 ED / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 4 / Brutal, Heavy (3), Rapid Fire (3)

determination: Lightning Reflexes. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: BROTHER SGT HOFNIEL
description:
In the brief years since his initiation, Hofniel has served in dozens of conflicts. He earned the rank of Sergeant after only a handful of engagements, when he demonstrated his calm leadership in the heat of combat. During a mission to Persephone's Regret, his Sergeant and several squad members were incapacitated by enemy fire. Hofniel not only completed the mission but even carried the injured to safety, extracting them to ensure they survived for later treatment.

The Sergeant holds the members of Righteous Will to the highest standards. They drill constantly to maintain and expand a series of predefined fire combat drills, which can be adapted to most tactical situations. Hofniel is fluent in rapidly identifying the most appropriate of those for any engagement and issuing commands necessary to execute them. Hofniel trusts his squad to immediately comply, reacting to their actions with transhuman swiftness to account for issues arising from communications break down or deadly environmental conditions. When it comes to their fields of expertise, he expects his battle-brothers to have a knowledge base that goes beyond his own, and does not hesitate to ask for input.
skills: Athletics 4, Awareness 3, Ballistic Skill 6, Intimidation 2, Investigation 1, Leadership 3, Scholar 1, Stealth 4, Survival 2, Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: Talents
bonuses.description: Duty Until Death, Angel of Death, Gilead Combat Veteran

equipment: Astartes Combat Knife, Auspex, Boltgun, Chainsword, 3 Frag Grenades, 3 Krak Grenades, Mk 8 Power Armour

abilities.name: Savage Echoes
abilities.description: You may reroll Double Rank dice once per melee attack Test.

abilities.name: Defender of Humanity
abilities.description: +Rank Icons to any successful attack against a Mob.

abilities.name: Honour the Chapter
abilities.description: This Threat must honour the beliefs and traditions of their Chapter. Increase final Resolve by +1.

abilities.name: Space Marine Implants
abilities.description: You are immune to the Bleeding Condition. You gain +1 bonus die to any Test related to one of the 19 implants if deemed appropriate by the GM.

name: BROTHER PURIEL
description:
As the only member of Righteous Will who is not native to the Gilead System, Brother Puriel recognises that his life experience is decidedly different from his battle-brothers. Puriel was born on the death world Newmann's Folly, where survival depended upon skill at arms and very limited technology. An Absolvers Chaplain recruited him to the Chapter after seeing him battle a massive felinoid in defence of a group of younger children. The Chaplain interceded to save the group from the enormous predator, almost certainly saving their lives. Seeing the child's grit, he brought him back to Castle Grigori to become an aspirant. During Puriel's training, he demonstrated such an affinity for close combat that several trainers expressed concern for his susceptibility to the Red Thirst.

Puriel has served the Absolvers for nearly a century, a significant portion of which was spent as a dedicated member of an Assault Squad. Within Righteous Will, he serves as the primary melee combat specialist. He revels in the visceral feel of hand-to-hand combat, preferring to use his chainsword over any ranged weapons. In tactical discussions, Puriel advocates strongly for melee approaches and routinely advocates for plans that focus upon a stealthier approach that includes close combat. He feels that this is the purest way to dispense the Emperor's judgement. While he also advocates that focusing on close combat preserves necessary resources, even he would have to admit that this is not his primary motive.
skills: Athletics 5, Awareness 4, Ballistic Skill 5, Intimidation 3, Stealth 3, Survival 1, Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Talents
bonuses.description: Gilead Combat Veteran, Whirlwind of Rage

equipment: Astartes Combat Knife, Chainsword, 3 Frag Grenades, Hand Flamer, Mk 8 Power Armour

abilities.name: Savage Echoes
abilities.description: You may reroll Double Rank dice once per melee attack Test.

abilities.name: Defender of Humanity
abilities.description: +Rank Icons to any successful attack against a Mob.

abilities.name: Honour the Chapter
abilities.description: This Threat must honour the beliefs and traditions of their Chapter. Increase final Resolve by +1.

abilities.name: Space Marine Implants
abilities.description: You are immune to the Bleeding Condition. You gain +1 bonus die to any Test related to one of the 19 implants if deemed appropriate by the GM.

name: BROTHER BRIATHOS
description:
With nearly a decade of service as a member of Righteous Will, Brother Briathos is the longest standing member of the Kill Team. During those years, he has seen all the other members lost — some to reassignment and others to the vagaries of war. Throughout his time, his primary focus has remained the study and execution of the Codex Astartes. Briathos has exceptionally strong feelings, even by Adeptus Astartes standards, about internalising Guilliman's writings and applying them to all things. This application goes far beyond military matters, extending to all phases of life, including routine discussions with the fellow members of his Kill Team and those outside of it. He often quotes the Codex in conversation, using it as a key point in driving home his — or rather, the Primarch's — perspective on the discussion. Of course, his battle-brothers do not always agree with his interpretation or application.

Briathos is most accomplished with his bolter, embracing the idea that it is the weapon most applicable in the broadest range of circumstances. Because of this, he spends additional time drilling with the weapon, and encourages the Kill Team's other members to join him in extra practice sessions. Briathos also enjoys performing routine maintenance on his bolter, as well as his other gear. He often assists his peers with the basic upkeep on their wargear, though this is probably at least partially to make certain that they are keeping all their equipment up to Codex requirements.
skills: Athletics 5, Awareness 4, Ballistic Skill 7, Insight 2, Intimidation 3, Medicae 2, Stealth 3, Survival 1, Tech 2, Weapon Skill 4

bonuses.name: Talents
bonuses.description: Deadshot, Trademark Weapon

equipment: Astartes Combat Knife, Boltgun, 3 Frag Grenades, Hellfire Rounds, 3 Krak Grenades, Mk 8 Power Armour

abilities.name: Savage Echoes
abilities.description: You may reroll Double Rank dice once per melee attack Test.

abilities.name: Defender of Humanity
abilities.description: +Rank Icons to any successful attack against a Mob.

abilities.name: Honour the Chapter
abilities.description: This Threat must honour the beliefs and traditions of their Chapter. Increase final Resolve by +1.

abilities.name: Space Marine Implants
abilities.description: You are immune to the Bleeding Condition. You gain +1 bonus die to any Test related to one of the 19 implants if deemed appropriate by the GM.

name: BROTHER MARMAROTH
description:
After completing his initiation, Brother Marmaroth was immediately assigned to replace a fallen member of Kill Team Righteous Will. In the months since, he has acquitted himself admirably. Marmaroth was particularly adept at infiltration and demolition missions during his service as a Scout, prior to completing his initiation. Those aptitudes have led him to build closer connections with both Brothers Puriel and Rogziel. During missions, he often works closely with one or both, providing backup for melee engagements or assisting when missions call for the deployment of ordnance.

Marmaroth joined the Righteous Will as a direct replacement; his role within the team was to assume that of the fallen battle-brother ensuring any risk of performance loss was kept to a minimum. As a result, Brother Marmaroth must carry and use a flamer as his primary weapon. While he is competent with this weapon, he far prefers to wield his combat knife or bolt pistol. His greatest challenge has been learning to adapt to the flamer's utility, and while he still prefers the greater precision of his Astartes Combat Knife he has come to appreciate the devastation a gout of blazing promethium can provide. Despite his preferences, he has increased the amount of focus time drilling with the flamer and has enhanced his proficiency with the weapon. He longs to also experiment in using promethium in conjunction with his demolitions training, but has not yet had an opportunity.
skills: Athletics 6, Awareness 4, Ballistic Skill 5, Intimidation 2, Stealth 4, Survival 2, Tech 2, Weapon Skill 4

bonuses.name: Talents
bonuses.description: Promethium Proficiency, Silent

equipment: Astartes Combat Knife, Bolt Pistol, Flamer, 3 Frag Grenades, 3 Krak Grenades, Mk 8 Power Armour, Melta Bomb

abilities.name: Savage Echoes
abilities.description: You may reroll Double Rank dice once per melee attack Test.

abilities.name: Defender of Humanity
abilities.description: +Rank Icons to any successful attack against a Mob.

abilities.name: Honour the Chapter
abilities.description: This Threat must honour the beliefs and traditions of their Chapter. Increase final Resolve by +1.

abilities.name: Space Marine Implants
abilities.description: You are immune to the Bleeding Condition. You gain +1 bonus die to any Test related to one of the 19 implants if deemed appropriate by the GM.

name: BROTHER ROGZIEL
description:
Brother Rogziel has served Kill Team Righteous Will as the demolitions and heavy weapons expert for several years. He is loath to adhere to the Absolvers' recent directives regarding supply conservation, instead preferring to be absolutely certain that threats are unequivocally eradicated. Where a single round might be enough to kill an opponent, he prefers to use two, to leave no question about their fate. He often makes light of this, insisting that he is not an Apothecary, so wishes to remain confident that his foes are properly dispatched.

Since his assignment to the squad, this belief has led to an increase in collateral damages. This is particularly true on missions where the assignments explicitly call for demolitions work. Brother Rogziel seems to have an unusual knack for getting exceptional performance out of the ordnance he uses. His squadmates suspect that this might have to do with a tendency to exploit any other combustible materials that might be available, invariably finding a way to utilise any volatile substances nearby to augment the overall effectiveness of his equipment. In more candid moments, Brother Rogziel readily admits to the fellow members of the Righteous Will that his Sanguine Vision includes him dying amid an explosion. He has chosen not to share further details of his fate with his battle-brothers, lest he leave them unreasonably concerned.
skills: Athletics 4, Awareness 4, Ballistic Skill 6, Cunning 3, Intimidation 1, Stealth 4, Survival 2, Tech 4, Weapon Skill 4

bonuses.name: Talents
bonuses.description: Gilead Combat Veteran, Trademark Weapon - Missile Launcher

equipment: Astartes Combat Knife, Bolt Pistol, 3 Frag Grenades, 3 Krak Grenades, Missile Launcher with Frag and Krak missiles, Mk 8 Power Armour

abilities.name: Savage Echoes
abilities.description: You may reroll Double Rank dice once per melee attack Test.

abilities.name: Defender of Humanity
abilities.description: +Rank Icons to any successful attack against a Mob.

abilities.name: Honour the Chapter
abilities.description: This Threat must honour the beliefs and traditions of their Chapter. Increase final Resolve by +1.

abilities.name: Space Marine Implants
abilities.description: You are immune to the Bleeding Condition. You gain +1 bonus die to any Test related to one of the 19 implants if deemed appropriate by the GM.

name: PSYCHNEUEIN
description: Psychneuein are 2-metre-long, psychically active insectoids resembling gargantuan Terran wasps. Native to the immaterium, they enter realspace in order to breed by psychically implanting their eggs in the brains of injured, latent or weak-willed Psykers, usually with fatal results. Swarms are commonly made up of equal numbers of juvenile queens and drones.
skills: Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Psychic Mastery 3, Agility 4, Stealth 4, Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: Mindless
bonuses.description: This Threat automatically passes Resolve Tests.

abilities.name: Psychic Drone
abilities.description: Anyone hearing the droning of a swarm of Psychneuein must make a DN 5 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Wings
abilities.description: This Threat can fly at Speed 10. A DN 5 Agility roll must be made to remain in the air when injured.

abilities.name: Implantation (juvenile queens only)
abilities.description: Range 18. Spend 1 Ruin to attempt to psychically lay eggs in the mind of an agent with the PSYKER trait. Roll Psychic Mastery vs the target's Willpower. If the Psychneuein is successful, a clutch of d6 eggs are implanted in the target's head, and unless removed (requiring a Medicae roll, DN 8) will messily hatch 2d6 hours later, with fatal results for the host.

abilities.name: Sting (drones only)
abilities.stats: 13 +2 ED / AP -4 / Range 1. Anyone with the PSYKER trait stung by a Psychneuein Drone immediately rolls a DN 6 Toughness Test. On a failure they immediately roll on the Perils of the Warp table.

name: CORRUPTED SCRIBES
description: The ship's crew are dead. The pilgrims, however, cling to a semblance of life as hollowed-out husks eternally copying the Liber Servitium, unaware of their part in their own damnation. If disturbed, they respond with lethal force. One scribe is no threat to a well-armed agent, but a thousand might be a different issue.
skills: Default 2, Awareness 3 (Passive 2)

bonuses.name: Mindless
bonuses.description: This Threat automatically passes Resolve Tests.

abilities.name: Convergence of the Damned
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to draw an additional 10 corrupted scribes into combat.

name: JACOBIN GRIZARI
description: [AI-Generated] Jacobin Grizari is a charming and persuasive master criminal who shook Gilead high society with an outrageous heist of truly epic proportions. He convinced many of the upper echelons to invest a veritable fortune in Thronegelt on an audacious scheme promising a new and safe route through the Straits of Andraste, waiting only long enough for the Thronegelt to be in his possession before making his escape. The bounty on his head is sizable.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 4, Cunning 10, Deception 10, Insight 10, Persuasion 10, Stealth 6, Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: Talents
bonuses.description: Has the Talents Jargon [Scholar] and Scum Savvy.

abilities.name: Lasgun
abilities.stats: 7 +1 ED / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Rapid Fire (1), Reliable

abilities.name: Sidestep
abilities.description: Sidestep Talent

name: SLAUGHTER SERVITOR (PROCESSOR)
description: The following represents three different types of servitors (Processor, Corral, and Excoriator) active at the Abattoir of the Luminous Emperor.
skills: Default 5, Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

bonuses.name: Coordinated Slaughter
bonuses.description: When this Threat hits a target with its electro-prod, it can then make a single move towards the target and make an attack with its spiker. When performing this attack, this Threat does not suffer any penalties for making a Multi-Attack.

abilities.name: Spiker
abilities.stats: 10 +1 ED / AP -3 / Range 1 / Agonising, Brutal, Unwieldy (2)

abilities.name: Gristle in the Gears
abilities.description: The Slaughter Servitor is Exhausted for 1 Round. This can be negated by the Slaughter Servitor spending an action and succeeding at a DN 3 Athletics (Str) Test.

name: SLAUGHTER SERVITOR (CORRAL)
description: The following represents three different types of servitors (Processor, Corral, and Excoriator) active at the Abattoir of the Luminous Emperor.
skills: Default 5, Athletics 7, Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

abilities.name: Vice Grip
abilities.description: The Slaughter Servitor makes an Athletics Interaction Attack. If this check succeeds the target is Restrained for 1 round.

abilities.name: Gristle in the Gears
abilities.description: The Slaughter Servitor is Exhausted for 1 Round. This can be negated by the Slaughter Servitor spending an action and succeeding at a DN 3 Athletics (Str) Test.

name: SLAUGHTER SERVITOR (EXCORIATOR)
description: The following represents three different types of servitors (Processor, Corral, and Excoriator) active at the Abattoir of the Luminous Emperor.
skills: Default 5, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

abilities.name: Horrifying Flaying
abilities.description: If this Threat rolls a Wrath Critical as part of an attack with its blade arms, the target increases the Bleeding Condition to 2.

abilities.name: Dulled Blades
abilities.description: The Slaughter Servitor reduces its blade arms attack damage to 9 +1 ED for 1 Round.

name: ETERNITY WATCH
description: Eternity Watch are boundlessly enthusiastic about the great work. Far more given to free-thinking and fanciful expressions of faith than the typical Tech-Priest, they scoff at the idea of their research being dangerous, and quickly forget anything troubling or suspicious to do with the flares or their own behaviour.
skills: Default 3, Scholar 6, Tech 6, Awareness 6

bonuses.name: In Defence of Science
bonuses.description: When fighting to protect the great work, members of the Eternity Watch are immune to Fear and have +2 dice on all Actions.

name: MACHINAE FRACTUS
quote: The Machine God is broken. The flesh is weak. Only together can they be redeemed.
description: The Machinae are a horrible fusion of man and machine, but not as the Omnissiah intended. They shamble relentlessly towards enemies, heedless of their own lives. When an enemy falls in battle, some of them are tasked with carrying away the remains to be processed into more abominations.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 3, Medicae 4, Weapon Skill 4

bonuses.name: Beyond Human Frailties
bonuses.description: Ignore penalties for being Heavily Injured.

abilities.name: Cybernetic Abomination
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 2 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Body Snatcher
abilities.description: If anybody reaches Dying within 3m of a Fractus, the Fractus may immediately pick them up and make a Movement Action to carry them away.

name: SUNDERED WHEEL CULTIST
quote: We must remind the Magi that even the mightiest machine rests upon the functioning of its simplest component.
attribution: Alorex Vaunt, Cultist of the Sundered Wheel
description: Cultists are almost serene in their devotion to the Omnissiah. However, should any mention be made of the Tech-Priests mistreating the laity, their faces grow grim and their jaws clench. Occasionally they will whisper a prayer about the Omnissiah's wrath while touching their hidden cog.
skills: Default 3, Athletics 4, Awareness 3 (Passive 1), Tech 5, Weapon Skill 3

bonuses.name: Labour Augmetics
bonuses.description: Add +4 dice for Tests to lift heavy loads and ignore the penalty for using Heavy weapons.

abilities.name: Cybernetic Abomination
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 2 Fear Test.

name: HELIXUS HARVESTER TECH-PRIEST
description: Harvesters are unused to dealing with outsiders and are awkward and uncomfortable when forced to do so, but are unthinkingly ruthless and eerily efficient when given a clear task to perform. They move with almost insectile grace, and are much stronger than their delicate frame would suggest.
skills: Default 3, Athletics 4, Awareness 3 (Passive 1), Ballistic Skill 4, Medicae 4, Tech 4, Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: Cranial Augmetics
bonuses.description: Sealed internal air supply. Ignore any penalties to Tests for visual conditions.

abilities.name: Tranq-Gas Blower
abilities.stats: 6 +1 ED / AP -1 / Range 5-10-15 / Salvo 2 / Inflict (Exhausted 4), Spread

name: IRON FEEDER
description: If you can get a good look at an Iron Feeder, it's probably a distraction so another one can sneak up and stab you. They're patient and stealthy, but when they strike it's quick and ruthless. They work together unless the odds turn against them — at that point it's each Feeder for themselves. They covet augmetics, and will attack such targets for preference. They speak highly mangled Gothic.

resilience.note: Mutated skin & scrap armour plating: 2 AR

skills: Default 4, Awareness 6, Stealth 6, Survival 6, Tech 3, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: Favoured Prey
bonuses.description: If the target of this Threat's attack has any Augmetics, add +1 ED to any melee attack.

abilities.name: Scatter
abilities.description: Once per Round, when another Iron Feeder within 10m of this Threat is killed, this Threat can take an immediate Movement Action.

abilities.name: Shadow Strike
abilities.description: When an Iron Feeder succeeds in a melee attack as part of an ambush, the GM can add +1 ED per point of Ruin they choose to spend.

name: HERALDS OF THE AZURE FLAME
description: Heralds are spindly Humans with thin hair and pale skin. Most have minor mutations and cult markings hidden beneath their azure robes. Arrogant and spiteful, they believe they have been robbed of their birthright. Due to their power, they are prone to underestimating others and are fond of the sound of their own voices.
skills: Default 4, Psychic Mastery 9, Psyniscience 10

bonuses.name: Servants of the Flame
bonuses.description: Heralds are immune to any flamers or fires that are not sanctified.

bonuses.name: Sacrificial Flame
bonuses.description: Each round before combat begins a Herald can choose to sacrifice up to 3 loyal Cultists within 20m, who burst into blue flames. This causes the DN of all attacks or powers used against the Herald to increase by an amount equal to the number of Cultists sacrificed.

bonuses.name: A Thousand-Thousand Charms
bonuses.description: Within their lair, all Heralds receive +1 Defence, +1 Determination and may ignore a single 1 on the Wrath Die of each Psychic Mastery Test. All Psykers roll an extra Wrath Die on each Psychic Mastery Test they make.

abilities.name: Sorcerer
abilities.description: The Herald uses any of the Pyromancy abilities or the Dark Flame psychic ability. Their corruption level counts as 4.

abilities.name: Daemon Stave
abilities.stats: 9 +2 ED / AP -1 / Range 2 / Force, Inflict (On Fire), Parry

name: ORDER OF THE THRONE KNIGHT PALADIN
description: Ancient, pitted and battered, a Knight of the Order of the Throne sports beautifully customised carapace armour depicting scenes of battle and valour.

resilience.note: Adamantium Armour: 7 AR, Ion Shield: 3* AR

skills: Default 3, Awareness 5 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 5, Weapon Skill 8

bonuses.name: Pilot
bonuses.description: When crewed by an expert Order of the Throne pilot, the Knight gains +2 dice on all Actions pertinent to combat. Every time the Knight takes damage, the pilot takes 1d3 Shock.

bonuses.name: Juggernaut
bonuses.description: Can make a Stomp attack as a Free Action once per round if all they do is Move.

abilities.name: Battle Cannon
abilities.stats: 18 +2 ED / AP -3 / Range 30/60/90 / Salvo 3 / Heavy 12, Rapid Fire 2

abilities.name: War Horns
abilities.description: A great echoing roar issues from the machine, forcing everyone who can hear it to make a DN 4 Terror Test.

name: ESCUTCHEON ASSASSIN
description: Well dressed, polite and measured, the Escutcheon Assassin seems quite above reproach. They are methodical, well-informed, and patient — willing to take time in order to make their executions look like accidents. Few of them know more than one immediate superior, and they usually work alone. If in danger of capture, they may well use their suicide pills.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 7, Stealth 7, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: Well Connected
bonuses.description: The Assassin can spend 1 Ruin to be cleared of almost any criminal charges by Nethrean authorities and released. Anything incriminating will be covered up.

abilities.name: Needler
abilities.stats: 8 +2 ED / Range 6/12/18 / Salvo 1 / Agonising, Inflict (Poisoned 4), Pistol, Silent

abilities.name: Suicide Pill
abilities.description: If captured by enemies, the Assassin will most likely attempt suicide. It would require an immediate DN 7 Medicae (Int) Test to save their life.

name: EPICUREAN BODYGUARD
description: Epicureans are debauched, titled, and indolent. They sneer at anybody who doesn't measure up to their standards. For the most part they rely on their wealth and influence to protect themselves, but each one keeps a loyal food-taster and bodyguard close to their side to wait upon them and protect them from harm.
skills: Default 4, Ballistic Skill 5, Weapon Skill 5

abilities.name: Duelling Las
abilities.stats: 7 +2 ED / AP -1 / Range 4-8-12 / Salvo 0 / Pistol, Reliable

name: WORSHIPFUL ROOTFOLK
quote: Roots go deep, roots know all. Drink of the blood of the roots and hear their wisdom.
description: The Rootfolk exist largely in a state of serene ignorance, utterly dedicated to the giftroot. They are peaceful and calm, except when roused to defend the giftroot, when they become fanatical. Most rootfolk are ill-educated peasants, simple commoners with little idea about the world beyond their dominion.
skills: Default 3

bonuses.name: Servant of the Roots
bonuses.description: When defending or spreading giftroot, the cultist gains +1d6 on all Actions.

name: DUKE OF PUTRESCENCE (BLIGHTLORD CHAMPION)
description: Its current owner is a mighty Chaos Lord named Khargast the Bloated, Duke of Putrescence. He is well aware of the Tome's deceptions, and delights in the steady stream of fools coming to him, thinking they can relieve him of his axe. Those he does not kill, he corrupts, and the first mission of his new minions is always to return the Tome to an Imperial world, where it can spread corruption and send Khargast new playthings.
skills: Default 7, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 10, Cunning 8, Intimidation 8, Leadership 10, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Architect of Ruin
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's Turns.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Cumbersome Armour
bonuses.description: This Threat may not Run or Sprint.

bonuses.name: Mark of Chaos: Nurgle
bonuses.description: This Threat's Toughness increases by +1.

bonuses.name: Space Marine Implants
bonuses.description: Gain bonus dice and options for actions from Space Marine Implants.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Veteran of the Long War
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to add the game's Tier as ED to all attacks this Threat makes this Round.

abilities.name: Death to the False Emperor!
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to Charge, gaining +2 bonus dice to the attack Test.

abilities.name: Noxious Discharge
abilities.description: When this Threat is wounded in melee combat, all enemies within 3m must make a DN 3 Toughness Test or suffer 1d3 Mortal Wounds.

determination: Disgustingly Resilient. You do not need to spend Ruin to roll Determination for this Threat. Roll 8d6. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: KASTELAN ROBOT
description: Once these potent ferric warriors marched in vast legions at the behest of the Adeptus Mechanicus, scouring whole alien civilisations from the face of the galaxy. In the current age, the secrets of their construction are long lost, and the remaining few Kastelan are zealously maintained by rites and rituals whose true meanings have long since been obscured by the mists of time. Grouped together into Maniples, they are led into battle by Cybernetica Datasmiths, who manipulate their programming as needed.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 6, Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Battle Protocols
bonuses.description: By default, the Kastelan Robot's Aegis Protocol is active. As an Action, an individual with the Tech Skill can make a DN 10 Tech Test to change the Kastelan Robot's Battle Protocol. An individual with the Reprogrammer ability can make this Test as a Simple Action at DN 5. Aegis Protocol: The Kastelan Robot's Resilience increases to 20. Conqueror Protocol: The Kastelan Robot's Weapon Skill increases to 10 and it gains +2 bonus dice when it Charges. Protector Protocol: The Kastelan Robot's Speed is reduced to 0, its Ballistic Skill is increased by 2, and its Resilience is increased to 18.

bonuses.name: Robot
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind, and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting. Additionally, this Threat is immune to the Bleeding, Blinded, Exhausted, Fear, Pinned, Poisoned, and Terror Conditions.

abilities.name: Heavy Phosphor Blaster
abilities.stats: 13 +2 ED / AP -2 / Range 18-36-54 / Salvo 1 / Melta, Heavy (8)

abilities.name: Incendine Combustor
abilities.stats: 12 +2 ED / AP -2 / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 2 / Flamer, Heavy (8)

abilities.name: Dataslot Disruption
abilities.description: If the Kastelan Robot rolls a Complication or a Complication is rolled on a Tech Test targeting the Kastelan, roll 1d6. If the result is another Complication, the Kastelan Robot uses its next Action to move its Speed in a random direction as dictated by the Scattering rules and attacks the nearest individual. If the result is not a Complication, the Kastelan Robot's Battle Protocol changes as determined by the GM. When a Complication is triggered, any character with the ADEPTUS MECHANICUS Keyword within 10m can attempt a DN 10 Tech Test to prevent this effect. This Tech Test is DN 5 for individuals with the Reprogrammer ability.

abilities.name: Explodes
abilities.description: When this Threat is destroyed, roll 1d6. If you roll a Complication, the Threat explodes with the following profile: 12 +6 ED / Blast (6).

determination: Repulsor Grid. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 10d6. Whenever this Threat rolls Determination against a ranged attack they may Shift Exalted Icons to deal 1 Mortal Wound to the attacker for every Exalted Icon Shifted.

name: RAIDER CYBERCANID
description: Cybercanid constructs are highly advanced combat servitors, melding the instincts of naturally aggressive creatures with the strength and power of an augmetic frame. They can lope rapidly across almost any terrain, and maintain a noospheric link to their rider, allowing them access to the creature's sensory augmetics. The metal beast itself is a potent engine of war, with razor claws and an armoured hide. Cybercanids are carefully matched to a specific rider, each complementing the other's combat capabilities. Over time the two form a nigh-unbreakable bond of loyalty; should one die, the other will seek vengeance with cold, savage fury.
skills: Athletics 6, Awareness 5, Intimidation 5, Stealth 4, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: Cybercanid
bonuses.description: This Threat ignores Difficult Terrain.

bonuses.name: Gyro-stabilised Saddle
bonuses.description: Whenever the Cybercanid is being ridden by its bonded Serberys rider, the bonded Serberys rider may reroll any Wrath Die that rolls a Complication, and must take the second result.

bonuses.name: Noospheric Link
bonuses.description: Whenever the Raider Cybercanid is being ridden by its bonded Serberys rider, the bonded Serberys rider may use its movement to command the Raider Cybercanid to move and take an Action.

determination: Enhanced Bionics. Spend 1 Ruin (or Wrath, if the cyber-beast is your mount) to roll 6d6. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: SULPHURHOUND CYBERCANID
description: Cybercanid constructs are highly advanced combat servitors, melding the instincts of naturally aggressive creatures with the strength and power of an augmetic frame. They can lope rapidly across almost any terrain, and maintain a noospheric link to their rider, allowing them access to the creature's sensory augmetics. The metal beast itself is a potent engine of war, with razor claws and an armoured hide. Cybercanids are carefully matched to a specific rider, each complementing the other's combat capabilities. Over time the two form a nigh-unbreakable bond of loyalty; should one die, the other will seek vengeance with cold, savage fury.
skills: Athletics 6, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 6, Intimidation 5, Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Cybercanid
bonuses.description: This Threat ignores Difficult Terrain.

bonuses.name: Gyro-stabilised Saddle
bonuses.description: Whenever the Cybercanid is being ridden by its bonded Serberys rider, the bonded Serberys rider may reroll any Wrath Die that rolls a Complication.

bonuses.name: Noospheric Link
bonuses.description: Whenever the Cybercanid is being ridden by its bonded Serberys rider, the bonded Serberys rider may use its movement to command the Cybercanid to move and take an Action.

abilities.name: Sulphur Breath
abilities.stats: 10 +2 ED / AP -2 / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 0 / Assault, Flamer

determination: Enhanced Bionics. Spend 1 Ruin (or Wrath, if the cyber-beast is your mount) to roll 6d6. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: OILY SQUIG
description:
The creatures are a type of orkoid being known to the Orks as an Oily Squig. The Runtherdz of the Orks have painstakingly adapted their squig breeds to fulfil a wide variety of tasks, and this particular type is used to provide lubricant. Oily Squigs are scavengers, and will consume almost any organic material, but prefer fats and oils where possible. They store such chemicals in their plump, fleshy bodies, releasing it in a jet when they need to squeeze into tight spaces, or when startled. This makes them especially useful to Mekaniaks, who will generally ensure they have a supply of well-fed Oily Squigs on hand to lubricate their inventions. As with most of the barely understood orkoid species, Oily Squigs appear to reproduce through spores, and some such spores have apparently managed to find their way down into the lightless depths of the Unguent Pits. This is an ideal breeding ground for the invasive species, and they are reproducing rapidly. Whenever a pit opens, the squigs race from all around to dive into the precious fluid and gorge themselves, irreparably polluting the sacred substance in the eyes of the Mechanicus.
Normally such beings would be exterminated by flamer-equipped servitors or Pteraxii Sterilyzors with phosphor torches, but such weapons can't be countenanced here. Any spark or flame could set off a chain reaction that would cause untold devastation. The Mechanicus here do not know the nature of the Oily Squigs or where they came from — they assume it is just some manner of mutated vermin from the hive-bottom. If the creatures were properly identified then the Ordo Xenos or a Magos Biologis would be able to advise on much more effective methods to sterilise the spores and stop the squigs from breeding. Individually the squigs are no challenge at all to an armed Human, at worst giving a painful bite. Even in swarms they are cowardly creatures.
skills: Default 1, Athletics 2, Ballistic Skill 2, Weapon Skill 3

bonuses.name: Filled with Oil
bonuses.description: If an Oily Squig is damaged by a weapon with the FLAME or EXPLOSIVE Keywords it explodes with the following profile: 7 +4 ED / Blast (4), Inflict (On Fire). This explosion causes any other Oily Squigs caught in the radius to explode in the same manner.

abilities.name: Spew Oil
abilities.description: Make a Ballistic Skill Test against a target within 10m. If successful, the Oily Squig spews oil, covering the target and the area in a line to the target with flammable oil. The target must succeed on a DN 3 Agility Test or fall Prone as they slip on the oil.

mobAbilities: A Swarm of Teeth and Claws: A Mob of Squigs gains +1 bonus Icon to any Resolve Tests. This increases by +1 for every ten Squigs.
mobOptions: COMPLICATION: Vicious by Nature. Whenever the Mob rolls a Complication, the squigs inflict 1d3 Shock on themselves. Add 1d3 Shock to this damage for every ten Squigs in the Mob.

name: THE ORACULAR ATTENDANT
description: This servitor is of an incredibly advanced pattern unseen in the Gilead system before or since, and was created with a single purpose — the maintenance of the Orrery itself. It can only speak in binaric cant, but its intelligence level skirts close to the acceptable limits for an independent piece of machinery.
skills: Default 3, Ballistic Skill 4, Tech 5, Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

bonuses.name: Hatches & Tunnels
bonuses.description: Within the Orrery complex, the Attendant has numerous secret tunnels for moving around. It gains +5 Dice to Stealth checks to Surprise intruders.

bonuses.name: Guardian
bonuses.description: The Attendant is tied to the noosphere of the Orrery complex, and receives +2 Dice to Awareness (Int) Tests and +4 Dice to Tech (Int) Tests to repair the Orrery while within its walls.

abilities.name: Hidden Defences
abilities.description: Within the Orrery complex, the Attendant can activate a variety of hidden defences. On the first round of combat it activates a hidden gun platform (effectively an immobile Combat Servitor).

abilities.name: Flechette Blaster
abilities.stats: 8 +2 ED / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 2 / Pistol, Rapid Fire (4)

abilities.name: Repair Protocol Gamma 19
abilities.description: Should the Attendant be destroyed while the Orrery still functions, automated systems will attempt to trap a Human subject and create a new Attendant from spare parts. This takes 1d6 hours.

name: MAGOS LUXUS
description: The Magos is clad in a ceremonial outfit, studded with glowing crystal shards and laced with arcane circuitry. Both of his arms have been replaced with augmetic las weapons and a pair of mechadendrites for labour. He is perfectly affable, and quite pleased to give a tour to any pilgrims who visit the Cathedral. He also talks to himself quite a bit, and seems rather preoccupied with some decidedly non-Imperial looking tech that he's working on.
skills: Default 4, Athletics 6, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Tech 9, Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: Autonomous Targeting
bonuses.description: Each round, this Threat can make a standard ranged attack Action as a Free Action.

bonuses.name: Diffractor Field
bonuses.description: The Magos Luxus is protected by an arcane energy field. This grants him +5 Defence against LAS weapon attacks.

abilities.name: Luminous Beamer
abilities.stats: 13 +3 ED / AP -2 / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Reliable, Rending (2)

abilities.name: Point Defence Lasers
abilities.description: As a Reaction to any PROJECTILE attack, the Magos can make an opposed Ballistic Skill (AGI) Test. If he succeeds the projectile is vapourised harmlessly.

determination: Extensive Augmetics. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6.

name: SQUIG (HEAVY SQUIG LAUNCHA)
description: Squig Launcher ammunition is a living, conscious being. Its effect on the battlefield has been simplified to that of a projectile, but if you wish to run a squiggly beast as a combatant, you can use the following profile.
skills: Default 2, Athletics 4, Weapon Skill 4

abilities.name: Boom Squig Explosion
abilities.stats: 14 +4 ED / AP -1 / Blast 4 / Using this Action kills the Squig.

name: BLUE HORROR
quote: I am many made one.
description: Pink Horrors split into two Blue Horrors on death. Blue Horrors use the same statistics as Pink Horrors, with the following adjustments.
skills: Default 7, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Psychic Mastery 8, Weapon Skill 8

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Daemonic Determination
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 3d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds using Toughness.

abilities.name: Split
abilities.description: The Blue Horror splits into two Brimstone Horrors.

name: BRIMSTONE HORROR
quote: I am many made one.
description: Blue Horrors split into two Brimstone Horrors on death. Brimstone Horrors use the same statistics as Pink Horrors, with the following adjustments.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Psychic Mastery 7, Weapon Skill 7

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Daemonic Determination
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 3d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds using Toughness.

name: ARCO-FLAGELLANT
skills: Default 2, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Athletics 6, Weapon Skill 8

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

bonuses.name: Extremis Trigger Word
bonuses.description: An Arco-Flagellant, or a Mob of Arco-Flagellants, may be triggered by uttering a single code-word (either directly, or over a vox). When triggered, Arco-Flagellants become Frenzied and add +2 to their Speed.

abilities.name: Penance Through Death
abilities.description: When an Arco-Flagellant is slain, it immediately makes a melee attack against a single enemy within reach. It then adds +1 to Glory.

determination: Spend 1 Glory to roll 5d6. This Follower may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.
mobAbilities: BERSERK KILLING MACHINES: When a member of this Mob is killed, roll 1d6: on a 5 or 6, they are not killed.
description: For those heretics found guilty of heresies of insufficient severity to warrant immediate execution, there is another fate in store: arco-flagellation. An arco-flagellant undergoes an extended program of surgical modification, including muscle grafts, combat drug injections, and cybernetically implanted weaponry. At the same time, the subject's mind is reconditioned to turn him into a berserk killing machine who seeks only to destroy enemies of the Emperor. Normally, an arco-flagellant is kept calm through the use of a sealed pacifier helmet. The helmet floods the arco-flagellant's senses with sacred images and songs, which renders the arco-flagellant virtually unresponsive to outside stimuli. However, once the proper activation word is given, the sensory input stops and a cocktail of combat drugs and stimulants are pumped in the arco-flagellant's body, turning the once- passive cyborg into a frightening and fearless combatant that exists only to destroy everything it sees. The use of a deactivation word will cause the arco-flagellant to shut down and resume its passive state.

name: BLACK TEMPLARS NEOPHYTE
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 8, Weapon Skill 8

bonuses.name: Know No Fear
bonuses.description: Reroll any failed dice on a Resolve Test.

bonuses.name: Space Marine Implants
bonuses.description: Gain bonus dice and options for actions from Space Marine Implants.

abilities.name: Follower Options
abilities.description: The follower's Boltgun may be exchanged for an Astartes Combat Shotgun. Astartes Combat Shotgun: 10 + 1 ED / Range 6-12- 18 / Salvo 2 / Assault, Spread, Reliable

description: killed. Black Templars Neophyte Unlike other Space Marine Chapters, the Black Templars have no dedicated Scout Company in which its aspirants are trained. Should a survivor of the trials impress one of the assembled battle-brothers, an Initiate may take it upon himself to personally mentor the neophyte in the art of war. From that point on, the Initiate takes sole responsibility for his pupil's training and conduct. He swears an oath to prepare the neophyte for his entry into the brotherhood that is the Chapter, teach him of its history, and guide him through its holy rites of worship to the Emperor. In return, the neophyte pledges obedience to his master and vows never to bring dishonour to his name. Neophytes also act as servants to their mentors, waiting on them at the great banquets and seeing to their day-to-day requirements. The crusade's Chaplains oversee this training and make sure the neophyte learns the history of the Chapter and watch for any signs of weakness in the neophyte's faith. The neophyte will also accompany his Initiate into combat, and should his master fall, another brother will take up his training. The bond between the Initiate and his neophyte pupil is strong, and if the neophyte meets his end, the Initiate will swear a death oath to avenge his apprentice or die trying. It is the Initiate's prerogative to say when his apprentice's training is complete. Once he has proven his valour and skill, a Black Templars neophyte submits to the Chapter's Chaplains to undergo the final trials of purity before, in a ceremony of great reverence, he is elevated into the ranks of a full battle-brother of Initiate status and honoured with a suit of Power Armour. He is now truly a Black Templar, possessed of great power, and sworn to use it in the Emperor's service unto death.

name: CAT UNIT
skills: Default 2, Awareness 4 (Passive 2)

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

bonuses.name: Simple Automata
bonuses.description: The Follower can only perform simple actions—navigating an environment, picking up or dropping off small objects—without direct instruction from its operator.

bonuses.name: Surveillance
bonuses.description: The Follower sends a constant feed of everything it sees and hears back to its operator, who may view them on a control device, or via armour autosenses or a data-tether.

bonuses.name: Tracked
bonuses.description: This Follower moves on a set of segmented tracks. It cannot jump, climb, or traverse any obstacle taller than half its height.

description: Cyber-Altered Task units ("CATs") are mechanical drones designed to perform simple tasks, like inorganic servitors. Programmed with a set of very simple instructions, they are occasionally used by the Adeptus Mechanicus, the Imperial Navy, and even some chapters of the Adeptus Astartes as remote probes and retrieval units. Though they do not possess any biological components, their extremely limited programming prevents them from being classified as examples of Abominable Intelligence. The drones utilise a simple short-ranged Vox transceiver which receives instructions from the user and relays data and pict-captures back to the user's control unit. The drone's ability to traverse environments independently is limited and relies more on simple trial-and-error than problem-solving ability. CATs have been in service across the Imperium for millennia, though their utility is limited compared to even a simple monotask servitor. Nevertheless, constructing CATs is a popular activity for Mechanicus Adepts and Techmarines, who claim that the activity is a useful meditative exercise, and CATs are frequently underfoot at any shrine to the Omnissiah, performing simple tasks for their masters and creators. In fact, some suspicious members of the Inquisition have observed that their creators seem to treat their CATs almost like pets, though the Mechanicum claims to be above such emotional attachments.

name: CHAPTER SERF
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4)

bonuses.name: Specialist
bonuses.description: Select two skills from the list below. The Chapter Serf has those skills at a rating of 8: Insight, Investigation, Medicae, Persuasion, Pilot, Scholar, Tech.

description: Chapter serfs are the normal human bondsmen and servants of a Space Marine Chapter. The Space Marines themselves are too few in number to manage all the tasks required to maintain all the aspects of the Chapter, its fleet, fortress, and other myriad aspects. It is the serfs who perform most of these vital functions. A Chapter's fortress-monastery is home to a large population of these hereditary servants. Although they occupy a humble position, they are loyal members of the Chapter. They are generally descended from individuals selected as potential recruits to the Chapter, but in the end, judged unfit to become actual Space Marines. The serfs are still inducted into the Chapter cult, and do not begrudge the status they could have obtained. They are generally well treated within the Chapter, are educated and trained to a much higher standard than most other servants of the Imperium and have access to a better range of equipment. Many serfs were unsuccessful aspirants who failed to become Adeptus Astartes, and many more are descended from the failed aspirants of generations past. Chapter Serfs are known by a wide variety of names and titles depending on the Chapter they serve and the role they perform within their Chapter. They are sometimes referred to as thralls, menials, helots, or serviles, and they can be found in almost every part of a Chapter, assisting everyone from the Chapter Master to the Librarians and Tech-Marines, to the ordinary Battle Brothers.

name: CHERUB
skills: Default 2, Awareness 4 (Passive 2)

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

bonuses.name: Symbol Of Purity
bonuses.description: A Cherub's owner gains +2 Conviction while the Cherub is within 10m.

bonuses.name: Variants
bonuses.description: A Cherub may have one of the following options:

bonuses.name: Armourium Cherub
bonuses.description: The Cherub carries 3 additional Ammo for its owner.

bonuses.name: Incensor Cherub
bonuses.description: When the Cherub's owner spends a Faith point, roll 1d6: on a 6, the Cherub's owner regains 1 Faith Point. The Cherub must be within 10m for this to function.

bonuses.name: Choristor Cherub
bonuses.description: While within 10m of its owner, the Cherub adds +2d to all the owner's Leadership and Persuasion tests.

bonuses.name: Defensor Cherub
bonuses.description: While within 3m of its owner, the Cherub's owner gains +2 Resilience.

bonuses.name: Warp-Bane Cherub
bonuses.description: Any psychic power which targets the Cherub or a character within 3m increases the DN by +2.

description: The servitors known as Cherubim are of uncertain origin, but they are one of the few permitted examples of such bio-sculpted homunculi allowed within the Imperium. Taking the form most commonly resembling that of somewhat corpulent and unwholesome looking genderless children, they are also often implanted with augmetic feathery wings (and a grav generator) allowing limited flight. Cherubim are not truly alive at all and their synthesised, bloodless and waxen flesh needs neither to eat nor sleep and is fed from their internal power-cell. They are controlled by an augmented cortex and nervous system usually harvested from some lesser creature such as a simian, bird, swine or felid, and implanted with a set of programmed commands that allows them to perform some simple task such as copying text, fetching and carrying small items or tirelessly singing the Emperor's praises with augmetic vocal cords. Outside the rarefied noble houses and Imperial hierarchy (most notably the Ecclesiarchy) where they are used, most citizens view Cherubim with a degree of distaste and superstitious fear. This is not entirely without cause as it is a matter of record that in rare instances Cherubim have been known to “devolve” allowing some corrupted and mangled version of their organic cortex to take over their behaviour with unpleasant consequences. These servitors are not purely functional in nature as their small chubby appearances are not suited for combat, maintenance, labour or any other such tasks. Their role was determined by the adept involved in their creation. Purposefully built as symbols of purity, they also serve as a form of decoration. Though not suited for combat roles, there are other more subtle tasks that a Cherub can be suited for such as spying, bearing weapons or equipment, being sycophants to their master and singing devotional hymns. Others possess integrated power generators allowing them to protect their master with an energy shield or anti-psychic equipment of use against psykers.

name: CYBER-MASTIFF
skills: Default 4, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Intimidation 6, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

bonuses.name: Animal
bonuses.description: This Threat is unable to take any actions which would require the use of hands.

bonuses.name: Apprehend
bonuses.description: If this Threat hits a target with a melee attack, it may choose to Restrain the target rather than dealing damage. The target is restrained by the Cyber-Mastiff's jaws and must succeed on a DN 4 Strength Test to break free.

description: Cyber-Mastiffs are mechanical creatures that resemble a metal hound, who are guided by the brain and nervous system of a hunting creature after such components have been integrated by members of the Adeptus Mechanicus. It is also not uncommon, however, to see purely biological canines who have received some form of cybernetic upgrades. Cyber- Mastiffs are usually deployed under the control of Adeptus Arbites Patrol and Enforcer units for hunting down their prey and to catch criminal fugitives who attempt to escape, but they are also found in other units, such as Anathema Psykana Pursuer Cadres, and even by underhive bounty hunters. Commonly known as kill-dogs, razorfangs and rending rovers, Cyber-Mastiffs have an in-built hunting and attack instinct and can only respond to the simplest of commands from their assigned handler but are still fully capable of defending themselves and their masters. They can be fitted with additional sensors, such as an Auspex, which are always used on passive.

name: FENRISIAN WOLF
skills: Default 6, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Intimidation 9, Weapon Skill 11

bonuses.name: Pack Animal
bonuses.description: This Follower adds +1 to Resolve for each SPACE WOLVES ally within 6 metres. Further, when it attacks an enemy, it adds +1 ED for each SPACE WOLVES ally who has attacked that enemy this round.

bonuses.name: Animal
bonuses.description: This Threat is unable to take any actions which would require the use of hands.

description: The massive Fenrisian Wolf is a fearsome semi-sentient predator and an enduring symbol of the Space Wolves Space Marine Chapter's frozen homeworld of Fenris. The Space Wolves, in the ancient tradition of their Primarch Leman Russ, often befriend and train Fenrisian Wolves (in so much as such a feral being can truly be trained). Fenrisian Wolves will fight ferociously beside their master against his foes. Fenrisian Wolves are simple, brutal beasts, loyal only to their master and remorseless against their enemies. As a follower, a Fenrisian Wolf will trail behind the battle- brother wherever he goes, whining if forced to stay behind, and attack his enemies with a gesture or a word. Fenrisian Wolves aid Space Wolves in numerous ways during battle. Their speed makes them a great flanking unit with which to harry the Space Wolves' enemies and pick off smaller units. They are also used as a fast- moving distraction to the main battleline, leaving the Space Wolves' opponents guessing at their next move. They will also stay by the side of the battle-brother if he falls, protecting his body and maybe even pulling him to safety.

name: GRAPPLEHAWK
skills: Default 4, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Stealth 6, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

bonuses.name: Animal
bonuses.description: This Threat is unable to take any actions which would require the use of hands.

bonuses.name: Apprehend
bonuses.description: If this Threat hits a target with a melee attack, it may choose to Restrain the target rather than dealing damage. The target is restrained by the Grapplehawk's talons and must succeed on a DN 4 Strength Test to break free.

description: Although most commonly employed by the Arbites, Grapplehawks are also used by some bounty hunters, Rogue Traders, Adeptus Mechanicus Magi, and the Pursuer Squads of the Anathema Psykana. Grapplehawks are technically a type of servitor and take the form of elegant shining steel hawks. Their glittering crania contain the transplanted instincts of avians trained to seize moving targets without damaging them. These instincts, transferred to mechanical constructs fitted with powerful suspensors and talons capable of tearing through cast-iron, enable handlers to detain suspects quickly (if brutally) on the streets of hive cities or wherever their prey may run.

name: PSYBER EAGLE
skills: Default 2, Awareness 4 (Passive 2)

bonuses.name: Animal
bonuses.description: This Threat is unable to take any actions which would require the use of hands.

bonuses.name: Psy-Bond
bonuses.description: The Follower is linked to its owner via a neural interface called a psyber-lure (implanted when the Follower is acquired). The owner can see, hear, etc., through the Follower's senses, and give instant mental commands, so long as the Follower is within a number of kilometres equal to the owner's Willpower.

bonuses.name: Psychic Focus
bonuses.description: If the Follower's owner is a PSYKER, the owner may focus their psychic abilities through the Follower. This adds +1 to the DN of the psychic power, but the power's range and effect are measured from the Follower instead.

description: A psy-bonded (or "psyber") Familiar is a living creature bonded to its master by arcane technology. Cybernetic neural interface circuitry implanted in the minds of both Familiar and master (called a "psyber-lure") allows the creature to be directly and precisely controlled, with the master having access to the sensory experiences of the creature and able to give it instantaneous commands at great distance. Owing to the idiosyncrasies of the little understood technology, usually only small, non-sapient creatures can become psy-bonded to a Human master. Psyber-Eagles are genetically and cybernetically enhanced familiars created as gifts from the Adeptus Mechanicus to the grandees of the Imperium. They are often utilised by psykers to extend and channel their powers. The same profile can also be used for Psyber-Ravens, and similar augmented avian familiars.

name: CALLIGRAPHUS SERVITOR
skills: Default 2, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Scholar 4

bonuses.name: Auto-Scribe
bonuses.description: The Follower can copy any text it is provided and can transcribe any speech dictated to it. These accurate recordings grant the owner +2d on all Investigate and Scholar tests.

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

abilities.name: Mindlock
abilities.description: The Servitor is Exhausted for 1 round. This can be negated by an ally succeeding on a DN 3 Tech (Int) Test.

description: of mindless, cybernetic drones created from a fusion of Human flesh and robotic technology that are used to carry out simple, manual tasks across the Imperium of Man. Servitors were created due to the strict prohibitions against the development or use of machine intelligences according to the tenets of the Cult Mechanicus, whose tech-priests deeply fear the creation of Silica Animus. They believe such artificial general intelligences to be the embodiments of blasphemy against the Omnissiah. While many of these programmable cybernetic slaves are genetically-engineered, vat-grown, sub-Human clones or replicae created by the Adeptus Mechanicus from Human genomes who have their bionic implants installed after "birth", others were once truly Human. These servitors were usually criminals who fell afoul of Imperial Law, particularly a person who has offended or damaged the Adeptus Mechanicus in some fashion. These unfortunate criminals will be sentenced to Servitude Imperpituis by the Arbitrators or Judges of the Adeptus Arbites and will be handed over to the Mechanicus' Tech-priests to be mind-wiped, reprogrammed, and cybernetically-enhanced to serve some specific, rudimentary function. Once lobotomised and "improved" through the process of painful operations, even criminals and Heretics are granted one last chance to serve the Imperium. Servitors are generally mindless, semi-organic robots, possessing only the most basic of instincts, though some are fully capable of speech if such functions and knowledge are programmed into them. Their brains are reprogrammed to perform only the task they were designed for, whether that be maintenance, construction, or even warfare. The altered and fragmented brain of a servitor functions poorly unless constantly supervised. Most will eventually go into a state of mindlock, babbling incoherent nonsense as the servitor tries to assert some form of control over its functions. Calligraphus Servitor Outfitted with a cluster of manipulator arms, each tipped with various writing instruments, a calligraphus servitor is capable of copying practically any document they are given. They can also transcribe spoken words and are often used to preserve sermons and speeches as well as taking dictation for letters, orders, and regulations. Many high-ranking members of the Holy Ordos have at least one calligraphus servitor on hand, while large monasteries and abbeys may have hundreds, usually engaged in replicating and preserving ancient texts.

name: COMBAT SERVITOR
skills: Default 4, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

abilities.name: Mindlock
abilities.description: The Servitor is Exhausted for 1 round. This can be negated by an ally succeeding on a DN 3 Tech (Int) Test.

description: Combat Servitors are modified mono-task lifter Servitors intended to fight in close melee combat, and they are normally equipped with some form of augmetic power claw or servo-arm.

name: GUN SERVITOR
skills: Default 4, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 5

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

bonuses.name: Gun Platform
bonuses.description: The Gun Servitor ignores the Heavy (X) trait on its weapons. It carries 3 Reloads of ammunition for its weapon.

abilities.name: Follower Options
abilities.description: The Follower's Heavy Bolter may be replaced by any other Heavy weapon the owner acquires.

abilities.name: Mindlock
abilities.description: The Servitor is Exhausted for 1 round. This can be negated by an ally succeeding on a DN 3 Tech (Int) Test.

description: Gun Servitors are intended to provide fire support for a Tech-priest or Techmarine as he works, and often they will have whole limbs replaced with cybernetically-implanted weapons. Many will have ammunition hoppers mounted somewhere on their bodies so they can lay down continuous curtains of fire without needing to reload.

name: MONOTASK SERVITOR
skills: Default 4, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Tech 5

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

bonuses.name: Assistant
bonuses.description: While a Monotask Servitor is within 3m of its owner, its owner adds +2d to any Tech test they attempt.

abilities.name: Mindlock
abilities.description: The Servitor is Exhausted for 1 round. This can be negated by an ally succeeding on a DN 3 Tech (Int) Test.

description: A Monotask Servitor carries out tedious labours for their masters. Enginseers and Techmarines often replace at least one of this kind of Servitor's hands with a less powerful version of their own Servo-arm manipulators. Monotask Servitors will not hold up long in combat conditions, but they can be useful on missions to carry out simple repairs and perform menial labours.

name: MEDICAE SERVITOR
skills: Default 4, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Medicae 5

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

bonuses.name: Assistant
bonuses.description: While a Medicae Servitor is within 3m of its owner, its owner adds +2d to any Medicae test they attempt.

abilities.name: Pharmacopoeia
abilities.stats: The Medicae Servitor may use any

abilities.name: Mindlock
abilities.description: The Servitor is Exhausted for 1 round. This can be negated by an ally succeeding on a DN 3 Tech (Int) Test.

description: Medicae Servitors are often used to supplement trained medicae personnel in manufactorums and other dangerous environments. Some are fixed in place, mounted into a wall alcove with their legs removed, providing care to anyone brought to them. Others roam their designated area or follow a designated owner. When supporting a trained chirurgeon, they function as nurses and orderlies.

name: MINISTORUM CHOIR DRONE
skills: Default 2, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Scholar 4

bonuses.name: Choristor
bonuses.description: While within 10m of its owner, the Follower adds +2d to all the owner's Leadership and Persuasion tests.

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

abilities.name: Mindlock
abilities.description: The Servitor is Exhausted for 1 round. This can be negated by an ally succeeding on a DN 3 Tech (Int) Test.

description: A simple form of servitor drone, choir drones are found in cathedrals and Shrine Worlds across the Imperium.
