bonuses.description: When this drone makes a ranged attack, it can only attack the closest enemy.

abilities.name: Missile Pod
abilities.stats: 14 +2ED / AP -1 / Range 18-36-54 / Salvo 2 / Barrage, Blast (2), Heavy (6)

abilities.name: Saviour Protocols
abilities.description: When a friendly T'AU EMPIRE model within 3m would suffer a wound, this Threat may spend 1 Ruin to intercept the attack and suffer the wound instead. The Drone then rolls Determination as normal.

name: DEMAGOGUE
description: Delivering dark sermons in their blasphemous temples, Demagogues drive their flock into a frothing frenzy of anger, hatred, and zeal. With honeyed words, they draw in the desperate, offering the promise of riches, power, revenge, and all the things denied to them by the so-called falsehoods of the Imperial Creed. As cult leaders, Demagogues do not just pontificate but also orchestrate abductions, sabotage missions, and acts of terror so that they might destabilise the local government in preparation for their uprising, or foster an environment that further facilitates their recruitment of hopeless souls.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Deception 5, Leadership 6, Stealth 5, Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: Herald of Ruin
bonuses.description: At the start of each Round this Threat is alive, the GM gains 1 Ruin for every 6 Cultists alive in the Scene.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Priest of the Dark Gods
bonuses.description: This Threat gains +2 bonus dice to all Interaction Attacks.

abilities.name: Kneel Before the Dark Gods!
abilities.description: As an Action the Demagogue makes an Interaction Attack against all targets within 15m who do not possess the CHAOS Keyword. Any target affected by the Interaction Attack is Prone in addition to normal effects.

abilities.name: Kill Them ALL!
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. As a Free Action, the Demagogue commands a Mob of Cultists within 3m to make one Combat Action immediately. The GM may spend 1 Ruin to have the Demagogue use Kneel Before the Dark Gods! as a Ruin Action.

name: MINDWITCH
description: If the Demagogue is the voice of the cult and mouthpiece of the Ruinous Powers, then the Mindwitch is the twisted soul. They embody the raw power of the Chaos Gods and the energies of the Immaterium unleashed. Such energies course through a Mindwitch's body, pushing their mortal form far beyond its limitations. The result is hideous mutations, usually a bloated cranium that pulsates grotesquely with the ebb and flow of eldritch energies. To preserve these potent psykers, the body of a Mindwitch is sacrificed, and their heads grafted to obscene cybernetic frames that bear them aloft on suspensor fields.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Intimidation 8, Psychic Mastery 9

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Warp Touched
bonuses.description: Whenever this Threat rolls a Psychic Mastery (Wil) Test, they gain bonus Wrath dice equal to the Tier of the game.

abilities.name: Maleficarum
abilities.description: The Mindwitch attempts to activate Smite or a Maleficarum psychic power.

abilities.name: Psychic Storm
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. This Threat attempts to activate a psychic power or Deny the Witch.

name: ICONARCH
description: While not blessed with the powers of the warp, or commanding the respect of the cult, an Iconarch still holds an honoured position within a Dark Commune — the foul coven that form the heart of a cult — as they bear into battle the repulsive cult icons. These grand sigils, forged from metal or carved from flesh and bone, are anointed in blood and inscribed with abominable runes, infusing the icon with an aura of dread. Often these banners take the form of growling daemonic faces, and many include flaming censers which exude clouds of intoxicating hallucinogenics and vaporised stimms, which drive the cultists into a frenzy.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Leadership 6

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Icon of Hate
bonuses.description: Any Threats with CHAOS CULTIST within 50 metres gain +1 Bonus to all Tests. Within 10 metres gain +2 Bonus to all Tests.

abilities.name: Glory for the Dark Gods!
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. A Mob of CHAOS CULTIST within 10m of the Iconarch may use the Iconarch's Leadership dice pool when making any Test on their next turn.

name: BLESSED BLADE
description: While the cult grows in secret amongst the societies of the Imperium, they must lurk in long abandoned and forgotten places. Given these threats, the Demagogue elevates the most skilled warriors in the cult and bestows the Blessed Blade role upon them. Bearing a cruel weapon — these ornate blades are inscribed and blessed by the Demagogue, who speaks venom-filled verses to empower them — Blessed Blades shadow the coven members. With swift sweeps of their weapon, they decapitate assassins or lead a braying mob of cultists into battle.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Executioner of the Gods
abilities.description: If this threat rolls a Wrath Critical as part of an attack, the target may suffer the Savage Attack critical hit as default.

abilities.name: Quicksilver Strike
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin when an enemy within 5m is targeted by an attack. This Threat may interpose and become the new target.

abilities.name: Bodyguard
abilities.description: When a Threat with the CHAOS CULT Keywords within 6m of this Threat is targeted by an attack, this Threat may interpose itself as a reaction and become the new target for the attack.

name: MUTANT
description: The Imperial war machine is monolithic and relentless, the gears of its industry smothering countless worlds in smoke, pollution and toxic detritus. Those exposed are tainted by the touch and presence of such dire wastes. Deformities and mutations become rife. Especially with the advent of the Great Rift, the effects of the warp have further induced mutation within populations. Mutants are so reviled and hated that they are forced to gather in the deepest parts of hive cities or the irradiated wastelands. Chaos Cults exploit this hate and lure mutants to their service, viewing their abnormalities as blessings from the Dark Gods.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Stealth 5, Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: Mutative
bonuses.description: Any time this Threat deals a Wound, the GM gains 1 Ruin.

abilities.name: Unnatural Regeneration
abilities.description: Whenever a Mutant rolls a 6 on the Wrath Die, the Mutant regains 1d3 Wounds.

mobAbilities: Mutant Rabble: A Mob of Mutants gains +1 bonus Icon to any Resolve Tests. This increases by +1 for every ten Mutants.

name: TORMENT
description: As genetic aberrations run rampant, and bizarre morphology ripples through the bodies of the mutants, Torments are those cursed lot whose aberrations have pushed past even these boundaries, their original human husk swollen and overtaken by spawn of the warp, brutally horned, winged and viciously clawed semi-manifested creatures from a nightmare realm beyond reality. In the wretched temples of the Dark Gods, the cultists bring trinkets and offerings to these mutants, as they treat them as living idols. When the cult emerges from their shadowy cathedrals of hate, Torments often charge from the front of the rabble, tearing and slashing with venomous claws that can cut through ceramite.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Intimidation 6, Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: Mutative
bonuses.description: Any time this Threat deals a Wound, the GM gains 1 Ruin.

bonuses.name: Second Strike
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

abilities.name: Unnatural Regeneration
abilities.description: Whenever a Torment rolls a 6 on the Wrath Die, the Torment regains 1d3 Wounds.

mobAbilities: Mutant Rabble: A Mob of Mutants may include a Torment. These Mobs gain +1 bonus Icon to any Resolve Tests. This increases by +1 for each Torment in the Mob.

name: LEGIONARY
description: Spat out of the Eye of Terror, filled with fury and the need for revenge, Legionaries are the rank-and-file of the Heretic Astartes warbands. Each is a superhuman warrior clad in corrupted power armour, wielding bolt weapons and chainswords with lethal proficiency. Many of these ancient warriors were involved in the darkest events of the Imperium's history — and old enmities and memories of defeat still burn within their corrupted hearts.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 9, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Architect of Ruin
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's Turns.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Mark of Chaos: Undedicated
bonuses.description: This threat gains +Rank bonus dice when using one of the following skills: Awareness, Cunning, Deception, Insight, Persuasion, Psychic Mastery, Stealth, or Weapon Skill.

bonuses.name: Space Marine Implants
bonuses.description: Gain bonus dice and options for actions from Space Marine Implants.

abilities.name: Boltgun (alternate)
abilities.stats: 10 +1 ED / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Brutal, Rapid Fire (2)

abilities.name: Veteran of the Long War
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to add the game's Tier as ED to all attacks this Threat makes this Round.

name: CHOSEN
description: Spat out of the Eye of Terror, filled with fury and the need for revenge, Chosen are veterans of countless wars who have faced all foes — xenos, Imperial and daemonic. Many of these ancient warriors were involved in the darkest events of the Imperium's history — and old enmities and memories of defeat still burn within their corrupted hearts. To have survived such apocalyptic battles and claimed swathes of territory on daemon worlds from rival heretic warbands, these Chaos Space Marines are battle-hardened. They wield not only the respect — or contempt — of their fellow Legionaries but also bear some of the most powerful and devastating warp-tainted weapons available.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 10, Intimidation 8, Leadership 8, Stealth 8, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Architect of Ruin
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's Turns.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Mark of Chaos: Undedicated
bonuses.description: This threat gains +Rank bonus dice when using one of the following skills: Awareness, Cunning, Deception, Insight, Persuasion, Psychic Mastery, Stealth, or Weapon Skill.

bonuses.name: Space Marine Implants
bonuses.description: Gain bonus dice and options for actions from Space Marine Implants.

abilities.name: Boltgun (alternate)
abilities.stats: 10 +1 ED / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Brutal, Rapid Fire (2)

abilities.name: Wanton Slaughter
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. This Threat makes a melee attack against every enemy within reach.

abilities.name: Veteran of the Long War
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to add the game's Tier as ED to all attacks this Threat makes this Round.

name: WARP TALON
description: Warp Talons have fallen so far into the thrall of the Chaos Gods, that they have willingly given their bodies over to the warp. Now, as beings of the Empyrean, they are capable of swooping down upon their enemies and striking from beyond the material realm by tearing ragged holes into realspace with their claws. Appearing, wreathed in warp fire, these shrikes cleave their opponents in half using talon-tipped gauntlets before disappearing into the warp.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Architect of Ruin
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's Turns.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Mark of Chaos: Undedicated
bonuses.description: This threat gains +Rank bonus dice when using one of the following skills: Awareness, Cunning, Deception, Insight, Persuasion, Psychic Mastery, Stealth, or Weapon Skill.

bonuses.name: Space Marine Implants
bonuses.description: Gain bonus dice and options for actions from Space Marine Implants.

abilities.name: Warp Rift
abilities.description: The Warp Talon emerges from the Warp. All opponents of the Warp Talon must make a DN 3 Initiative Test or are Ambushed. Additionally, all opponents of the Warp Talon must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Reality Slice
abilities.description: When this Threat successfully hits with a Wrath Critical in melee this Threat deals +2 Mortal Wounds, and 1d3 Shock.

abilities.name: Empyrean Return
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. The Warp Talon disappears into the Warp. At the start of its next Turn, the Warp Talon may reappear using its BATTLECRY: Warp Rift.

abilities.name: Jump Pack
abilities.description: A Warp Talon may fly at double Speed by making a DN 3 Pilot (A) Test, ignoring terrain. If they fail this test their movement deviates according to the Scattering rules. A Complication on this test triggers a crash, and the Warp Talon suffers 1d3 Shock and falling damage.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6. Warp Talons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: RAPTOR
description: Raptors are terror troops who launch far ahead of the main assault force of Heretic Astartes. They are borne aloft on jump packs, and the combined lethality of speed, agility and close-quarters martial prowess remains. Like their namesakes, Raptors are precision hunters, targeting the weak points in enemy lines and conducting hit-and-run strikes that sow confusion and fear amongst their enemies. So committed are they to their art of war, Raptors form insular cults, even worshipping a minor aspect of Chaos that suits their murderous impulses.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 9, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Architect of Ruin
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's Turns.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Mark of Chaos: Undedicated
bonuses.description: This threat gains +Rank bonus dice when using one of the following skills: Awareness, Cunning, Deception, Insight, Persuasion, Psychic Mastery, Stealth, or Weapon Skill.

bonuses.name: Space Marine Implants
bonuses.description: Gain bonus dice and options for actions from Space Marine Implants.

abilities.name: Terror From the Skies
abilities.description: When this Threat successfully hits with a Wrath Critical in melee on a turn that they made a charge using their Jump Pack, this Threat deals +1 Mortal Wound, and 1d3 Shock.

abilities.name: Jump Pack
abilities.description: A Raptor may fly at double Speed by making a DN 3 Pilot (A) Test, ignoring terrain. If they fail this test, their movement deviates according to the Scattering rules. A Complication on this test triggers a crash, and the Raptor suffers 1d3 Shock and falling damage.

name: OBLITERATOR
description: Hulking figures bristling with heavy weapons, Obliterators are nightmare beasts of utter destruction. A Baroque melding of Chaos Space Marine, daemon-infused armour, and mutated weaponry, Obliterators are able to reshape their forms from moment to moment, adapting to changing battlefield conditions and the nature of their target with an array of ever-shifting fleshmetal armaments. Obliterators often step directly from warp fissures into ideal firing positions, sweeping away their enemies in a firestorm of warp-tainted ruin.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 10, Intimidation 10, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Agent of Apocalypse
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Mark of Chaos: Undedicated
bonuses.description: This threat gains +Rank bonus dice when using one of the following skills: Awareness, Cunning, Deception, Insight, Persuasion, Psychic Mastery, Stealth, or Weapon Skill.

bonuses.name: Space Marine Implants
bonuses.description: Gain bonus dice and options for actions from Space Marine Implants.

abilities.name: Second Strike
abilities.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN, as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

abilities.name: Witness Annihilation!
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to increase the Salvo rating of an attack by 1.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 10d6. Obliterators can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: SORCERER (Heretic Astartes)
description: Despite the danger posed by dabbling with the energies of the Empyrean it became clear that psykers amongst the ranks of the Astartes were formidable warriors, and the Traitor Legions have no qualms in augmenting the abilities of their psykers with the terrible knowledge acquired from their daemonic allies. Sorcerers combine their psychic abilities with infernal rituals, bloody sacrifices and forbidden mysteries to summon forth power from the Immaterium.
skills: Default 7, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 10, Leadership 9, Psychic Mastery 9, Scholar 9, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Architect of Ruin
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's Turns.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Mark of Chaos: Undedicated
bonuses.description: This threat gains +Rank bonus dice when using one of the following skills: Awareness, Cunning, Deception, Insight, Persuasion, Psychic Mastery, Stealth, or Weapon Skill.

bonuses.name: Space Marine Implants
bonuses.description: Gain bonus dice and options for actions from Space Marine Implants.

bonuses.name: Warp Touched
bonuses.description: Whenever this Threat rolls a Psychic Mastery (Wil) Test, they gain bonus Wrath dice equal to the Tier of the game.

abilities.name: Maleficarum
abilities.description: The Sorcerer attempts to activate Smite or a Maleficarum psychic power.

abilities.name: Psychic Storm
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. This Threat attempts to activate a psychic power or Deny the Witch.

name: DARK APOSTLE
description: Keepers of the Primordial Truth, Dark Apostles are the malefic reflection of loyalist Chaplains. They recite the dark verses to inspire the devotion of their Legionaries while causing their enemies to cower and weep. The first Dark Apostles appeared in the ranks of the Word Bearers, the first of the Legions to fall to Chaos. These mouthpieces of the Chaos Gods carry into battle a Cursed Crozius — a vile weapon that is a mockery of the symbol of faith the Space Marine Chaplains bear. Dark Apostles are often accompanied by their Dark Disciples — faithful mortal cultists who attend to their lord's needs.
skills: Default 7, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 10, Leadership 10, Scholar 10, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Architect of Ruin
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's Turns.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Mark of Chaos: Undedicated
bonuses.description: This threat gains +Rank bonus dice when using one of the following skills: Awareness, Cunning, Deception, Insight, Persuasion, Psychic Mastery, Stealth, or Weapon Skill.

bonuses.name: Space Marine Implants
bonuses.description: Gain bonus dice and options for actions from Space Marine Implants.

abilities.name: Turn the Galaxy Red With Blood!
abilities.description: Anyone who encounters this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Dark Disciples
abilities.description: Use the profile for Demagogues to represent the Dark Apostle's Disciples.

abilities.name: Death to the False Emperor!
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to Charge, gaining +2 bonus dice to the attack Test.

name: WARPSMITH
description: Consorting with abominable powers and wielding forgotten and reviled technologies, Warpsmiths work beyond the confines of material law. They toil in titanic soul forges in the warp, melding machine, flesh and Daemon into monstrous war engines for their despotic lords. Each Warpsmith is a fusion of flesh and metal, host to a writhing nest of semi-sentient mechatendrils. They are twisted masters of machinery, dark scholars of corrupted engine-lore and other profane technological mysteries.
skills: Default 7, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 10, Scholar 8, Tech 10, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Architect of Ruin
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's Turns.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Mark of Chaos: Undedicated
bonuses.description: This threat gains +Rank bonus dice when using one of the following skills: Awareness, Cunning, Deception, Insight, Persuasion, Psychic Mastery, Stealth, or Weapon Skill.

bonuses.name: Space Marine Implants
bonuses.description: Gain bonus dice and options for actions from Space Marine Implants.

bonuses.name: Second Strike
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

abilities.name: Plasma Pistol
abilities.stats: 15 +1 ED / -3 AP / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 1 / Pistol, Supercharge

abilities.name: Melta Tendril
abilities.stats: 16 +1 ED / -4 AP / Range 3-6-9 / Salvo 1 / Melta, Pistol

abilities.name: Enrage Machine Spirit!
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to enrage a Daemonic Machine Spirit in a friendly vehicle within 6m. The vehicle benefits from a further +1 bonus die to all combat actions for the round.

determination: More Machine than Man: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. Warpsmiths can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: MASTER OF POSSESSION
description: Those Sorcerers who push the limits of reality and the Immaterium, and delve into the darkest rituals and blasphemous witchcraft, become capable thaumaturgists and manipulators of the energies of the Empyrean. Through their skill and deranged insight, these Masters of Possession, at the behest of their patrons and warlords, bind daemons into the bodies of willing, or sacrificial, Legionaries to create the terrible beasts — Daemonkin — known as Possessed.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Ballistic Skill 10, Leadership 9, Psychic Mastery 11, Scholar 11, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Architect of Ruin
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's Turns.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Mark of Chaos: Undedicated
bonuses.description: This threat gains +Rank bonus dice when using one of the following skills: Awareness, Cunning, Deception, Insight, Persuasion, Psychic Mastery, Stealth, or Weapon Skill.

bonuses.name: Space Marine Implants
bonuses.description: Gain bonus dice and options for actions from Space Marine Implants.

bonuses.name: Warp Touched
bonuses.description: Whenever this Threat rolls a Psychic Mastery (Wil) Test, they gain bonus Wrath dice equal to the Tier of the game.

abilities.name: Maleficarum
abilities.description: The Master of Possession attempts to activate Smite or a Maleficarum psychic power.

abilities.name: Slaughter of the Gods
abilities.description: The Master of Possession uses their sacrificial dagger to slay a friendly non-daemonic Heretic Astartes within 6m. Doing so provides the Master of Possession a bonus 2 dice to their next Psychic Mastery (Wil) test.

abilities.name: Soulbane
abilities.description: When this Threat makes a Critical Hit against a target with the PSYKER keyword when attacking with a Staff of Possession, the target suffers 1d3 Mortal Wounds in addition to the Critical Hit's effects.

abilities.name: Psychic Storm
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. This Threat attempts to activate a psychic power or Deny the Witch.

abilities.name: Whispers of the Warp
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. Target PSYKER within 20m of this Threat adds +10 to their Perils of the Warp result.

name: POSSESSED
description: An amalgam of Daemon and Heretic Astartes, these beasts are formed through pacts between the Chaos Space Marine and the warp-born entity or crafted through the arcane arts of a Master of Possession. Where lesser mortals become consumed by the daemon that inhabits their body, leaving them a meat puppet for the spirit which begins to contort and mutate the physical shell, those that possess a Heretic Astartes have much less control. Only in the heat of battle does the Chaos Space Marine relinquish control to the Daemon and allow the Warp-spawn to run rampant and utilise the full potential of its powers.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Architect of Ruin
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's Turns.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Mark of Chaos: Undedicated
bonuses.description: This threat gains +Rank bonus dice when using one of the following skills: Awareness, Cunning, Deception, Insight, Persuasion, Psychic Mastery, Stealth, or Weapon Skill.

bonuses.name: Space Marine Implants
bonuses.description: Gain bonus dice and options for actions from Space Marine Implants.

abilities.name: Turn the Galaxy Red With Blood!
abilities.description: Anyone who encounters this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Wanton Slaughter
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. This Threat makes a melee attack against every enemy within reach.

abilities.name: Veteran of the Long War
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to add the game's Tier as ED to all attacks this Threat makes this Round.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 8d6. Possessed can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: MASTER OF EXECUTIONS
description: Grim headhunters, these assassins and executioners are the brutal agents of powerful warlords, tasked with slaying enemies within and without the warband ranks. They hone their skills in the blood-drenched arenas of daemon worlds, slaying an array of beasts and captive warriors brought to fight for the warlord's amusement. Their skill and devotion often attract the attention of the Ruinous Powers themselves, and each Master of Executions who proves worthy of the name is bestowed with the gift of soul sight.
skills: Default 7, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 10, Weapon Skill 11

bonuses.name: Architect of Ruin
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's Turns.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Mark of Chaos: Khorne
bonuses.description: This Threat gains +2 bonus dice when making attacks using the All-Out Attack option.

bonuses.name: Space Marine Implants
bonuses.description: Gain bonus dice and options for actions from Space Marine Implants.

abilities.name: Limb Slicer
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. When this Threat successfully hits they deal +2 Mortal Wounds.

abilities.name: Head Taker
abilities.description: When this Threat successfully hits with their Axe of Dismemberment with a Wrath Critical in melee they roll twice on the Critical Hit table and select the best result.

abilities.name: Warp-Sighted Butcher
abilities.description: This Threat may make a free move in response to a target declaring a Charge action, and so interpose itself between the target and the Threat being charged, and become the new target for the attack.

name: LORD OF CHANGE
description: The greatest of Tzeentch's daemons, the Lords of Change shimmer with raw magic and are driven by the need to redirect the weave of fate itself. A Lord of Change revels in dashing the hopes of the ambitious, raising the impoverished to heights of power or overturning the societies of entire worlds. Each of these Greater Daemons are blessed with multi-layered cunning, blazing intelligence, and a deep understanding of the causality that drives the galaxy. A Lord of Change's appearance is as bewildering as it is terrifying — an ever-changing, multi-hued form that defies mortal reasoning or logic.
skills: Default 10, Psychic Mastery 20

bonuses.name: Foresee the Ending
bonuses.description: The GM gains 2 Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's turns.

bonuses.name: Entrusted by Tzeentch
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: One with the Warp
bonuses.description: This threat never encounters Perils of the Warp when using Psychic Powers.

abilities.name: Everchanging Presence
abilities.description: Anyone who sees a Lord of Change must make a DN 5 Terror Test.

abilities.name: Maleficarum
abilities.description: The Lord of Change attempts to activate any two psychic powers including Smite or a Maleficarum psychic power, treat Corruption as 7.

abilities.name: Healing Flames
abilities.description: Spend 2 Ruin, the Lord of Change recovers 3 Wounds.

abilities.name: Bolt of Change
abilities.description: Spend 2 Ruin, the Lord of Change unleashes a bolt of energy at a target who must make a successful DN 4 Willpower Test or transform into a Chaos Spawn.

abilities.name: Pluck from the Warp
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin, the Lord of Change cuts a portal to the Immaterium and a mob of 7 Pink Horrors emerges. They may act immediately.

abilities.name: Psychic Entity
abilities.description: Any time another psyker attempts to manipulate the warp, the Lord of Change attempts to Deny the Witch.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: THE CHANGELING
description: The Changeling is the most accomplished trickster amongst Tzeentch's daemons, the embodiment of the Great Conspirator's need to meddle and deceive. The Changeling possesses a supernatural ability to assume the shape of any other creature with unfailing precision. He is the ultimate doppelganger; there is no form the Changeling cannot duplicate, no mannerism he cannot adopt.
skills: Default 10, Deception 12, Psychic Mastery 12

bonuses.name: Formless Horror
bonuses.description: The Changeling begins each scene in the form of another being active within the scene. While in this form, it gains the ability to use that being's skills, talents, bonuses, and abilities, including psychic powers. Piercing this deception requires a DN 9 Awareness (Int) Test.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: The Changeling may use Ruin actions and has 4 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Trickster's Staff
abilities.description: This weapon duplicates the profile of any weapon the GM chooses that has appeared in the current scene.

abilities.name: Psychic Manipulator
abilities.description: The Changeling attempts to activate a psychic power including Smite or a Telepathy Discipline psychic power.

abilities.name: Ultimate Doppelganger
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin, the Changeling transforms into the shape of a new being or reverts to its native shape.

abilities.name: Lose Track
abilities.description: The Changeling immediately transforms into the shape of another being involved in the current conflict. Only those who pass a DN 9 Awareness (Int) Test can identify which of the two beings is the Changeling.

abilities.name: Psychic Trickster
abilities.description: Any time another psyker attempts to manipulate the warp, the Changeling attempts to Deny the Witch.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: FATESKIMMER
description: Pink Horrors who garner the blessings of the Changer of Ways may be granted a Herald. Those Heralds that acquire a Burning Chariot are known as Fateskimmers. These daemons hurtle along illogical trajectories that defy all physical laws, swooping and diving across the battlefield, cackling madly as they unleash fearsome sorceries from their lofty perches before smashing their bizarre contraption into the enemy lines.
skills: Default 8, Weapon Skill 10, Psychic Mastery 10

bonuses.name: Burning Chariot
bonuses.description: In melee, the Fateskimmer can make one Ritual Knife attack and two Lamprey Bite attacks each turn.

bonuses.name: Ritual Dagger
bonuses.description: Any time the Ritual Knife wounds an opponent, this Threat gains the same number of wounds as it inflicts on the target.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 5 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Magic Made Manifest
abilities.description: Spend 1 ruin to activate the Smite Psychic Power. This power is always activated at the Transcendent Power Level.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: FLUXMASTER
description: Those Pink Horrors who have earned the rank of Herald and ride a Disc of Tzeentch are known as Fluxmasters. Their name reflects the great speed with which they travel, and it is said that reality reshapes itself in their wake. They are often used as messengers and outriders within the Scintillating Legions.
skills: Default 8, Leadership 10, Psychic Mastery 10

bonuses.name: Disc of Tzeentch
bonuses.description: In melee, the Fluxmaster can make one Ritual Knife attack and one Blades attack each turn.

bonuses.name: Ritual Dagger
bonuses.description: Any time the Ritual Knife wounds an opponent, this Threat gains the same number of wounds as it inflicts on the target.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Magic Made Manifest
abilities.description: Spend 1 ruin to activate the Smite Psychic Power. This power is always activated at the Transcendent Power Level.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 3d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: CHANGECASTER
description: The Changer of Ways chooses Heralds of Tzeentch from the most intelligent, devious and skilled amongst the Pink Horrors. So elevated, they radiate the eldritch might of their master, and uniquely amongst Horror-kind, they are able to reform their two halves should they be dealt a mortal blow. Each is also gifted a ritual dagger, an ensorceled weapon that can transfer a slain foe's energies into the wielder.
skills: Default 8, Leadership 10, Psychic Mastery 10

bonuses.name: Ritual Dagger
bonuses.description: Any time the Ritual Knife wounds an opponent, this Threat gains the same number of wounds as it inflicts on the target.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Magic Made Manifest
abilities.description: Spend 1 ruin to activate the Smite Psychic Power. This power is always activated at the Transcendent Power Level.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 3d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: BLUE SCRIBES
description: The Blue Scribes appear across the warp, throughout time, and in the remotest corners of the galaxy on a flying Disc of Tzeentch to search for lost grimoires, scrolls and sorcerers to seek every fragment of arcana and learn every spell in existence. P'tarix siphons the power of enemy psykers to learn and catalogue their secrets, whilst Xirat'p unleashes a sorcerous barrage by reading from the huge collection of scrolls they have collected through the centuries.
skills: Default 7, Psychic Mastery 9, Weapon Skill 9

bonuses.name: Disc Riders
bonuses.description: The Blue Scribes can make one Sharp Quills attack, one Blades attack, and one Sorcerous Barrage each turn.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Sorcerous Barrage
abilities.description: The Blue Scribes attempt to activate a psychic power including Smite or a Maleficarum psychic power, treat Corruption as 5.

abilities.name: Squabbling
abilities.description: The Blue Scribes turn on one another, and return to the Warp, squabbling amongst themselves.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: FLAMER OF TZEENTCH
description: Flamers of Tzeentch are the wielders of wyrdflame, the warpfire of Chaos itself. The fires of change are as unpredictable as they are devastating, wreaking countless mutations upon their victims in the blink of an eye. Bounding in a disturbing fashion, Flamers spring toward the foe spouting wyrdflame, moving with an unexpected speed.
skills: Default 7, Ballistic Skill 8

bonuses.name: Bounding
bonuses.description: This threat moves by jumping. Its standard movement distance for Long and High Jumps is 12 metres. Its maximum Long and High Jump distance with an Athletics (S) Test is 36 metres.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Warpflame
abilities.stats: 10 +1 ED / Range 4-8-12 / Assault, Pistol, Flamer, Warp

abilities.name: Fires of Change
abilities.description: Those struck by a Flamer's attack undergo a warp-fueled physical transformation that leaves them Hindered (1) until the end of the scene, when the transformation reverts.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: GREAT UNCLEAN ONE
description: Great Unclean Ones are among Nurgle's most favoured servants, the field generals of his Plague Legions. As hulking, monstrous and horrific as their appearance is, these Greater Daemons are possessed of a paternal affection at odds with this nightmarish form. Gregarious and sentimental, a Great Unclean One takes pride in the achievements of his followers and looks upon all the creatures in his warhost as his 'children'. Each is shaped in the image of Nurgle himself; a gargantuan horned and bloated figure, flyblown, maggot-ridden innards spilling into view through the tears and gashes in its swollen belly.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 13 (Passive 7), Weapon Skill 12

bonuses.name: Neverending Plague
bonuses.description: The GM gains 2 Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's turns.

bonuses.name: Beloved of Nurgle
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Massive Bulk
bonuses.description: A Great Unclean One is huge and immensely difficult to kill. It has 40 Wounds.

abilities.name: Encroaching Pestilence
abilities.description: Anyone who sees a Great Unclean One must make a DN 5 Terror Test.

abilities.name: Bilesword
abilities.stats: 17 +4 ED / AP -2 / Brutal, Parry, Inflict (Poisoned 4), Inflict (Bleeding)

abilities.name: Putrid Vomit
abilities.stats: 14 +3 ED / AP -2 / Range 3-6-9 / Assault, Inflict (Poisoned 4), Spread

abilities.name: Maleficarum
abilities.description: The Great Unclean One attempts to activate any two psychic powers including Smite or a Maleficarum psychic power, treat Corruption as 7.

abilities.name: Nurglings!
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. A single band of Nurglings numbering the same as the Great Unclean One's remaining Wounds disgorges from the daemon's guts and acts immediately.

abilities.name: Disease Progression
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. The Great Unclean One heals 5 Wounds.

abilities.name: Noxious Discharge
abilities.description: When this Threat is wounded in melee combat, all enemies within 3m must make a DN 3 Toughness Test or suffer 1d3 Mortal Wounds.

determination: You do not need to spend Ruin to roll 10d6 Determination. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: POXBRINGER
description: Poxbringers project an air of malign authority. They stand taller and broader than the Plaguebearers that surround them, their lumpen heads crowned with magnificent sets of rotting antlers. Imbued with a generous portion of the unnatural vitality of Nurgle, Poxbringers project an aura of disease. This vile atmosphere is sometimes visible as a hazy fug that surrounds them. So noxious are these emanations that they can empower fellow minions of Nurgle.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Psychic Mastery 8, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: The Poxbringer may use Ruin actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Maleficarum
abilities.description: The Poxbringer attempts to activate a psychic power including Smite or a Maleficarum psychic power, treat Corruption as 5.

abilities.name: Cheerful Contagion
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. Another model in the conflict with the NURGLE or Mark of NURGLE keyword regains 2 Wounds.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 9d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: SPOILPOX SCRIVENER
description: The Heralds known as Spoilpox Scriveners are given a specific task by Grandfather Nurgle. It is their duty to audit the endless disease-tally and ceaseless counting of the Plaguebearers. To accomplish their role, Scriveners are equipped with endless hidebound scrolls upon which they use special quills made from the plucked tail feathers of a Lord of Change.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Leadership 8, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: The Spoilpox Scrivener may use Ruin actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Check Your Count
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. All Plaguebearers in the scene receive +1 Speed until the scene ends or the Spoilpox Scrivener is defeated.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 9d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: SLOPPITY BILEPIPER
description: A daemon infected with Chortling Murrain abandons his characteristic shuffling gait and steady, measured droning as he falls into what can only be described as a comedic fever. Once the symptoms fully manifest, its victim is given the title of Sloppity Bilepiper and a new task. Gifted with a gutpipe and marotter, these budding Heralds are sent to amuse Nurgle's Tallybands as they march to war.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Leadership 8, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: The Sloppity Bilepiper may use Ruin actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Disease of Mirth
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. All characters without the Mark of Nurgle keyword gain the Exhausted condition. On their turn, they may take a Free Action to make a DN 2 Resolve Test to remove the condition.

abilities.name: Jolly Gutpipes
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. All characters with the NURGLE keyword are immediately cured of all Conditions.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 9d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: NURGLING
description: Nurglings are rarely a formal part of any of the Plague Legions, but instead tag along in their swarms, cavorting upon the heels of the commanding Great Unclean One. When threatened, they swarm forward in a rush of malevolence, spilling over their victims like an irrepressible tide. Possessed of pointed teeth and sharp claws, the Nurglings swallow up their enemies in a mound of biting, scratching bodies.
skills: Default 1, Weapon Skill 2

bonuses.name: Mischief Makers
bonuses.description: Nurglings complicate everything. Once they appear in a scene, any die roll that includes two or more 1s triggers a Wrath Complication. Characters with NURGLE keyword are immune to this effect.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 2 Fear Test.

mobAbilities: A Mob of Nurglings gains +1 bonus Icon to any Resolve Tests. This increases by +1 for every ten Nurglings.
determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 1d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: BEAST OF NURGLE
description: Beasts of Nurgle are slug-like monstrosities whose enormous bodies are weighed down with slime-slick muscle and blubber. Despite this, they are not spiteful creatures bent on malice. For all their horrifying bulk, Beasts of Nurgle are friendly and enthusiastic in nature, incarnations of the Plague God's own bountiful exuberance. The mere touch of such a creature is quickly fatal to most mortals.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Deadly Slime Trail
bonuses.description: Anyone engaged with this threat becomes Restrained until they disengage or the threat is eliminated.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: ROT FLY
description: Favoured Plaguebearers ride into battle mounted upon Rot Flies — colossal daemonic insects whose appearance is so repugnant it scars the mind. Plaguebearers prize such steeds highly, for in their haste to punish mortals, Rot Flies speed into battle. As the Rot Flies fall upon their prey, leathery wings buzz in a flapping purr of motion, poisoned stingers and razor-sharp limbs lash and rend.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Buzzing Flight
bonuses.description: Rot Flies usually move by Flying. If knocked prone, they may choose to hover above the ground instead of landing.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: PLAGUE MARINE
description: Bloated with festering corruption, Plague Marines form the mainstay of the Death Guard. Sworn to Nurgle's service, Plague Marines have disgusting, rotted bodies that stink of decay. The putrescent slime that oozes from their sores corrodes armour and boils away skin, yet despite their horrific disfigurements, they are fearsome warriors indeed. Their rotting brains are inured to the agony of bodily corruption, making them all but immune to the pain or debilitation caused by battle wounds.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 8, Ballistic Skill 9, Weapon Skill 9

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: The Plague Marine may use Ruin actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Space Marine Implants
bonuses.description: Gain bonus dice and options for actions from Space Marine Implants.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Veteran of the Long War
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to add the game's Tier as ED to all attacks this Threat makes this Round.

abilities.name: Noxious Discharge
abilities.description: When this Threat is wounded in melee combat, all enemies within 3m must make a DN 3 Toughness Test or suffer 1d3 Mortal Wounds.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 8d6. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: BLOODTHIRSTER
description: Khorne demands blood, rage, skulls and death from his followers, and his Greater Daemons excel beyond all others. Bloodthirsters are the murderous brutality of war made flesh. None can match their boundless hate or their drive to kill. Towering over mere mortals, the ground itself bleeds and burns at the touch of the cloven hooves of these giants. A single Bloodthirster is easily a match for an entire mortal army.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Weapon Skill 15

bonuses.name: Architect of Ruin
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's Turns.

bonuses.name: Colossal Size
bonuses.description: This Threat is a mighty giant, immensely difficult to kill. It has 50 Wounds.

bonuses.name: Daemon Lord of Khorne
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Locus of Unbound Fury
bonuses.description: Anyone who makes a melee attack within 10 metres of this Threat (including itself) may reroll any 1s on their Weapon Skill Tests, apart from Complications.

abilities.name: Rage Incarnate
abilities.description: Anyone witnessing a Bloodthirster must make a DN 3 Terror Test. Additionally, anyone who fails must attack the nearest enemy (excluding the Bloodthirster) or ally as if Frenzied.

abilities.name: Blood for the Blood God!
abilities.description: If this Threat rolls a Wrath Critical as part of an attack, the target suffers the Bleeding Condition in addition to any other effects.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 10d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: BLOODMASTER
description: Khorne despises peace and weakness. His realm is an eternal proving ground where a daemon's right to existence only lasts while it remains undefeated in battle. Aspiring Bloodletters descend into the Skullpit, a nightmare arena where only the most furious and bloodthirsty champions prevail. The few that survive emerge glutted on slaughter and tempered in the fires of Khorne's infinite rage, to lead the Bloodletter hosts.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Weapon Skill 12

bonuses.name: Locus of Fury
bonuses.description: Anyone who makes a melee attack within 2 metres of this Threat may reroll any 1s on Weapon Skill Tests. Complications may not be rerolled in this way.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Blood for the Blood God!
abilities.description: If this Threat rolls a Wrath Critical as part of an attack, the target suffers the Bleeding Condition in addition to any other effects.

abilities.name: Unbound Fury
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to enhance Locus of Fury for 1 Round; melee attacks within 2 metres can reroll 1s twice (excluding Complications).

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 8d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: SKULLTAKER
description: Skulltaker is the immortal champion of Khorne, the greatest of those Bloodletters that form the bulk of the Blood God's daemonic forces. It stands tall above its lesser brethren, wearing embellished brazen armour and a cloak of skin and skulls. As Khorne's sacred executioner, Skulltaker wields the Slayer Sword, a fell blade of such unnatural rage and hunger it carves through armour like water.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Weapon Skill 12

bonuses.name: Locus of Fury
bonuses.description: Anyone who makes a melee attack within 2 metres of this Threat may reroll any 1s on Weapon Skill Tests. Complications may not be rerolled in this way.

bonuses.name: Lord of Decapitations
bonuses.description: This Threat does not suffer the usual +2 DN penalty for Called Shots to the head and gains +3 ED instead of +2 if it hits.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Slayer Sword
abilities.stats: 16 +5 ED / AP -4 / Range 1 / Brutal, Inflict (Bleeding), Parry

abilities.name: Blood for the Blood God!
abilities.description: If this Threat rolls a Wrath Critical as part of an attack, the target suffers the Bleeding Condition in addition to any other effects.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 9d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: RENDMASTER
description: The most favoured of Khorne's Heralds are granted the title of Rendmaster. They ride to battle atop monstrous daemon engines of iron and brass known as Blood Thrones. Infernal lore suggests that each Blood Throne is fashioned from a sliver of Khorne's own mighty throne, and that wherever they fight, they fight under the Blood God's demanding gaze.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Weapon Skill 12

bonuses.name: Locus of Fury
bonuses.description: Anyone who makes a melee attack within 2 metres of this Threat may reroll any 1s on Weapon Skill Tests. Complications may not be rerolled in this way.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Blood for the Blood God!
abilities.description: If this Threat rolls a Wrath Critical as part of an attack, the target suffers the Bleeding Condition in addition to any other effects.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 9d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: FLESH HOUND
description: Daemonic beasts resembling a mix of wolf and reptile, Flesh Hounds are terrifying hunters and savage killers. Thick-scaled hides protect their powerful, almost-canine bulks, and their maws are lined with razor-sharp fangs. It is said that Khorne sets them to hunt those who have insulted him: cowards, pacifists and sorcerers. Each Flesh Hound wears an enormous brass collar forged in the heat of Khorne's hatred for sorcery.
skills: Default 3, Weapon Skill 9

bonuses.name: Collar of Khorne
bonuses.description: This Threat may attempt to Deny the Witch once each Turn as if it had the PSYKER Keyword, with a roll of 10 dice.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Chilling Howl
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. All enemies in earshot must make a DN 3 Terror Test.

mobAbilities: Fury of the Pack: A Mob of 10 or more Flesh Hounds gains +1 Defence and +2 bonus dice to attack rolls as long as each member is attacking the same target.
determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: LORD OF SKULLS
description: Lords of Skulls are insane, monolithic creations — a mechanical vessel for a truly mighty daemon, fuelled by boiling blood and dedicated to slaughtering in the name of Khorne. These colossal constructs plough through the enemy's ranks, crushing infantry into paste beneath their tracks, hacking tanks into kindling with careless cleaver strikes, and hurling brazen projectiles or burning ichor at the survivors.
skills: Default 4, Ballistic Skill 8, Weapon Skill 8

bonuses.name: Towering Monstrosity
bonuses.description: This Threat is huge and heavily armoured. It has 50 Wounds.

bonuses.name: Daemon Engine
bonuses.description: At the start of each of this Threat's Turns, it heals 2d3 Wounds.

bonuses.name: Reckless Fury
bonuses.description: This Threat may fire its ranged weapons in close combat. If there are fewer enemies than half the Blast rating, or on a Complication, the Lord of Skulls is also hit.

abilities.name: Rage Incarnate
abilities.description: Anyone who sees a Lord of Skulls must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 9d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: KHORNE BERZERKER
description: Nowhere is the hate-fuelled hunger for violence, rage and brutal murder more apparent than in the warbands of the Khorne Berzerkers. Berzerkers relish their role as the Blood God's sacred destroyers, and their fanaticism is feared throughout the galaxy. Driven to murderous frenzies of killing movement, those who face them in battle are shredded under a rain of furious blows from revving chain weapons.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 7, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Architect of Ruin
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's Turns.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Mark of Chaos: Khorne
bonuses.description: This Threat gains +2 bonus dice when making attacks using the All-Out Attack option.

bonuses.name: Space Marine Implants
bonuses.description: Gain bonus dice and options for actions from Space Marine Implants.

bonuses.name: Eternal Bloodlust
bonuses.description: This Threat's maximum Shock is doubled (included in profile).

abilities.name: Kill! Maim! Burn!
abilities.description: This Threat may make 2 attacks each Turn without penalty. If dual wielding, it makes 1 attack with each weapon.

abilities.name: Veteran of the Long War
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to add the game's Tier as ED to all attacks this Threat makes this Round.

name: SKULLMASTER
description: Skullmasters are the elite of Khorne's cavalry, Bloodcrushers who have triumphed on countless battlefields and earned the honour of leading the charge through exemplary acts of violence and bloodshed. They strike enemy lines like the head of a living battering ram; while their Juggernaut steed tramples and gores everything within reach, they hack and stab about them with a potent Blade of Blood.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Weapon Skill 12

bonuses.name: Locus of Fury
bonuses.description: Anyone who makes a melee attack within 2 metres of this Threat may reroll any 1s on Weapon Skill Tests. Complications may not be rerolled in this way.

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Blood for the Blood God!
abilities.description: If this Threat rolls a Wrath Critical as part of an attack, the target suffers the Bleeding Condition in addition to any other effects.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 8d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: KEEPER OF SECRETS
description: Slaanesh's Greater Daemons. A Keeper of Secrets is above all things in subverting and twisting the intentions of those who would stand against Chaos, manipulating the purest champions to indulge, to obsess, to carry their virtues to the most unspeakable extremes until they become everything they once despised. To face a Keeper of Secrets is to face your most shameful desires, your every hope, want and aspiration.
skills: Default 10, Persuasion 15, Weapon Skill 15

bonuses.name: Colossal Size
bonuses.description: This Threat is extremely large, swift and immensely difficult to kill. It has 35 Wounds.

bonuses.name: Daemon Lord of Slaanesh
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Transcendent Agonies
bonuses.description: Daemons within 10 metres of this Threat (including itself) gain +2 ED to all attacks.

bonuses.name: Architect of Ruin
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's Turns.

bonuses.name: Legions of Excess
bonuses.description: A Keeper of Secrets may wield an extra weapon in its free hand. It suffers no penalty for Multi-attacks, and may attack 2 different targets as if it had the Dual Wield Talent.

abilities.name: Horrific Temptation
abilities.description: Anyone witnessing a Keeper of Secrets must make a DN 3 Terror Test. Anyone who fails must move towards the greater daemon instead of away.

abilities.name: Ritual Knife
abilities.description: 13 +3 ED / AP -1 / Range 1 / Agonising, Parry

abilities.name: Snapping Claws
abilities.description: 15 +4 ED / AP -3 / Range 3 / Agonising, Brutal

abilities.name: Witstealer Sword
abilities.description: 16 +6 ED / AP -4 / Range 3 / Agonising, Inflict (Hindered 2)

abilities.name: Living Whip (Legions of Excess)
abilities.description: (S) + 8 +2 ED / AP -2 / Range 4 / Agonising, Rending (3)

abilities.name: Shining Aegis (Legions of Excess)
abilities.description: AR 3* / Shield

abilities.name: Sinistrous Hand (Legions of Excess)
abilities.description: (S) +1 ED / AP -1 / Range 1 / Each time the Keeper of Secrets kills an enemy or destroys a Mob, it regains d6 Wounds but cannot exceed its Maximum Wounds.

abilities.name: Soulstain
abilities.description: When this Threat kills an enemy, the GM gains 1 Ruin.

abilities.name: Mesmerising Form
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. Until this Threat's next Turn, everyone within 20 metres without the SLAANESH keyword suffers a +2 DN penalty to all attacks.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 10d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: TRANCEWEAVER
description: The court of Slaanesh is fiercely competitive. His favoured Daemonettes, granted a place next to his throne, are the Tranceweavers, and they have earned their place by corrupting countless mortals and performing magnificent displays of sensual cruelty. Tranceweavers dance across the battlefields of the galaxy, leading by example. Gleeful war cries exhort their fellows to more extravagant displays of skill and slaughter.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 10 (Passive 6), Deception 11, Persuasion 11, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Allure of Slaanesh
bonuses.description: Attack Tests made against this Threat use Willpower as their Attribute instead of the Attribute the weapon would normally use.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Herald of Slaanesh
bonuses.description: If any Tranceweavers are within Short Range of this Threat, they may re-roll any 1s on their attack rolls.

abilities.name: Disquieting Creature & Quicksilver Swiftness
abilities.description: Anyone that can see or hear this Threat must pass a DN 3 Fear Test. This Threat then acts first in the Initiative order.

abilities.name: Ravaging Claws
abilities.description: 12 +3 ED / AP -1 / Range 1 / Parry, Rending (3)

abilities.name: Exquisite Agonies
abilities.description: When this Threat rolls a Wrath Critical, its attacks gain the Agonising Trait.

abilities.name: Tranceweaver
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin and nominate a Mob of Daemonettes within 20 metres; Until Tranceweaver's next turn, that Mob's attacks gain a -1 bonus to their AP rating.

determination: Daemonic Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: CONTORTED EPITOME
description: A pair of Daemonettes ride these twisted metallic manifestations into battle. Resembling a mirror perched atop a writhing mass of tendrils, the Contorted Epitome reflects the deepest desires of those who look upon it. Weak-willed enemies stare awestruck at visions of paradise as the creature's monstrous whipping tentacles and attendant's claws tear them apart. Worse, however, is its sorcerous ability; The Contorted Epitome steals power from enemy Psykers even as it sows destruction with potent psychic arts of its own.
skills: Default 6, Psychic Mastery 8, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat and its riders may use Ruin Actions. They have 3 personal Ruin between them.

bonuses.name: Heralds of Slaanesh
bonuses.description: If any Daemonette is within Short Range of the Contorted Epitome, they may re-roll any 1s on their attack rolls.

bonuses.name: Mount
bonuses.description: A Contorted Epitome may be ridden by 2 Tormentbringers. They take their Turns together, using the Contorted Epitome's movement, and each have their own Action. Riders and mount may be targeted separately.

abilities.name: Disquieting Creature & Quicksilver Swiftness
abilities.description: Anyone that can see or hear this Threat must pass a DN 4 Fear Test. This Threat then acts first in the Initiative order.

abilities.name: Coiled Tentacles

abilities.name: Soulstain

name: MASQUE OF SLAANESH
description: It is said that once, the Masque was Slaanesh's favourite herald, but the petulant god placed a curse on it over some imagined, unforgivable slight. Now the Masque is fated to dance forever across space and time. Its acrobatic performances rival the legendary skill of Aeldari Harlequins, compelling enemies to abandon their safety and join in, and encouraging allies to engage in even greater spectacles of bloodshed.
skills: Default 9, Awareness 10 (Passive 6), Deception 11, Persuasion 11, Weapon Skill 11

name: TORMENTBRINGER
description: Obsessed with eradicating enemies in the most spectacularly gruesome manner possible, Tormentbringers ride to battle on wide chariots made entirely out of wickedly curved, razor sharp spinning blades. When these chariots smash into enemy lines the result is an explosion of gore. The cruel whips Tormentbringers use to spur their mounts are then turned on the enemy, each delicate lick parting flesh with barbs and rending hooks.

name: DAEMONETTE
description: The handmaidens of Slaanesh, the footsoldiers of the Legions of Excess, Daemonettes combine seductive beauty and the viscerally grotesque. Graceful and agile, they flow like silk across a battlefield, in contrast to the savage butchery they administer with their elegant claws. Their sighs of delight and pleasure as they kill and are killed can unsteel the most determined foe, revelling in every sensation to be found in the heat of battle.

name: INFERNAL ENRAPTURESS
description: These Daemonettes are singers and musicians of inhuman skill. Their instruments are sculpted from still-living victims condemned to become their own torture devices. In battle, they cast shockwaves of sonic agony at their enemies, shattering armour, pulverising flesh and unravelling the concentration of psykers alike, whilst their unearthly music is so beguiling it can even overcome death or banishment, drawing fallen daemons back to realspace to continue their orgy of slaughter.

name: FIEND
description: These daemonic beasts are truly bizarre amalgamations of stark human flesh, glittering insectoid chitin and bestial shape. They stalk swiftly across the battlefield, crooning and hooting in delight as they hunt. Each Fiend exudes a soporific musk that permeates even sealed suits and vacuum, making easy targets of enemies for their wicked claws and stabbing tails.
skills: Default 4, Weapon Skill 8

name: STEED OF SLAANESH
description: Lightning fast cavalry, Seekers comprise a Daemonette astride the grotesque and bizarrely alluring beasts known as Steeds of Slaanesh. The thrill of running down mortal prey is their all-consuming obsession, and few if any vehicles can outrun a Seeker that has committed itself to the kill. When the fight is joined, mount and rider fight in perfect harmony, piercing claws and lashing, venomous whip-tongues taking their enemy apart in a kaleidoscopic spray of blood and torn limbs.
skills: Default 5, Athletics 8

name: NOISE MARINE
description: With their roots originating amongst the Emperor's Children Legion during the Horus Heresy, any Heretic Astartes dedicated to Slaanesh may become one of these abhorrent, monstrous hedonists known as Noise Marines. Wholly given over to the pursuit of auditory sensations, Noise Marines have a supernaturally-honed sense of hearing, and all sounds cause them abnormally heightened emotional responses. They arm themselves with psychosonic weapons unleashing insane chords and discordant notes at the enemy.

description: Helbrutes are walking engines of destruction and psychosis, their occupants kept alive in a state of agony and insanity. These infernal sarcophagi are fitted with a variety of powerful armaments to blast enemy armour open from afar, or cruel appendages with which to hack and crush with enormous strength at close range.

name: HORMAGAUNT
description:
Hormagaunts (subspecies name: Gaunti gladius) are fearsome but expendable Tyranid creatures used in their billions which often precede a main Tyranid attack. They are a subspecies of Tyranid Gaunt armed with razor-sharp Scything Talons and move on powerful hind legs in a series of exceptionally fast, bounding leaps that appears as a skittering, insect-like gait.
Before the full attack of a Tyranid Hive Fleet, Hormagaunts are often dropped in Mycetic Spores in such large numbers that even if many are destroyed by orbital defences those that make planetfall will pose a serious problem to any inhabitants.
Hormagaunts have a deadly instinctual ability to hunt that needs little direction from the Tyranid Hive Mind. They are so single-minded in hunting that they will ignore personal injury and tiredness until they have run down their quarry. Hormagaunts will then feed upon their prey, ripping pieces of flesh apart with razor sharp teeth. However, their extremely fast metabolism will always drive them to constantly seek out new victims. They are usually left to their own devices once a Tyranid attack is underway, though occasionally the Hive Mind will intervene and direct them towards a more distant and more important target.
Hormagaunts, unlike other Tyranid creatures, can lay hundreds of eggs in the ground and so reproduce independently of a Hive Fleet. Each Hormagaunt has a short lifespan—days at most—but once one generation has died a fresh wave will have hatched and grown to maturity, ready to carry on ravaging a world where the previous generation left off.
skills: Default 5, Athletics 5, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Instinctive Behaviour (Feed) (Synapse)

Tyranids automatically pass Resolve tests if they are within 25m of a friendly creature with the Synapse keyword.

bonuses.name: Bounding Leap

name: TERMAGANT
description:
A Termagant serves as the standard infantry unit of any Tyranid swarm. Speed, agility, and survival are the main characteristics of the Termagant bioform (Gaunti virago). These small xenos warriors most commonly carry the dreaded Fleshborer Biomorph but have been known to carry other more potent weapon Biomorphs into battle. While ineffective in combat as a small group, they are most powerful when swarming in large broods across a target planet once the Great Devourer's invasion reaches its high tide. The desperate need to survive makes them a menace even if their synaptic control with the Tyranid Hive Mind is broken, as they run to cover and will lurk waiting to kill whatever threatens their hiding spot.
Termagants are naturally cunning and have a strong sense of self-preservation. Often, they will skirt an enemy ambush and instead find a way to assail their foe from an unexpected quarter, or they will seek out and exploit enemy weak points. If cut off from the Hive Mind's influence, a Termagant's self-preservation instinct will take control and they will typically abandon the fight in search of shelter. This seeming weakness means however that Termagants remain a threat once a Tyranid assault has been defeated since every cave, ruin, or path of undergrowth that surviving defenders pass by could conceal a nest of Termagants ready to attack upon discovery. In some circumstances the Hive Mind will suppress the survival instincts of Termagants to instead send them rushing forward for the sole purpose of depleting enemy ammunition stores.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Stealth 6

bonuses.name: Instinctive Behaviour (Lurk) (Synapse)

Any Termagant may replace their Fleshborer with one of the following:
Devourer: 10 +1ED / 9-18-27 / Salvo 3 / Agonizing, Assault
Spinefists: 8 +1ED / 6-12-18 / Salvo 2 / Paired, Pistol
Spike Rifle: 8 +1ED / 9-18-27 / Salvo 0 / Assault, Sniper (1)

MOB OPTIONS - SWARM: In a Mob of ten or more Termagants, one Termagant may exchange its Fleshborer for one of the following:
Strangleweb: 6 +2ED / 4-8-12 / Salvo 0 / Assault, Blast (2), Inflict (Restrained)
biomorphs:

TOXIN SACS: Add +1ED and Inflict (Poisoned 3) to melee attacks.

name: GARGOYLE
description:
A Gargoyle is a vicious winged Tyranid bioform that is often the first species of Tyranid seen in battle. Their prime purpose seems to be seeking out the enemy and sowing terror and confusion amongst them. Thus, fire and the flap of the Gargoyles' membranous wings precede the Tyranid hordes, driving the enemy out into the open to be absorbed by the swarm, spitting death from their Fleshborers.
Physically, Gargoyles strongly resemble the Termagants from which they are genetically derived, with compact but lithe bodies encased in a lightly armoured exoskeleton. They have wide, leathery wings, raking claws and barbed tails. They also display the same animal cunning as their ground-dwelling counterparts, and instinctively assail the foe from an unexpected quarter whenever the situation allows.
Winged manoeuvrability gives the Gargoyles a distinct advantage over most opponents, who for the most part rely on technological assistance to fly. As a result, Gargoyles have earned a dread reputation, a legend that, in truth, far outstrips their physical threat. Wherever Gargoyles are abroad, defenders look fearfully to the skies, for they know that every skyborne shadow could be a flock of Gargoyles about to attack.
While they are built for ranged combat, Gargoyles are not helpless in melee. They can spit a toxic fluid, which they instinctively aim at the eyes of their opponents to blind them. Then they tear into the foe with barbed tails and talons until either they or their prey are slain, or the Hive Mind relinquishes its control.

name: RIPPER
description:
Rippers (Minoris omniphagea) are a small, maggot-like species of Tyranids that serve as the primary means of devouring biomass from a planet for a Tyranid Hive Fleet. Indeed, Ripper swarms facilitate the speed and scale that Tyranids are infamous for in the stripping of a planet of all its natural resources. Rippers are the most numerous of the Tyranid creatures, and in great swarms they can pull down and consume creatures many times their own size. However, they are completely mindless and will perish if they lose a synaptic link with the Hive Mind, although while under its guidance they are utterly relentless and pose a truly horrifying threat. During the final stages of a Tyranid planetary invasion, they scour the entirety of a planet, ingesting all biological material on the planet and leaving only an empty and desolate wasteland.
Eventually, the Rippers will become bloated full of biomass, unfit for combat. At this point, they simply crawl into Tyranid Reclamation Pools at the bases of impossibly tall Capillary Towers that project beyond the atmosphere, where they and the biomass they have fed upon are broken down and absorbed by the Hive Fleet for the creation of new Tyranid organisms and structures. However, in some cases they may be evolved by a Norn-Queen to perform more advanced functions for the swarm depending on the genetic material they have absorbed.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Stealth 6, Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: Instinctive Behaviour (Feed) (Synapse)
