An Ork Painboy, also known as a Mad Dok or just a Dok, is a member of a special class of Ork Oddboyz who are responsible for fixing injuries even the highly regenerative Ork physiology cannot repair, such as severed limbs and brain damage. They use "Stabby Bits" as their medical tools.
An Ork will only go to a Painboy when he has no other choice, as these Oddboyz are infamous for trying out experimental procedures (such as the greatly feared Squig brain transplant) on patients while they are under anaesthesia (known as a "concussion" to other intelligent races).
skills: Default 6, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 3, Medicae 8, Intimidation 8, Weapon Skill 10

abilities.name: Sawbones
abilities.description: The Painboy attempts a DN 3 Medicae test to heal an ORK within 1m. If successful, the patient regains 1d3+Tier Wounds, +1 per Exalted Icon rolled. If the test is failed, the patient suffers 1d3 Mortal Wounds instead.

abilities.name: On Yer Feet!
abilities.description: When the Painboy uses the Sawbones action, they may heal an ORK who died during the previous turn.

name: RUNTHERD
description:
Runtherdz are Ork Oddboyz who exhibit a trait extremely uncommon amongst Orks: patience. Only they have the right mindset to "care" about their smaller Orkoid cousins, the Gretchins and Snotlings, and the patience to perform the task of training them to be more efficient at their tasks.
The Runtherdz make a good living by selling well-trained Gretchin and Snotling servants and workers to other Orks. Runtherdz often become quite wealthy and naturally invest their earned teef in solid weaponry and other wargear.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 3, Insight 7, Intimidation 8, Persuasion 7, Weapon Skill 10

name: GRETCHIN
description:
Gretchin or Grotz are basically a smaller subspecies of Orks, who are more cowardly than normal Orks and are usually used as living shields, to clear mine fields, are stepped on to get through difficult terrain, and sometimes even as emergency rations.
While they are not as aggressive as standard Orks, they enjoy fighting weaker opponents and are less likely to flee if they comfortably outnumber their opponents.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 5, Stealth 5, Survival 5

name: SNOTLING
description:
A Snotling is an Orkoid, the smaller cousin of Gretchins and Orks. Snotlings are often used by their larger counterparts as cannon fodder, food or even ammunition in certain cases.
Snotlings represent the lowest rung of Orkoid society and are bullied by all other Greenskins. Snotlings often wield mushrooms or sticks into battle.
Snotlings' affinity with Squigs usually ensures that only a few dozen Snotlings are eaten by their "livestock" on any given day.
skills: Default 2, Awareness 2 (Passive 1), Survival 3

abilities.name: Misplaced Enthusiasm
abilities.description: The Snotlings move up to their Speed towards the enemy, unless a RUNTHERD within 6m tells them not to.

name: ATTACK SQUIG
description:
Attack Squigs are one of the most common types of Squig. An Attack Squig is a bouncing ball of claws and razor-sharp teeth, with immense variations in morphology between individuals, with some having horns and a devil-like tail, while others are single-eyed or single-nosed creatures.
Bomb Squigs are little more than common Squigs with explosives strapped to their sides or gripped firmly in their teeth. When properly goaded, they run headlong at their master's desired target, detonating their explosive payload when in close proximity.
Squighounds, commonly known as "Growlers," are a variation of the Attack Squig, used by Ork Runtherdz to help them keep the Gretchins and slaves from other races in line.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Survival 5, Weapon Skill 6

abilities.name: Detonate
abilities.description: The Bomb Squig explodes. Bomb Squig Explosion: 16 +3ED / AP -3 / Brutal, Blast (2d3)

name: SQUIGHOG
description:
Squighog Boyz are Beast Snaggas who ride four-legged Squighogs to battle.
Tough, determined, and heavily armed, Squighog Boyz make up Beast Snagga fast cavalry and are designed to engage the enemy at close range. In battle Squighog Boyz unleash an unrelenting fury of attacks and are perfect for dealing with enemy light vehicles.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Weapon Skill 9

abilities.name: Get Stuck In!
abilities.description: The Squighog Boy makes a Charge move towards the nearest enemy.

abilities.name: Onslaught
abilities.description: When a Squighog Boy makes an attack, it may spend 1 Ruin to make one attack from the Squighog, one attack from the Rider, and one from the Saddlegit.

determination: Thick Hide. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 9d6. Any dice which roll 1s may be re-rolled.

name: BIG MEK
description: The most important and skilled Mekboyz are known as "Big Meks," who lead groups of lesser Mekboyz armed with a wide variety of Greenskin kustom equipment and Kombi-weapons, sometimes including even full warbands or whole WAAAGHs! armed with a large amount of less-than-conventional Ork weaponry. A Big Mek's understanding of technology is unsurpassed amongst the Orkoid races and a Big Mek is often seen generating a "Kustom Force Field" around himself that protects his person and his creations.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Intimidation 9, Tech 10, Weapon Skill 9

abilities.name: Mekaniak
abilities.description: The Mek attempts a DN 3 Tech test to repair an ORK KAN or Vehicle within 1m. If successful, the target regains 1d3+Tier Wounds, +1 per Exalted Icon rolled.

abilities.name: Made It Betterer!
abilities.description: When the Mek uses the Mekaniak action and rolls a Wrath critical, the ORK KAN or Vehicle also gains +1 Speed or +2 Resilience, at the Mek's choice.

name: BIG MEK IN MEGA ARMOUR
description: As it is among Ork society at large, within the disparate ranks of Mekboyz, the bigger a Mek is, the more powerful he is. The most common (and therefore least potent) among these are the Mekboyz. As Mekboyz grow in size and experience, many become Big Meks. Big Meks command squads of lower-ranked Mekboyz and countless Gretchin in battle and devise the more potent kinds of wargear fielded by Orks, such as Mega Armour and Kustom-Blastas.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Intimidation 9, Tech 10, Weapon Skill 9

abilities.name: Kustom Mega-Blasta
abilities.stats: 16 +5ED / AP -3 / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 1 / Assault, Blast (4), Supercharge, Waaagh!

abilities.name: Mekaniak
abilities.description: The Mek attempts a DN 3 Tech test to repair an ORK KAN or Vehicle within 1m. If successful, the target regains 1d3+Tier Wounds, +1 per Exalted Icon rolled.

abilities.name: Made It Betterer!
abilities.description: When the Mek uses the Mekaniak action and rolls a Wrath critical, the ORK KAN or Vehicle also gains +1 Speed or +2 Resilience, at the Mek's choice.

name: DEFF DREAD
description:
The Ork Deff Dread is an Ork combat walker comparable to a Space Marine Dreadnought. Like a Dreadnought, a Deff Dread's Ork pilot must be cybernetically hardwired into the machine.
When it is possible to craft a Deff Dread many Orks volunteer for the process since it will allow them to essentially become one of the biggest and most powerful Orks in the clan. Deff Dreads are also popular with other Orks since their immense destructive capacity, large number of weapons and tendency to stomp things to death lie at the very heart of what defines Ork "kultur".
skills: Default 6, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 3, Intimidation 8, Weapon Skill 10

abilities.name: Terrifying Presence
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Terror Test.

abilities.name: Rampage
abilities.description: When this Threat scores a Wrath Critical when making an attack, it may immediately move up to 2d3 metres and make an additional attack. This attack must be with a different weapon.

abilities.name: Kaboom!
abilities.description: When the Deff Dread dies, roll a d6. If you roll a 1, the Deff Dread explodes. Deff Dread Explosion: 15 +6ED / AP -1 / Blast (12)

determination: Ramshackle. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 13d6. Any dice which roll 1 may be re-rolled.

name: KILLA KAN
description:
Killa Kans are smallish, bipedal walkers composed of a rickety, lightly armoured "kan" perched atop a pair of piston driven legs and armed with a selection of ranged and close-combat weapons. Relatively primitive and weak by Ork standards, they are nonetheless fast and incredibly dangerous for their size.
As for the operator within, Killa Kans are not so much piloted as they are inhabited by a particularly ill-tempered Gretchin. Not only is the procedure excruciatingly painful but implanting a Grot into a Killa Kan often increases the creature's aggression and brute savagery by an inordinate amount.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 7, Weapon Skill 6

abilities.name: Kanned Rage
abilities.description: When a Killa Kan is Exhausted or fails a Resolve test, roll 1d6; on an Icon, the Killa Kan becomes Frenzied instead.

abilities.name: Kaboom!
abilities.description: When the Killa Kan dies, roll a d6. If you roll a 1, the Killa Kan explodes. Killa Kan Explosion: 15 +6ED / AP -1 / Blast (12)

determination: Ramshackle. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 8d6. Any dice which roll 1 may be re-rolled.

name: WEIRDBOY
description:
A Weirdboy (pl. Weirdboyz) is one of the Orks' psykers, unique in that he acts as a psychic sponge, absorbing and channelling the natural psychic energies constantly emanated by other Orks.
Weirdboyz are the most psychically attuned of all Orks. They are capable of vomiting blasts of Warp energy that can reduce foes to molten goop in seconds. Weirdboyz unconsciously channel the background mental emissions of nearby Greenskins.
Some Weirdboyz, known as "Warpheads," become addicted to the thrill of spewing WAAAGH! energy, actively seeking out the deadly rush of battle.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 3, Psychic Mastery 7, Weapon Skill 8

abilities.name: Don't Wanna Be Here!
abilities.description: The Weirdboy makes a DN 3 Resolve test, and becomes Pinned if he fails.

abilities.name: Power of the WAAAGH!
abilities.description: The Weirdboy attempts to use Smite or one of the WAAAGH psychic powers or attempts to Deny the Witch.

abilities.name: Psychic Vomit
abilities.description: This Threat makes a ranged attack using its Psychic Vomit weapon against all enemies in a cone.

abilities.name: 'Eadbang!
abilities.description: If the Weirdboy is killed as a result of Mortal Wounds from using psychic powers, he will explode, inflicting 1d3+Tier Mortal Wounds on all ORKS within 6m.

name: WURRBOY
description:
Wurrboyz are unsavoury Beast Snaggas Weirdboyz who channel Waaagh! energy in its most primal, animalistic form. When they unleash its power, roiling storms of psychic energy tear through their foes and their enemies are left as little more than shrivelled husks, or transformed into mindless Squigs.
Off the battlefield, the Wurrboyz take on what is possibly an even more important role in their tribes. They use their pseudo-shamanistic powers to receive visions from the Orks' gods, Gork and Mork, which they relay to their fellow Beast Snaggas as grand proclamations and barely coherent prophecies.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 3, Psychic Mastery 7, Survival 7, Weapon Skill 8

abilities.name: Power of the WAAAGH!
abilities.description: The Wurrboy attempts to use Smite or one of the Beasthead psychic powers or attempts to Deny the Witch.

abilities.name: Psychic Vomit
abilities.description: This Threat makes a ranged attack using its Psychic Vomit weapon against all enemies in a cone.

name: WARBOSS
description:
A Warboss is the biggest, the greenest, and the meanest Ork in a tribe or clan, and as such, he's the supreme commander of every Greenskin that falls under his jurisdiction. Relatively cunning strategists (by Ork standards) and exceedingly powerful warriors, these brutes rise through the Ork ranks by winning battles and killing every challenger to his power who puts himself in the way of the putative Warboss.
These monstrous killing machines can reach up to ten feet in height, and their sheer muscular bulk makes them wider at the shoulder than a fully armoured Space Marine.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Intimidation 11, Leadership 10, Weapon Skill 12

abilities.name: WAAAGH!
abilities.description: This Threat bellows, and any non-ORK who can see and hear must pass a DN 3 Fear test. ORKS who can see and hear this Threat add +2 to Speed and Resolve until the end of the round.

abilities.name: Surly Glare
abilities.description: When an ORK Mob within 12m fails a Resolve test, this Threat may spend 1 Ruin to have the mob automatically pass instead.

abilities.name: Orks Iz Never Beaten
abilities.description: When slain, this Threat makes an immediate melee attack if possible.

determination: Dead 'Ard. Roll 10d6. The Warboss may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. The Warboss regains 1 Shock for every Exalted Icon rolled when rolling Determination.

name: BEASTBOSS
description: Beast Snaggas Warbosses are known as Beastbosses, and they are decked in the spoils of their greatest kills. Beastbosses lead from the front lines and look for the biggest, meanest prey they can find to bring down with their claws. Rippling with muscle, scar tissue, and bad attitudes, these hulking Warbosses sometimes ride Squigosaurs into battle.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Intimidation 11, Leadership 10, Survival 11, Weapon Skill 12

abilities.name: WAAAGH!
abilities.description: This Threat bellows, and any non-ORK who can see and hear must pass a DN 3 Fear test. ORKS and SQUIGS who can see and hear this Threat add +2 to Speed and Resolve until the end of the round.

abilities.name: Surly Glare
abilities.description: When an ORK or SQUIG Mob within 12m fails a Resolve test, this Threat may spend 1 Ruin to have the mob automatically pass instead.

abilities.name: Orks Iz Never Beaten
abilities.description: When slain, this Threat makes an immediate melee attack if possible.

determination: Tough As Squig-Hide. Roll 10d6, plus additional dice equal to the ED of the attack. The Beastboss may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. The Warboss regains 1 Shock for every Exalted Icon rolled when rolling Determination.

name: SQUIGOSAUR
description: These huge squigs are a favoured mount for some Beast Snagga Warbosses, who are the only Orks strong and belligerent enough to bully a Squigosaur into allowing a rider.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 9 (Passive 4), Weapon Skill 11

abilities.name: Get Stuck In!
abilities.description: The Squigosaur and rider makes a Charge move towards the nearest enemy.

abilities.name: Onslaught
abilities.description: When a Squighog Boy makes an attack, it may spend 1 Ruin to make one attack from the Squighog and one attack from the Rider.

determination: Thick Hide. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 13d6. Any dice which roll 1s may be re-rolled.

name: MOUNTED BEASTBOSS
description: These huge squigs are a favoured mount for some Beast Snagga Warbosses, who are the only Orks strong and belligerent enough to bully a Squigosaur into allowing a rider. The Mounted Beastboss rides atop a Squigosaur, forming a devastating cavalry unit.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Intimidation 11, Leadership 10, Survival 11, Weapon Skill 12

abilities.name: WAAAGH!
abilities.description: This Threat bellows, and any non-ORK who can see and hear must pass a DN 3 Fear test. ORKS and SQUIGS who can see and hear this Threat add +2 to Speed and Resolve until the end of the round.

abilities.name: Surly Glare
abilities.description: When an ORK or SQUIG Mob within 12m fails a Resolve test, this Threat may spend 1 Ruin to have the mob automatically pass instead.

abilities.name: Orks Iz Never Beaten
abilities.description: When slain, this Threat makes an immediate melee attack if possible.

determination: Tough As Squig-Hide. Roll 10d6, plus additional dice equal to the ED of the attack. The Beastboss may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. The Warboss regains 1 Shock for every Exalted Icon rolled when rolling Determination.

name: WARBOSS IN MEGA-ARMOUR
description:
Any good Ork Hunter knows the safest way to deal with a rampaging Warboss is to hit them with tank-busting artillery from as far away as possible. By donning a piston-driven suit of incredibly durable mega armour, this Warboss makes a mockery of such underhanded enemy tactics, much to the terror of his foes.
The strongest and meanest among his already brutal kin, some Warbosses supplement their fearsome bulk and staggering might with powered armour that makes them a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Intimidation 11, Leadership 10, Weapon Skill 12

abilities.name: WAAAGH!
abilities.description: This Threat bellows, and any non-ORK who can see and hear must pass a DN 3 Fear test. ORKS who can see and hear this Threat add +2 to Speed and Resolve until the end of the round.

abilities.name: Surly Glare
abilities.description: When an ORK Mob within 12m fails a Resolve test, this Threat may spend 1 Ruin to have the mob automatically pass instead.

abilities.name: Orks Iz Never Beaten
abilities.description: When slain, this Threat makes an immediate melee attack if possible.

determination: Dead 'Ard. Roll 10d6. The Warboss may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. The Warboss regains 1 Shock for every Exalted Icon rolled when rolling Determination.

name: SPEEDBOSS
description:
Fast-moving fighting platforms favoured by some Speed Freek Warbosses, Deffkilla Wartrikes make little concession to armoured protection for their riders. Scythe-wheeled, with an enormous rokkit engine afterburner on the back, these trikes not only move at a frankly vulgar pace but also pack enough firepower to make them extra killy.
The Speedboss is mounted on a Deffkilla Wartrike, which can be.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Intimidation 11, Leadership 10, Pilot 9, Weapon Skill 12

abilities.name: VROOM!
abilities.description: The Speedboss drives their Deffkilla Wartrike towards the enemy. If not on their Wartrike, they move up to twice their Speed towards it, mounting the vehicle if possible.

abilities.name: Twin Boomstikks
abilities.stats: 12 +1ED / AP - / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 2 / Assault, Spread, Waaagh!

abilities.name: Crashin' Through
abilities.description: When the Speedboss makes a melee attack from their Wartrike, they may spend 1 Ruin to add +3ED to the attack's damage and increase the AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2). If the Speedboss takes the Ram action at Breakneck Speed against an enemy smaller than their Wartrike, they may spend 1 Ruin to knock the enemy out of the way, inflicting 1 Mortal Wound and allowing the Wartrike to continue its move.

determination: Dead 'Ard. Roll 10d6. The Warboss may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. The Warboss regains 1 Shock for every Exalted Icon rolled when rolling Determination.

name: BOSS SNIKROT
description:
Snikrot, also called Boss Snikrot and Snikrot the Stalker, is a vicious and skilled Ork Kommando who leads the company of Ork special forces known as the Red Skull Kommandoz within the equatorial jungles of the Imperial Hive World of Armageddon.
The infamous Ork Hunters of the Armageddon Astra Militarum are afraid of one Ork and one Ork alone. In the dark nights of the steaming equatorial jungles, these grizzled veterans whisper tales of Boss Snikrot. They tell of a killer who slips through the jungle like a ghost, who can pass through throttlevine groves without disturbing a single leaf.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Intimidation 11, Leadership 10, Stealth 11, Weapon Skill 12

abilities.name: Kunnin' Infiltrator
abilities.description: During the first round of combat in which Snikrot ambushes his opponents, he may use his Stealth dice pool of 11 for any Test.

abilities.name: Brutal But Kunnin'
abilities.description: When Snikrot fails a melee attack against a single enemy (i.e., not a Multi-Attack), he immediately gains 1 Ruin, which must be used before his next Turn to make an attack as a Ruin Action.

abilities.name: Orks Iz Never Beaten
abilities.description: When slain, this Threat makes an immediate melee attack if possible.

determination: Dead 'Ard. Roll 10d6. Snikrot may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Snikrot regains 1 Shock for every Exalted Icon rolled when rolling Determination.

name: BOSS ZAGSTRUK
description: Boss Zagstruk is a fearsome Ork Warboss of the Goff clan, known for leading Stormboy formations into battle with devastating aerial assaults. His cybork body and Da Vulcha's Klaws make him a terrifying sight as he descends upon the enemy from above.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Intimidation 12, Leadership 10, Pilot 11, Weapon Skill 12

abilities.name: Thunderous Impact
abilities.description: When this Threat Charges, it makes an additional attack with its mount against every enemy within 2m at the end of the Charge.

abilities.name: Orks Iz Never Beaten
abilities.description: When slain, this Threat makes an immediate melee attack if possible.

determination: Cybork Body. Roll 10d6. Zagstruk may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Zagstruk does not suffer Shock when rolling Determination; Wounds are simply ignored.

name: GHAZGHKULL THRAKA
description:
Ghazghkull Mag Uruk Thraka (usually shortened to Ghazghkull Thraka) is an Ork Warlord of the Goff clan and a mighty prophet of the WAAAGH! He is the single most influential Ork in the galaxy in the late 41st Millennium, and billions of greenskins march to war in his name.
Since Ghazghkull's rise to power, he has led countless campaigns of destruction. He has crushed Aeldari war hosts, banished tides of daemons, and smashed phalanxes of Necrons to so much sparking scrap.
Yet Ghazghkull is not satisfied. Gork and Mork have greater plans for their prophet. He will travel the galaxy, subjugating every Warlord and gathering every Ork to his banner until the stars themselves shudder to the thundering footfalls of his horde.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 5, Intimidation 13, Leadership 14, Weapon Skill 15

abilities.name: WAAAGH!
abilities.description: This Threat bellows, and any non-ORK who can see and hear must pass a DN 3 Fear test. ORKS who can see and hear this Threat add +2 to Speed and Resolve until the end of the round.

abilities.name: Mork's Roar
abilities.stats: 12 +2ED / AP -1 / Range 18-36-54 / Salvo 12 / Assault, Rapid Fire (6), Waaagh!

abilities.name: Da Boss Iz Watchin'
abilities.description: When an ORK Mob within 25m fails a Resolve test, Ghazghkull may use his Reflexive Action to glare disapprovingly. The Mob counts as succeeding at that Resolve test.

abilities.name: Orks Iz Never Beaten
abilities.description: When slain, this Threat makes an immediate melee attack if possible.

determination: Cybork Body. Roll 12d6. Ghazghkull may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Ghazghkull does not suffer Shock when rolling Determination; Wounds are simply ignored.

name: MAKARI
description:
Makari, also known as Makari the Grot is an infamous Ork Gretchin. He is thought to be the luckiest Gretchin ever, surviving for nine years under the Warboss Ghazghkull Thraka before being accidentally sat on by his master and subsequently fed to a Squig.
Now Ghazghkull's official "banner-waver", Makari enthusiastically fulfilled his duties at the front of Ghazghkull's mobs. He is also the bearer of the Ghazghkull's war banner, Da Lucky Stikk.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Survival 5, Weapon Skill 5

abilities.name: On My Way Boss!
abilities.description: Makari moves up to his Speed towards Ghazghkull.

determination: Suspiciously Lucky. Roll 1d6. On a 2 or higher, Makari ignores the attack entirely. On a roll of a 1, Makari takes the attack's full damage and cannot make this roll again for the rest of the scene.

name: KAPTIN BADRUKK
description:
Kaptin Badrukk is the greatest Freebooter of his age, a monstrous, roaring privateer bedecked in barbarous finery. Badrukk's Flash Gitz carry enough firepower into battle to level a well-defended hab-block, and the Kaptin totes the most fearsome firearm of the lot.
For an Ork, Badrukk is unusually cunning and has proved to be an excellent strategist and tactician.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Intimidation 11, Leadership 10, Weapon Skill 10

abilities.name: DAKKA!
abilities.description: This Threat makes a ranged attack with all of its ranged weapons.

abilities.name: Da Rippa
abilities.stats: 15 +2ED / AP -3 / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 3 / Heavy (5), Supercharge, Kustom

abilities.name: Surly Glare
abilities.description: When an ORK Mob within 12m fails a Resolve test, this Threat may spend 1 Ruin to have the mob automatically pass instead.

abilities.name: Orks Iz Never Beaten
abilities.description: When slain, this Threat makes an immediate melee attack if possible.

determination: Dead 'Ard. Roll 10d6. The Warboss may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. The Warboss regains 1 Shock for every Exalted Icon rolled when rolling Determination.

name: MAD DOK GROTSNIK
description:
Grotsnik, also known as Mad Dok Grotsnik, was a typical Ork Painboy obsessed with the performance of "surjery" and rooting around in other people's heads to see what he could find--or alter.
Mad Dok Grotsnik is an absolute terror, the most bloodthirsty and deranged of an unhinged breed. Once a Painboy of some skill, Grotsnik is now all but berserk with the desire to do harm to others.
Raving and screaming, the delusional Dok leads the charge toward the foe at an all-out sprint, unmindful of enemy fire in his desperation to sink needles and blades into unwilling flesh.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 3, Medicae 5, Intimidation 8, Weapon Skill 10

abilities.name: Sawbones
abilities.description: The Painboy attempts a DN 3 Medicae test to heal an ORK within 1m. If successful, the patient regains 1d3+Tier Wounds, +1 per Exalted Icon rolled. If the test is failed, the patient suffers 1d3 Mortal Wounds instead.

abilities.name: On Yer Feet!
abilities.description: When the Painboy uses the Sawbones action, they may heal an ORK who died during the previous turn.

determination: Cybork Body. Roll 10d6. Grotsnik may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Grotsnik does not suffer Shock when rolling Determination; Wounds are simply ignored.

name: MOZROG SKRAGBAD
description:
Mozrog is known to have always preferred the company of Squigs to other Orks. Living his days in self-imposed exile, he has spent his life hunting one monstrous beast after another.
Since that brush with death, he has always driven to seek bigger and nastier quarry. Some Orks say he can't be killed, others that he will one day hunt the stars themselves.
Mozrog's primary companion is the great albino Squig Big Chompa. Known as the untameable Squig, the Badbeast of Skrapmud, and "Dat Fing Wot Ate Boss Norbag's Buggy"--Big Chompa had many names before he became Mozrog's steed.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Intimidation 11, Survival 12, Weapon Skill 12

abilities.name: WAAAGH!
abilities.description: This Threat bellows, and any non-ORK who can see and hear must pass a DN 3 Fear test. ORKS and SQUIGS who can see and hear this Threat add +2 to Speed and Resolve until the end of the round.

abilities.name: Surly Glare
abilities.description: When an ORK or SQUIG Mob within 12m fails a Resolve test, this Threat may spend 1 Ruin to have the mob automatically pass instead.

abilities.name: Surly as a Squiggoth
abilities.description: The first time Mozrog is killed, roll 1d6. If an Icon is rolled, Mozrog heals 1d3+Tier Wounds and remains alive.

determination: Tough As Squig-Hide. Roll 10d6, plus additional dice equal to the ED of the attack. The Beastboss may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. The Warboss regains 1 Shock for every Exalted Icon rolled when rolling Determination.

name: NAZDREG
description:
In many ways Nazdreg is a typical Bad Moon Warlord - rich, ostentatious, overindulgent and overweight. However, Nazdreg is remarkable for one reason - he is easily one of the most intelligent and cunning battlefield commanders to be found in all of Orkdom.
Nazdreg leads an extremely powerful warband which has laid waste to at least 11 Imperial Worlds so far. According to Imperial reports, he speaks fluent Low Gothic and is seemingly more resourceful than other Warbosses.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 9, Intimidation 11, Leadership 10, Weapon Skill 11

abilities.name: Kunnin' Plans
abilities.description: Nazdreg chooses a number of BAD MOON ORK Threats or Mobs on the battlefield equal to his Intellect. Each one may move up to their Speed.

abilities.name: Kustom Blast-X
abilities.stats: 15 +3ED / AP -3 / Range 21-42-63 / Salvo 4 / Barrage, Blast (6), Heavy (6), Supercharge, Rending (1)

abilities.name: Ded Kunnin'
abilities.description: Nazdreg may spend 1 Ruin to have a BAD MOON ORK Threat or Mob within 25m of Nazdreg to take either the Move or Attack ruin actions.

abilities.name: Orks Iz Never Beaten
abilities.description: When slain, this Threat makes an immediate melee attack if possible.

determination: Dead 'Ard. Roll 10d6. The Warboss may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. The Warboss regains 1 Shock for every Exalted Icon rolled when rolling Determination.

name: OLD ZOGWORT
description:
Old Zogwort is the greatest of all Ork Weirdboyz. He lost one eye in an especially devastating blast which destroyed an entire Imperial Guard Company, although he claims Mork guided him into doing so.
Old Zogwort was born on Zurk under the ominous phenomena of a total eclipse, where his spore had matured within a nest of bloodvipers. As soon as he was born, he was attacked and bitten, until, in order to survive, he began to bite back. From that point on, no snake would bite him.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 3, Psychic Mastery 13, Weapon Skill 8

abilities.name: Warphead
abilities.description: Zogwort makes a normal move towards the enemy, and then attempts to use a Psychic Power.

abilities.name: Power of the WAAAGH!
abilities.description: The Weirdboy attempts to use Smite, one of the WAAAGH psychic powers, Beasthead psychic powers or attempts to Deny the Witch.

abilities.name: Zogwort's Curse
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin as a Ruin Action. Zogwort attempts to use the Squiggly Curse psychic power on as many enemies as are in range and may ignore up to twice the game's Tier in Multi-Target DN increases.

abilities.name: 'Eadbang!
abilities.description: If the Weirdboy is killed as a result of Mortal Wounds from using psychic powers, he will explode, inflicting 1d3+Tier Mortal Wounds on all ORKS within 6m.

determination: Irrepressible Power. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 8d6. After this, Zogwort immediately uses a Psychic Power against the attacker.

name: WAZDAKKA GUTZMEK
description:
The greatest Ork Bikeboy ever known, Wazdakka Gutzmek sits astride a turbo-powered monstrosity that seems to have once been an Ork Warbike but has been transformed into something far more powerful.
Wazdakka had been tinkering with Warbikes ever since his yoof. Over the years Wazdakka has become a legendary figure among the Orks. Kept awake continuously by the concoctions of outlaw Mad Doks, Wazdakka is rarely out of his bike's seat, usually only to upgrade his machine's potency.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Intimidation 9, Tech 10, Pilot 12, Weapon Skill 9

abilities.name: VROOM!
abilities.description: Wazdakka drives his bike towards the enemy. If not on his bike, he moves up to twice his Speed towards it, mounting the vehicle if possible.

abilities.name: Kustom Mega-Blasta
abilities.stats: 16 +5ED / AP -3 / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 1 / Assault, Blast (4), Supercharge, Waaagh!

abilities.name: Dakkakannons
abilities.stats: 15 +6ED / AP -2 / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 3d3 / Barrage, Blast (4), Mounted (Large)

abilities.name: Mekaniak
abilities.description: Wazdakka attempts a DN 3 Tech test to repair his bike. If successful, it regains 1d3+Tier Wounds, +1 per Exalted Icon rolled.

abilities.name: Crashin' Through
abilities.description: When Wazdakka makes a melee attack from his bike, he may spend 1 Ruin to add +3ED to the attack's damage and increase the AP by 1. If Wazdakka takes the Ram action at Breakneck Speed against an enemy smaller than his bike, he may spend 1 Ruin to knock the enemy out of the way, inflicting 1 Mortal Wound and allowing the bike to continue its move.

name: ZODGROD WORTSNAGGA
description:
Zodgrod started off as a member of the Warboss Ugulhard Duffgrunta's "Chargerz," a tribe of Orks wholly drawn from the Snakebites clan. Zodgrod was made the tribe's Runtherd, the Ork in charge of breeding Snotlings.
Zodgrod proved to be unusually effective in training his Gretchin to follow orders and act aggressively. His Gretchin, known as "Kommando Runtz" among the Chargerz, became quite well-known among the local Greenskin tribes.
Zodgrod took to the spacelanes with his beloved Gretchin as an Ork Freebooter, selling his services as an unparalleled Runtherd to any Greenskin Warboss or Warlord who could pay his fees.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 3, Insight 7, Intimidation 11, Persuasion 9, Weapon Skill 10

abilities.name: Super Runts
abilities.description: Zodgrod selects one mob of GRETCHIN within 6m. This mob adds +Tier to all of their Skill ratings.

name: ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY
description:
The armies of the Astra Militarum are made from billions of regiments, recruited from every world in the Imperium. There is no universal uniform for these Guardsmen; warriors don the armour and wargear native to their homeworlds.
The only piece of armament common to all Guardsmen is the Lasgun, and even then, some regiments from more technologically primitive worlds have been trained with only black powder muskets, crossbows, or even spears. The fighting ability of each regiment reflects the human world and society it comes from. Some planets breed cunning gang fighters whilst others raise savage and barbaric warriors.
Guardsmen are disciplined troops indoctrinated to follow orders to the letter. In the face of the enemy the serried ranks of the Astra Militarum are trained to stand firm and respond with a steady aim. When sergeants bellow, the rank-and-file obey; backs stiffen and Lasguns level at the foe. Opponents charging at Imperial Guard positions must first survive a blazing hail of las-fire, a fusillade that can stem the tide of all but the most determined assault.
The fate of battles is often decided upon the courage and mettle of Imperial Guard Infantry Squads -- but they are still only Human. On equal terms they are no match for the many alien and Chaos-tainted horrors they must face. Should such enemies close the distance between themselves and an Infantry Squad, the Guardsmen, more often than not, are slaughtered.
Although some Guardsmen are equipped with a variety of powerful and specialised weaponry, the primary strength of the Astra Militarum's infantry regiments remains their huge and expendable mass of manpower. It is the combined firepower of Astra Militarum regiments that ultimately makes them a deadly opponent, capable of out-shooting almost any enemy. The thundering charge of a thousand Guardsmen can overwhelm the most elite and dangerous of opponents, crushing them underfoot and running them through with a wall of bayonet points.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5

abilities.name: Lasgun
abilities.stats: 7 +1ED / AP - / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Rapid Fire (1), Reliable

abilities.name: Human Waves
abilities.description: If this mob fails a Resolve Test or is wiped out, the GM gains 1 Ruin.

abilities.name: Bring It Down!
abilities.description: This Mob gains +2ED when all individuals fire at the same target.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: CADIAN SHOCK TROOPS
description: Born soldiers, Cadians are trained for military service from the moment they can hold a rifle. Long years of rigorous firing drills have forged them into expert sharpshooters, skilled in both dogged defence and storming assault.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5

abilities.name: Lasgun
abilities.stats: 7 +1ED / AP - / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Rapid Fire (1), Reliable

abilities.name: Shock Troops
abilities.description: If this Threat scores a Wrath Critical when making a ranged attack with a lasgun or laspistol, they may immediately make a second attack with that weapon.

abilities.name: Human Waves
abilities.description: If this mob fails a Resolve Test or is wiped out, the GM gains 1 Ruin.

abilities.name: Bring It Down!
abilities.description: This Mob gains +2ED when all individuals fire at the same target.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: CATACHAN JUNGLE FIGHTERS
description: These heavily muscled soldiers are drawn from a warrior people that survive on the most infamous of death worlds. Skilled in deadly close combat with the fiercest of beasts amidst hazardous terrain, Jungle Fighters are also skilled infiltrators and trackers, adept at luring their prey into fiendish traps.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Stealth 5, Survival 6, Weapon Skill 5

abilities.name: Jungle Fighters
abilities.description: When this Threat Charges, add +2 ED to the attack's damage, and add the Sustained quality to the attack.

abilities.name: Scout
abilities.description: The Threat makes a normal move and attempts a Stealth test to create a Stealth Score.

abilities.name: Human Waves
abilities.description: If this mob fails a Resolve Test or is wiped out, the GM gains 1 Ruin.

abilities.name: Bring It Down!
abilities.description: This Mob gains +2ED when all individuals fire at the same target.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: DEATH KORPS OF KRIEG
description: The grim regiments of the Death Korps of Krieg excel in the most gruelling of conditions, their famous siege regiments resolutely holding key positions no matter the onslaught unleashed upon them. They are extollers of a pitiless cult of sacrifice, but with their legendary endurance, death often claims their foes first.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5

abilities.name: Grim Demeanour
abilities.description: This Threat suffers no penalties for being Wounded. Further, when making a Resolve Test, this Threat automatically succeeds if a Wrath Critical is rolled.

abilities.name: Entrench
abilities.description: During the first round of combat, this Threat adds +1 to Defence, or +2 if in cover.

abilities.name: Human Waves
abilities.description: If this mob fails a Resolve Test or is wiped out, the GM gains 1 Ruin.

abilities.name: Bring It Down!
abilities.description: This Mob gains +2ED when all individuals fire at the same target.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: ASTRA MILITARUM CONSCRIPTS
description:
"Whiteshields" or Conscript Platoons are units of the Imperial Guard that consist of normal Imperial citizens with little or no military training, new Guard recruits who have not yet entered training, children of an already extant regiment's troops or standing Guardsmen who have not yet completed their training. Sometimes, in military emergencies, the Imperium's need for manpower is so great that normal Imperial citizens will simply find themselves conscripted by their local Imperial Guard regiment.
These reckless cadets are eager to prove their courage and earn the title of "Guardsman". To them, this is more than a simple promotion, it is considered a rite of passage for many amongst the Probitors, marking their entry into adulthood.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 4

abilities.name: Raw Recruits
abilities.description: If a Conscript receives an Order from the Voice of Command ability, roll 1d6: on a 1, 2, or 3, the Conscript misunderstands the Order and does not gain the benefit. For mobs, roll 1d6 for the whole mob.

abilities.name: Lasgun
abilities.stats: 7 +1ED / AP - / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Rapid Fire (1), Reliable

abilities.name: Human Waves
abilities.description: If this mob fails a Resolve Test or is wiped out, the GM gains 1 Ruin.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: ASTRA MILITARUM OFFICER
description:
Astra Militarum Officers hold a position of command within the Imperial Guard's strictly regimented hierarchy. The presence of a beloved regimental leader at the forefront can mean the difference between a unit standing firm or collapsing, the troopers fighting to emulate them or simply to protect him from the enemy's attentions.
Given the ubiquity of conflict in the galaxy of the late 41st Millennium, it is perhaps inevitable that leaders rise from the teeming masses, individuals seemingly blessed by the Emperor or the gods of war who are able to perform the most valorous of deeds and earn the most incredible of victories.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Leadership 7, Weapon Skill 6

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Command Structure
abilities.description: [REGIMENT] allies within 6m may use the Officer's Conviction and Resolve scores instead of their own.

abilities.name: Voice of Command
abilities.description: The Threat issues a single Order as an Action. The Threat may give Regimental Orders.

abilities.name: Inspired Command
abilities.description: The Threat spends 1 Ruin and issues a single Order as a Ruin Action. The Threat may give Regimental Orders.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 3d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: MEDIC
description: Medics and Field Chirurgeons are Guardsmen trained to give medical treatment to wounded in the field in the heat of combat. They typically operate out of Company Command Squads. Medics go by many different names, but all are trained in providing first response and frontline medical care to injured Guardsmen. They are also equally combat-capable and will fight shoulder-to-shoulder with their fellow squad-mates.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Medicae 6

abilities.name: Lasgun
abilities.stats: 7 +1ED / AP - / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Rapid Fire (1), Reliable

abilities.name: Medicae
abilities.description: As an Action, the Medic attempts a Medicae Test (DN3) to heal an ally. On success, heal 1 Wound, +1 per Exalted Icon shifted.

abilities.name: Medic!
abilities.description: When a [REGIMENT] ally within 6m reaches their Maximum Wounds, this Threat may make a normal move towards them and attempt a DN5 Medicae test; on success, the patient recovers 1 Wound and survives the attack.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: STANDARD BEARER
description: Standard Bearers are Guardsmen who due to battlefield gallantry have been rewarded with the honor of holding the Company or Regimental Standard. Typically operating out of Command Squads, the Standard Bearer serves as a reminder for the rest of the Company to fight with duty and honor.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6

abilities.name: Regimental Standard
abilities.description: Any [REGIMENT] allies within 6m of the Standard Bearer may re-roll any dice which roll 1s when making an attack or attempting a Resolve test.

abilities.name: Lasgun
abilities.stats: 7 +1ED / AP - / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Rapid Fire (1), Reliable

abilities.name: Plant the Colours
abilities.description: As an Action, the Standard Bearer plants the banner and unfurls it. Until the Standard Bearer moves, the Regimental Standard ability's range is doubled.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: VOX-OPERATOR
description: Vox-Operators are Guardsmen who operate Vox communication systems in the field, allowing for improved communications and coordination between Company, Platoon, and Squad commands.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Tech-Use 6

abilities.name: Master-Vox
abilities.description: This Threat carries a Master Vox.

abilities.name: Lasgun
abilities.stats: 7 +1ED / AP - / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Rapid Fire (1), Reliable

abilities.name: Vox-Link
abilities.description: Make a Tech test with a DN of 3. If successful, add 1 to Ruin.

abilities.name: Fire on My Position
abilities.description: You may spend 1 Ruin when this Threat is slain to call in an artillery strike aimed at the Vox-Caster. This is a ranged attack with a Ballistic Skill of 6: Artillery: 12 +4ED / AP -1 / Blast (3d3+1), Inflict (Pinning).

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: VETERAN GUARDSMAN
description: As regiments fight gruelling campaigns that last for years on end, eventually they will shrink in size as the number of casualties rises. In many cases an entire company will be reduced to a single squad of the most battle-tested, hardcore Guardsmen blessed with the strength and will to survive the nightmarish battlefields of the 41st Millennium.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6

abilities.name: Lasgun
abilities.stats: 7 +1ED / AP - / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Rapid Fire (1), Reliable

abilities.name: Veteran
abilities.description: If this Threat scores a Wrath Critical when making an attack, they immediately add 1 Ruin.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: CASTELLAN
description: Strategic senior officers often ranking as Captains, Majors, or Colonels, Castellans are authoritative leaders of the Astra Militarum. Bearing a panoply of armaments and insignia that mark their high office, they wield their weapons as skilfully as they command the soldiers beneath them.
skills: Default 7, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Leadership 10

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Senior Officer
abilities.description: [REGIMENT] allies within 9m may use the Officer's Conviction and Resolve scores instead of their own.

abilities.name: Voice of Command
abilities.description: The Threat issues one or two Orders as an Action. The Threat may give Regimental Orders.

abilities.name: Inspired Command
abilities.description: The Threat spends 1 Ruin and issues a single Order as a Ruin Action. The Threat may give Regimental Orders.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: COMMISSAR
description: Commissars are invariably stern and uncompromising individuals, able to keep even the most anarchic regiments in line through fear, strength and power. Every regiment has one or more attached Commissars who remain with the regiment throughout its duties. Commissars are assigned to regiments by the Departmento Munitorum's Officio Prefectus. They have authority over both the soldiers and regimental officers.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 3), Intimidation 7, Leadership 7, Weapon Skill 7

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Political Officer
abilities.description: An ASTRA MILITARUM OFFICER within 6m may re-roll any failures on Resolve or Conviction tests.

abilities.name: Voice of Command
abilities.description: The Threat issues one Order as an Action. The Threat may give Prefectus Orders.

abilities.name: Summary Execution
abilities.description: When an ASTRA MILITARUM Mob within 6m fails a Resolve Test, the Commissar may kill one member of that mob as a Reflexive Action. The Mob then counts as succeeding at the Resolve Test.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: LORD COMMISSAR
description: Amongst the ranks of the Officio Prefectus there are many heroic individuals who have become legend through their deeds. Some of those paragons may achieve the rank of Lord Commissar. Where a commissar will be attached as an ancillary officer to an Astra Militarum regiment's company, fulfilling their charge under the tactical direction of the company commander, a Lord Commissar will often lead the soldiers they oversee into battle directly.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Intimidation 10, Leadership 9, Weapon Skill 9

abilities.name: Aura of Discipline
abilities.description: ASTRA MILITARUM allies within 6m may use the Officer's Conviction and Resolve scores instead of their own.

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Political Officer
abilities.description: An ASTRA MILITARUM OFFICER within 12m may re-roll any failures on Resolve or Conviction tests.

abilities.name: Voice of Command
abilities.description: The Threat issues one or two Orders as an Action. The Threat may give Prefectus Orders.

abilities.name: Unquestioning Obedience
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin as a Ruin Action. All ASTRA MILITARUM allies within 12m immediately recover from Fear, Terror, or Pinning.

abilities.name: Summary Execution
abilities.description: When an ASTRA MILITARUM Mob within 6m fails a Resolve Test, the Commissar may kill one member of that mob as a Reflexive Action. The Mob then counts as succeeding at the Resolve Test.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: TANK CREW
description: The Imperial Guard utilises a vast number and array of armoured vehicles, from swift scout walkers and reconnaissance buggies to massive battle tanks and devastating artillery platforms. These require dedicated and effective crews in order to allow them to function.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Pilot 5, Tech 5

abilities.name: Iron Bulwark
abilities.description: This Threat adds +3 to Resolve when operating an ASTRA MILITARUM vehicle.

abilities.name: Brutal Fusillade
abilities.description: Whenever this Threat makes an attack with a vehicle-mounted weapon, it may make a Salvo Attack, despite being Troops.

abilities.name: Well-Oiled Machine
abilities.description: Due to close teamwork, the PILOT and CREW of an ASTRA MILITARUM vehicle gain bonus dice equal to half the number of Tank Crew (rounding up) operating the vehicle as if they were a mob.

abilities.name: Main Gunner
abilities.description: In any ASTRA MILITARUM TANK, one CREW will operate the vehicle's main turret gun. When making an attack with this weapon, the Tank Crew gains +2 bonus dice and may fire the weapon at enemies engaged with the vehicle.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: TANK COMMANDER
description: A Tank Commander is an officer of the Astra Militarum who commands the armoured companies or regiments of the Imperial Guard. A Tank Commander most often rides to battle in the cupola of a mighty Leman Russ main battle tank. These grizzled Guard officers are virtually one with their machines, possessing an implicit knowledge of mechanised warfare in all its forms.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 3), Leadership 8, Pilot 7, Tech 7

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Ace Crew
abilities.description: This Threat adds +3 to Resolve when operating an ASTRA MILITARUM vehicle. All Tank Crew in the same vehicle may use the Threat's Resolve and Conviction and add +2 to all of their Skill ratings.

abilities.name: Brutal Fusillade
abilities.description: Whenever this Threat makes an attack with a vehicle-mounted weapon, it may make a Salvo Attack, despite being Troops.

abilities.name: Well-Oiled Machine
abilities.description: Due to close teamwork, the PILOT and CREW of an ASTRA MILITARUM vehicle gain bonus dice equal to half the number of Tank Crew (rounding up) operating the vehicle as if they were a mob.

abilities.name: Voice of Command
abilities.description: The Threat issues a single Order as an Action. The Threat may give Mechanised Orders.

abilities.name: Inspired Command
abilities.description: The Threat spends 1 Ruin and issues a single Order as a Ruin Action. The Threat may give Mechanised Orders.

abilities.name: A Death Befitting an Officer
abilities.description: If this Threat is slain due to their vehicle being destroyed, they may make a single attack with one of the vehicle's weapons before they are killed.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 3d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: ASTRA MILITARUM HEAVY WEAPONS TROOPER
description: A Heavy Weapons Squad is a small unit of the Astra Militarum that is outfitted with heavy weapons intended to provide close or heavy fire support to standard Imperial Guard infantry. Those soldiers with an affinity for bulky and more complicated weaponry are often gathered together within a dedicated Heavy Weapons Company.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6

abilities.name: Weapon Team
abilities.description: Heavy Weapons Troopers work in pairs, a gunner and a loader. If a gunner is killed, the loader may take over the gunner's weapon. While the loader is within 1m of the gunner, the gunner's heavy weapon gains the Sustained quality and the gunner may make a Salvo Attack, despite being Troops.

abilities.name: Firing Position
abilities.description: When their heavy weapon is braced, a heavy weapon team gains +1 Defence.

abilities.name: Lasgun
abilities.stats: 7 +1ED / AP - / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Rapid Fire (1), Reliable

abilities.name: Heavy Bolter
abilities.stats: 12 +2ED / AP -1 / Range 18-36-54 / Salvo 3 / Brutal, Heavy (4), Rapid Fire (4)

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: FIELD ORDNANCE CREW
description: The largest man-portable weapons fielded by the Imperial Guard are fitted to large, wheeled carriages and operated by a crew of three. These carriages can be towed into position behind other vehicles, and though heavy, the carriage is just light enough to be pulled by the crew short distances should they need to be redeployed in the field.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Tech 5

abilities.name: Gun Crew
abilities.description: A Field Ordnance Team of three operates a single weapon mounted on a gun carriage. The DN of any attack made with the gun increases by +1 for each missing crew member.

abilities.name: Gun Shield
abilities.description: Once emplaced, the crew add +2 to their defence, as they are able to take cover behind the gun carriage.

abilities.name: Lasgun
abilities.stats: 7 +1ED / AP - / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Rapid Fire (1), Reliable

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: VETERAN GUARDSMAN
description: Astra Militarum Veterans are natural born survivors. They have escaped ambushes, negotiated mine fields, fought a myriad of foes and lived to tell the tale. Their continued existence, despite the dangers they face, is testament to both their skill at war and their natural survival instinct.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6

abilities.name: Lasgun
abilities.stats: 7 +1ED / AP - / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Rapid Fire (1), Reliable

abilities.name: Veteran
abilities.description: If this Threat scores a Wrath Critical when making an attack, they immediately add 1 Ruin.

name: VETERAN SERGEANT
description: Veteran Sergeants command squads of Veterans in battle. Calm under pressure and unphased by the horrors of war, they are solid combat leaders who will fight tooth and nail to achieve victory as well as see their comrades survive to fight another day.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Leadership 6

abilities.name: Squad Leader
abilities.description: A Veteran Sergeant may issue orders as per Voice of Command, but only to other [REGIMENT] VETERANs.

abilities.name: Boltgun
abilities.stats: 10 +1ED / AP - / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Brutal, Rapid Fire (2)

abilities.name: Voice of Command
abilities.description: The Threat issues a single Order as an Action. The Threat may give Regimental Orders.

abilities.name: Veteran
abilities.description: If this Threat scores a Wrath Critical when making an attack, they immediately add 1 Ruin.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: VETERAN SNIPER
description: Expert marksmen, their skills honed in the harsh conditions of numerous battlefields, Sniper Veterans are sharpshooters who specialise in cutting down key enemy troops at extreme ranges - all unseen by the foe.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 7, Stealth 6

abilities.name: Vantage Point
abilities.description: The Threat makes a normal move to a firing position and attempts a Stealth test to create a Stealth Score.

abilities.name: Deadeye Shot
abilities.description: If this Threat scores a Wrath Critical when making a ranged attack, they also inflict 1d3 Mortal Wounds.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: VETERAN GUNNER
description: With experience and skills in wielding a whole host of specialist weapons, Gunner Veterans are called whether a Sergeant Veteran needs a xenos nest burned to nothing, a bunker reduced to melted sludge or to bring down heavy enemy infantry that lasguns are insufficient for.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Tech-Use 6

abilities.name: Veteran
abilities.description: If this Threat scores a Wrath Critical when making an attack, they immediately add 1 Ruin.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The Astra Militarum (Apocrypha)

name: CONFIDANT VETERAN
description: Even the best Sergeant Veterans need to call on solid tactical advice - and their confidants are experts. Experienced troopers and capable leaders themselves, they can be trusted to carry out the sergeant's orders in the field as well as contribute to the formulation of a solid battle plan.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6

abilities.name: Second in Command
abilities.description: When a Veteran Sergeant is killed, one Confidant Veteran gains the Squad Leader bonus and the Voice of Command action.

abilities.name: Direct
abilities.description: When this Threat finishes a turn, they may Keep the Initiative for free.

abilities.description: If this Threat scores a Wrath Critical when making an attack, they immediately add 1 Ruin.

name: DEMOLITION VETERAN
description: Whether blowing up ammo dumps or cracking open defences, many kill teams need explosives experts. Demolition Veterans are such troops. Naturally daring, they often have to put themselves in harm's way to plant their remote mines at the optimum point to blow their target into smithereens.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Tech-Use 6

name: ZEALOT VETERAN
description: Zealot Veterans are deeply spiritual warriors, often claiming their survival through the horrifying battlefields they've experienced is only thanks to the direct intervention of the Emperor himself.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Persuasion 6

abilities.description: Select a [REGIMENT] VETERAN ally within 3m. Until the Zealot Veteran's next turn, that ally is Inspired, and may re-roll up to Tier dice on the first attack they make.

name: MEDIC VETERAN
description: The efforts of the Medic Veteran is all that stands between life and miserable death for the troops of his squad. Equipped with little more than basic medical equipment, they strive to keep their comrades alive in the most hazardous conditions.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Medicae 6

abilities.name: Medic!
abilities.description: When a [REGIMENT] ally within 6m reaches their Maximum Wounds, this Threat may make a normal move towards them and attempt a DN5 Medicae test; on success, the patient recovers 1 Wound and survives the attack.

name: COMMS VETERAN
description: Comms Veterans are consummate professionals, accompanying their leaders wherever required whilst carrying heavy equipment, all to receive and transmit communications that are vital for their comrades and superiors to understand the inevitable confusion of battle.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Tech-Use 6

abilities.name: Vox Operator
abilities.description: This Threat carries a Vox Caster.

name: BRUISER VETERAN
description: For some, war and fighting just agrees with them. Bruiser Veterans are such people. They look the galaxy's endless malevolent threats in the eye with a trench club in their hand, ready to bludgeon anything and everything to death.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Weapon Skill 6

name: HARDENED VETERAN
description: Some Veterans are resilient above and beyond even their peers. These troops are steel in body as well as in mind, with bionics in the place of body parts lost in battle. Despite the horrific wounds they have suffered, they fight on still, unbowed.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6

name: SPOTTER VETERAN
description: To direct battle-winning heavy fire, forward observers form a part of kill teams. These Spotter Veterans possess great focus, accurately guiding salvoes of mortar fire from safe lines even when under immense pressure.

name: GUARDIAN DEFENDER
description:
A Guardian is one of the militia infantry of the Aeldari craftworlds who serve multiple tactical roles as needed in the defence of their homes.
In times of peace the Guardians pursue their normal civilian roles. All adult Asuryani, however, are trained in the arts of warfare and can be called to arms if their craftworld is threatened.
Guardians are the civilians of the Craftworlds, who take up arms as assault teams, pilots, and artillerymen. In this way, all Aeldari can play the role of the remorseless killer should the fates dictate it.
Among the ever-thinning ranks of the Aeldari, Guardians remain the most numerous of a craftworld's warriors. Yet they are not deployed idly, for every Aeldari life is a precious thing, not to be squandered in pyrrhic victories or needless last stands.
To tip the odds further in their favour, Guardians go to battle supported by anti-gravitic weapons platforms whose crews have a mandate to vanquish priority targets in a storm of firepower. Should a foe draw too near, Guardian Defenders make a fighting retreat, for their weapons are designed for accuracy on the move.
When an Aeldari Guardian dons his war mask, his former life is supplanted by the thrill of battle. Thoughts of peace and tranquillity are replaced with the desire to destroy his foes and secure glorious victory.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6

bonuses.name: Ancient Doom
bonuses.description: When making a melee attack against an enemy with the SLAANESH keyword, the Threat may re-roll any failures. However, the DN of all Resolve tests attempted within 6 metres of an enemy with the SLAANESH keyword is increased by +1.

bonuses.name: Battle Focus
bonuses.description: When this Threat takes a Sprint action, they may fire any non-Heavy ranged weapon as if it had the Assault trait, ignoring the DN increase. In addition, when this Threat takes the Sprint action, it is not required to move in a straight line.

abilities.name: Shuriken Catapult
abilities.stats: 10 +1 ED / AP - / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 3 / Assault, Rending (3)

abilities.name: Fire and Fade
abilities.description: If a Guardian Defender rolls a Wrath critical on any Test, they may move up to double their Speed after the Test resolves.

abilities.name: Fire and Fade (Ruin)
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. The Guardian Defender may activate Fire and Fade as though they had rolled a Wrath Critical on a Test.

mobAbilities:
In a Mob of ten or more Guardian Defenders, two individuals can operate a heavy weapons platform with one of the weapons below. The heavy weapons platform allows the Mob to ignore the Heavy Trait of the weapon.
Shuriken Cannon: 14 +2ED / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 4 / Assault, Heavy (6), Rending (3)
Bright Lance: 16 +3ED / AP -4 / Salvo 0 / Heavy (4), Sniper (1)
Scatter Laser: 14 +2ED / AP - / 18-36-54 / Salvo 6 / Heavy (8)
Starcannon: 14 +2ED / AP -3 / 18-36-54 / Salvo 4 / Heavy (8)
Aeldari Missile Launcher: damage and AP as missile / 24-48-72 / Salvo - / Heavy (6) (Sunburst Missile: 10 +5ED / AP -1 / Blast (10)) (Starshot Missile: 16 +6ED / AP -2 / Blast (2))

name: STORM GUARDIAN
description:
Despite the precious nature of all Aeldari life, sometimes the brutal economy of war requires Autarchs to commit troops to shock assaults and bloody close combats. Though rare among the Craftworlder warhosts, the Storm Guardians are warriors ideally suited to the reckless maelstrom of melee.
Many Storm Guardians are drawn from those Asuryani who once walked the Path of the Warrior and served with Aspect Shrines dedicated to close combat. Though they have set down their war masks to walk a new Path, when necessity calls, they can put it back on and once more use the deadly melee skills they once honed to perfection.
Armed with Shuriken Pistols and razor-sharp blades, they wade into the press of enemy ranks, hewing open flesh in vivid sprays of gore. However, unlike the clumsy butchery of the other starfaring species of the galaxy, there is a beautiful violence to the way the Storm Guardians despatch their foes.
Storm Guardian squads are a rare sight, but effective nonetheless, acting as assault troops in support of the Craftworld's Aspect Warriors. Although they lack the protection afforded by Aspect Armour, they fight with all the skill and grace of their kind.
With preternatural speed, their weapons sweep into the foe, chopping through limbs and joints before their adversaries can take a heavy toll in return. Storm Guardian squads invariably need to move fast, sprinting from one hotly contested strongpoint to another, and thus they forego the use of heavy weapon platforms.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Weapon Skill 6

abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action. The Storm Guardian may Fall Back and move up to their Speed.

name: WINDRIDER
description:
Windriders, known also as Guardian Jetbike Squadrons, consist of Asuryani Guardians who take to the air riding Eldar Jetbikes. Typically recruiting from Aeldari with piloting skills from their civilian life, these pilots form a close bond with their vehicles.
These units are commonly assigned as forward scouts for the main Eldar host or as a rapid-response force, using their weapons to strike down the enemy as they speed past them in a brightly coloured blur. A common tactic for Jetbike riders is to circumvent enemy lines completely and then close in on their vulnerable rear, taking a fearsome toll before gunning their engines and speeding off again.
To an Aeldari, the mastery of the Jetbike is an exhilarating challenge. Jetbikes have long, curved vanes on either side that allow the rider to execute incredibly sharp turns in mid-air, and the strength of their anti-grav motors can be subtly manipulated to send the Jetbikes hurtling into a steep dive or sharp climb. Even for an Aeldari it takes years of practice to master a Jetbike's potential, but one who does so may build a rapport with his steed comparable to the horsemasters of Aeldari Mythology.
Guardian Windriders are mounted upon Aeldari Jetbikes.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Pilot 6, Weapon Skill 6

name: WARLOCK
description:
A Warlock is an Eldar Seer or psyker who previously walked the Path of the Warrior as an Aspect Warrior of the Eldar Craftworlds and now uses his potent psychic powers to help lead Eldar warhosts. Warlocks who lose themselves upon this path ultimately become Farseers.
The most aggressive and warlike of all the potential variants of the Path of the Seer is that of the Warlock. Since Warlocks are Seers who once trod the Path of the Warrior, their previous experience as Aspect Warriors allows them to harness their more destructive impulses when using their psychic powers in combat.
The ornate helmets worn by Warlocks in the field are kept in the shrines of the Warrior Aspects as a sign of the close link between Warlocks and their former status as Warriors. A Warlock can only attain that status by returning to the Aspect Shrine that he once belonged to and receiving his helmet from the shrine's Exarch as part of the same blood-ritual undergone by Aspect Warriors.
A Warlock not only learns the use of the psychic runes of war but also how to wield the Witchblade, a powerful Eldar Force Weapon. Witchblades writhe and twist with living runes that focus the inherent power of the Warlock's mind into destructive psychic energy using a helical psychic matrix that runs through the core of the blade. In the hands of a Warlock, a Witchblade strikes with a devastating burst of psychic force that can incinerate an enemy where he stands.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 7, Psychic Mastery 8, Weapon Skill 7

ASURYANI PSYKERS may re-roll a single Wrath Dice that rolled a Complication once per Psychic Mastery Test.

name: RANGER
description:
Rangers are the scouts of the Asuryani craftworlds, well-trained survivalists and marksmen able to find the eye sockets and neck joints of even the most heavily armoured enemy troops with their Long Rifles.
Many Rangers remain loyal to their craftworlds and the kin who live upon them even if they do not feel the need to live there, so when the craftworld goes to war, they almost always provide their aid, offering to conduct reconnaissance of enemy forces and wield their expert marksmanship to harry and cripple enemy forces and eliminate select targets like commanding officers that will cripple the foe's command and control.
The Rangers' preternatural skill at finding the eye socket, neck joint or any other weak point on even the most heavily armoured enemy troops is legendary even among a species as keen-eyed as the Aeldari.
While some Rangers never return to their craftworlds, their lives claimed by the alien dangers of some unknown world or consumed by their own passions and ultimate fall into the embrace of Slaanesh, many others do, scarred and finally ready to settle into another Path, their experiences as a Ranger having granted them both a better understanding of themselves and their place in the Aeldari society of their craftworld.

name: DIRE AVENGER
description:
The Dire Avengers were the first amongst the Aspect Warriors of the Aeldari. They represent the Aeldari War God Khaela Mensha Khaine in his aspect as the noblest and yet most merciless of warriors. The Dire Avengers show no mercy to their foes and are unwavering in their devotion to their people.
These warriors are the least specialised and the most tactically flexible of all the Warrior Aspects, as they serve Aeldari armies as elite infantry. The Dire Avengers are also the most common of the Warrior Aspects amongst the Aeldari, and their shrines are the largest to be found on all the Craftworlds.
It is to the Dire Avengers that the Farseers turn for the most important missions. When an ancient Aeldari relic needs to be recovered or an abandoned Webway portal needs to be defended, Dire Avengers are often sent to carry out the task. When a human or Ork colony is discovered upon a Maiden World, Dire Avengers are sent to clear the trespassers. On those occasions when a Farseer has need to meet with agents of the Imperium of Man, it is the Dire Avengers who accompany him as an honour guard.
Dire Avengers are patient and methodical warriors, as furious in attack as they are intractable in defence. They possess an uncanny ability to read the ebb and flow of a battle, in much the same way as a sailor might read the sea, riding its waves, and harnessing its power to overwhelm a foe. One moment they might unleash a hail of fire before plunging forwards into the enemy lines, weapons drawn, whilst the next they might be falling back, luring their foe into a carefully prepared ambush.

name: DIRE AVENGER EXARCH
description:
Every Aspect Shrine of the Aeldari is led by an Exarch, an Aeldari who has been called permanently to the Path of the Warrior. An Exarch has travelled so far down that Path that they can no longer leave it and so dedicates him or herself fully as a high priest of Khaine in service to the Aspect of the War God that they represent.
Exarchs wear more elaborate and ornate versions of Aspect Armour which incorporates the spirits of their past wearers, granting an Exarch not only wisdom and knowledge stretching across the millennia but a raw pool of potent psychic energy that can be used in combat.
This permanent acceptance of the Aeldari's "war mask" provides Exarchs with enhanced skill and dedication to their craft and entitles them to access their Shrine's oldest and most advanced wargear. Their secret knowledge and supernatural abilities also allow Exarchs to enhance the abilities of the Dire Avengers squads they lead.

name: FIRE DRAGON
description:
The Fire Dragons are Asuryani Aspect Warriors who seek to embody the writhing, sinewy dragons of Aeldari Mythology. No Aeldari Aspect Warriors revel more in destruction than those who serve the Aspect Shrine of the Fire Dragons. Taking as their totem the fierce, fire-breathing creatures of Aeldari mythology, they epitomise the brutal, wanton destruction of war.
When called to arms their goal is the total annihilation of their foes, to the exclusion of all else. Fire Dragons are aggressive and warlike close combat fighters who utilise heat-based weaponry to destroy enemy armoured vehicles and drive the foe from his fortified strongpoints.
They have an unsurpassed mastery of their chosen and highly dangerous weapons and take savage delight in the devastation they create. For this reason, the Asuryani believe that the Fire Dragons are the embodiment of the Aeldari war god Kaela Mensha Khaine's penchant for pure destruction. It is said that Fire Dragon Exarchs generate a corona of lambent flame around themselves when the battle lust is upon them.

bonuses.name: Assured Destruction
bonuses.description: When making an attack against a Vehicle, the Threat may re-roll any ED which roll 1.

bonuses.name: Battle Focus
bonuses.description: When this Threat takes a Sprint action, they may fire any non-Heavy ranged weapon as if it had the Assault trait, ignoring the DN increase. In addition, when this Threat takes the Sprint action, it is not required to move in a straight line.

abilities.stats: 16 +2 ED / AP -4 / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 1 / Assault, Melta

abilities.name: Placed Charge
abilities.description: Any target within a Melta Bomb's blast is within close range for the purposes of the Melta trait. Melta Bombs cannot be used in a grenade launcher. In addition, they may be placed onto a vehicle or structure within 1m rather than thrown, requiring a Tech test with a DN equal to the vehicle's Defence. Placed melta bombs do not detonate immediately and can be detonated as a simple action on any of the character's subsequent turns.

abilities.name: It's Gonna Blow!
abilities.description: If an enemy Vehicle or Monster within 3m is about to explode, the Fire Dragon may move up to half their Speed (round up) before the explosion occurs.

determination: Withstand the Inferno: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. This Threat may instead spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6 if the damage is inflicted by a weapon with the FIRE or MELTA keywords.

name: FIRE DRAGON EXARCH
description:
Every Aspect Shrine of the Aeldari is led by an Exarch, an Aeldari who has been called permanently to the Path of the Warrior. An Exarch has travelled so far down that Path that they can no longer leave it and so dedicates him or herself fully as a high priest of Khaine in service to the Aspect of the War God that they represent.
Exarchs wear more elaborate and ornate versions of Aspect Armour which incorporates the spirits of their past wearers, granting an Exarch not only wisdom and knowledge stretching across the millennia but a raw pool of potent psychic energy that can be used in combat.
This permanent acceptance of the Aeldari's "war mask" provides Exarchs with enhanced skill and dedication to their craft and entitles them to access their Shrine's oldest and most advanced wargear. As befits their shrine's tactical focus, the Fire Dragons' Exarchs are masters of destroying enemy strongholds, well-armoured troops, or emplaced weapons. Exarchs often have versed their squad in the art of stalking armoured vehicles and being able to spot weak points in their armour with uncanny speed.

name: STRIKING SCORPION
description:
The Aeldari Aspect Warriors known as the Striking Scorpions epitomise the deadly attributes of their namesake, and they are the most skilled of all the close-assault Warrior Aspects on the Aeldari Path of the Warrior.
They are merciless killers without exception, revelling in the hunt and the kill, using stealth and shadow to cloak themselves from sight until the moment of attack. The Striking Scorpions represent the wrath of the War God Kaela Mensha Khaine, which can fall without warning and with extraordinary savagery upon his foes.
The Striking Scorpions are one of the Aeldari Warrior Aspects dedicated to close combat, particularly close combat during infiltration missions in which they must first close with the enemy undetected before unleashing their wrath.
Striking Scorpions are best deployed to deal with tactical situations in which they face off against large numbers of enemy troops who are weaker than they, though their unusual physical prowess for Aeldari allows the Striking Scorpions to successfully battle foes head-to-head that most Aeldari, even other Aspect Warriors, would avoid.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 8, Stealth 8, Weapon Skill 9
