abilities.name: Rendmaster
abilities.description: As a Simple Action, the Rendmaster may choose a Bloodletter mob within 6m. Until the start of the Rendmaster's next turn, the chosen Bloodletters add +2ED to their melee damage for each Exalted Icon shifted.

abilities.name: Daemonic Manifestation
abilities.description: The Rendmaster may spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action to summon 1d3 Bloodletters, which may appear individually, or add to a mob.

abilities.name: Skulls for the Skull Throne
abilities.description: If this Threat rolls a Wrath Critical as part of an attack, the critical hit inflicted is improved as if 3 Glory had been spent.

abilities.name: Glorious Decapitation
abilities.description: After killing an enemy Player Character or Adversary, this Threat may spend 1 Ruin: For the rest of the scene all KHORNE LESSER DAEMONS within 6m gain Mortal (1) on melee attacks.

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 8d6.

name: BLOODTHIRSTER
description:
A Bloodthirster is the Greater Daemon of Khorne, and each is a manifestation of the unreasoning rage and savagery of total war. It is said that there are no more powerful masters of battle in the entire galaxy than the Greater Daemons of the Blood God and that none may stand before them. They are the very essence of brutality, every blow ever struck and life ever taken in anger distilled into a single, towering form of iron and sinew.

As the living embodiments of war, rage and murder, Bloodthirsters represent the bloodiest side of warfare and are renowned as the greatest warriors amongst daemonkind.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 13 (Passive 7), Leadership 13, Weapon Skill 16

abilities.name: Avatar of Carnage
abilities.description: At the start of each of the Bloodthirster's turns, add 1d3 to Ruin.

abilities.name: Blood for the Blood God
abilities.description: The Threat becomes Frenzied when within 8m of an enemy who is Bleeding.

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 8 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Lord of Khorne
abilities.description: While friendly KHORNE DAEMON Troops are within 6m, they may re-roll any die which rolls a 1 on any attack they attempt.

abilities.name: Monstrous Creature
abilities.description: This Threat is immune to the Fear, Terror, Pinned, and Staggered conditions.

abilities.name: Relentless Carnage
abilities.description: At the end of the Bloodthirster's turn, anyone within 3m of it suffers a hit dealing 13 +3ED damage.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 5 Terror Test.

abilities.name: Hellfire Breath
abilities.stats: 12 +1 ED / AP -2 / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 0 / Flamer, Inflict (Terror)

abilities.name: Daemonic Manifestation
abilities.description: The Bloodthirster may spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action to summon a mob of 10 Bloodletters, a mob of 5 Flesh Hounds, or 3 Bloodcrushers.

abilities.name: Lash of Khorne (Option)
abilities.stats: 16 +3 ED / AP -1 / Range 9 / Inflict (On Fire), Inflict (Restrained)

abilities.name: Collar of Khorne
abilities.description: If this Threat is targeted by a Psychic Power, or a Psychic Power is used within 16m of the Threat, it may attempt to Deny the Witch as a Reflexive Action. Its dice pool is equal to its Willpower plus the game's Tier.

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 13d6.

name: KARANAK
description:
For those that incur the wrath of Khorne, there is but one fate. Karanak is Khorne's favoured hound, the incarnation of the Blood God's vengeance. Relentless, vicious, and single-minded, Karanak is an implacable hunter who tracks his prey across the warped daemon realms and through the depths of realspace. No army can defend against him, and no wall can bar his path.

When not hunting, Karanak prowls the shadows of the Blood God's throne room. Karanak is vigilant above all other Flesh Hounds, for he has no less than three heads above his brass collar.

resilience.note: Melee: 12 / Ranged: 13 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 8, Awareness 16 (Passive 8), Survival 12, Weapon Skill 12

abilities.name: Aspect of Death
abilities.description: When an enemy fails a Resolve test within 6m of Karanak, they suffer 1d3+Tier Shock.

abilities.name: Blood for the Blood God
abilities.description: The Threat becomes Frenzied when within 8m of an enemy who is Bleeding.

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Pack Leader
abilities.description: While friendly Flesh Hounds are within 6m, they may re-roll any ED which roll a 1. If they are attacking a PSYKER, they may instead re-roll any ED which roll a failure.

abilities.name: Witch-Bane
abilities.description: When Karanak makes an attack against a PSYKER, it may re-roll any ED which roll failures.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 5 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Soul-Rending Fangs
abilities.stats: 13 +5 ED / AP -2 / Brutal, Inflict (Bleeding). Against Karanak's prey, gains Mortal (2).

abilities.name: Daemonic Manifestation
abilities.description: Karanak may spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action to summon 1d3 Flesh Hounds.

abilities.name: Brass Collar of Bloody Vengeance
abilities.description: If this Threat is targeted by a Psychic Power, or a Psychic Power is used within 16m of the Threat, it may attempt to Deny the Witch as a Reflexive Action. Its dice pool is equal to its Willpower plus twice the game's Tier.

abilities.name: Savage Pounce
abilities.description: This Threat makes a Charge and gains +2 bonus dice on its melee attack at the end of the Charge.

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6.

name: SKULLTAKER
description:
Skulltaker, also known as U'zuhl, is an infamous Bloodletter and Herald of Khorne who has been anointed as the Blood God's own Sacred Executioner. Skulltaker often goes to war at the head of the Cohort of Blood, an assemblage of the greatest Bloodletters selected from amongst the daemonic legions' ranks.

Whether battling against the armies of realspace, the legions of Khorne's rivals, or even against fellow warriors of the Blood God, Skulltaker will always seek out the greatest champions of the enemy.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 13 (Passive 7), Leadership 12, Weapon Skill 16

abilities.name: Blood for the Blood God
abilities.description: The Threat becomes Frenzied when within 8m of an enemy who is Bleeding.

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Herald of Khorne
abilities.description: While friendly KHORNE DAEMON Troops are within 6m, it may re-roll any ED which roll a 1.

abilities.name: Mounted (Optional)
abilities.description: Skulltaker is sometimes mounted upon a Juggernaut named Khul'tyran, whose Strength and Toughness are both increased by +2. Increase damage, Resilience, Wounds, and Determination accordingly.

abilities.name: Skulls for Khorne
abilities.description: Against an enemy Player Character or Adversary, Skulltaker may re-roll any failures on melee attacks or melee damage rolls. Each time Skulltaker slays a Player Character or Adversary, add 1 to Ruin.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

abilities.name: The Slayer Sword
abilities.stats: 15 +8 ED / AP -3 / Brutal, Parry, Mortal (1). Melee attacks made by Skulltaker cannot have their damage reduced by Determination.

abilities.name: Lord of Decapitations
abilities.description: As a Simple Action, Skulltaker may choose a single mob of Bloodletters within 6m. Until the start of Skulltaker's next turn, the chosen Bloodletters add Mortal (1) to their melee attacks.

abilities.name: Daemonic Manifestation
abilities.description: Skulltaker may spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action to summon 1d3 Bloodletters.

abilities.name: Skulls for the Skull Throne
abilities.description: If this Threat rolls a Wrath Critical as part of an attack, the critical hit inflicted is improved as if 3 Glory had been spent.

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 10d6. Cloak of Skulls: When Skulltaker rolls Determination, reroll any dice which roll 1.

name: SKARBRAND
description:
Skarbrand the Exiled One is a Bloodthirster, a Greater Daemon of the Blood God Khorne. Skarbrand is wrath incarnate, a creature of murderous violence unleashed from the Realm of Chaos to reap skulls and souls for his lord in a storm of rage.

Once Skarbrand was the greatest of Khorne's generals, the mightiest of all Bloodthirsters, until, due to the machinations of Tzeentch, his rage was stoked to uncontrollable levels and he had the temerity to actually strike at the Blood God himself. For such a betrayal, Khorne exiled his Bloodthirster from the Blood God's Domain for all time.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 13 (Passive 7), Leadership 11, Weapon Skill 16

abilities.name: Avatar of Carnage
abilities.description: At the start of each of the Bloodthirster's turns, add 1d3 to Ruin.

abilities.name: Blood for the Blood God
abilities.description: The Threat becomes Frenzied when within 8m of an enemy who is Bleeding.

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 8 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Deepening Fury
abilities.description: Skarbrand does not suffer the normal penalty for being wounded; instead, he adds +Tier to all melee attacks while wounded.

abilities.name: Monstrous Creature
abilities.description: This Threat is immune to the Fear, Terror, Pinned, and Staggered conditions.

abilities.name: Rage Incarnate
abilities.description: Skarbrand and all creatures, whether friend or foe, within 8m of Skarbrand are Frenzied. A creature may attempt to resist this frenzy as normal. While Frenzied, affected creatures add +1 to their Speed when they Sprint or Charge.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 5 Terror Test.

abilities.name: Slaughter & Carnage (Sweep)
abilities.stats: 17 +4 ED / AP -3 / Range 2 / Reaping. When making a Multi-Attack, reduce the DN penalty by an amount equal to the game's Tier.

abilities.name: Bellow of Endless Fury
abilities.stats: 12 +3 ED / AP -1 / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 0 / Flamer, Inflict (Terror)

abilities.name: Daemonic Manifestation
abilities.description: Skarbrand may spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action to summon a mob of 10 Bloodletters, a mob of 5 Flesh Hounds, or 3 Bloodcrushers.

abilities.name: Witchbane
abilities.description: If this Threat is targeted by a Psychic Power, that psychic power fails, and 1 is added to Ruin.

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 14d6.

name: DOOMBREED
description:
Khorne was the first of the Chaos Gods to truly awaken within the Warp, and Doombreed was one of the Blood God's first servants. A warlord on Ancient Terra, long before the Imperium was even a dream, he spread such slaughter and carnage that Khorne could not help but grant the murderous mortal apotheosis. With that Doombreed became Khorne's first Daemon Prince.

Doombreed is so ancient that even myths of his origin and mortal name are lost to time, and his power is such that he rivals even mighty Angron, Daemon Primarch of the World Eaters, in might and fury.

Doombreed takes the form of a giant Bloodthirster, wreathed in black smoke which becomes red muscle as he grows ever larger feeding on slaughter.
skills: Default 12, Awareness 15 (Passive 8), Leadership 15, Weapon Skill 18

abilities.name: Ancient Enmity
abilities.description: Doombreed hates Slaanesh and all servants of the Dark Prince. On any attack against any creature with the SLAANESH keyword, Doombreed may re-roll any dice which result in failures.

abilities.name: Avatar of Carnage
abilities.description: At the start of each of the Bloodthirster's turns, add 1d3 to Ruin.

abilities.name: Blood for the Blood God
abilities.description: The Threat becomes Frenzied when within 8m of an enemy who is Bleeding.

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 8 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: First Lord of Khorne
abilities.description: While friendly KHORNE DAEMON Troops are within 12m, it may re-roll any die which rolls a failure on any attack they attempt.

abilities.name: Glory of Battle
abilities.description: Doombreed reduces the DN for a multi-attack by an amount equal to the number of enemies within 3m.

abilities.name: Monstrous Creature
abilities.description: This Threat is immune to the Fear, Terror, Pinned, and Staggered conditions.

abilities.name: Praise of Khorne
abilities.description: Doombreed cannot suffer more than 8 Wounds in a single turn.

abilities.name: Relentless Carnage
abilities.description: At the end of the Bloodthirster's turn, anyone within 3m of it suffers a hit dealing 16 +3ED damage.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 7 Terror Test.

abilities.name: Rod of Khorne
abilities.stats: 19 +3 ED / AP -1 / Range 3 / Brutal. Against PSYKERS, the Rod of Khorne gains the Mortal (1d3) trait.

abilities.name: Daemonic Manifestation
abilities.description: Doombreed may spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action to summon a mob of 10 Bloodletters, a mob of 5 Flesh Hounds, or 3 Bloodcrushers.

abilities.name: Brass Collar of Spite
abilities.description: If this Threat is targeted by a Psychic Power, or a Psychic Power is used within 16m of the Threat, it may attempt to Deny the Witch as a Reflexive Action. Its dice pool is equal to its Willpower plus the game's Tier. If the power is negated, the Psyker immediately suffers 1d3 Mortal Wounds.

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 16d6.

name: PLAGUEBEARER OF NURGLE
description:
Plaguebearers are the foot soldiers of Nurgle's daemonic legions. These loathsome creatures are crafted from the blighted souls of mortals who have been slain by the virulent plague known as Nurgle's Rot.

These Lesser Daemons of the Lord of Decay are shambling, pustulent creatures. Plaguebearers have gangling, bony limbs, their bodies swollen with decay, so much so that glistening innards are exposed through rents in their skin.

They possess a single, cyclopean eye and a single horn rising above their haggard, drawn faces, their bodies covered in filth and parasites. Despite the Plaguebearer's unusual appearance, they are supernaturally resilient to harm, the gifts of their master having inured them to all pain.

resilience.note: Melee: 11 / Ranged: 12 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Weapon Skill 10

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Pestilential
abilities.description: Any character Poisoned by a Daemon of NURGLE suffers 1 Mortal Wound at the start of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Cloud of Flies
abilities.description: When a Plaguebearer is attacked, it may spend 1 Ruin to become wreathed in swarming, fat-bodied flies. The Plaguebearer, and all other Plaguebearers within 7m, add +2 to Defence (as if from cover) until the start of its next turn.

determination: Disgustingly Resilient Daemonic Aura. Roll 7d6; you do not need to spend Ruin.

name: NURGLING
description:
Nurglings, also known as "Mites of Nurgle," "Gleeful Castoffs", "Tiny Plagues" are tiny, mischievous Lesser Daemons of Nurgle. They are surely some of the most numerous and among the most favoured children of Grandfather Nurgle. Even their appearance is pleasing to the Plague God, for each Nurgling is like a minute copy of the dread master himself.

These pernicious and capricious Daemons erupt from the boils and pustules that pock the fleshy hide of Great Unclean Ones. They caper and dance about the Greater Daemons, causing mischief whenever possible, constantly giggling as they play.

resilience.note: Melee: 6 / Ranged: 7 (Daemonic Aura: *2 AR Melee, *1 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 4, Awareness 3 (Passive 2), Weapon Skill 6

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Pestilential
abilities.description: Any character Poisoned by a Daemon of NURGLE suffers 1 Mortal Wound at the start of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 1 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Mischievous
abilities.description: When a Nurgling attacks, spend 1 Ruin to give the Nurgling's attack the Inflict (Hindered) trait.

abilities.name: Mischievous Swarm
abilities.description: This mob's melee attack gains a range of 3m and inflicts 7 +3ED damage.

abilities.name: Innumerable
abilities.description: 1d3 Nurglings are added to the mob at the start of each of its turns.

determination: Disgustingly Resilient Daemonic Aura. Roll 3d6; you do not need to spend Ruin.

name: BEAST OF NURGLE
description:
Immense slug-like monstrosities, Beasts of Nurgle crawl across the ground on their bellies, weakly propelled by clawed flippers, leaving a layer of stinking slime in their wake. While slow, the Beast is implacable in its advance, undeterred by all but the most fearsome of weapons, as relentless as the decay it embodies.

The Beast of Nurgle is no less deadly than it is ugly, for its touch causes paralysis and its slimy secretions rot everything they cover. Despite its fearsome appearance and deadly attributes, the Beast is an affectionate creature that behaves in all respects exactly like an over-friendly and easily excited puppy.

resilience.note: Melee: 13 / Ranged: 14 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 6, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Weapon Skill 8

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Grotesque Regeneration
abilities.description: At the start of a Beast of Nurgle's turn, it heals Wounds equal to twice the game's Tier.

abilities.name: Putrid Slime
abilities.description: Any character Poisoned by a Beast of Nurgle is Staggered and suffers 1d3 Mortal Wounds at the start of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Slime Trail
abilities.description: When a Beast of Nurgle moves, spend 1 Ruin to exude a paralytic slime trail, covering an area 3m wide and as long as the Beast of Nurgle's movement, which lasts until the Beast's next turn. Any non NURGLE creature which moves into that area must pass a DN 5 Toughness Test or become Poisoned (5).

abilities.name: Attention Seeker
abilities.description: When an enemy moves within 5m of the Beast, the Beast may spend 1 Ruin to immediately Charge that enemy as a reflexive action.

abilities.name: Gooey Demise
abilities.description: Roll 1d6 when this Threat dies. On a roll of a 6, it explodes, inflicting 1d3 Mortal Wounds and the Poisoned (5) condition on all non-NURGLE creatures within 3m.

determination: Disgustingly Resilient Daemonic Aura. Roll 9d6; you do not need to spend Ruin.

name: PLAGUE DRONE
description:
A terrible thrum of insectile wings fills the air as the Plague Drones descend. High-ranking Plaguebearers riding atop monstrous Rot Flies, these daemonic airborne cavalry hit the enemy lines like hard-swung wrecking balls, bowling warriors over with their sheer stinking bulk.

Hairy limbs scrabble, ripping through flesh and cracking bone. Needle proboscis punch through armour joints and eye lenses to inject diseased acids into their victims.

resilience.note: Melee: 13 / Ranged: 14 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 6, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Weapon Skill 8

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Cavalry
abilities.description: A Plague Drone is ridden by a Plaguebearer. The Plague Drone and rider take a single shared turn in combat, with one set of actions between them. The rider may be targeted separately with a Called Shot, requiring +2 DN. If the rider is slain, the Plague Drone becomes Frenzied, and can only be calmed by another NURGLE DAEMON.

abilities.name: Pestilential
abilities.description: Any character Poisoned by a Daemon of NURGLE suffers 1 Mortal Wound at the start of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 5 Terror Test.

determination: Disgustingly Resilient Daemonic Aura. Roll 9d6; you do not need to spend Ruin.

name: POXBRINGER
description:
A mortal who resists the ravages of Nurgle's Rot for a significant time transforms into an unusually resilient Plaguebearer, resulting in a larger, tougher individual destined to one day reach the rank of Herald as a Poxbringer.

Further engorged by the touch of blessed diseases, Poxbringers grow stronger and tougher still, becoming true champions of their kind. Imbued with a generous portion of the unnatural vitality of Nurgle, Poxbringers project an aura of disease.

resilience.note: Melee: 14 / Ranged: 15 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Weapon Skill 11

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Herald of Nurgle
abilities.description: While friendly NURGLE DAEMON Troops are within 6m, it may re-roll any ED which roll a 1.

abilities.name: Pestilential
abilities.description: Any character Poisoned by a Daemon of NURGLE suffers 1 Mortal Wound at the start of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Poxbringer
abilities.description: As a Simple Action, the Poxbringer may choose a single mob of Plaguebearers within 6m. Until the start of the Poxbringer's next turn, the chosen Plaguebearers add +2ED to melee damage per Exalted Icon shifted.

abilities.name: Daemonic Manifestation
abilities.description: The Poxbringer may spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action to summon 1d3 Plaguebearers.

abilities.name: Warprot
abilities.description: The Poxbringer may attempt to activate any psychic power it knows. It knows Smite, Psyniscience, Deny the Witch, and one power from the Warprot discipline.

abilities.name: Pestilent Inspiration
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to use any Warprot Discipline psychic power, Smite, or Deny the Witch as a Ruin Action.

determination: Disgustingly Resilient Daemonic Aura. Roll 10d6; you do not need to spend Ruin.

name: SLOPPITY BILEPIPER
description:
Not all of the plagues created by Nurgle turn out as planned. The disease that eventually became known as the Chortling Murrain was at first believed to be a damp squib, but, when it was re-purposed as a punishment, it swiftly became one of the Lord of Plagues' favoured creations.

Once the symptoms of the Chortling Murrain fully manifest, its victim is given the title of "Sloppity Bilepiper" and a new task. Gifted with a gutpipe and marotter, these budding Heralds of Nurgle are sent to amuse Nurgle's Tallybands as they march to war.

resilience.note: Melee: 14 / Ranged: 15 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Persuasion 12, Weapon Skill 11

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Herald of Nurgle
abilities.description: While friendly NURGLE DAEMON Troops are within 6m, it may re-roll any ED which roll a 1.

abilities.name: Pestilential
abilities.description: Any character Poisoned by a Daemon of NURGLE suffers 1 Mortal Wound at the start of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Jolly Gutpipes
abilities.description: As a Simple Action, select one NURGLE DAEMON or a mob of Nurglings or NURGLE LESSER DAEMON Troops. Until the start of the Sloppity Bilepiper's next turn, the selected DAEMONs add +1 to Speed.

abilities.name: Disease of Mirth
abilities.description: The Sloppity Bilepiper makes a Persuasion Interaction Attack, and may target up to seven enemies within 12m. Enemies affected are also Poisoned (5) and are Staggered while they remain Poisoned.

abilities.name: Daemonic Manifestation
abilities.description: The Sloppity Bilepiper may spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action to summon 1d3 Plaguebearers.

abilities.name: Chortling Murrain
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin and use the Disease of Mirth action as a Ruin Action. Each enemy affected suffers Mortal Wounds equal to the game's Tier.

determination: Disgustingly Resilient Daemonic Aura. Roll 10d6; you do not need to spend Ruin.

name: SPOILPOX SCRIVENER
description:
The Heralds known as Spoilpox Scriveners are given a specific task by Grandfather Nurgle. It is their lot to tally the Tallyband, to audit their ceaseless counting, and to ensure that their calculations are accurate.

Spoilpox Scriveners themselves are sullen and spiteful creatures; they long to catch their fellows out with a mistake or, even better, to record enough wrongdoing to actually punish them.

resilience.note: Melee: 14 / Ranged: 15 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Scholar 11, Weapon Skill 11

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Herald of Nurgle
abilities.description: While friendly NURGLE DAEMON Troops are within 6m, it may re-roll any ED which roll a 1.

abilities.name: Pestilential
abilities.description: Any character Poisoned by a Daemon of NURGLE suffers 1 Mortal Wound at the start of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Distended Maw
abilities.stats: 13 +6 ED / AP -1 / Careful. The Spoilpox Scrivener can make one attack with the Plaguesword and one with the Distended Maw as a single combat action.

abilities.name: Keep Counting!
abilities.description: As a Simple Action, the Spoilpox Scrivener may choose a single mob of Plaguebearers within 6m. Until the start of the Scrivener's next turn, the chosen Plaguebearers add +2 bonus dice to any skill test they attempt, and +2 to their Resolve.

abilities.name: Daemonic Manifestation
abilities.description: The Spoilpox Scrivener may spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action to summon 1d3 Plaguebearers.

abilities.name: Pestilent Inspiration
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to use any Warprot Discipline psychic power, Smite, or Deny the Witch as a Ruin Action.

determination: Disgustingly Resilient Daemonic Aura. Roll 10d6; you do not need to spend Ruin.

name: GREAT UNCLEAN ONE
description:
A Great Unclean One is a grotesquely corpulent Greater Daemon of the Plague God Nurgle. To the mortal eye, a Greater Daemon of Nurgle is undoubtedly the foulest of all the daemonic servants of the Ruinous Powers. Their forms are squat and mountainous, covered in rotting flesh and open sores that weep foul rivulets of pus. Hot ropes of intestines dribble out of huge tears in their enormous, bloated and distended bellies.

Flyblown, maggot-ridden innards spill into view through the tears and gashes in his swollen belly as he lumbers forwards. Clusters of pustules and weeping buboes erupt from his hide, birthing small swarms of giggling Nurglings.

resilience.note: Melee: 18 / Ranged: 19 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 12, Awareness 13 (Passive 7), Leadership 14, Psychic Mastery 13, Weapon Skill 13

abilities.name: Avatar of Pestilence
abilities.description: At the start of each of the Great Unclean One's turns, add 1d3 to Ruin.

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 7 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Lord of Nurgle

abilities.description: At the start of each round, roll a number of dice equal to the current Ruin. For each Icon rolled, a single Nurgling is spawned within the Great Unclean One's guts. These Nurglings are counted as a single mob.

abilities.name: Embodiment of Pestilence
abilities.description: A character Poisoned by a GREATER DAEMON of NURGLE suffers 1d3 Mortal Wounds at the start of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 5 Terror Test.

abilities.stats: 14 +4 ED / AP -3 / Range 7 / Salvo 0 / Spread (No Range modifiers apply)

abilities.name: Daemonic Manifestation
abilities.description: The Great Unclean One may spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action to summon a mob of 10 Plaguebearers or a mob of 3 Plague Drones.

abilities.name: Warprot
abilities.description: The Great Unclean One may attempt to activate any psychic power it knows. It knows Smite, Psyniscience, Deny the Witch, and two powers from the Warprot discipline.

abilities.name: Doomsday Bell (Option)
abilities.stats: 16 +4 ED / AP -1 / Range 3 (M) / Inflict (Staggered). The Bell Tolls: As a Simple Action, select one mob of NURGLE LESSER DAEMONS within 12m. Roll 7d6. For each Icon rolled, a new member of that mob appears.

abilities.name: Bileblade (Option)
abilities.stats: 14 +3 ED / AP -1 / Inflict (Poisoned 5). Vile Offering: When attempting to activate a Psychic Power, it may suffer 1d3 Mortal Wounds (no Determination) to add bonus dice equal to the game's Tier.

abilities.name: Pestilent Inspiration
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to use any Warprot Discipline psychic power, Smite, or Deny the Witch as a Ruin Action.

determination: Disgustingly Resilient Daemonic Aura. Roll 14d6; you do not need to spend Ruin.

name: EPIDEMIUS
description:
Epidemius, also called the "Tallyman of Nurgle," is a powerful Herald of Nurgle and one of the seven masters of the Plague God's foot soldiers in his daemonic legions. The task of cataloguing the potency of Nurgle's many diseases falls to Epidemius, the Lord of Decay's chosen Tallyman.

Borne aloft on a rotten palanquin by a horde of Nurglings, Epidemius moves amongst the Daemons of Nurgle, making note of all the varied afflictions and poxes unleashed into the universe.

resilience.note: Melee: 14 / Ranged: 15 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Scholar 11

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Herald of Nurgle
abilities.description: While friendly NURGLE DAEMON Troops are within 6m, it may re-roll any ED which roll a 1.

abilities.name: Palanquin
abilities.description: This Threat is carried upon a throne borne aloft by a swarm of Nurglings. This counts as Heavy Cover (included in Defence, above), and there are 21 Nurglings. If the Nurglings are all slain, this Threat's speed is reduced to 0, but 2d6 new Nurglings appear at the start of each turn.

abilities.name: Pestilential
abilities.description: Any character Poisoned by a Daemon of NURGLE suffers 1 Mortal Wound at the start of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Tally of Pestilence
abilities.description: While this Threat is present on the battlefield, keep a tally of the number of enemies slain by NURGLE DAEMONS. If this total ever reaches 7, add +1 to Ruin.

abilities.name: Virulent Touch
abilities.description: Each time this Threat makes a melee attack, if the attack hits, then the target will suffer a minimum number of Wounds equal to the game's Tier, regardless of the attack's damage or the target's Resilience.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 5 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Daemonic Manifestation
abilities.description: Epidemius may spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action to summon 1d3 Plaguebearers.

abilities.name: Revolting Constitution
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin when you roll Determination; you gain bonus dice equal to the attack's ED.

determination: Disgustingly Resilient Daemonic Aura. Roll 10d6; you do not need to spend Ruin.

name: ROTIGUS
description:
Rotigus, also called "Rotigus Rainmaker", "Rainfather" and "the Generous One," is a powerful Great Unclean One, a Greater Daemon of Nurgle. Rotigus is the epitome of Nurgle's generosity and fecundity. None, save for the Lord of Decay himself, is more attuned to the woes of the world.

In their despair, the most defiant of mortals vow to endeavour onwards, despite the utter hopelessness of their situation. Rotigus listens to each supplication, and to those desperate enough to pledge anything in exchange for life, he promises salvation. And the Rainfather always delivers.

resilience.note: Melee: 18 / Ranged: 19 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 12, Awareness 13 (Passive 7), Leadership 14, Psychic Mastery 14, Weapon Skill 13

abilities.name: Avatar of Pestilence
abilities.description: At the start of each of the Great Unclean One's turns, add 1d3 to Ruin.

abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 7 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Deluge of Nurgle
abilities.description: Each time Rotigus scores one or more Wrath Criticals when attempting to activate a Warprot Psychic Power, add 1 to Ruin. While Rotigus is present, you may spend Ruin on a unique Warp Storm effect: Spend 1-3 Ruin, and place a Blast with a rating of 4 + twice the Ruin spent anywhere on the battlefield. Enemies in that Blast suffer 1d3+Ruin spent Mortal Wounds from toxic, acidic rain.

abilities.name: Pestilent Miasma
abilities.description: Any creature engaged with Rotigus at the start of its turn must roll 7d6. For each Effect rolled, they suffer 1 Mortal Wound.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 5 Terror Test.

abilities.name: Streams of Brackish Filth
abilities.stats: 14 +2 ED / AP -3 / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 3 / Flamer, Inflict (Poisoned 7)

abilities.name: Daemonic Manifestation

name: DAEMONETTE OF SLAANESH
description:
A Daemonette, also known as a "Maiden of Ecstasy," is a Lesser Daemon of Slaanesh, the Prince of Pleasure. Known as "Bringers of Joyous Degradation," "Harbingers of Endless Delights," and "Seekers of Decadence," Daemonettes are all these things and more.

In battle, Daemonettes are lithe, dexterous killers, whose claws can tear their opponents to shreds, or allure their mortal victims into their clutches. Daemonettes can gift their victims with a mixture of excruciatingly painful caresses and the most delicate and tender of killing strokes.

resilience.note: Melee: 8 / Ranged: 9 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 6, Athletics 11, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Persuasion 10, Weapon Skill 10

abilities.name: She Who Thirsts
abilities.description: This Threat may re-roll any dice which roll Failures on attacks and ED against targets of the AELDARI or DRUKHARI species.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Swift Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test. Then the Daemon makes a normal move.

abilities.name: Dance of Death
abilities.description: The Threat makes a Multi-Attack, reducing the DN penalty by 2.

abilities.name: The Endless Dance
abilities.description: When the Threat makes a Multi-Attack, it may spend 1 Ruin to reduce the DN penalty by 4, increases its Speed by +3, and may Fall Back as a free action so long as it is moving to engage another enemy.

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6.

name: SEEKER OF SLAANESH
description:
Seekers, also known as the Steeds of Slaanesh, are the daemonic mounts of Slaanesh. Hidden within the circles of Slaanesh's domain within the Realm of Chaos are great meadows of gold and silver that crest into rolling hills and idyllic dales. Here roam herds of Steeds of Slaanesh, running uninhibited across the iridescent plains.

A Steed of Slaanesh is a swift and powerful bipedal creature, with a serpentine body propelled on two long, muscular legs. The Steed's tongue can taste the desires of mortals, and so swollen are their sensoriums that they can trace fear, joy and lust on the breeze from a kilometre away.

resilience.note: Melee: 9 / Ranged: 10 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 6, Athletics 11, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Survival 10

abilities.name: She Who Thirsts

abilities.name: Cavalry
abilities.description: A Seeker is ridden by a Daemonette. The Seeker and rider take a single shared turn in combat, with one set of actions between them. The rider may be targeted separately with a Called Shot, requiring +2 DN.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Swift Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test. Then the Daemon makes a normal move.

abilities.name: Unholy Speed
abilities.description: When a Seeker makes a Charge action, it increases its Speed by +2.

abilities.name: The Endless Dance
abilities.description: When the Threat makes a Multi-Attack, it may spend 1 Ruin to reduce the DN penalty by 4, increases its Speed by +3, and may Fall Back as a free action so long as it is moving to engage another enemy.

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6.

name: FIEND OF SLAANESH
description:
A Fiend of Slaanesh is a Daemonic Beast of Slaanesh. Also known as "Harbingers of Deadly Fragrance" and the "Rams of Slaanesh," Fiends of Slaanesh appear as an unholy mixture of creatures, chimerical beings from Warp-induced nightmares given physical shape.

Fiends exude an unnatural soporific musk, a heady fragrance that attracts and immobilises their prey. As a mortal succumbs to the pervasive sweet state of euphoria, their limbs grow heavy and their minds drift dreamily elsewhere. It is then that Fiends close, and the daemon's razor-sharp claws sweep down and rend its unresisting victim apart.

resilience.note: Melee: 10 / Ranged: 11 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 6, Athletics 11, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Survival 10, Weapon Skill 12

abilities.name: Soporific Musk
abilities.description: Any non-SLAANESH creature who begins their turn within 3m of a Fiend of Slaanesh suffers the Hindered (2) condition until the start of their next turn.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6.

name: TORMENTBRINGER
description: Tormentbringers who ride the many and varied Chariots of Slaanesh, are Daemonettes of ghastly beauty and ecstatic cruelty. Should a foe even be able to fire upon the Herald's mount, they would have little chance of landing a hit, as the Tormentbringers ride these hurtling and swerving vehicles with joyous abandon.

name: TRANCEWEAVER
description: Tranceweavers are raw manifestations of sensory excess and wilful cruelty. These Daemonettes flow across the battlefield with inhuman grace, keening gleeful war cries as they exhort their fellows to greater acts of sadistic bliss-giving and lay enemies low with the razor caress of their talons.

name: INFERNAL ENRAPTURESS
description: An Infernal Enrapturess, also called a "Muse of Agony," a "Bringer of Discord" and a "Herald of the Choir Infernal," are Heralds of Slaanesh who play harps made from their victims' bodies. Playing the harp during battles allows an Enrapturess to bolster the summoning of her brethren and send out sonic waves that shred her enemies.

abilities.description: While an enemy PSYKER is within 24m of this Threat, they suffer a complication on Psychic Mastery tests for each Wrath die which rolls 1, 2, or 3.

name: KEEPER OF SECRETS
description:
The loathsome yet beguiling entity of the Warp known as a Keeper of Secrets is a Greater Daemon of Slaanesh, the Chaos God of amoral pleasure. The appearance of a Keeper of Secrets can vary wildly. Each of these huge and powerful creatures are created by the capricious whims of its master.

Embodiments of the alluring power of pleasure, the very presence of a Keeper of Secrets is enough to bring even the most stalwart warrior to their knees in anguish and ecstasy.

resilience.note: Melee: 16 / Ranged: 17 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

abilities.name: Dark Temptations
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to make a Persuasion Interaction Attack as a Ruin Action. Any target affected must also pass a DN6 Corruption Test.

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 12d6.

name: THE MASQUE OF SLAANESH
description:
The Masque of Slaanesh is the most infamous Daemonette and Herald of Slaanesh to have ever plagued the sentient creatures of the galaxy. Once Slaanesh's favoured dancer and chief handmaiden, she was cast out by her master, and cursed to forever dance through the Materium and Immaterium alike.

The Masque has turned this curse into a potent weapon, forcing any being she manages to seduce with her hypnotic dance to join her performance until the unfortunate soul drops dead from exhaustion.

resilience.note: Daemonic Aura: *4 AR (both Melee and Ranged: 9)

name: SHALAXI HELBANE
description:
Shalaxi Helbane, called the "Monarch of the Hunt," is a Keeper of Secrets, a Greater Daemon of Slaanesh. Helbane is a peerless hunter whose favoured prey is nothing less than the greatest champions of the other Dark Gods.

Shalaxi is the embodiment of Slaanesh's eternal, furious feud with the Blood God, Khorne, and was in many ways created by Slaanesh from its own essence to slay Bloodthirsters with contemptuous ease.

abilities.description: When this Threat kills an enemy, the GM gains 1 Ruin.

abilities.name: Shining Aegis (Option)
abilities.description: The Threat's Defence and Resilience are both increased by +1.

abilities.name: Dark Temptations
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to make a Persuasion Interaction Attack as a Ruin Action. Any target affected must also pass a DN6 Corruption Test.

abilities.name: Monarch of the Hunt
abilities.description: When an enemy takes the Charge action and concludes their move within 6 metres of Shalaxi Helbane, it may spend 1 Ruin as a Reflexive Action to move up to its Speed towards that enemy to engage them and make a melee attack before the enemy makes their attack. It is considered to be charging.

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 12d6. Cloak of Constriction: Re-roll any dice which roll 1 on the Daemon's Determination rolls.

name: PINK HORROR
description:
The Lesser Daemons called Horrors are often used as daemonic slaves by the Greater Daemons called Lords of Change. They do not have static material bodies, sometimes taking on a discernible form, at others blurring into a frantic mass of colour.

Pink Horrors are identified by their luminescent pink skin and their high-pitched squeals of laughter. They whirl about in a frantic and barely controlled ecstasy, all the while giggling insanely. Flashes of energy dart from the Pink Horrors' fingertips as they leap across the battlefield.

When wounded, a Pink Horror exhales a final lunatic cackle before rapidly decomposing into an ectoplasmic blob, which swiftly divides into two Blue Horrors.

resilience.note: Melee: 7 / Ranged: 10 (Daemonic Aura: *2 AR Melee, *5 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Psychic Mastery 9

abilities.name: Flames of Tzeentch
abilities.description: The Threat uses Psychic Mastery instead of Ballistic Skill when making ranged attacks.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Coruscating Flames
abilities.stats: 10 +1 ED / AP -1 / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 2 / Assault, Corrupting, Inflict (On Fire)

abilities.name: Psychic Minions
abilities.description: The Pink Horror attempts to use Psyniscience.

abilities.name: Minions of Magic
abilities.description: When the Threat makes a ranged attack, it gains the Rending (3) quality.

abilities.name: Exploding Horrors
abilities.description: When this Threat is defeated, roll 1d6: if an Icon is rolled, two Blue Horrors appear in its place. If an Exalted Icon is rolled, an Engaged enemy suffers 1 Mortal Wound, and then two Blue Horrors appear.

name: BLUE HORROR
description:
Blue Horrors are diminutive replicas of their parent Daemon, though their temperament is quite different. They are sullen and malicious, like evil-tempered children, and wear perpetual scowls as they sneer and grumble their way through a battle.

Once spawned, Blue Horrors swiftly re-join their fellows, adding a deeper whining note to the incessant chortling of the group as they attempt to grapple with enemies and squeeze the life from them.

resilience.note: Melee: 6 / Ranged: 8 (Daemonic Aura: *2 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 4, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Psychic Mastery 7

abilities.name: Flames of Tzeentch
abilities.description: The Threat uses Psychic Mastery instead of Ballistic Skill when making ranged attacks.

abilities.name: Exploding Horrors

name: BRIMSTONE HORROR
description:
Just as a dying Pink Horror splits into two lesser incarnations, a slain Blue Horror will split once more into a pair of Brimstone Horrors. Named for a stench so strong it offends even other Daemons, these diminutive Warp creatures may look bright and whimsical, but they are in truth spiteful and vindictive.

To make themselves feel better, they burn everything they come across by hurling magical flame.

resilience.note: Melee: 6 / Ranged: 7 (Daemonic Aura: *2 AR Melee, *3 AR Ranged)

name: FLAMER OF TZEENTCH
description:
A Flamer, also called the "Pyrodaemons of Tzeentch," are Lesser Daemons of Tzeentch. Flamers are amongst the strangest and most disturbing of all Tzeentch's Daemons. The body of a Flamer is a headless conical torso with two long arms terminating in fingerless stumps continuously belching acrid and sulphuric smoke.

In spite of their unnatural, awkward appearance, Flamers are agile creatures. They move by bumping and hopping around, leaping high in the air in a disturbing and gravity-defying fashion.

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6.

name: EXALTED FLAMER OF TZEENTCH
description:
Exalted Flamers are champions of their kind and exude Warp energies and change-magic from every pore of their fungoid flesh. They are far more capable of independent thought than their lesser kin, and often lead other Flamers or Horrors into battle.

The fires of Tzeentch manifested by these beings are more powerful and varied than those of typical Flamers.

name: SCREAMER OF TZEENTCH
description:
A Screamer of Tzeentch or Sky-shark, is a daemonic beast of Tzeentch who resembles the mythical rays and skates that once inhabited the oceans of ancient Terra. They soar through the skies of the Warp in predatory groups in a constant search for souls to devour and deliver to their master.

As they fly, Screamers leave behind contrails of multi-coloured sparks, and they emit the piercing, high-frequency whine that gives these creatures their name.

resilience.note: Melee: 8 / Ranged: 11 (Daemonic Aura: *2 AR Melee, *5 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 4), Weapon Skill 8

abilities.description: As a Full Action, the Screamer makes a Charge move, and then immediately Falls Back from engagement range with any remaining movement.

abilities.name: Rider of the Immaterial Winds
abilities.description: As a Full Action, the Screamer vanishes into the Warp, and reappears anywhere within 100m and more than 9m from an enemy.

name: DISC OF TZEENTCH
description: Among the devotees of the Master of Magic, there are few possessions more prized than the daemonic mount crafted from a Screamer, known as a Disc of Tzeentch. An amalgam of daemonic flesh, flashing blades, and burnished metal, a powerful Chaos Sorcerer mounted on a Disc is lethally fast and manoeuvrable.

name: CHANGECASTER
description:
The most intelligent, devious and skilled amongst the Pink Horrors are chosen by the Changer of Ways to lead the hosts of his daemonic legions. So elevated, they radiate the eldritch might of their master, and uniquely amongst Horror-kind, they are able to reform their two halves should they be dealt a mortal blow.

The most common type of Herald is the Changecaster, named for the mutating magics they wield.

description: Those Tzeentch Heralds that acquire a Burning Chariot of Tzeentch -- usually through trickery -- are known as Fateskimmers. These Daemons will swoop and dive across the battlefield, cackling madly as they unleash fearsome sorceries from their lofty perches before smashing their bizarre contraption into the enemy lines.

description: The title of Fluxmaster is borne by those Heralds who ride a Disc of Tzeentch, so named because as they fly across the battlefields at great speed, reality reshapes itself in their wake. They are often used as messengers and outriders within the Scintillating Legions.

name: LORD OF CHANGE
description:
A Lord of Change, also called a "Supreme Mutator," and one of the "Eyes of Tzeentch," is an insidious Greater Daemon of Tzeentch. Lords of Change are creatures born from some impossible nightmare, immense bird-like Daemons with shimmering skin, wicked curved beaks and multi-coloured, spectrum-shattering wings.

Treachery, deceit, capriciousness: these are the hallmarks of the Lords of Change. Tzeentch's greatest servants weave scheme upon scheme, a dense tangle of intermingling threads, so convoluted and eon-spanning that none can grasp their true purpose.

skills: Default 12, Awareness 15 (Passive 8), Leadership 14, Psychic Mastery 16, Scholar 15

name: THE BLUE SCRIBES
description: The Blue Scribes, also known as the "Azure Arcanologists," the "Wandering Wizardkin" and "Tzeentch's Quaestors," are a pair of Blue Horrors named P'tarix and Xirat'p, created by their master Tzeentch to travel throughout the dimensions of reality to find and record every known spell and scrap of forbidden knowledge.

resilience.note: Melee: 10 / Ranged: 12 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *5 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 8, Awareness 11 (Passive 5), Psychic Mastery 11, Scholar 11

abilities.name: Dualistic Entity
abilities.description: Despite being two beings, P'tarix and Xirat'p function as a single character in game terms.

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 6 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Mounted
abilities.description: The Blue Scribes are mounted upon a Disc of Tzeentch.

abilities.name: P'tarix's Sorcerous Syphon
abilities.description: An enemy PSYKER within 12m of The Blue Scribes must add +2 to the DN of any Psychic Power they attempt to activate. Further, if they fail to activate that power, that power has been Syphoned, and cannot be used again by that PSYKER until they take a Respite or Regroup.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Xirat'p's Sorcerous Barrage
abilities.description: The Blue Scribes may attempt to activate a psychic power they know. They may activate any one power from the Pandaemoniac discipline, or any power which had been Syphoned since The Blue Scribes' previous turn.

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6. Incorporeal Form: This Threat may re-roll any dice that roll 1s when rolling Determination.

name: THE CHANGELING
description:
The Changeling, also known as the "Trickster of Tzeentch," is a daemonic Horror of Tzeentch who epitomises the Lord of Change's love of sowing discord and distrust, and his perverse sense of humour.

Tzeentch long ago bestowed upon the Changeling a doppelganger's ability to assume any shape, from that of the tiniest insect to the largest Greater Daemon. The only shapes that the Changeling cannot assume is that of Tzeentch and his own, for he has long forgotten his original form.

resilience.note: Melee: 13 / Ranged: 15 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *5 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 9, Awareness 11 (Passive 5), Deception 18, Psychic Mastery 11

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 6 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Formless Horror
abilities.description: When engaged with one or more enemies, the Changeling can select a single one of those enemies, and use their Strength, Defence, and Skills in place of its own.

abilities.name: Herald of Tzeentch
abilities.description: While friendly TZEENTCH DAEMON Troops are within 6m, it may re-roll any ED which roll a 1.

abilities.name: Warp Tether
abilities.description: Friendly TZEENTCH DAEMONs within 12m may use The Changeling's Resolve instead of their own.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Trickster's Staff
abilities.description: Each time the bearer makes an attack, select one melee weapon of an enemy engaged with The Changeling. Use that weapon's profile for the attack.

abilities.name: Daemonic Manifestation
abilities.description: The Changeling may spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action to summon 1d3 Pink Horrors.

abilities.name: Shapeshifter
abilities.description: As a simple action, The Changeling can assume the appearance of any other creature. It requires an Awareness or Insight test opposed by The Changeling's Deception test in order to see through this guise. The Changeling may create a Stealth Score using a Deception Test rather than a Stealth Test.

abilities.name: Pandaemoniac
abilities.description: The Changeling may attempt to activate any psychic power it knows. It knows Smite, Psyniscience, Deny the Witch, and two powers from the Pandaemoniac discipline.

abilities.name: Warp Portal
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin as a Ruin Action for The Changeling to vanish and reappear anywhere on the battlefield within 100m but more than 9m from an enemy.

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 9d6.

name: KAIROS FATEWEAVER
description:
Kairos Fateweaver, also known simply as Fateweaver and the Oracle of Tzeentch, is a two-headed Lord of Change, a Greater Daemon of Tzeentch. Fateweaver is the mightiest of the Lords of Change and is blessed with access to all of Tzeentch's knowledge concerning the nature of fate and destiny.

Fateweaver has gained infallible knowledge of both the past and the future but cannot see what will occur in the present. One of Kairos' two heads will always answer with the truth. Unfortunately, the other head simultaneously responds with a contradictory answer.

resilience.note: Melee: 16 / Ranged: 18 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *5 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 12, Awareness 15 (Passive 8), Leadership 14, Psychic Mastery 16, Scholar 15

abilities.name: Avatar of Prophecy
abilities.description: At the start of each of Kairos' turns, add 1d3 to Ruin.

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 9 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Lord of Tzeentch
abilities.description: While friendly TZEENTCH DAEMON Troops are within 6m, they may re-roll any die which rolls a 1 on any attack they attempt.

abilities.name: Monstrous Creature
abilities.description: This Threat is immune to the Fear, Terror, Pinned, and Staggered conditions.

abilities.name: Mastery of Magic
abilities.description: The Threat may re-roll any dice which roll a 1 on Psychic Mastery tests.

abilities.name: Flames of Tzeentch
abilities.description: The Threat uses Psychic Mastery instead of Ballistic Skill when making ranged attacks.

abilities.name: The Two Heads of Fate
abilities.description: Kairos Fateweaver receives two turns in each round.

abilities.name: One Head Looks Forward
abilities.description: Kairos may borrow power from the near future: whenever Kairos spends Ruin, it may spend from the future, gaining the effects immediately. On the following round, reduce the number of available points of Ruin by one for each "future" point spent.

abilities.name: One Head Looks Back
abilities.description: Kairos may shape the present with past events. On any skill test, when Kairos shifts one or more Exalted Icons, it may take one of them and save it for future use. On a test in any subsequent round, Kairos may use one or more of those saved Exalted Icons, changing a die in that test to a 6. Kairos may only save 9 Exalted Icons in this way.

abilities.name: Tyrant of the Warp
abilities.description: Kairos never suffers Perils of the Warp, and may re-roll any dice which roll 1s on Determination rolls against damage from Psychic powers.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 5 Terror Test.

abilities.name: Staff of Tomorrow
abilities.stats: 17 +5 ED / AP -3 / Range 2 [M] / Brutal, Corrupting, Force, Warp Weapon

abilities.name: Daemonic Manifestation
abilities.description: Kairos may spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action to summon a mob of 10 Pink Horrors or a mob of 3 Flamers of Tzeentch, or a mob of 3 Screamers of Tzeentch.

abilities.name: Pandaemoniac
abilities.description: Kairos may attempt to activate any psychic power it knows. It knows Smite, Psyniscience, Deny the Witch, and all powers from the Pandaemoniac discipline.

abilities.name: Magical Boon
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to use any Pandaemoniac Discipline psychic power, Smite, or Deny the Witch as a Ruin Action.

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 12d6.

name: DAEMON PRINCE
description:
A Daemon Prince is a mortal Champion of Chaos who has been elevated to daemonhood as a reward for their actions on the behalf of one of the major Chaos Gods or by the will of Chaos Undivided. Daemon Princes have chosen to trade their souls for the god-like power and immortality of a creature of the Warp.

A Daemon Prince is a living extension of the force of Chaos. To ascend to the rank of Daemon Prince is the ultimate goal of the most powerful Champions of Chaos, as it gives them immortality and power beyond the reckoning of mortals.

resilience.note: Melee: 12 / Ranged: 13 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 10, Awareness 11 (Passive 6), Leadership 13, Weapon Skill 13

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 8 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: Prince of Chaos
abilities.description: While friendly [MARK OF CHAOS] DAEMON Troops are within 6m, they may re-roll any die which rolls a 1 on any attack they attempt.

abilities.name: Monstrous Creature
abilities.description: This Threat is immune to the Fear, Terror, Pinned, and Staggered conditions.

abilities.name: Daemonic Allegiance
abilities.description: The Daemon Prince must replace its [MARK OF CHAOS] keyword with KHORNE, NURGLE, TZEENTCH, or SLAANESH. See stat block for allegiance-specific bonuses: KHORNE (+2 S, +2 WS), NURGLE (+2 T, free Determination, one Warprot power), SLAANESH (+2 I, +2 Speed, one Soulstain power), TZEENTCH (+2 Wil, +2 Psychic Mastery, two Pandaemoniac powers).

abilities.name: Touched by the Warp
abilities.description: If the Daemon Prince does not have the KHORNE keyword, it gains the PSYKER keyword and a Psychic Mastery skill of 13, and knows the Smite, Psyniscience, and Deny the Witch powers, plus any determined by its [MARK OF CHAOS].

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 5 Terror Test.

abilities.name: Daemonic Manifestation
abilities.description: The Daemon Prince may spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action to summon a mob of 10 [MARK OF CHAOS] LESSER DAEMONS.

abilities.name: Psyker
abilities.description: The Daemon Prince may attempt to activate any psychic power it knows.

abilities.name: Malefic Talons (Paired Option)
abilities.description: If an extra set of Malefic Talons are selected, they gain the Paired quality. The Daemon Prince may have Wings, which changes its Speed to 12 (Fly).

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 8d6.

name: CHAOS FURIES
description:
A Fury, also known as a Crow of Chaos, is a winged, gargoyle-like Daemonic Beast of Chaos Undivided formed from scraps of Warp energy and emotion that coalesce together. Furies are amongst the lowliest denizens of the Realm of Chaos, making their home in the Formless Wastes that lie outside the domains of the Ruinous Powers.

It is said that Furies are actually created from the souls of those Humans and other sentient beings who selfishly served Chaos for their own personal gain, rather than devoting themselves heart and soul to a single Chaos God. They are doomed to spend eternity in a grotesque, gargoyle-like state.

resilience.note: Melee: 8 / Ranged: 9 (Daemonic Aura: *3 AR Melee, *4 AR Ranged)

skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Weapon Skill 7

abilities.name: Mark of Chaos

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura

abilities.name: Prey on the Weak
abilities.description: This Threat inflicts +2ED damage to any enemy affected by Fear, Terror, or Pinning.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6.

name: BE'LAKOR, THE DARK MASTER
description:
Be'lakor, also called the "Dark Master" and the "First-Damned," is the first Daemon Prince ever raised up from mortality by combined will of the Ruinous Powers. Ancient beyond imagining, Be'lakor was the very first of his kind. Granted his dark apotheosis by the combined will of the Chaos Gods as Chaos Undivided, he was given a portion of each of their power.

Be'lakor's fate has ever been influenced by the endless struggle between the gods, as he is beholden to each of the Dark Gods equally. Nevertheless, Be'lakor remains a master of shadows, moving behind the veil of history to exert the will of the Chaos Gods upon the universe.
skills: Default 12, Awareness 15 (Passive 8), Deception 13, Psychic Mastery 13, Weapon Skill 13

abilities.name: Champion
abilities.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 8 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.description: See common Daemonic Legion rules.

abilities.name: The Dark Master

abilities.name: Monstrous Creature

abilities.name: Shadow Form
abilities.description: Each time an attack is made against Be'lakor, the attacker cannot re-roll any dice on the attack roll, or any ED.

abilities.name: Lord of Torment
abilities.description: Enemies within 6m of Be'lakor reduce their Resolve and Conviction by 1, to a minimum of 1.

abilities.stats: 21 +6 ED / AP -4 / Range 3 (M) / Enemies cannot roll Determination against the Blade of Shadows (Pierce).

determination: Daemonic Aura. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 11d6. Shadow Form: Be'lakor may re-roll any dice that roll 1 when he rolls Determination.

name: KABALITE WARRIOR
description:
The warriors of the Drukhari Kabals lie at the heart of every Drukhari strike force, pirate fleet and slave raider assault. They are the cruellest members of their caste, hungry for power over their fellows and thirsty to taste the suffering of others.
Each warrior will have forged a fearsome reputation for himself in the war-torn halls of High Commorragh and has proven himself in multiple battles to be a merciless combatant. The more vicious and ruthless a warrior is, the better his chances for advancement within the Kabal.
Only a born killer can thrive within the backstabbing halls of the Dark City and only a chosen few of true skill and utter cruelty are selected by the Kabal leadership to enjoy the thrill and privilege of striking at the worlds of realspace and returning with living souls, the screaming booty that every Kabal requires for its survival.
Kabalite Warriors are typically equipped with sophisticated flexible armour like the mesh warsuits used by their Asuryani kin, and with slender, deadly splinter rifles that unleash hails of envenomed crystalline shards.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Intimidation 6, Ballistic Skill 6, Weapon Skill 6

abilities.name: Splinter Rifle
abilities.stats: 5 +2ED / AP - / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Fleshbane, Rapid Fire (2)

abilities.name: Never Stationary

abilities.name: Ruinous Speed
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. This Threat makes a Charge, adding +Tier to its Speed.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

name: SYBARITE
description:
Each band of Kabalite Warriors is led by a Sybarite, who is typically the most veteran and experienced among their number.
Sybarites are not only veteran raiders of realspace, but also the Kabalites who have the honour and duty of initiating each new warrior into the always-brutal mysteries of their Kabal.
While certainly no sybarite, or any Drukhari for that matter, can claim the loyalty of their underlings, the sybarites are obeyed for the simple reason that they are the masters of the craft of war and their orders when followed are more likely to lead to success in the raid..and survival.
A Sybarite may lead a group of Kabalite Warriors in battle, using the same statistics as a Kabalite Warrior with the following adjustments.

name: KABALITE TRUEBORN
description:
Naturally born Drukhari are rare, due to the long gestation period of the Aeldari infant. The ones that are naturally birthed from their mothers' wombs, known as Trueborn, are privileged in Drukhari society because of the circumstances of their birth.
As such, they are arrogant and see themselves as far better than the majority of Drukhari, who are born in amniotic gestation tubes and whom the Trueborn derisively call the Halfborn.
Due to this prejudice, the Trueborn often gather only in squads of other Trueborn within the Drukhari Kabals and serve as the elite warriors that escort their Kabal's Archon into battle and serve as their most elite unit of warriors.
The Trueborn are an elite group that excludes any "Halfborn" Drukhari birthed in an amniotic tube from their company. Led by an officer called a Dracon, these hardened killers carry a wide assortment of expensive and deadly weapons wherever they go, supposedly to better protect the life of their Archon but in truth only to better inflict more pain and death.
Kabalite Trueborn may be represented using the same statistics as Kabalite Warriors, with the following adjustments.

name: KABALITE AGENT
description:
Archons are the oft-disputed rulers of the Drukhari Kabals, surrounded by exotic courtiers and elite attendants. When these cartel-masters need something done right, they assemble a squad of expert agents--their Hand--armed with an exotic arsenal of macabre materiel to aid the hunt.
Well equipped and with murderous talents honed by survival in Commorragh, Hand of the Archon teams are malevolent enforcers of their master's will, carrying out the most vital tasks. Any prey they cannot painfully cut down with their splinter rifles, they slice apart with graceful sweeps of their numerous blades.

The owner can see, hear, etc., through the Razorwing's senses, and give instant mental commands, so long as the Razorwing is within a number of kilometres equal to the owner's Willpower.

name: ARCHON
description:
An Archon is the leader of a Drukhari Kabal, the organisation that serves as the heart of the standard Drukhari raiding force as well as the primary political unit within the Dark City. The Archons of the Drukhari Kabals are the true lords of Commorragh. They sit at the apex of the Drukhari hierarchy that controls the Dark City and the Labyrinthine Realm of the Drukhari portion of the Webway.
Each wields enough political influence to collapse portions of realspace into the Warp, stall the progress of an Imperial Crusade or take the population of entire worlds as slaves.
The overlord of a Kabal is always a potent foe on the battlefield, but they have attained his position not merely through martial prowess in the arts of war and violence but through consistently emerging as the victor in the deadliest game of all: the byzantine intrigues that govern all things in the heart of the Dark City, sometimes known as the thyllian ai-kelethril, or "path of shards." Only the most ingenious survive long enough to kill their way to the top.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Intimidation 11, Leadership 10, Weapon Skill 12

abilities.name: Dread Slayer
abilities.description: When the Archon scores a Wrath Critical on an attack, it may immediately make an Intimidation Interaction Attack.

abilities.name: Soul Trap
abilities.description: If an Archon kills a character, it may spend 1 Ruin to capture that character's soul, adding +2 to Strength and +2 to Weapon Skill for the remainder of the scene.

abilities.name: Deathless Vendetta
abilities.description: When this Threat dies, the GM gains 2 Ruin.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.
