bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Overlord
bonuses.description: Allied threats with the [KABAL] or INCUBI keywords within 12 metres may re-roll rolls of 1 on all attacks.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

bonuses.name: Shadow Field
bonuses.description: The Archon has two separate values for Resilience and Determination. At the start of a scene, use the first of these two values, representing the Archon's Shadow Field. If, after rolling Determination, the Archon suffers any damage, the Shadow Field fails, and the Archon uses the second of its Resilience and Determination values for the remainder of the scene. Second Resilience: 8 (Kabalite Armour: 4 AR). Second Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 3d6.

determination:
Shadow Field: Roll 9d6; this does not cost Shock or Ruin and may cancel Mortal Wounds.
Spend 1 Ruin to roll 3d6.

name: LHAMAEAN
description:
A Lhamaean is a female Drukhari warrior who is a member of the Sisterhood of Lhilitu and devotes herself to the study of poisons, drugs, toxins, and other methods to kill with stealth and misdirection. Many of the greatest and most powerful Archons who have warred against the Imperium were accompanied by these deadly female warriors.
The Lhamaeans revere the mysterious figure known as Shaimesh, Father of Poisons. Such is the Sisterhood's mastery that they can alter the poisons of others to enhance their effect, intuiting how best to maximise a weapon's potency with a glance.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Intimidation 7, Medicae 8, Tech 8

abilities.name: Deadly Venom
abilities.description: If a Lhamaean rolls a Wrath critical on a melee attack, the target suffers 1d3 Mortal Wounds, if the target is not a VEHICLE.

abilities.name: Toxic Artist
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. The Lhamaean attempts a Tech Interaction Attack against any creature currently suffering from the Poisoned condition, regardless of range.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

bonuses.name: Toxin Crafter
bonuses.description: While a friendly Archon or Kabalite Trueborn Threat is within 6m, and make an attack with a Fleshbane weapon, each die they shift inflicts 1 mortal wound on the target.

name: MEDUSAE
description:
A Medusae is an invertebrate, alien parasitic organism that resides within the Aeldari Webway. These highly empathic parasites look like a collection of brains and spinal cords one atop another, and they float through the Aether like jellyfish, feeding on the daydreams and nightmares of mortals. Medusae can latch onto a host that intrudes into their realm, absorbing their emotions directly and providing a means of motive power in realspace.
Though meeting the gaze of a Medusae's host can cause instant emotional haemorrhaging, these hybrid creatures are highly valuable in the Drukhari realm of Commorragh, for they absorb and store extreme sensations. These visored slave-beings are utilised by Archons to record the roiling emotions of the battlefield.
Consuming one of the Medusae's brain-fruit brings back all the vivid and anarchic emotions of a raid as if they were happening then and there.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 8, Intimidation 7, Insight 10

abilities.name: Eyeburst
abilities.stats: 10 +1ED / AP -2 / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 0 / Agonising, Blast (4), Pistol

abilities.name: Savoured Experience
abilities.description: If a Medusae rolls a Wrath critical on any test, its experiences of the battle produce one additional brain-fruit (see Brain-Fruit bonus).

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

bonuses.name: Brain-Fruit
bonuses.description: A DRUKHARI may take and consume a brain-fruit from a Medusae as a simple action. The vivid memories contained within the fruit removes all Shock suffered. The Medusae begins each scene with 1d3-1 brain-fruit.

name: SSLYTH
description:
The Sslyth are a sentient xenos race of reptilian creatures with a snake-like lower body and vaguely humanoid torso, though they sport multiple arms and a head more serpentine than human.
As true Drukhari make rather dubious bodyguards due to their treacherous nature, instead, Archons employ these more reliable alien mercenaries.
These four-armed, serpentine monstrosities hail from a world long lost to the caress of She Who Thirsts, yet their short-sighted and self-indulgent nature makes them safe enough for the Drukhari to exploit.
All but inured to physical pain, and happy to be paid in slaves and sensory gratification, these alien warriors make excellent, if dull-witted bodyguards.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 8, Intimidation 7, Weapon Skill 9

bonuses.name: Cold-Blooded Bodyguard
bonuses.description: When an attack targets an Archon within 6m, this Threat may spend 1 Ruin and use its Reflexive Action to become the target instead. The Threat rolls Determination against that attack without spending additional Ruin.

bonuses.name: Second Strike
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

determination: Insensible to Pain: You do not need to spend Ruin to roll Determination for this Threat. Roll 6d6. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of converted to Shock.

name: UR-GHUL
description:
The Ur-Ghul is a lanky, carnivorous, humanoid xenos that is a superlative tracker and hunter. They are native to the labyrinthine ziggurats of the Drukhari city of Shaa-Dom, a satellite realm of the Dark City of Commorragh in the Webway. Their savage nature makes them a popular addition to the courts of many Dark Eldar Archons.
An Ur-Ghul is a very efficient hunter despite its lack of any discernible vision senses, able to track its quarry for kilometres using an easy looping gait that covers long distances with low effort. Once it is ready, the Ur-Ghul's speed is unnatural. It rapidly becomes a fury of claws and teeth as it tears its prey into gobbets of flesh.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Survival 10, Weapon Skill 10

abilities.name: Tracker
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin as a Reflexive Reaction when an enemy with a Stealth Score finishes a move within 25m. That creature's Stealth Score is reduced by 1d3+1. The Ur-Ghul may then make a normal move towards that enemy.

bonuses.name: Ferocious Charge
bonuses.description: When the Ur-Ghul charges, it adds +4 bonus dice to the attack.

determination: Insensible to Pain: You do not need to spend Ruin to roll Determination for this Threat. Roll 6d6. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of converted to Shock.

name: WYCH
description:
The Wych Cults, or Hekatarii, of Commorragh are second in prestige in Drukhari society only to the Kabals that sponsor them. The Drukhari thrive upon expert displays of bloodletting, and in the pursuit of murder the Wyches are talented Aeldari indeed.
Each Wych Cult is a thousands-strong organisation of gladiators that put on nightly displays of the most incredible violence, not only for the edification of the masses, but also for their literal sustenance.
Most Hekatarii are female, for they are more often able to attain the pinnacle of poise and grace their craft demands.
skills: Default 4, Athletics 6, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Intimidation 6, Weapon Skill 6

abilities.name: Combat Drugs
abilities.description: This Threat chooses which Combat Drugs they are using and then makes a normal move.

abilities.name: No Method of Death Beyond Our Grasp
abilities.description: This Threat may use any weapon from the Execution Force armoury, chosen at the start of each scene.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Dual Wield
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

bonuses.name: No Escape
bonuses.description: Enemies engaged with this Threat attempting to Fall Back must pass an Agility test (DN 2 + Double Tier). If they fail, they cannot Fall Back this turn.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: HEKATRIX BLOODBRIDES
description:
Each squad of Drukhari Wyches is led by a more skilled Wych known as a Hekatrix, who in her turn reports to the Wych Cult's ruling Succubus. It is common for a Succubus to gather the most talented and skilled of her Hekatrix handmaidens into a clique of elite murderesses, led by the most skilled Hekatrix in the cult, who holds the rank of Syren.
These cliques, whose members are known as Hekatrix Bloodbrides, are usually plagued by often intense rivalries for the Succubus' favour. When combat begins, however, Bloodbrides become an unstoppable force, ritually anointing themselves with the blood they spill from the foe as a foul testament to their own dark prowess in the arts of death, pain, and terror.
Hekatrix Bloodbrides may be represented using the same statistics as Wyches, with the following adjustments.
skills: Default 6, Athletics 8, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Intimidation 7, Leadership 7, Weapon Skill 8

abilities.name: Combat Drugs
abilities.description: This Threat chooses which Combat Drugs they are using and then makes a normal move.

abilities.name: No Method of Death Beyond Our Grasp
abilities.description: This Threat may use any weapon from the Execution Force armoury, chosen at the start of each scene.

bonuses.name: Deadly Grace
bonuses.description: When a Hekatrix Bloodbride makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 3 (i.e., from -1 to -4) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack. This replaces the normal Blade Artist ability.

bonuses.name: Ascendant Disdain
bonuses.description: Hekatrix Bloodbrides may re-roll all dice on Resolve Tests.

bonuses.name: Dual Wield
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

bonuses.name: No Escape
bonuses.description: Enemies engaged with this Threat attempting to Fall Back must pass an Agility test (DN 2 + Double Tier). If they fail, they cannot Fall Back this turn.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: SPECIALIST WYCHES
description:
Many Wyches employ specialised fighting styles, utilising elaborate and unusual weapons. Each group of Wyches is only likely to have one of each such specialist.
Wyches of any kind may use one of the following fighting styles, replacing their normal weapons with that style's listed weapons.
skills: Default 4, Athletics 6, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Intimidation 6, Weapon Skill 6

abilities.name: Combat Drugs
abilities.description: This Threat chooses which Combat Drugs they are using and then makes a normal move.

abilities.name: No Method of Death Beyond Our Grasp
abilities.description: This Threat may use any weapon from the Execution Force armoury, chosen at the start of each scene.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Dual Wield
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

bonuses.name: No Escape
bonuses.description: Enemies engaged with this Threat attempting to Fall Back must pass an Agility test (DN 2 + Double Tier). If they fail, they cannot Fall Back this turn.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: REAVER
description:
The Reavers of Commorragh are those Drukhari fascinated by bringing death to others at high speeds. They ride to war upon the most streamlined and pared-down of all Aeldari craft -- the Reaver Jetbike, the perfect fusion of motion and lethal power.
The Aeldari experience sensations and emotions to a far greater degree than any other sentient species and their psyches are given over too easily to obsession. Reavers, having first gotten a taste for high-speed violence during raids into realspace, are those Drukhari consumed with achieving the maximum-impact kill.
Reavers are mounted upon Reaver Jetbikes.
skills: Default 4, Athletics 6, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Intimidation 6, Pilot 7, Weapon Skill 6

abilities.name: Combat Drugs
abilities.description: This Threat chooses which Combat Drugs they are using and then makes a normal move.

abilities.name: Splinter Rifle (Vehicle)
abilities.stats: 5 +2ED / AP - / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Fleshbane, Rapid Fire (2)

abilities.name: Eviscerating Fly-By
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin when the Reaver flies within 2m of an enemy on their Reaver Jetbike. Against that enemy, the Reaver Jetbike's Bladevanes inflict one Mortal Wound for each Exalted Icon rolled on the ED.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Lethal Swiftness
bonuses.description: The Bladevanes on a Reaver Jetbike ridden by this Threat inflict +Tier ED damage.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

determination:
Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.
While riding a Reaver Jetbike, the Threat may spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6, even though you cannot normally roll Determination for vehicles.

name: HELLION
description:
A Hellion is a member of one of the vicious airborne skimmer gangs to be found in the Drukhari city of Commorragh. The most savage of these airborne horrors are the Hellions, gangs of feral Drukhari who descend upon their prey in a flurry of blades before soaring away, safely out of reach.
Hellions are Drukhari miscreants. Their numbers include aspirants not yet old enough to be chosen as Kabalite Warriors, those who have been exiled by their Archons and those who have rejected life in a Kabal in favour of one of continued autonomy, beholden to none.
Hellions enter combat upon Skyboards, single-pilot, anti-gravitic skimmers that are highly prized amongst the Hellions as symbols of their independence.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Intimidation 6, Pilot 6, Weapon Skill 6

abilities.name: Combat Drugs
abilities.description: This Threat chooses which Combat Drugs they are using and then makes a normal move.

abilities.name: Deadly Strike
abilities.description: When the Hellion rolls a Wrath Critical on a melee attack, it inflicts 1d3 Mortal Wounds and may immediately move up to half its Speed.

abilities.name: Eviscerating Flyby
abilities.description: This Threat makes a normal move and may make a melee attack against any enemy it passes within 2m of during the move.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Combat Drugs
bonuses.description: See Hekatarii Combat Drugs rules.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

name: BEASTMASTER
description:
The wild hunts Beastmasters stage in the arenas remain a popular favourite of the crowds. Although the Beastmasters are part of the Wych Cults, they keep themselves distant from the Wyches and are also predominantly male, unlike the mostly female Wyches.
Some suspect that Beastmasters have roots in shamanic traditions, as when entering battle they adorn themselves in totems and masks that echo the beasts under their control. In fact, their masks contain complex sonic emitters and pheromone traps that can partially control the beasts, although all Beastmasters, even unmasked, have a natural ability to dominate lower creatures.
Beastmasters will gladly accompany Dark Eldar raids into Realspace, driving their herds of beasts into a bloodlust using whips and lures as they hover safely above the frenzy upon modified skyboards.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Intimidation 8, Leadership 8, Pilot 7, Survival 8, Weapon Skill 7

abilities.name: Combat Drugs
abilities.description: This Threat chooses which Combat Drugs they are using and then makes a normal move.

abilities.name: Master's Lash
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin when a BEAST threat within 12m takes a Charge action. The selected BEAST, and others of the same type within 6m of it, add +Tier to their Speed.

bonuses.name: Beastmaster
bonuses.description: Creatures with the BEAST keyword within 12m may use the Beastmaster's Resolve as their own. They may also re-roll up to Tier dice on melee attacks.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Combat Drugs
bonuses.description: See Hekatarii Combat Drugs rules.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

name: CLAWED FIEND
description:
These semi-sentient monsters care nothing for civilisation or war, only for their animalistic instincts of consuming prey. They are hulking monsters of muscle and fur with incredible senses capable of perceiving multiple spectrums at once and are known to be at their most dangerous state after having been wounded as the scent of their own bleeding ichor sends them into a berserk fury that few warriors will be quick enough to escape.
Clawed Fiends are made use of by the Dark Eldar, as long ago the Webway Portal leading into the Donorian system was destroyed by the force of a Warp Storm, splitting the portal apart and allowing Clawed Fiends to enter and infest the adjacent Webway tunnels.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 7 (Passive 3), Intimidation 6, Survival 6, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: Berserk Fury
bonuses.description: The Threat gains the Frenzied condition when it suffers one or more wounds.

name: KHYMERAE
description:
Khymerae are Warp-beasts born from the stuff of a Daemon World. They coalesce around vivid nightmares into terrifying forms of long-fanged, many-eyed, sinewy cat-like beasts.
Dark Eldar Beastmasters enter dream-quests to hunt down Khymerae in the spirit realm and draw packs of them back into Realspace. They then enslave them as half-real nightmares that can wreak utter havoc upon a battlefield before fading away like mist.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Intimidation 6, Weapon Skill 8

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

determination: Daemonic: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock.

name: RAZORWING FLOCKS
description:
Razorwings are large birds of prey with a wingspan of nearly thirteen feet. They drift along on thermal currents until they have a prey in sight, at which point they dive with such speeds that escape is impossible.
Razorwings have an insatiable hunger for bone and are incredibly swift. They attack in flocks, surrounding their prey in a deadly hurricane of knife-like feathers and razor-sharp beaks that strip their victim's flesh from their bones. A well-trained Beastmaster's flock will then parade their kill for their master before finally tearing it apart in a savage feeding frenzy.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Weapon Skill 8

bonuses.name: Flyby
bonuses.description: The Threat never counts as being Engaged, and thus enemies cannot attempt Reflexive Attacks when the Threat moves away.

determination: Scattered Flock: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 1d6. Then the mob moves up to half its Speed and adds +2 to its Defence until the start of its next turn.

name: SUCCUBUS
description:
The Succubi are the ruling elite of the Dark Eldar Wych Cults. Extraordinarily beautiful and possessed of an elegant but deadly grace, they are born to the fury of battle and stride through its chaos surrounded by coteries of their lethal Wyches who seek out worthy alien opponents for their mistresses to kill. Every Succubus is famed across Commorragh for the precision and artistry of her kills.
The Succubi are collectively called the ynnitach in the Eldar Lexicon, the "brides of death." Competition among the Succubi is fierce, though any disputes between them are far more likely to be concluded through an artful decapitation or the twist of a poisoned blade than by the skilful political scheming preferred by the Archons.
skills: Default 8, Athletics 12, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Intimidation 10, Weapon Skill 12

abilities.name: Combat Drugs
abilities.description: This Threat chooses which Combat Drugs they are using and then makes a normal move.

abilities.name: Multi-Action
abilities.description: The Succubus may make an Athletics Interaction Attack and a melee attack without suffering the -2DN Multi-Action penalty.

abilities.name: Invigorating Slaughter
abilities.description: When the Succubus scores a Wrath Critical on a melee attack, she immediately regains 1d3+2 Shock and gains 1 additional Pain Token.

abilities.name: Lightning-Fast Reactions
abilities.description: This Threat may re-roll all failed dice when rolling Determination.

abilities.name: Deathless Vendetta
abilities.description: When this Threat dies, the GM gains 2 Ruin.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Brides of Death
bonuses.description: Allied Threats with the [CULT] keyword within 12m may re-roll all 1s on their damage rolls.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 4 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Dual Wield
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

bonuses.name: No Escape
bonuses.description: Enemies engaged with this Threat attempting to Fall Back must pass an Agility test (DN 2 + Double Tier). If they fail, they cannot Fall Back this turn.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

determination: Lightning Dodge: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Then, the Threat may move up to half its Speed in any direction.

name: WRACK
description:
A Wrack is a twisted biological creation of the Drukhari Haemonculi, individuals of that species dissected and refashioned into living instruments of torture.
They act as assistants and bodyguards to their fleshcrafting masters and are equipped with a range of cruel Drukhari weapons including razor-sharp blades, needles, poisons and even more exotic and disturbing instruments of pain and torment.
Each Wrack is an abhorrent example of their master's surgical craftsmanship, an individual cut apart and refashioned into a walking instrument of torture. Perhaps the most disturbing aspect of the Wracks is that they have chosen this nightmarish form voluntarily.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Medicae 6, Ballistic Skill 5, Weapon Skill 5

abilities.name: Flesh-crafted Horrors
abilities.description: Wracks may use Medicae to make Interaction Attacks. This is treated as if they were using Tech in all regards.

abilities.name: Resurgent Vigour
abilities.description: If this Threat rolls a Wrath critical on any Test, they may immediately heal 1d3 Wounds or gain 1 Pain Token.

abilities.name: Torturer's Craft
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin when you hit with a melee attack. This Threat may re-roll all failures when rolling for damage.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

determination: Insensible to Pain: You do not need to spend Ruin to roll Determination for this Threat. Roll 5d6. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of converted to Shock.

name: ACOTHYST
description:
Amongst the wracks there is a position known as Acothyst. This seems to be a position of authority amongst the wracks, perhaps equivalent to a captain or commander. These Acothysts are sometimes rewarded with unique Haemonculi weapons such as the Hexrifle.
An Acothyst may lead a group of Wracks in battle, using the same statistics as a Wrack with the following adjustments.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Leadership 8, Medicae 8, Ballistic Skill 7, Weapon Skill 7

abilities.name: Flesh-crafted Horrors
abilities.description: Wracks may use Medicae to make Interaction Attacks. This is treated as if they were using Tech in all regards.

abilities.name: Resurgent Vigour
abilities.description: If this Threat rolls a Wrath critical on any Test, they may immediately heal 1d3 Wounds or gain 1 Pain Token.

abilities.name: Torturer's Craft
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin when you hit with a melee attack. This Threat may re-roll all failures when rolling for damage.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 Personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

determination: Insensible to Pain: You do not need to spend Ruin to roll Determination for this Threat. Roll 5d6. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of converted to Shock.

name: HAEMOXYTES
description:
Highly prized by their masters, the Haemoxytes consider themselves to be the pinnacle of the fleshcrafting art. Grafted with a bewildering array of internal augmentations derived from both Aeldari gene-stock and that of other races, they exhibit enhanced abilities, and are often tasked with particularly vital duties by their masters.
Although they are viewed with disgust by other Drukhari, it is not unusual for a Wrack to viciously slay any rivals to secure a chance to become a Haemoxyte, earning a prestigious place among their masters' favoured creations.
Haemoxytes may be represented using the same statistics as Wracks, with the following adjustments.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Medicae 8, Ballistic Skill 7, Weapon Skill 7

abilities.name: Flesh-crafted Horrors
abilities.description: Wracks may use Medicae to make Interaction Attacks. This is treated as if they were using Tech in all regards.

abilities.name: Resurgent Vigour
abilities.description: If this Threat rolls a Wrath critical on any Test, they may immediately heal 1d3 Wounds or gain 1 Pain Token.

abilities.name: Torturer's Craft
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin when you hit with a melee attack. This Threat may re-roll all failures when rolling for damage.

bonuses.name: Augmented Resilience
bonuses.description: Haemoxytes have a Resilience of 10. Further, the first time each round a Haemoxyte rolls Determination, ignore all wounds inflicted and inflict no Shock.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

bonuses.name: Transgenic Disdain
bonuses.description: Haemoxytes may re-roll all dice on Resolve Tests.

determination: Insensible to Pain: You do not need to spend Ruin to roll Determination for this Threat. Roll 5d6. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of converted to Shock.

name: GROTESQUE
description:
A Grotesque is a hulking, monstrous Drukhari warrior creation of the Haemonculi gifted with incredible strength and potent melee weaponry. The Grotesques are horrors that the Haemonculi often use as shock assault troops to break enemy lines.
Unlike their fellow Haemonculi creations Wracks, none join the ranks of the Grotesques willingly. Most who undergo the long, excruciatingly painful process of transformation are captured alien slaves of Drukhari realspace raids or other Drukhari subjects who have displeased the Haemonculi or their Kabal's archon.
These musclebound horrors are gathered into loose cells and led into battle by their creator, their destructive capabilities thoroughly field-tested upon their master's chosen victims.
skills: Default 4, Athletics 8, Weapon Skill 7

abilities.name: Frightful Form
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Fear Test. Then, this Threat becomes Frenzied.

abilities.name: Resurgent Vigour
abilities.description: If this Threat rolls a Wrath critical on any Test, they may immediately heal 1d3 Wounds or gain 1 Pain Token.

abilities.name: Torturer's Craft
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin when you hit with a melee attack. This Threat may re-roll all failures when rolling for damage.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

determination: Insensible to Pain: You do not need to spend Ruin to roll Determination for this Threat. Roll 7d6. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of converted to Shock.

name: CRONOS PARASITE ENGINE
description:
The Cronos Parasite Engine is a Drukhari war construct and Engine of Pain. It resembles a great, biomechanical insect or spined deep-sea abomination, its burnished shell covered in bristling antennae and twitching vanes.
Through the blend of alchemy and science practised by the Haemonculus covens, the Cronos can drain the very life essence from its victims using a variety of esoteric apparatus. What remains of its prey when the vile creature has drunk its fill is a testament to the diabolical skill of its creators, for in its wake a Cronos leaves little more than grey and shrivelled husks.
skills: Default 4, Athletics 8, Weapon Skill 7

abilities.name: Terrifying Presence
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Terror Test.

abilities.name: Spirit Siphon
abilities.stats: 12 +1ED / AP -2 / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 0 / Assault, Brutal, Flamer

abilities.name: Pain Syphon
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin when a DRUKHARI Threat within 12m of a Cronos kills a creature to gain 1d3+Tier Pain Tokens instantly.

abilities.name: Death Throes
abilities.description: When slain, this Threat makes a melee attack against any enemy within 2m.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Monstrous Creature
bonuses.description: This Threat is immune to the Fear, Terror, Pinned, and Staggered conditions.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

bonuses.name: Reservoir of Pain
bonuses.description: Each time a Cronos kills an enemy with its Spirit-Leech Tentacles, pick one DRUKHARI Threat or Mob within 12m. A Drukhari Threat heals 1d3 Wounds and recovers all lost Shock. A Mob regains 1 Threat who had previously been slain.

bonuses.name: Spirit Probe
bonuses.description: While a DRUKHARI Threat is within 12m of a Cronos with a Spirit Probe, they may re-roll 1s when rolling for damage.

determination: Insensible to Pain: You do not need to spend Ruin to roll Determination for this Threat. Roll 9d6. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of converted to Shock.

name: TALOS PAIN ENGINE
description:
The Talos Pain Engine is a Drukhari construct and the most widespread of their many so-called Engines of Pain. Festooned with multiple surgical apparatus and grotesque weapons of war, the Talos is a part organic, and part mechanical device conceived by the creations of a mad genius.
These semi-sentient machines are invaluable to the Haemonculi, as they serve as both guardians and mobile torture chambers, inflicting punishment upon all those that displease their master.
skills: Default 4, Athletics 8, Ballistic Skill 6, Weapon Skill 7

abilities.name: Terrifying Presence
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Terror Test.

abilities.name: Death Throes
abilities.description: When slain, this Threat makes a melee attack against any enemy within 2m.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Second Strike
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

bonuses.name: Monstrous Creature
bonuses.description: This Threat is immune to the Fear, Terror, Pinned, and Staggered conditions.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

determination: Insensible to Pain: You do not need to spend Ruin to roll Determination for this Threat. Roll 9d6. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of converted to Shock.

name: HAEMONCULUS
description:
The Haemonculi, the Lords of Pain, are horrific and insane Drukhari flesh-sculptors who have lived within the depths of Commorragh for many Terran centuries, if not millennia. They are master torturers, the Drukhari's greatest connoisseurs of pain and terror.
The Haemonculi are organised into groups called "covens" that are integral to Commorrite society since they are the true masters of the Drukhari's necessary regenerative processes as well as of torture, but they remain the embodiments of terror and paranoia even for others of their species.
How a Drukhari becomes a Haemonculus is unknown. They are all ancient, even for the long-lived Aeldari, and their withered and horrific appearances speaks of Drukhari so old they have passed beyond the ability to regenerate a youthful appearance.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Medicae 14, Scholar 12, Tech 12, Ballistic Skill 10, Weapon Skill 10

abilities.name: Stinger Pistol
abilities.stats: 5 +4ED / AP - / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 1 / Pistol, Fleshbane, Tearing

abilities.name: Ichor Injector
abilities.description: Make a single melee attack, which cannot be part of a Multi-Attack. If the attack succeeds, it inflicts 1d3 Mortal Wounds.

abilities.name: Fleshcraft
abilities.description: Select a single [COVEN] Threat within 3m and make a DN 3 Medicae test. If successful, that Threat heals 1d3 Wounds, +1 per Icon shifted.

abilities.name: Crucible of Malediction
abilities.description: Once per scene, spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action. Roll 1d6 for each PSYKER within 24m. If an Icon is rolled, that Psyker immediately suffers 1d3 Mortal Wounds and one roll on the Perils of the Warp table.

abilities.name: Deathless Vendetta
abilities.description: When this Threat dies, the GM gains 2 Ruin.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 4 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Second Strike
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

bonuses.name: Master of Pain
bonuses.description: Allied [COVEN] Threats within 12m of the Haemonculus add +2 dice to all Determination rolls.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

determination: Insensible to Pain: You do not need to spend Ruin to roll Determination for this Threat. Roll 5d6. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of converted to Shock.

name: INCUBUS
description:
An Incubus (pl. Incubi) is a member of a mercenary order of Drukhari, like the Aspect Warriors of their Asuryani counterparts, who dedicate themselves to the perfection of the killing strike.
Their services are in great demand, whether as bodyguards or shock troops, and the Incubi will fight for any who can afford to purchase their loyalty. Their obsession is the mastery of the Klaive, a bladed melee weapon that becomes as much a part of an Incubus as his own murderous heart.
In battle the Incubi wield these weapons with lethal precision, their every swing severing limbs and shattering blades with contemptuous ease.
skills: Default 6, Athletics 8, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Weapon Skill 12

abilities.name: Onslaught
abilities.description: When an Incubus scores a Wrath Critical on a melee attack, they may immediately make another melee attack.

abilities.name: Perfect Lethality
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to add the game's Tier as ED to all attacks this Threat makes this Round.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Lethal Precision
bonuses.description: For each Exalted Icon rolled on the damage roll for a melee attack, roll one additional ED. These additional ED cannot themselves generate extra ED.

bonuses.name: Tormentor
bonuses.description: The nearest enemy within 2m of this Threat acts last: cannot take a turn until after all other characters have taken a turn this round.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

name: MANDRAKE
description:
A Mandrake is a foul humanoid creature who was once one of the Drukhari of Commorragh that lurk within the darkest corners of the Webway's labyrinthine confines.
The Mandrakes can be found in Aelindrach, a region of Commorragh. Literally fallen into shadow, it is one of the several districts of Commorragh that exists in more than one dimension at once.
This vile breed of their species is secretly feared even by other Drukhari, for a Mandrake can pull itself into any region of space-time through another being's shadow, emerging with a sibilant hiss to sink its frigid claws and teeth into flesh.
Their ebony skins writhe with blasphemous runes and their faces shift and flow, one moment a featureless mask, the next parting to reveal a maw filled with sharpened teeth.
skills: Default 6, Athletics 8, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Stealth 12, Weapon Skill 12

abilities.name: Lurk
abilities.description: The Mandrake makes a normal move towards the nearest area of shadow or darkness and makes a Stealth Test to hide.

abilities.name: Baleblast
abilities.stats: 10 +3ED / AP -1 / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 0 / Assault, Mortal (1), Rapid Fire (2)

abilities.name: Vanish
abilities.description: When a Mandrake scores a Wrath Critical on any Skill Test, they may immediately make a normal move and then make a Stealth Test to hide.

abilities.name: Fade Away
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to make a normal move as a Ruin Action. If this move ends within an area of shadow, the Threat may instantly move to any other area of shadow out of enemy line of sight. Only one SHROUDED Threat may use this per round.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

bonuses.name: Shadow Creatures
bonuses.description: Mandrakes can move at full Speed when Moving Stealthily.

bonuses.name: Umbral Entities
bonuses.description: Mandrakes always count as being in full cover, adding +2 to their Defence. This is included above. If they are in an area of shadow, their Resilience increases by +Tier.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 3d6. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds; after this, move up to half its Speed after the attack is resolved.

name: SCOURGE
description:
A Scourge is a genetically altered Drukhari mercenary who has had wings grafted onto his body and who now serves essentially as jump infantry in Drukhari raid forces.
Scourges are an intrinsic part of the society of Commorragh. The omnipresent intrigues of the Dark City thrive on information, without which even the greatest of the Kabals is soon rendered impotent.
No matter what their chosen appearance, all Scourges relish the arts of war. Clad in a form of porous body armour called Ghostplate, they descend from above, shrieking with the sheer exhilaration as they ruthlessly scythe down those who seek to escape.
skills: Default 6, Athletics 10, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 10, Cunning 8

abilities.name: Haywire Grenade (1 ammo)
abilities.stats: Damage 0 / AP - / Range 12m (T) / Salvo - / Blast (2), Haywire (4)

abilities.name: Never Stationary
abilities.description: If this Threat rolls a Wrath critical on any Test, they may move up to double their Speed after the Test resolves.

abilities.name: Ruinous Speed
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. This Threat makes a Charge, adding +Tier to its Speed.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

name: BARON SATHONYX
description:
In the rotten underbelly of Commorragh there dwells a warrior who commands the dispossessed, ruling over an army of outcasts like a cruel king. He is the self-styled Baron Sathonyx, the Helfather, the Lord of the Middle Dark, the Lord Hellion, and his influence is felt throughout the underworld.
Sathonyx was once a noble of some standing in the Slashed Eye Kabal, and his boundless thirst for the thrill of realspace raids was well-known. Baron Sathonyx enjoys a grudging respect from the Archons and other highborn of Commorragh; with his presence, the Hellion gangs can be bargained with.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Intimidation 11, Leadership 10, Pilot 10, Stealth 11, Weapon Skill 11

abilities.name: Deadly Strike
abilities.description: When the Baron rolls a Wrath Critical on a melee attack, he inflicts 1d3+2 Mortal Wounds and may immediately move up to half its Speed.

abilities.name: Eviscerating Flyby
abilities.description: This Threat makes a normal move and may make a melee attack against any enemy it passes within 2m of during the move.

abilities.name: Deathless Vendetta
abilities.description: When this Threat dies, the GM gains 2 Ruin.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Master of the Skies
bonuses.description: Baron Sathonyx and allied Hellions within 12 metres may re-roll rolls of 1 on Pilot tests, and increase their Speed by +Tier.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

bonuses.name: Seer's Bones
bonuses.description: The Baron gleans foresight from the bones of the Farseer he once captured. Add 1 to Ruin at the start of each of the Baron's turns.

bonuses.name: Shadow Field
bonuses.description: The Baron has two separate values for Resilience and Determination. At the start of a scene, use the first of these two values, representing the Baron's Shadow Field. If, after rolling Determination, the Baron suffers any damage, the Shadow Field fails, and the Baron uses the second of his Resilience and Determination values for the remainder of the scene. Second Resilience: 8 (Skyboard: 3 AR). Second Determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6.

determination:
Shadow Field: Roll 9d6; this does not cost Shock or Ruin and may cancel Mortal Wounds.
Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6.

name: DRAZHAR
description:
Amongst the insular ranks of the Drukhari Incubi, Drazhar remains an enigma. All that is known is that he entered the Great Shrine of the Incubi unannounced and unbidden, clad in ancient, segmented armour of a senior member of their order. He proceeded to cut his way through into the inner sanctum, leaving a trail of dismembered hands and fallen blades on the flagstones.
He has never shown any inclination to take up the position of Hierarch or Klaivex, though the Master of Blades' merciless skill in the battle arts of the Incubi is unparalleled. Drazhar instead holds an esteemed position within the Incubi order as Executioner, the champion of his order.
skills: Default 10, Athletics 14, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Weapon Skill 17

abilities.name: Onslaught
abilities.description: When Drazhar scores a Wrath Critical on a melee attack, he may immediately make another melee attack.

abilities.name: Perfect Lethality
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to add the game's Tier as ED to all attacks this Threat makes this Round.

bonuses.name: Ancient Warrior
bonuses.description: Drazhar can suffer a maximum of 5 Wounds in any single Round of combat and does not suffer Shock damage.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Hatred Eternal
bonuses.description: Each time Drazhar makes an attack, he may re-roll any failures on the attack and on the damage roll.

bonuses.name: Lethal Precision
bonuses.description: For each Exalted Icon rolled on the damage roll for a melee attack, roll one additional ED. These additional ED cannot themselves generate extra ED.

bonuses.name: Master of Blades
bonuses.description: Friendly Incubi within 6m of Drazhar add +1 ED to all successful melee attacks.

bonuses.name: Murderous Assault
bonuses.description: If Drazhar begins a round engaged in melee, he may take two turns in combat that round, rather than one.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

bonuses.name: Second Strike
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

bonuses.name: Tormentor
bonuses.description: The nearest enemy within 2m of this Threat acts last: cannot take a turn until after all other characters have taken a turn this round.

determination: Deadly Riposte: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. Drazhar may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds, and Wounds are negated instead of being converted to Shock. If damage was inflicted in melee, each Exalted Icon Drazhar rolls for Determination also inflicts 1 Mortal Wound on the attacker.

name: LELITH HESPERAX
description:
Lelith Hesperax is best known for her abilities in the Dark Eldar coliseums and is considered the undisputed master of the gladiatorial arenas. Instances have been recorded of her fighting up to ten opponents simultaneously without receiving a scratch.
The deadliest of her kind, Lelith's skill in the arts of combat bear all the hallmarks of true genius. Lelith is deadly grace embodied, her movements hypnotic, sensual and spellbinding.
Alone amongst the Wych Cults, Lelith does not use combat drugs to enhance her performance. Lelith's disciples, the Cult of Strife, maintain that their mistress needs nothing more than a piece of edged steel to outclass her foes.
skills: Default 11, Athletics 15, Awareness 11 (Passive 6), Intimidation 13, Weapon Skill 17

abilities.name: Multi-Action
abilities.description: Lelith may make an Athletics Interaction Attack and a melee attack without suffering the +2 DN Multi-Action penalty.

abilities.name: Blood Dancer
abilities.description: When Lelith scores a Wrath Critical on a melee attack, she may forego scoring a critical hit or any other Wrath effect from that attack to make a second attack after the first one is resolved.

abilities.name: Lightning-Fast Reactions
abilities.description: This Threat may re-roll all failed dice when rolling Determination.

abilities.name: Deathless Vendetta
abilities.description: When this Threat dies, the GM gains 2 Ruin.

bonuses.name: At Last, A Challenge
bonuses.description: Lelith seeks to test herself against the strongest foes. Against Player Characters and Adversary Threats, Lelith may re-roll any failures when making an attack, or on ED when rolling for damage.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Brides of Death
bonuses.description: Allied Threats with the CULT OF STRIFE keyword within 12m may re-roll all 1s on their damage rolls.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 7 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Deadly Dance
bonuses.description: Lelith may Fall Back as a free action. After each melee attack she makes, Lelith may move up to 3m so long as she ends this move engaged with an enemy. She may make this move up a number of times each round equal to the game's Tier.

bonuses.name: Dual Wield
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

bonuses.name: No Escape
bonuses.description: Enemies engaged with this Threat attempting to Fall Back must pass an Agility test (DN 2 + Double Tier). If they fail, they cannot Fall Back this turn.

bonuses.name: Power Through Pain
bonuses.description: This Threat harvests and spends Pain Tokens per the Power Through Pain rules.

bonuses.name: Lelith's Many Blades Note
bonuses.description: Each Exalted Icon shifted from an attack with Lelith's Many Blades adds +2ED rather than +1ED.

determination: Quicksilver Dodge: Roll 11d6; Lelith does not need to spend Ruin to roll Determination. Lelith may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Then, she may move up to half her Speed in any direction.

name: URIEN RAKARTH
description:
Ancient enough to have witnessed the Fall, Urien is a depraved genius in the fields of bodily manipulations anatomical sculpture, and his skills as a flesh-crafter are legendary. Through the many millennia of his existence, he has developed a uniquely expansive knowledge of pain and torture.
As the progenitor of the art of regeneration, Urien has died and risen back to life so many times that he now savours death like a fine wine.
Though he once enjoyed a senior position in the intrigues that bind Commorragh, he has transcended squabbles over power and prestige entirely. Now, only the most grandiose transmogrifications of Commorrite society pique his interest.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Medicae 16, Scholar 14, Tech 14, Ballistic Skill 12, Weapon Skill 12

abilities.name: Diabolical Soothsayer
abilities.description:
When the battle begins, Urien Rakarth selects one of the following options:
- The Haemonculus increases their Toughness by +1. This also adds +1 to Resilience and Wounds, and +1d to Determination.
- The Haemonculus adds +1 to Speed, +1 to Defence, and +1d to all melee attacks.

abilities.name: Casket of Flensing
abilities.stats: 7 +4ED / AP -2 / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo - / Assault, Tearing, Flamer

abilities.name: Ichor Injector
abilities.description: Make a single melee attack, which cannot be part of a Multi-Attack. If the attack succeeds, it inflicts 1d3 Mortal Wounds.

abilities.name: Fleshcraft
abilities.description: Select a single PROPHETS OF FLESH Threat within 3m and make a DN 3 Medicae test. If successful, that Threat heals 1d3 Wounds, +1 per Icon shifted.

abilities.name: Sustained by Dark Science
abilities.description: When Urien Rakarth dies, roll 1d6. On a 1, he dies. On any other result, he is restored to life with wounds equal to 1d3+ the game's Tier.

bonuses.name: Blade Artist
bonuses.description: When a Drukhari threat makes an attack with a melee weapon, increase the weapon's AP by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2) if they shift one or more Icons on the attack.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 7 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Clone Field
bonuses.description: Whenever Urien Rakarth is attacked, roll a d6. On an Icon, the attack is considered to have missed. This has no effect against Blasts or area effect attacks.

bonuses.name: Father of Pain
bonuses.description: See the Power Through Pain rule. Due to Rakarth's mastery of torment and fleshcrafting, gain 1 free Pain Token on each of Rakarth's turns.

bonuses.name: Haemovores
bonuses.description: At the start of Urien's turn, roll 1d6 for each enemy in engagement range. For each Exalted Icon rolled, that enemy suffers 1 Mortal Wound.

bonuses.name: Master of Pain
bonuses.description: Allied PROPHETS OF FLESH Threats within 12m of the Haemonculus add +2 dice to all Determination rolls.

bonuses.name: Sculptor of Torments
bonuses.description: While a friendly PROPHETS OF FLESH Threat is within 6m of Urien Rakarth, it adds +1 to Strength and Resolve.

determination: Contempt for Death: You do not need to spend Ruin to roll Determination for this Threat. Roll 7d6 and re-roll any failures. This Threat can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of converted to Shock.

name: SLAUGTH INFILTRATOR
quote: The worm that walks has come for us all…
description: These rank-and-file Slaugth are encountered singly or in small groups, conducting low-level operations. While formidable, a concerted effort with true military force can eliminate these Slaugth, but their mere presence always suggests a deeper agenda.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Intimidation 9, Stealth 7, Tech 7

bonuses.name: Elasticity
bonuses.description: This Threat adds +2 bonus dice to all tests to climb or escape from being Restrained.

bonuses.name: Psychic Null
bonuses.description: This Threat cannot be affected by any TELEPATHY psychic powers and adds +2 to the DN of all other psychic powers.

bonuses.name: Shroud Cloak
bonuses.description: While wearing this cloak, the Threat cannot be detected by an Auspex or similar device and may re-roll Tier dice on Stealth tests.

bonuses.name: Undying
bonuses.description: This Threat suffers no penalties for being Wounded and cannot suffer the Bleeding condition. They heal 1d3+1 Wounds at the start of each Turn.

abilities.name: Fear
abilities.description: Anyone able to see the Threat must make a DN 5 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Enunciator
abilities.description: This Threat makes an Intimidation Interaction Test; if successful, the target suffers 1d3 Shock as well.

abilities.name: Necrotic Grasp
abilities.description: When this Threat makes a melee attack, spend 1 Ruin to increase the attack's range to 5, and to add the Mortal (1) quality.

determination: Necrotic. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6. Each Exalted Icon inflicts 1 Mortal Wound on an enemy within 2m.

name: SLAUGTH OVERSEER
quote: The worm that walks has come for us all…
description: More senior and powerful, these Slaugth are often behind major operations, often acting as the true power behind several cults, conspiracies, and clandestine activities across entire subsectors. Their intellect and cruelty is matched by their lethality.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Intimidation 11, Scholar 10, Stealth 7, Tech 8

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Elasticity
bonuses.description: This Threat adds +2 bonus dice to all tests to climb or escape from being Restrained.

bonuses.name: Psychic Null
bonuses.description: This Threat cannot be affected by any TELEPATHY psychic powers and adds +2 to the DN of all other psychic powers.

bonuses.name: Shroud Cloak
bonuses.description: While wearing this cloak, the Threat cannot be detected by an Auspex or similar device and may re-roll Tier dice on Stealth tests.

bonuses.name: Undying
bonuses.description: This Threat suffers no penalties for being Wounded and cannot suffer the Bleeding condition. They heal 2d3+2 Wounds at the start of each Turn.

abilities.name: Fear
abilities.description: Anyone able to see the Threat must make a DN 5 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Necrotic Sceptre
abilities.stats: 13 +2ED / AP -3 / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 0 / Brutal, Careful, Mortal (1d3)

abilities.name: Neurophage
abilities.description: As an action, the Threat consumes the brain of a slain foe and adds 1 Ruin.

abilities.name: Necrotic Grasp
abilities.description: When this Threat makes a melee attack, spend 1 Ruin to increase the attack's range to 5, and to add the Mortal (1) quality.

determination: Necrotic. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. Each Exalted Icon inflicts 1 Mortal Wound on an enemy within 2m.

name: HRUD VERMINKIN
description: Verminkin represent the rank and file troops of the Hrud. They make up the bulk of the forces of a migration and are armed with basic weaponry and herded into battle in great numbers.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Stealth 6, Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: Gloomshroud
bonuses.description: Hrud increase their Defence by +1 due to a pall of darkness. They may also re-roll 2 dice on Stealth tests.

abilities.name: Hrud Fusil
abilities.stats: 9 +2ED / AP -1 / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 1 / Assault, Supercharge, Warp Weapon

abilities.name: Shoot and Skitter
abilities.description: When this Threat scores a Wrath Critical on a ranged attack, they may immediately move up to their Speed.

abilities.name: Seething Swarm
abilities.description: At the end of each round, a Mob of Verminkin regains 1d3+Tier slain creatures.

name: HRUD STORMVERMIN
description: Stormvermin are bigger, stronger, and more aggressive than the lesser Verminkin. They are recruited early by powerful Hrud to serve as enforcers, bodyguards, and elite shock troops.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 8, Intimidation 8, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Gloomshroud
bonuses.description: Hrud increase their Defence by +1 due to a pall of darkness. They may also re-roll 2 dice on Stealth tests.

abilities.name: Hrud Caliver
abilities.stats: 9 +3ED / AP -1 / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 2 / Assault, Supercharge, Rapid Fire (1), Warp Weapon

abilities.name: Bodyguard
abilities.description: When a HRUD Adversary within 3m is attacked, spend 1 Ruin as a Reflexive Action to force the attack to target the Stormvermin instead. The Stormvermin will automatically roll Determination against this attack, without needing to spend further Ruin.

name: HRUD CLAWLORD
description: Clawlords are the brutal leaders of the common Vermin Clans. They fight with merciless and underhanded savagery, seizing upon the slightest advantages that may offer victory, much like how they rose to their positions. While they are swaggering and arrogant, they also share their race's instinct for self-preservation and will not think twice about stooping to any depths in order to murder their foes while remaining alive.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Intimidation 10, Leadership 9, Weapon Skill 9

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Cornered Fury
bonuses.description: When this Threat is Wounded, they do not suffer the normal DN penalty. Instead, add +2 dice to all attacks while Wounded.

bonuses.name: Gloomshroud
bonuses.description: Hrud increase their Defence by +1 due to a pall of darkness. They may also re-roll 2 dice on Stealth tests.

bonuses.name: Scurry Away
bonuses.description: A HRUD Adversary may Fall Back as a Simple Action as long as there are at least three other HRUD within 6m.

abilities.name: Warplock Pistol
abilities.stats: 9 +2ED / AP -1 / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 1 / Pistol, Supercharge, Warp Weapon

abilities.name: Gnaw on their Bones!
abilities.description: As a Simple Action, select a HRUD mob within 12m and spend 1 Ruin. That mob adds +Tier bonus dice to any attacks they make until the start of the Clawlord's next turn.

determination: Warpstone Charm. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: ESHIN GLOOM-RUNNERS
description: The Eshin Clans are mysterious and deadly, in a society in which treachery is an art form they are the masters of stealth, assassination and spying. Outside of mass migrations, Eshin Hrud are those most commonly encountered. Within the Eshin, Gloom-Runners are silent enforcers, scouts, and saboteurs.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Stealth 8, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Gloomshroud
bonuses.description: Hrud increase their Defence by +1 due to a pall of darkness. They may also re-roll 2 dice on Stealth tests.

abilities.name: Sneaky Infiltrators
abilities.description: Before the first round of combat, this Threat moves up to its Speed, and makes a Stealth test to hide.

abilities.name: Warp Stars
abilities.stats: 7 +2ED / AP -1 / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 2 / Assault, Fleshbane, Silent

abilities.name: Gloom Canister (2)
abilities.stats: No Damage / Range 16m / Blast (6), Gas, Inflict (Blinded)

abilities.name: Skitter-Flee!
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin as a Ruin Action for the Threat to move up to its Speed and make a Stealth test.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6. The Threat moves its Speed and makes a Stealth test.

name: ESHIN DEATHMASTER
description: Those whom influential Hrud deem too dangerous to live often become the targets of a Deathmaster from the Eshin Clans. The poisoned 'weeping blades' of these supernaturally dexterous killers have slain kings and warlords beyond count.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Stealth 11, Weapon Skill 9

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Gloomshroud

bonuses.name: Scurry Away

bonuses.name: Hidden Killer
bonuses.description: The Threat does not need to spend a Combat Action to move stealthily and may Run (though not Sprint) while moving stealthily.

abilities.name: Sneaky Infiltrators

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. The Threat moves its Speed and makes a Stealth test.

name: MOULDER BEHEMOTH
description:
The Moulder Clans specialise in the creation of some of the most horrific and fearsome war-beasts to have ever existed through breeding, mutation, and surgical alteration.
Behemoths created by the Moulder Clans are terrifying war beasts the size of Ogryns whose packs rip through the enemy ranks in a storm of flying limbs and jetting gore.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Avalanche of Muscle
bonuses.description: When this Threat charges, it adds +Tier bonus dice to the melee attack.

bonuses.name: Big Target
bonuses.description: The Behemoth will shield a single MOULDER Elite or Adversary. While that Elite or Adversary is within 3m, any ranged attack targeting them must target the Behemoth instead.

abilities.name: Rabid Fury
abilities.description: The Behemoth becomes Frenzied.

abilities.name: Rampage
abilities.description: The Behemoth makes an All-Out Attack. Each Exalted Icon rolled on the attack grants the Behemoth one additional die.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. The Threat may re-roll any die which rolls 1.

name: MOULDER BEASTMASTER
description: Moulder Beastmasters are twisted and cruel. Theirs are the deranged minds behind the creation of the Clans Moulders' horrific war beasts, and at their command pack after pack of those foul fiends can be unleashed upon the foe.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Intimidation 10, Leadership 9, Medicae 10

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Crack the Whip
bonuses.description: The Threat may spend Ruin to allow a MOULDER Threat within 13m to take a Ruin action.

bonuses.name: Gloomshroud
bonuses.description: Hrud increase their Defence by +1 due to a pall of darkness. They may also re-roll 2 dice on Stealth tests.

bonuses.name: Scurry Away
bonuses.description: A HRUD Adversary may Fall Back as a Simple Action as long as there are at least three other HRUD within 6m.

abilities.name: Master Moulder
abilities.description: Attempt a DN 3 Medicae test to heal a MOULDER Threat within 3m. If successful, the Threat recovers Wounds equal to the game's Tier, +1d3 per Icon shifted.

abilities.name: Obey!
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin as a Ruin Action to add +1 Speed to a MOULDER Threat within 13m. Affected MOULDER Threats also add +2ED to melee attacks. This lasts until the Beastmaster's next turn.

name: SKRYRE WARPLOCK-ENGINEER
description: The Clans Skryre are the engineers and technologists of the Hrud, constantly seeking to improve and innovate.. often at the cost of their underlings' lives. Warplock-Engineers scurry into battle with arcane engines strapped to their backs and crackling weapons of war clutched in their gnarled claws.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Scholar 9, Tech 9, Psychic Mastery 9

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Gloomshroud
bonuses.description: Hrud increase their Defence by +1 due to a pall of darkness. They may also re-roll 2 dice on Stealth tests.

bonuses.name: Scurry Away
bonuses.description: A HRUD Adversary may Fall Back as a Simple Action as long as there are at least three other HRUD within 6m.

bonuses.name: Overcharge
bonuses.description: When the Warplock-Engineer makes an attack or attempts to activate a Psychic Power, they may add extra Wrath Dice equal to the game's Tier.

abilities.name: Warplock Pistol
abilities.stats: 9 +2ED / AP -1 / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 1 / Pistol, Supercharge, Warp Weapon

abilities.name: Warp Engineering
abilities.description: The Warplock-Engineer attempts to activate a psychic power. It knows the Psyniscience, Deny the Witch, and Smite powers, plus one Warpvolt power.

abilities.name: Discharge!
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to activate the Smite psychic power as a Ruin Action.

name: SKRYRE ACOLYTE
description: The Acolytes of the Clans Skryre go to war amidst the tinny wheeze of rebreather masks and the perilous clink of volatile grenades rattling together. They hurl volleys of these lethal devices, which unleash horrific death as they detonate.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 8, Tech 7

bonuses.name: Gloomshroud
bonuses.description: Hrud increase their Defence by +1 due to a pall of darkness. They may also re-roll 2 dice on Stealth tests.

bonuses.name: Quick-Quick Volley
bonuses.description: This Threat treats all grenades as if they have the Assault quality.

abilities.name: Poisoned Wind Globe
abilities.stats: 8 +5ED / AP -2 / Range 12m / Blast (6), Fleshbane, Gas, Inflict (Poisoned 5)

abilities.name: Calamitous Withdrawal
abilities.description: When the Grenadier is the target of a Charge action, when the enemy finishes their move, but before they make their attack, the Grenadier may make a normal move and then make an attack with a grenade as a Reflexive Action.

name: SKRYRE GUNNER
description: The largest and burliest of Skryre Acolytes are tasked with hauling powerful heavy weapons. Warpshot Gatling Guns unleash a withering hail of warp-infused shells, mowing down the foe, while Warpfire Throwers spew noxious, green warp-flames that melt their foes.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 8, Tech 7

bonuses.name: Gloomshroud
bonuses.description: Hrud increase their Defence by +1 due to a pall of darkness. They may also re-roll 2 dice on Stealth tests.

bonuses.name: More-More Fire!
bonuses.description: When the Skryre Gunner makes a ranged attack, they may add additional Wrath dice to their pool equal to the game's Tier. This may allow them to roll multiple Criticals or Complications (or both) on one roll.

abilities.name: Warpshot Gatling Gun
abilities.stats: 13 +2ED / AP -1 / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 2d3 / Heavy (5), Sustained, Volatile (1)

abilities.name: Sustained Fire
abilities.description: If the Gunner rolls a Wrath Critical on a ranged attack, they may make an additional ranged attack with that weapon. Additional attacks cannot themselves generate extra attacks.

name: SKRYRE STORMFIEND
description: Stormfiends are monstrous fusions of vat-bred Moulder Behemoths and Skryre contraptions. They are the lumbering shock-troops of the Clans Skryre and can sweep away entire enemy units in a heartbeat with their vicious wonder-weapons.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 8, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: Big Target
bonuses.description: The Stormfiend will shield a single SKRYRE Elite or Adversary. While that Elite or Adversary is within 3m, any ranged attack targeting them must target the Stormfiend instead.

abilities.name: Monstrous
abilities.description: Enemies who can see the Stormfiend must pass a DN3 Fear test.

abilities.name: Warpshot Gatling Gun
abilities.stats: 13 +2ED / AP -1 / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 2d3 / Heavy (5), Sustained, Volatile (1)

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. The Threat may re-roll any die which rolls 1.

name: PESTILENS PLAGUE PRIEST
description: The Clans Pestilens are a priesthood of decay and ruin, seeking to spread plague and filth, and accelerate the entropy of all things. Plague Priests shriek blasphemous prayers that unleash dark diseases upon their foes. Those not wasted away or withered into ooze are swiftly put out of their misery.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Medicae 9, Persuasion 9, Scholar 9

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Foetid
bonuses.description: If the Poisoned X condition is inflicted by a PESTILENS Threat, the Poisoned character suffers 1d3 Shock at the start of each turn.

bonuses.name: Gloomshroud
bonuses.description: Hrud increase their Defence by +1 due to a pall of darkness. They may also re-roll 2 dice on Stealth tests.

bonuses.name: Scurry Away

bonuses.name: Noxious Fumes
bonuses.description: The Threat is wreathed in a toxic fog, and any foe who begins their turn within 3m of the Threat becomes Poisoned 3.

abilities.description: The Plague Priest invokes its entropic gods. This is a DN3 Persuasion test, and inflicts 1d3 Shock on the Plague Priest. If successful, select one creature within 13m. It suffers 1d3 Mortal Wounds and becomes Poisoned 3. If the creature is PESTILENS, it instead heals 1d3 Wounds.

abilities.name: Loathe the Uninfected!
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to become Frenzied and Charge as a Ruin Action.

name: PESTILENS PLAGUE MONKS
description: Driven into battle by their frenzied faith, Plague Monks overwhelm their enemies in a pestilential mass. They hack and stab wildly with their foetid blades, spreading disease and infection with every blow.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: Foetid
bonuses.description: If the Poisoned X condition is inflicted by a PESTILENS Threat, the Poisoned character suffers 1d3 Shock at the start of each turn.

abilities.name: Infectious
abilities.description: When this Threat scores a Wrath Critical on a melee attack, the target suffers the Poisoned 3 condition.

name: PALE SEER
description: Pale Seers are manipulators and master sorcerers who attempt to direct the Hrud to ultimate victory at any price. They are dangerous, deranged and more than willing to devour the raw stuff of the Warp in order to supercharge their abilities.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 11 (Passive 6), Psychic Mastery 13

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 7 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Architect of Ruin

bonuses.name: Gloomshroud
bonuses.description: Hrud increase their Defence by +1 due to a pall of darkness. They may also re-roll 2 dice on Stealth tests.

bonuses.name: Scurry Away

bonuses.description: When the Pale Seer attempts to activate a psychic power, it may choose to consume Warp-stuff. If it does so, any Wrath Dice the Pale Seer rolls count 1s and 2s as Complications, 3s and 4s as Icons, and 5s and 6s as Exalted Icons.

abilities.name: Warpstone Staff
abilities.stats: 10 +3ED / AP -1 / Range 2 [M] / Brutal, Force, Warp Weapon
