abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to activate a Psychic Power or Deny the Witch as a Ruin Action.

determination: Warpstone Charm. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: SKINK
description: The smallest of all Seraphon subspecies, skinks are swift and clever warriors. Though physically frail they are capable of covering ground with impressive speed, swarming as a scaly mass to unleash a storm of poison-tipped projectiles.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Stealth 6, Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: Cold-Blooded
bonuses.description: Seraphon may re-roll failures on Resolve and Conviction tests.

abilities.name: Swift and Nimble
abilities.description: Despite not being Champions, Skinks may use a Ruin Action to make a Move by spending 1 Ruin. When they do so, they increase their Speed by +Tier, and do not suffer any Reflexive Attacks from enemies.

name: SAURUS WARRIOR
description: Saurus Warriors are the brutal heart of the Seraphon armies. Bred solely for war, their cohorts advance across the battlefield in disciplined lockstep, unleashing their cold-blooded savagery only when battle is joined.

resilience.note: Scaly Skin and Shield: 4 AR, and 1 AR, Shield

skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Intimidation 8, Weapon Skill 9

bonuses.name: Cold-Blooded
bonuses.description: Seraphon may re-roll failures on Resolve and Conviction tests.

bonuses.name: Ordered Cohort
bonuses.description: Saurus add +1 to Defence and Resilience if there are one or more Saurus within 1m.

abilities.name: Saurus Jaws
abilities.stats: 9 +3ED / Careful, Tearing. A Saurus may make an attack with Saurus Jaws as a Simple Action.

abilities.name: Predatory Aggression
abilities.description: When a Saurus rolls a Wrath Critical when making a melee attack, increase the effect of the Critical Hit as if 1 Glory had been spent.

name: KROXIGOR
description: Taller and bulkier than even the most hulking saurus, each Kroxigor is a monstrously strong crocodilian brute. They wade into battle alongside massed skink cohorts, crushing any who would threaten their diminutive cousins.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Athletics 7, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: Cold-Blooded
bonuses.description: Seraphon may re-roll failures on Resolve and Conviction tests.

bonuses.name: Skink Guidance
bonuses.description: A Kroxigor adds +Tier to any skill test it attempts while within 6m of one or more SKINK allies.

abilities.name: Vice-Like Jaws
abilities.stats: 12 +4ED / Careful, Tearing. A Kroxigor may make an attack with Vice-Like Jaws as a Simple Action.

abilities.name: Spawn of Sotek
abilities.description: When one or more SKINK allies within 12m are slain, the Kroxigor may become Frenzied as a Reflexive Action.

determination: Heavy-scaled Skin: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 8d6. Add +Tier dice when rolling Determination against a ranged attack.

name: SKINK STARPRIEST
description: Blessed with great intelligence and a deep connection to the Immaterium, the Starpriests provide front-line psychic support to the Seraphon in battle. Each is a talented psyker, able to unleash the scouring power of the deep warp upon the foe.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Psychic Mastery 9, Scholar 8

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Cold-Blooded
bonuses.description: Seraphon may re-roll failures on Resolve and Conviction tests.

abilities.name: Power of the Heavens
abilities.description: The Skink Starpriest attempts to activate a psychic power. It knows the powers Smite, Deny the Witch, Psyniscience, and up to two Celestial powers.

abilities.name: Serpent Staff
abilities.description: Select one SERAPHON mob, or up to 5 individual SERAPHON allies, within 12m, as a Ruin Action. Until the start of this Threat's next turn, all the weapons of those SERAPHON gain the Fleshbane trait, or the Mortal (1) trait if they already have the Fleshbane trait.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 3d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: SAURUS OLDBLOOD
description: Veterans of centuries of fearsome bloodshed, Saurus Oldbloods are the greatest commanders of the Seraphon. Each directs their cohorts with an instinctive, savage precision, enacting the designs of the Slann with faultless loyalty.

resilience.note: Scarred Scales, Shield: 5 AR, and 2 AR, Shield

skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Intimidation 8, Weapon Skill 9

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Cold-Blooded
bonuses.description: Seraphon may re-roll failures on Resolve and Conviction tests.

bonuses.name: Predatory Exemplar
bonuses.description: Allied SAURUS within 12m of this Threat may re-roll up to Tier dice on attacks.

abilities.name: Mighty Jaws
abilities.stats: 11 +4ED / Brutal, Careful, Tearing. A Saurus Oldblood may make an attack with Mighty Jaws as a Simple Action.

abilities.name: Wrath of the Seraphon
abilities.description: When this Threat makes an All-Out Attack, it and all SAURUS affected by Predatory Exemplar (above) add +2ED to their melee attacks.

abilities.name: Predatory Strike
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to make the Threat Charge as a Ruin Action.

determination: Iron Scales and Old Scars: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 8d6. Re-roll any dice which roll 1.

name: SLANN STARMASTER
description: Ancient beings created to serve the Old Ones, the Starmasters are amongst the greatest psychic minds in the galaxy. The powers of the void are theirs to command, the energies of the immaterium wielded to annihilate their enemies.

resilience.note: Shield of the Old Ones: *7 AR, Force Field

skills: Default 4, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 6, Scholar 10, Psychic Mastery 13

bonuses.name: Arcane Vassal
bonuses.description: When this Threat attempts to activate a psychic power, you may choose a SKINK PSYKER within 12m, and determine the power's range, effect, and line of sight from them instead.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 7 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Cold-Blooded
bonuses.description: Seraphon may re-roll failures on Resolve and Conviction tests.

bonuses.name: Foresight
bonuses.description: At the start of each of the Slann's turns gain 1 Ruin.

bonuses.name: Master of Order
bonuses.description: Re-roll a number of dice equal to the game's Tier on all Psychic Mastery tests. In addition, they may Deny the Witch at any range.

bonuses.name: Shield of the Old Ones
bonuses.description: This adds +5 to the Threat's Defence and Determination. This is included already.

abilities.name: Arcane Lightning
abilities.stats: 13 +2ED / AP -1 / Range 3-6-9 / Salvo 3 / Arc (2), Pistol, Rapid Fire (3), Tesla

abilities.name: Cosmic Power
abilities.description: The Slann Starmaster attempts to activate a psychic power. It knows Smite, Deny the Witch, Psyniscience, and 3 Celestial powers.

abilities.name: Cosmic Imperative
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to activate a Psychic Power or Deny the Witch as a Ruin Action.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 11d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: CUSTODIAN GUARD
description: The Adeptus Custodes are the Emperor's vengeance made manifest. They defend the Master of Mankind with singular determination and breathtaking skill, and whether their vigil requires them to stand immovable before the gates of the Imperial Palace or storm into battle on a distant alien world, they do their duty without a moment's hesitation.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 13 (Passive 7), Ballistic Skill 12, Weapon Skill 12

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: The Emperor's Chosen
bonuses.description: A Custodian Guard does not suffer the penalties for being Wounded, or the Bleeding or Exhausted conditions.

abilities.name: Guardian Spear (ranged)
abilities.stats: 10 +2ED / AP -1 / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Brutal, Rapid Fire (2)

abilities.name: Heroic Intervention
abilities.description: When an enemy finishes a Charge move within 6m of this Threat, this Threat may perform a Charge as a Reflexive Action against that enemy.

determination: Aegis of the Emperor. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: PROSECUTOR
description: Prosecutors operate in more tactically flexible squads designed around longer-ranged combat. They are the most commonly encountered type of Null-Maiden by the wider Imperium.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 10, Investigate 9, Weapon Skill 9

bonuses.description: Attacks against PSYKERS and DAEMONS gain +3ED. DAEMONS may not roll Determination while within 5m.

abilities.name: Psychic Abomination
abilities.description: PSYKERs and DAEMONs who can see this Threat must pass a DN 3 Fear test, even if normally immune to Fear.

abilities.name: Creeping Dread
abilities.description: When an enemy makes an attack while within 6m of this Threat, they must re-roll any Wrath dice that show a 6.

name: VIGILATOR
description: Vigilators are the most experienced type of tactical formation used by the Silent Sisterhood, entrusted with slaying the most dangerous targets and performing the most important duties.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 9, Investigate 9, Weapon Skill 11

bonuses.name: Champion

bonuses.description: This Threat may not be affected by Psychic Powers, and any PSYKER attempting or targeting a psychic power within 5m add +3 DN.

bonuses.description: Attacks against PSYKERS and DAEMONS gain +3ED. DAEMONS may not roll Determination while within 5m.

abilities.name: Creeping Dread
abilities.description: When an enemy makes an attack while within 6m of this Threat, they must re-roll any Wrath dice that show a 6.

name: WITCHSEEKER
description: Witchseekers, or more commonly Seekers are a type of warrior of the Sisters of Silence. Deployed for purging operations of Psykers, Abhumans, or criminals, Witchseekers are specialists equipped with Flamers for close-range multi-target assault.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 10, Investigate 9, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Untouchable
bonuses.description: This Threat may not be affected by Psychic Powers, and any PSYKER attempting or targeting a psychic power within 5m add +3 DN.

bonuses.name: Daughter of the Abyss
bonuses.description: Attacks against PSYKERS and DAEMONS gain +3ED. DAEMONS may not roll Determination while within 5m.

abilities.name: Witchseeker
abilities.description: The Threat moves up to its Speed. PSYKERs and DAEMONs who see this Threat must pass a DN 3 Fear test.

abilities.name: Witchseeker Flamer
abilities.stats: 10 +1ED / AP -1 / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 1 / Assault, Flamer, Inflict (Pinned 3)

abilities.name: Creeping Dread
abilities.description: When an enemy makes an attack while within 6m of this Threat, they must re-roll any Wrath dice that show a 6.

name: KNIGHT-CENTURA
description: Knights-Centura are the leaders of Anathema Psykana cadres and the guardians of their traditions. Respected for their years of service, prowess, power as Nulls, and their encyclopaedic knowledge of the witch and the sorcerer.

resilience.note: Vratine Armour, Voidsheen Cloak: 5 AR, *2 AR

skills: Default 10, Awareness 11 (Passive 6), Ballistic Skill 11, Investigate 11, Weapon Skill 12

bonuses.name: Daughter of the Abyss
bonuses.description: Attacks against PSYKERS and DAEMONS gain +4ED. DAEMONS may not roll Determination while within 10m.

bonuses.description: Allied ANATHEMA PSYKANA within 6m increase their Speed by +2.

abilities.name: Abomination
abilities.description: PSYKERs and DAEMONs who see this Threat must pass a DN 4 Fear test.

abilities.name: Creeping Dread
abilities.description: When an enemy makes an attack while within 6m of this Threat, they must re-roll any Wrath dice that show a 6.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: ARBITES CASTIGATOR
description: It is the Castigator's role to ensure that the guilty receive due punishment, their hood-like helms steeling their resolve against curses and pleas alike. Once the quarry is located, the Castigator is charged with their subdual by any means - a task they perform with zealous dedication.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 8, Intimidation 7, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Subdue
bonuses.description: If a creature becomes Exhausted due to Shock suffered from this Threat's attack, it is rendered unconscious.

bonuses.name: Ruthless Efficiency
bonuses.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack at short range with a Shotgun or Shotpistol, each Exalted Icon shifted adds +2ED rather than +1.

abilities.name: Fist of Justice
abilities.description: HERETIC and SCUM who see the Threat must pass a DN 3 Fear test.

abilities.name: Arbites Combat Shotgun
abilities.stats: 10 +1ED / AP -1 / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 2 / Assault, Rapid Fire (1), Spread

abilities.name: Stun Grenade (2)
abilities.stats: No Damage / Range 16 / Blast (6), Enemies hit become Blinded and Vulnerable (2)

abilities.name: Executioner Shell
abilities.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack with a Shotgun, spend 1 to load an Executioner shell; the weapon gains +1ED, but loses Spread. It also reverses the normal modifiers for Short and Long range.

name: ARBITES CHIRURGANT
description: Chirurgants are highly skilled medical specialists, used to treating debilitating wounds inflicted by those resisting detention. They are also skilled in the tactical questioning of prisoners and have studied the limits to which the body can be pushed to elicit answers.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 8, Intimidation 7, Medicae 8

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Ruthless Efficiency
bonuses.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack at short range with a Shotgun or Shotpistol, each Exalted Icon shifted adds +2ED rather than +1.

abilities.name: Fist of Justice
abilities.description: HERETIC and SCUM who see the Threat must pass a DN 3 Fear test.

abilities.name: Arbites Combat Shotgun
abilities.stats: 10 +1ED / AP -1 / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 2 / Assault, Rapid Fire (1), Spread

abilities.name: Medicae
abilities.description: As an Action, the Chirurgant attempts a Medicae Test (DN3) to heal an ally. On success, heal 1 Wound, +1 per Exalted Icon shifted.

abilities.name: Medic
abilities.description: When an ADEPTUS ARBITES ally within 6m reaches their Maximum Wounds, this Threat may make a normal move towards them and attempt a DN5 Medicae test; on success, the patient recovers 1 Wound and survives the attack.

name: ARBITES GUNNER
description: Gunners provide substantial firepower to Arbites operations using weapons such as heavy stubbers rapid-firing cannons whose solid shot can scythe through mobs. Other gunners may fire restraining Webbers, or versatile Grenade Launchers.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 8, Intimidation 7, Medicae 8

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Crowd Suppression
bonuses.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack, they may shift Exalted Icons on the attack to inflict the Pinned 3 condition on one enemy per Exalted Icon within 5m of the target.

abilities.name: Fist of Justice
abilities.description: HERETIC and SCUM who see the Threat must pass a DN 3 Fear test.

abilities.name: Grenade Launcher
abilities.stats: Damage as Grenade / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo - / Assault

abilities.name: Stun Grenade (2)
abilities.stats: No Damage / Range as Launcher / Blast (6), Enemies hit become Blinded and Vulnerable (2)

name: ARBITES LEASHMASTER
description: Leashmasters are specialists who command the caniform servitors known as Cyber-mastiffs. They direct override the construct's basic protocols with advanced commands and broadcast shouted orders to their guilt-ridden prey via the Cyber-mastiff's emitters.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 8, Intimidation 7, Tech 8

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Handler
bonuses.description: When this Threat takes a turn, a Cyber-Mastiff takes a turn immediately afterwards, without needing to Seize the Initiative.

bonuses.name: Ruthless Efficiency
bonuses.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack at short range with a Shotgun or Shotpistol, each Exalted Icon shifted adds +2ED rather than +1.

abilities.name: Fist of Justice
abilities.description: HERETIC and SCUM who see the Threat must pass a DN 3 Fear test.

abilities.name: Arbites Combat Shotgun
abilities.stats: 10 +1ED / AP -1 / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 2 / Assault, Rapid Fire (1), Spread

abilities.name: Attack Pattern
abilities.description: As a Ruin Action, spend 1 Ruin to make the Cyber-Mastiff take a specific Action: AGGRESSOR: Charge or All-Out Attack. VELOCITAS: Sprint. DEFENSOR: Full Defence.

name: ARBITES MALOCATOR
description: Technically gifted, Malocators carry bio-sample extractors to gather trace evidence on their team's quarry. They operate with an icy calm under fire, scrutinising evidence via their veriscant multi-lens array and informing their team of enemy weaknesses.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 8, Intimidation 7, Tech 8

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Ruthless Efficiency
bonuses.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack at short range with a Shotgun or Shotpistol, each Exalted Icon shifted adds +2ED rather than +1.

abilities.name: Fist of Justice
abilities.description: HERETIC and SCUM who see the Threat must pass a DN 3 Fear test.

abilities.name: Arbites Combat Shotgun
abilities.stats: 10 +1ED / AP -1 / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 2 / Assault, Rapid Fire (1), Spread

abilities.name: Veriscant
abilities.description: Make a Tech Interaction attack against a single visible enemy, regardless of range. This attack can only make an enemy Vulnerable.

abilities.name: Surveil
abilities.description: As a Ruin Action, perform a Tech Interaction Attack using the Veriscant.

name: ARBITES PROCTOR
description: Arbites Squads are led by Proctors. These experienced Arbitrators are ruthless tacticians and savvy fighters. They are also intimidating embodiments of Imperial justice and employ nuncio-aquilas to broadcast deafening orations that cow the guilty into submission.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 8, Intimidation 7, Leadership 7, Weapon Skill 8

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Ruthless Efficiency
bonuses.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack at short range with a Shotgun or Shotpistol, each Exalted Icon shifted adds +2ED rather than +1.

abilities.name: Fist of Justice
abilities.description: HERETIC and SCUM who see the Threat must pass a DN 3 Fear test.

abilities.name: Arbites Combat Shotgun
abilities.stats: 10 +1ED / AP -1 / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 2 / Assault, Rapid Fire (1), Spread

abilities.name: Nuncio-aquila
abilities.description: As a simple action, move the Nuncio-aquila up to 6m. When performing an Intimidation Interaction Attack or making a Leadership test, the Threat may determine the range and effect from the Nuncio-aquila instead of himself.

abilities.name: Broadcast
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to make an Intimidate Interaction Attack or a Leadership test using the Nuncio-aquila.

name: ARBITES MARKSMAN
description: The rabble-rouser lurking behind those they incite, the heavily armed bodyguard or the fleeing criminal about to escape - such are the targets of the Marksman. Their long-barrelled shotguns fire shells so powerful that they leave wounds more akin to gory craters than bullet holes.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 8, Intimidation 7, Stealth 8

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Ruthless Efficiency
bonuses.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack at short range with a Shotgun or Shotpistol, each Exalted Icon shifted adds +2ED rather than +1.

abilities.name: Fist of Justice
abilities.description: HERETIC and SCUM who see the Threat must pass a DN 3 Fear test.

abilities.name: Executioner Shotgun
abilities.stats: 12 +2ED / AP -2 / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 0 / Heavy (4), Silent, Spread

abilities.name: Executioner Shell
abilities.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack with an Executioner Shotgun, spend 1 to load an Executioner shell; the weapon gains +1ED and Sniper (1), but loses Spread. It also reverses the normal modifiers for Short and Long range.

name: ARBITES REVELATUM
description: A Revelatum reconnoitres their targets' movements in advance of the rest of the team, scouting hideouts and ascertaining criminal contacts. They then lead other Arbitrators straight to the guilty, using their soulguilt scanners to identify threats to their fellow officers.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 8, Intimidation 7, Tech 8

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Ruthless Efficiency
bonuses.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack at short range with a Shotgun or Shotpistol, each Exalted Icon shifted adds +2ED rather than +1.

abilities.name: Reconnoitre
abilities.description: The Revelatum moves up to his Speed.

abilities.name: Scoped Shotpistol
abilities.stats: 9 +1ED / AP -1 / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 1 / Pistol, Silent, Sniper (1), Spread

abilities.name: Soulguilt Scanner
abilities.description: Make a Tech test with a DN of 3. Any enemies within 12m who currently have a Stealth Score reduce that score by 1, and by a further 1 per Exalted Icon shifted.

abilities.name: Scan
abilities.description: As a Ruin Action, take the Soulguilt Scanner action above.

name: CYBER-MASTIFF
description: Arbitrators employ many servo-constructs for intimidation, security and pursuit. The Rantal-class Venatus Reclamotor is an advanced Cyber-mastiff used by Exaction Squads. The R-VR's detectors enable them to track their prey, while their iron jaws can break bones or kill on command.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Intimidation 6, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

bonuses.name: Animal
bonuses.description: This Threat is unable to take any actions which would require the use of hands.

bonuses.name: Apprehend
bonuses.description: If this Threat hits a target with a melee attack, it may choose to Restrain the target rather than dealing damage. The target is restrained by the Cyber-Mastiff's jaws and must succeed on a DN 4 Strength Test to break free.

name: ARBITES SUBDUCTOR
description: Subductors possess one of the most recognisable and feared - silhouettes to the Imperium's criminal classes. Bearing Subjugation-pattern assault shields and crackling shock mauls, they are brutal front line brawlers capable of crushing the most stubborn dissent.

resilience.note: Arbites Carapace and Assault Shield: 6 AR

skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Intimidation 7, Weapon Skill 9

bonuses.name: Brutal Repression
bonuses.description: An enemy who fails a melee attack against this Threat suffers 1 Shock. Anyone suffering a complication on a melee attack against this Threat suffers 1d3 Shock.

abilities.name: Fist of Justice
abilities.description: HERETIC and SCUM who see the Threat must pass a DN 3 Fear test.

abilities.name: Shield Line
abilities.description: When charged, the Arbitor may take the Full Defence action as a Reflexive Action, adding +1 Icon for every other ADEPTUS ARBITES ally with a Shield within 1m. The Threat may not move next turn.

name: ARBITES VIGILANT
description: Vigilants brutally sweep the guilty from existence with the signature combat shotgun of the Adeptus Arbites. These grim men and women are ever-alert to malfeasance and unwavering in its punishment, unleashing devastating blasts at close range.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 8, Intimidation 7

bonuses.name: Ruthless Efficiency
bonuses.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack at short range with a Shotgun or Shotpistol, each Exalted Icon shifted adds +2ED rather than +1.

abilities.name: Fist of Justice
abilities.description: HERETIC and SCUM who see the Threat must pass a DN 3 Fear test.

abilities.name: Arbites Combat Shotgun
abilities.stats: 10 +1ED / AP -1 / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 2 / Assault, Rapid Fire (1), Spread

abilities.name: Executioner Shell
abilities.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack with a Shotgun, spend 1 to load an Executioner shell; the weapon gains +1ED, but loses Spread. It also reverses the normal modifiers for Short and Long range.

name: ARBITES VOX-SIGNIFIER
description: The team's Vox-signifier listens for coded missives from mission command on their powerful precinct vox-relay. They issue updates to the rest of the squad arising from changes to mission priorities and new intelligence - likely painfully extracted from prisoners.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 8, Intimidation 7, Tech 8

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Ruthless Efficiency
bonuses.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack at short range with a Shotgun or Shotpistol, each Exalted Icon shifted adds +2ED rather than +1.

abilities.name: Fist of Justice
abilities.description: HERETIC and SCUM who see the Threat must pass a DN 3 Fear test.

abilities.name: Arbites Combat Shotgun
abilities.stats: 10 +1ED / AP -1 / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 2 / Assault, Rapid Fire (1), Spread

abilities.name: Vox-Relay
abilities.description: Make a Tech test with a DN of 3. If successful, add 1 to Ruin.

abilities.name: Backup
abilities.description: As a Ruin Action, spend 1 Ruin to call for reinforcements: a number of ADEPTUS ARBITES Elites equal to the game's Tier, or an ADEPTUS ARBITES mob consisting of 3x Tier Troops.

name: INQUISITION MYSTIC
description: Using their empyric senses to 'see' hidden truths and the souls of those they hunt, Mystics engage in the most arcane of missions. They provide vital support to their team, scrying the future for dangers or creating shields of psychic energy.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Psychic Mastery 8

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Foresight
abilities.description: The Mystic attempts to activate the Forewarning psychic power.

abilities.name: Psychic Powers
abilities.description: The Mystic attempts to activate a psychic power. It knows Smite, Deny the Witch, Psyniscience, Forewarning, and Telekinetic Dome.

abilities.name: Mystical Power
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to attempt to use a Psychic Power or Deny the Witch as a Ruin Action.

name: INQUISITION ENLIGHTENER
description: Known to some as Excruciators or Truth-Peelers, these sadistic individuals are highly valued by Inquisitors for their utter lack of mercy and uncanny skill in extracting valuable information, even from the most uncooperative of prisoners.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Intimidation 8, Weapon Skill 9

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: No Escape
bonuses.description: Enemies engaged with this Threat attempting to Fall Back must pass an Agility test (DN 2 + Double Tier). If they fail, they cannot Fall Back this turn.

bonuses.name: Second Strike
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

abilities.name: Disseminate
abilities.description: When the Enlightener scores a Wrath Critical on a melee attack, the target suffers the Bleeding condition.

name: INQUISITION AUTOSAVANT
description: Little remains of the original Human the Autosavant once was. Much of their form has been replaced with bionics dedicated to the recording of information. Whether in their base of operations or the heat of battle, they never cease their scribblings of every word and deed they witness.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Scholar 9

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Scrivener
bonuses.description: Each time the enemy spends 1 Wrath, gain 1 Ruin.

abilities.name: Document
abilities.description: The Autosavant may make an Interaction Attack using Scholar against an enemy it can see, as they study enemy actions.

abilities.name: Disseminate
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to attempt the Document action as a Ruin Action.

name: INQUISITION HEXORCIST
description: Hexorcists are holy men and women that are often mistaken for priests by the uninitiated. They believe that the Imperial Faith will only be spread at the barrel of a gun and are experienced enough in the galaxy's many horrors to know they must fight tooth and nail for it.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Intimidation 8, Weapon Skill 9

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Hexorcism
bonuses.description: Enemies within 6m of the Hexorcist cannot re-roll any dice on attacks.

abilities.name: Chasten
abilities.description: Make an Intimidation Interaction Attack. If successful, the enemy also loses the use of a single Talent (if a PC) or Bonus (if a Threat) it has while the Interaction Attack remains in effect.

abilities.name: Condemn
abilities.description: When the Hexorcist scores a Wrath Critical when using the Chasten action, the target suffers 1d3 Shock as well.

name: INTERROGATOR
description: Ruthless, resourceful and skilled in all manner of clandestine and war-making skills, Interrogators are selected by the Inquisitor they serve for their dogged determination and unflagging loyalty and are on the path to becoming Inquisitors themselves.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 11 (Passive 6), Intimidation 10, Leadership 10

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Holy Ordos
bonuses.description: INQUISITION allies within 6m may use the Interrogator's Conviction and Resolve.

abilities.name: Denounce
abilities.description: Select an enemy within 6m. INQUISITION allies attacking that enemy gain +2 bonus dice until the start of the Interrogator's next turn.

abilities.name: Sanctify
abilities.description: Select an INQUISITION ally within 6m. That ally's Defence is increased by +2 until the start of the Interrogator's next turn.

abilities.name: Influence
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to use either Denounce or Sanctify as a Ruin Action.

name: INQUISITION PISTOLIER
description: Sometimes known as Desperadoes, these Agents are skilled killers who have honed their talents in the crime-ridden underbowels of hive worlds. Alongside the quick draw they have learned the value of the silent kill, as well as the ostentatiously explosive.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 9, Stealth 8

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Second Shot
bonuses.description: The Threat reduces the DN of a ranged Multi-Attack by 2, as if they had the Dual Wield talent.

abilities.name: Scoped Plasma Pistol
abilities.stats: 15 +1ED / AP -3 / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 1 / Pistol, Sniper (1), Supercharge

abilities.name: Fusillade
abilities.description: When the Pistolier scores a Wrath Critical on a ranged attack, the target also suffers the Pinned 3 condition.

name: INQUISITION QUESTKEEPER
description: Questkeepers--also known as Knights-Errant, Penitents and many other names--are fanatical zealots dedicated to the Imperial Creed. With an intense hatred for foes of the Emperor, they execute sworn quests to slaughter heretics and traitors.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 9, Stealth 8

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Unrelenting
bonuses.description: If the Questkeeper makes an All-Out Attack in melee, the weapon loses its Unwieldy trait, and inflicts +2 Damage.

abilities.name: Reaper
abilities.description: When the Questkeeper scores a Wrath Critical on a melee attack, each other enemy within range also suffers 1d3 Mortal Wounds.

determination: Zealot. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6. Each Exalted Icon rolled recovers 1 Shock.

name: INQUISITOR
description:
An Inquisitor is a clandestine agent and one of the highest-ranking members of the Imperial Inquisition. Inquisitors are the secret policemen and intelligence agents of the Imperium.
As the most important arm of the Imperial government dedicated to ensuring the security of the Imperium of Man, the authority of the Inquisition technically supersedes all others, including, in theory, a High Lord of Terra or even a Chapter Master of the Adeptus Astartes. Thus, Inquisitors have access to an almost limitless variety of Imperial resources that allow them to act in full strength against any threats they perceive to the Emperor's domain.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 13 (Passive 7), Leadership 12

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 6 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Unlimited Authority
bonuses.description: IMPERIUM allies within 6m may use the Inquisitor's Conviction and Resolve.

abilities.name: Iron Will
abilities.description: When the Inquisitor is affected by a Psychic Power, it may spend 1 Ruin as a Reflexive Action to make a Willpower Test, with bonus dice equal to the game's Tier, against the power's DN. If successful, the power has no effect on the Inquisitor.

determination: Refractor Field. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6. The Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: NAVIS ARMSMAN
description: Well-trained, well-drilled and well-equipped, the Armsmen of Imperial Navy Breacher kill teams are formidable troops in the close confines of ship-to-ship combat. Any foe they cannot blast aside with their powerful shotguns they hack down with vicious blows from their hatchets.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: Breach and Clear
bonuses.description: Once per round, when a Threat with this ability takes a turn, they may Seize the Initiative without spending Ruin.

bonuses.name: Void Armour
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the AP of incoming attacks by one step (i.e., from AP -1 to AP 0, or from AP -2 to AP -1).

abilities.name: Switch Ammunition
abilities.description: As a simple action, the Threat exchanges ammunition types. This removes the Spread trait from their Navis Shotguns and adds the Brutal trait. Using this action again reverses this.

name: NAVIS AXEJACK
description: Sometimes, the only solution to a problem faced by Imperial Navy Breachers is a heavy, two-handed axe. The Axejacks who carry these weapons can not only smash through blocked doorways obstacles, but they are also formidable fighters who hack apart any enemy in their way.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: Breach and Clear
bonuses.description: Once per round, when a Threat with this ability takes a turn, they may Seize the Initiative without spending Ruin.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Void Armour
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the AP of incoming attacks by one step (i.e., from AP -1 to AP 0, or from AP -2 to AP -1).

abilities.name: Wade in
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to Charge as a Ruin Action. When the Threat uses this action, their Power Axe reduces the DN penalty of a Multi-Attack by 2.

determination: Emboldened. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 3d6. If the Threat Charged during their last turn, re-roll any dice which roll failures.

name: NAVIS C.A.T.
description: Cyber-Altered Task Units are tracked reconnaissance vehicles that have served the Imperium for millennia. Fitted with pict-recording equipment and frequency scanning augurs, they can be remotely operated to provide vital tactical information for their kill team.
skills: Default 2, Awareness 4 (Passive 2)

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

bonuses.name: Simple Automata
bonuses.description: The Follower can only perform simple actions—navigating an environment, picking up or dropping off small objects—without direct instruction from its operator.

bonuses.name: Surveillance
bonuses.description: The Follower sends a constant feed of everything it sees and hears back to its operator, who may view them on a control device, or via armour autosenses or a data-tether.

bonuses.name: Tracked
bonuses.description: This Follower moves on a set of segmented tracks. It cannot jump, climb, or traverse any obstacle taller than half its height.

abilities.name: None
abilities.description: This Threat has no attacks.

name: NAVIS ENDURANT
description: Only the biggest Armsmen in a squad become known as Endurants. To them falls the task of carrying an Endurant shield and heavy shotgun while either taking point or guarding the rear of the squad. Their sheer bulk makes them highly intimidating to their enemies.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: Breach and Clear
bonuses.description: Once per round, when a Threat with this ability takes a turn, they may Seize the Initiative without spending Ruin.

bonuses.name: Breachwall
bonuses.description: A single NAVIS IMPERIALIS ally within 1m and behind the Endurant is shielded, and cannot be targeted by ranged attacks except with a Called Shot (+2 DN).

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Void Armour
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the AP of incoming attacks by one step (i.e., from AP -1 to AP 0, or from AP -2 to AP -1).

abilities.name: Navis Heavy Shotgun
abilities.stats: 10 +1ED / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 4 / Assault, Rapid Fire (2), Spread

abilities.name: Switch Ammunition
abilities.description: See Navis Armsman.

abilities.name: Disengage
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to Fall Back and move up to Speed as a Ruin Action.

name: NAVIS GHEISTSKULL
description: These servo-skulls are often made from the heads of former Imperial Navy Breachers. As a result, they are often named 'Dead Man's Revenge' or regarded as the perished soldier's 'Last Laugh' for their ability to detonate and kill all around them in a final act of defiance towards to the enemy.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Stealth 7

bonuses.name: Gheistskull
bonuses.description: Commonly used by the Imperial Navy, a Gheistskull contains a Vox Disruptor Array, and an explosive charge. The owner may make Tech Interaction Attacks through the Skull. The explosive charge can be detonated at any time the owner wishes, as a Simple Action, destroying the Skull.

bonuses.name: Iron Soul
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by abilities that target the mind and never needs to make a Resolve Test to continue fighting.

name: NAVIS GRENADIER
description: It is the life of an Imperial Navy Breacher to become very accustomed to explosions. Even more so for the Grenadiers. These Armsmen carry demolition charges designed to crack through bulkheads and sealed doors, enabling their squadmates to keep moving and reach their objectives.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Tech 7, Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Breach and Clear
bonuses.description: Once per round, when a Threat with this ability takes a turn, they may Seize the Initiative without spending Ruin.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Void Armour
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the AP of incoming attacks by one step (i.e., from AP -1 to AP 0, or from AP -2 to AP -1).

abilities.name: Switch Ammunition
abilities.description: See Navis Armsman.

abilities.name: Stun Grenade (2)
abilities.stats: No Damage / Range 16 / Blast (6), Enemies hit become Blinded and Vulnerable (2)

abilities.name: Demolition Charge (1)
abilities.stats: 16 +4ED / AP -3 / Range 6 / Blast (10). May be planted with a Tech test and detonated with a Simple action.

abilities.name: Grenadier
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to attack with a Grenade or plant a demolition charge as a Ruin Action. Thrown grenades gain the Indirect quality.

name: NAVIS GUNNER
description: The largest troops in the squad who don't fulfil the role of Endurants carry their squad's heaviest ranged weapons. A las-volley unleashes devastating salvoes, the searing heat of a meltagun shot burns through a reinforced bulkhead, and even heavily-armoured enemies cannot withstand a plasma gun.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 7, Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Breach and Clear
bonuses.description: Once per round, when a Threat with this ability takes a turn, they may Seize the Initiative without spending Ruin.

bonuses.name: Void Armour
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the AP of incoming attacks by one step (i.e., from AP -1 to AP 0, or from AP -2 to AP -1).

abilities.name: Navis Las-Volley
abilities.stats: 13 +2ED / AP -1 / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 4 / Heavy (4), Rapid Fire (2), Reliable

name: NAVIS HATCHCUTTER
description: It is vital for Imperial Navy Breachers to be able to move through enemy ships quickly to reach their objectives. Hatchcutters can not only cut through barricades with their chainfists and plasma torches, but they can also use the latter to seal shut paths the foe might otherwise use.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Tech 6, Weapon Skill 7

abilities.name: Weld Shut
abilities.description: As a Combat Action, the Hatchcutter may attempt a DN 3 Tech Test to weld a metal door shut.

abilities.name: Breach Point
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to cut through a barricade, obstacle, bulkhead, or similar as a Ruin Action.

name: NAVIS SERGEANT-AT-ARMS
description: As disciplined fighters, often with years of experience at the mast, the leaders of Imperial Navy Breacher squads are as skilled in close-quarter fighting as they are in devising battle-winning tactics on the move.
skills: Default 7, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 8, Leadership 9, Weapon Skill 8

abilities.name: Command Breach
abilities.description: The Navis Sergeant-at-Arms may spend Ruin to allow a NAVIS IMPERIALIS ally within 3m to perform a Ruin Action.

name: NAVIS SURVEYOR
description: Surveyors operate the C.A.T. units that provide vital reconnaissance for Imperial Navy Breacher kill teams, scanning ahead for threats and relaying tactical data back to the squad.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Tech 7, Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Breach and Clear
bonuses.description: Once per round, when a Threat with this ability takes a turn, they may Seize the Initiative without spending Ruin.

bonuses.name: Void Armour
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the AP of incoming attacks by one step (i.e., from AP -1 to AP 0, or from AP -2 to AP -1).

abilities.name: Switch Ammunition
abilities.description: See Navis Armsman.

abilities.name: Wayfind
abilities.description: The Surveyor uses a Simple Action, and a single CAT Unit in the scene may make an immediate normal move or take a combat action.

abilities.name: Surveillance
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin as a Ruin Action to scan around a CAT Unit. Until the Surveyor's next turn, enemies within 6m of the CAT Unit are Vulnerable.

name: NAVIS VOID-JAMMER
description: It falls to the Void-jammers in an Imperial Navy Breacher kill team to operate gheistskulls--servo-skulls fitted with an explosive device and an electro-magnetic pulse emitter. These devices can move quickly, fly through the air and navigate terrain far too dense for the Armsmen in order to reach the foe.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 6, Tech 7, Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Breach and Clear
bonuses.description: Once per round, when a Threat with this ability takes a turn, they may Seize the Initiative without spending Ruin.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Void Armour
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the AP of incoming attacks by one step (i.e., from AP -1 to AP 0, or from AP -2 to AP -1).

abilities.name: Switch Ammunition
abilities.description: See Navis Armsman.

abilities.name: Interference Pulse
abilities.description: The Void-Jammer attempts a Tech Interaction attack, determining range and target from the position of a Gheistskull in the scene.

abilities.name: Detonate
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin as a Ruin Action to detonate a Gheistskull's explosive charge, which explodes centred upon the Gheistskull's location. This destroys the Gheistskull.

name: ASTROPATH
description: Astropaths--short for Astro-telepaths--are psykers who are responsible for carrying out all of the superluminal communications that tie the Imperium of Man together using their telepathic abilities.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Psychic Mastery 9

bonuses.name: Astro-Telepathy
bonuses.description: An Astropath may spend 10 minutes entering a trance, which lets them use the Telepathy power with a basic range of 1 light year instead of 100m. Each attempt to activate Telepathy in this way inflicts 1d3 Shock.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Soul-Bound
bonuses.description: The Astropath's Conviction has been increased by +2 (included below). An Astropath is permanently Blinded but can perceive their surroundings well enough to navigate using their psychic powers.

abilities.name: Psychic Powers
abilities.description: The Astropath attempts to activate a psychic power. It knows Telepathy, Deny the Witch, Psyniscience, and up to two Telepathy, Divination, or Theosophamy powers.

abilities.name: Psychic Mastery
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to attempt to use a Psychic Power or Deny the Witch as a Ruin Action.

name: CALLIDUS ASSASSIN
description: The all-female Assassins of the Officio Assassinorum's Callidus Temple are the most subtle of the Imperium of Man's secret operatives, specialising in deceit and the use of artful deception to accomplish their objectives, usually assisted in their bloody tasks by the shape-changing Polymorphine drug.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Deception 13, Stealth 12, Weapon Skill 12

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Reign of Confusion
bonuses.description: While the Callidus still has a Stealth Score, roll 1d6 each time the PCs spend Wrath or Glory; on an Icon, add 1 to Ruin.

abilities.name: Polymorphine
abilities.description: Roll a Deception test and generate a Stealth Score from that test. The Threat is in disguise while the Stealth Score is 1 or higher.

abilities.name: Neural Shredder
abilities.stats: 4 +4ED / Range 5-10-15 / Salvo 0 / Assault, Blast (6), compare damage roll to Resolve instead of Resilience, all damage inflicted is Mortal Wounds

abilities.name: Hit and Run
abilities.description: As a Ruin Action, spend 1 Ruin to make a melee attack with a Poisoned Blade, then make a normal move without provoking Reflexive Attacks.

determination: Lightning Reflexes. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: CULEXUS ASSASSIN
description: The Culexus Temple is one of the most sinister and feared orders of the Officio Assassinorum and its Assassins have been described by the Aeldari as nothing short of pure evil. Its operatives are skull-helmed harbingers of death, nigh-invisible terrors whose merest touch can extinguish the victim's soul.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Ballistic Skill 12, Stealth 13, Weapon Skill 13

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Etherium
bonuses.description: While the Culexus has a Stealth Score, that Stealth Score increases to 7 at the start of each turn unless it was higher.

bonuses.name: Untouchable
bonuses.description: This Threat may not be affected by Psychic Powers, and any PSYKER attempting or targeting a psychic power within 7m add +4 DN.

bonuses.name: Anathema
bonuses.description: Attacks against PSYKERS and DAEMONS suffer 1 Mortal Wound for each Exalted Icon rolled on ED. DAEMONS may not roll Determination while within 7m.

abilities.name: Psychic Abomination
abilities.description: PSYKERs and DAEMONs who can see this Threat must pass a DN 5 Terror test, even if normally immune to Fear.

determination: Lightning Reflexes. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: EVERSOR ASSASSIN
description: The Eversor Temple is possibly the most gruesome weapon of the Officio Assassinorum. The temple specialises in shock and terror tactics, instilling fear of Imperial retribution in the hearts and minds of all who hold positions of power.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Ballistic Skill 12, Stealth 12, Weapon Skill 13

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Paralytic Neurotoxins
bonuses.description: A character Poisoned by an Eversor's weapons is also Restrained and suffers 1d3 Mortal Wounds at the start of each turn.

bonuses.name: Second Strike
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

abilities.name: Executioner Pistol (Needler)
abilities.stats: 8 +3ED / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 1 / Agonising, Inflict (Poisoned 4), Pistol, Silent

abilities.name: Sentinel Array
abilities.description: When an enemy moves out of engagement range--even if they Fall Back--the Eversor may make an attack against them as a Reflexive Action.

abilities.name: Bio-Meltdown
abilities.description: When slain, the Eversor remains alive until the end of its next turn, and then explodes. Eversor Explosion: 12 +5ED / AP -2 / Blast (6)

determination: Lightning Reflexes. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: VINDICARE ASSASSIN
description: Vindicare Temple Assassins are cold, calculating killers that eliminate their targets with contemptuous ease. They aim to bring inglorious death to the enemies of the Emperor with a sniper's bullet and have elevated the skills of the marksman to an art form.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 14 (Passive 7), Ballistic Skill 14, Stealth 12

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Deadshot
bonuses.description: When the Threat Aims and makes a called shot, double the number of ED gained.

bonuses.name: Stealth Suit
bonuses.description: When in shadows or cover, this Threat gains +2d on Stealth tests and +2 Defence.

bonuses.name: Special Ammunition
bonuses.description: When the Threat makes a shooting attack, they may choose one of the following. Each may only be used once. Hellfire: add Fleshbane and Mortal (d3). Turbo-Penetrator: add Brutal, and Rending (4). Shield-Breaker: add Careful and Warp Weapon.

bonuses.name: Spy Mask
bonuses.description: The Threat ignores darkness and fog and targets receive no benefit from Cover.

abilities.name: Exitus Longrifle
abilities.stats: 12 +2ED / AP -3 / Range 36-72-108 / Salvo 0 / Careful, Sniper (3), Reliable

abilities.name: Blind Grenade (2)
abilities.stats: No Damage / Range 20 / Blast (10), Gas. The cloud blocks line of sight.

abilities.name: Skirmish
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to make a Pistol or Grenade attack, then normal move as a Ruin Action.

determination: Lightning Reflexes. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: FIRE CASTE STRIKE SHAS'LA
description:
Having been bred and trained to be soldiers at birth, T'au Fire Warriors strictly follow both the Greater Good and the Code of Fire and represent the best fighters of their species. They are soldiers outfitted with a wide variety of advanced technology. As basic infantry, they are deployed in smaller numbers than other races' infantry because of the superior firepower they can bring to bear. Fire Warriors are known to be efficient, professional, but cautious fighters. Often deployed from a Devilfish APC, they can rapidly deploy and lay down withering barrages of fire against their foes. The basic team is made up of six Fire Warriors, but it is not uncommon for them to contain up to twelve including a Shas'ui team leader, as well as drone and turret support.

The Strike Team is the most common type of T'au Fire Warrior deployment. A Fire Warrior Strike Team is a high-speed detachment of shock troops who lay down sheets of withering pulse rifle fire, throwing photon and EMP Grenades, and aiming powerful tactical support turrets at a rapidly depleting foe.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5

bonuses.name: Ta'lissera Bonding Ritual
bonuses.description: Whenever this Threat attempts a Resolve or Conviction test, and rolls a 6 on their Wrath die, then the test is automatically successful, regardless of how many icons were rolled.

abilities.name: Photon Grenade (2)
abilities.stats: Damage - / Range 8 / Blast (6) / Enemies hit are Blinded until the end of their next turn

abilities.name: Relentless Fusillade
abilities.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack with its Pulse Rifle, spend 1 Ruin to add bonus dice equal to the game's Tier to the attack, and improve the AP by 1.

abilities.name: Pulse Onslaught
abilities.description: When this Threat scores a Wrath critical on a ranged attack with a PULSE weapon, the attack inflicts a minimum of 1 Wound, regardless of the target's Resilience.

mobOptions: RUIN: Turret Support - A mob of Fire Warriors which did not move may spend 1 Ruin to have a DS8 Tactical Support Turret air-dropped on their position. It does not receive a turn this Round.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: FIRE CASTE BREACHER SHAS'LA
description:
Having been bred and trained to be soldiers at birth, T'au Fire Warriors strictly follow both the Greater Good and the Code of Fire and represent the best fighters of their species. They are soldiers outfitted with a wide variety of advanced technology. Fire Warriors are known to be efficient, professional, but cautious fighters. Often deployed from a Devilfish APC, they can rapidly deploy and lay down withering barrages of fire against their foes. The basic team is made up of six Fire Warriors, but it is not uncommon for them to contain up to twelve including a Shas'ui team leader, as well as drone support.

The Breacher Team is a type of T'au Fire Warrior deployment. The Fire Warriors Breacher Team specializes in brutally effective close-range assaults, clearing buildings of threats in a tight, tactical formation and delivering sharp, shockingly sudden frontline displays of raw incendiary power that grind enemy soldiers into dust, discharging Pulse Blasters and hurling Photon Grenades until they are certain every path is clear.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5

bonuses.name: Ta'lissera Bonding Ritual
bonuses.description: Whenever this Threat attempts a Resolve or Conviction test, and rolls a 6 on their Wrath die, then the test is automatically successful, regardless of how many icons were rolled.

abilities.name: Photon Grenade (2)
abilities.stats: Damage - / Range 8 / Blast (6) / Enemies hit are Blinded until the end of their next turn

abilities.name: Breach & Clear
abilities.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack against enemies with the Blinded or Pinned conditions, the target does not receive the benefits of cover from the attack, and all ED may be re-rolled.

abilities.name: Pulse Onslaught
abilities.description: When this Threat scores a Wrath critical on a ranged attack with a PULSE weapon, the attack inflicts a minimum of 1 Wound, regardless of the target's Resilience.

mobOptions: RUIN: Turret Support - A mob of Fire Warriors which did not move may spend 1 Ruin to have a DS8 Tactical Support Turret air-dropped on their position. It does not receive a turn this Round.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: FIRE CASTE PATHFINDER SHAS'LA
description:
Pathfinders are the main scouting infantry forces for the Fire Caste of the T'au Empire. As light reconnaissance units, Pathfinder Teams are the eyes and ears of their T'au Commander in a way no T'au Drone can yet emulate.

A Pathfinder's role is not to engage the enemy, but instead to maximise the efficiency of the rest of their Hunter Cadre with their Marker Lights which designate priority enemy targets and guide the fire of their comrades. Pathfinders often operate ahead of the main body of T'au forces and close with the foe to accurately scout the enemy. In such a position, a Pathfinder's life is always under threat. For this reason and more, Pathfinders are held in high regard by the members of every T'au caste.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Stealth 4

bonuses.name: Ta'lissera Bonding Ritual
bonuses.description: Whenever this Threat attempts a Resolve or Conviction test, and rolls a 6 on their Wrath die, then the test is automatically successful, regardless of how many icons were rolled.

abilities.name: Vanguard
abilities.description: This Threat makes a normal move towards cover or concealment.

abilities.name: Photon Grenade (2)
abilities.stats: Damage - / Range 8 / Blast (6) / Enemies hit are Blinded until the end of their next turn

abilities.name: Recon Sweep
abilities.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack with a Markerlight, add a number of bonus dice equal to the game's Tier to the attack.

abilities.name: Pulse Onslaught
abilities.description: When this Threat scores a Wrath critical on a ranged attack with a PULSE weapon, the attack inflicts a minimum of 1 Wound, regardless of the target's Resilience.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: DS8 TACTICAL SUPPORT TURRET
description: DS8 Tactical Support Turrets are a type of light Drone-operated Turret used by Fire Warrior teams. They are deployed rapidly to the field carrying in racks along the flanks of Orca Dropships and most commonly are armed with a Smart Missile pod. DS8 Tactical Support Turrets are programmed to self-destruct should their sensors register that the enemy could capture or tamper with them.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 4

bonuses.name: Artificial Intelligence
bonuses.description: A drone is immune to fear, terror, and all interaction-based skills. It can only perform simple actions in accordance with its programming or instructions given by an operator.

bonuses.name: Immobile
bonuses.description: Once deployed, a DS-8 Tactical Support Turret cannot move, except to rotate its turret and sensors to face different directions.

abilities.name: Missile Pod
abilities.stats: 14 +2ED / AP -1 / Range 18-36-54 / Salvo 2 / Barrage, Blast (2), Heavy (6)

abilities.name: Smart Missile System
abilities.stats: 12 +2ED / AP - / Range 15-30-45 / Salvo 4 / Barrage, Blast (2), Heavy (6), Indirect

abilities.name: Safeguards
abilities.description: If there are no allied T'au within 5m at the end of the turret's turn, it self-destructs and is destroyed.

determination: A DS-8 Tactical Turret cannot roll Determination.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: FIRE CASTE CADRE FIREBLADE
description:
A Cadre Fireblade is the most grizzled and seasoned T'au Fire Warrior of a Hunter Cadre, whose extraordinary skill at the Fire Warrior's art of battle leads him to eschew T'au Battlesuit technology and remain as a leader of the T'au infantry. Cadre Fireblades are excellent field leaders and their long experience at war has taught them exactly where to place shots to maximise damage, and fire with pinpoint accuracy. It is on the firing line that Cadre Fireblades really comes into their own. There, they radiate a steadying calm, directing their Fire Warriors to maintain accurate fire no matter the circumstances, instilling each T'au trooper with the precision and efficiency that is the hallmark of thousands of Terran years of martial training.

Whether breaking the impetus of an advancing horde of Ork Greenskins or seeking to bring down the heavily armoured Space Marines of the Imperium, no one knows a Fire Warrior's strength better than a Cadre Fireblade. A Cadre Fireblade will always extol a focus upon what they believe to be the T'au's primary military strength -- overwhelming infantry firepower! Theirs is the ability to drive and direct Fire Warriors as they pour volley after volley of merciless pulse fire onto the target.

Experts in the standard Fire Caste tactical doctrine as laid down in the Code of Fire, Cadre Fireblades will also instruct all warriors nearby to fight closely together, with each member of a team doing his utmost to protect not just his comrades, but also nearby teams in his cadre. All teams then provide mutual support on the battlefield when the enemy launches a major assault, helping to annihilate the foe with mutually reinforcing fields of overlapping firepower.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 9, Leadership 8

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 3 Personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Ta'lissera Bonding Ritual
bonuses.description: Whenever this Threat attempts a Resolve or Conviction test, and rolls a 6 on their Wrath die, then the test is automatically successful, regardless of how many icons were rolled.

bonuses.name: Target Sighted
bonuses.description: At the start of the Threat's turn, it may select a single Mob of [SEPT] FIRE CASTE Troops within 9m. That mob may re-roll all dice which roll 1 on their next ranged attack.

bonuses.name: Volley Fire
bonuses.description: When allied [SEPT] FIRE CASTE Troops make a ranged attack with a PULSE weapon within 6m of this Threat, each Exalted Icon rolled on the attack allows one additional die to be rolled. These additional dice cannot themselves grant extra dice.

abilities.name: Photon Grenade (2)
abilities.stats: Damage - / Range 16 / Blast (6) / Enemies hit are Blinded until the end of their next turn

abilities.name: Pulse Onslaught
abilities.description: When this Threat scores a Wrath critical on a ranged attack with a PULSE weapon, the attack inflicts a minimum of 1 Wound, regardless of the target's Resilience.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: T'AU DRONE
description:
A Tau Drone (Kor'vesa in the Tau language, meaning "flying helper") is a form of artificial intelligence extensively utilised by the Tau Empire for a variety of combat and non-combat purposes. The mobile variants of Tau Drones exist in the form of sleek disk-shaped machines which are well-armoured and equipped with small anti-gravitic engines and manoeuvring jet-thrusters so that they can hover and skim across the ground. As they hover over landscapes, rotating back and forth, their sensor vane constantly transmits vital information about their surroundings.

These types of Drones are commonly seen alongside the warriors of the Fire Caste, but similar designs can be found buzzing through the streets and skies of any T'au settlement. Although small and innocuous, those foes that underestimate Tau Drones often pay for such a costly mistake with their lives. In addition, Drone intelligences can also be found built into a great number of technologies developed by the Tau Earth Caste, giving a simple synthetic intellect to a wide array of devices.

There are many different types of Drones utilised by the Tau in varying roles; these can range from mundane civilian uses to multiple combat roles. Tau Drones can carry a wide variety of equipment, ranging from defensive Shield Generators to offensive weaponry, communications equipment, and various combat support systems. Most Tau Drones can interact with their Tau masters, obeying simple instructions and even anticipating what duties are required of them. The Tau value their Drones, and whilst they are not regarded as having equal status to a Tau, they are treated with a degree of respect akin to that of a favoured animal companion amongst humans.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 4 (Passive 2)

bonuses.name: Artificial Intelligence
bonuses.description: A drone is immune to fear, terror, and all interaction-based skills. It can only perform simple actions in accordance with its programming or instructions given by an operator.

abilities.name: Saviour Protocols
abilities.description: When a friendly T'AU EMPIRE model within 3m would suffer a wound, this Threat may spend 1 Ruin to intercept the attack and suffer the wound instead. The Drone then rolls Determination as normal.

determination: Roll 4d6. A drone may only roll Determination when using Saviour Protocols.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: FIRE CASTE TEAM LEADER SHAS'UI
description:
When a Fire Warrior is old enough, he or she enters service as a Shas'la, or line trooper. After four years 'on the line', each Fire Warrior then undertakes the Trial by Fire. If they pass this ancient ritual (which varies depending on sept), they are fit to become a Shas'ui, who are able to pilot Battlesuits. Team leaders are Shas'ui who have chosen to remain with their teams, or to lead teams of younger T'au, rather than becoming battlesuit pilots. This time spent in a leadership role is considered extremely valuable, for it places the future of the T'au way above personal advancement.

One member of a team of Shas'la will normally be the Shas'ui Team Leader. They modify their profile as follows:
skills: Default 4, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 5, Leadership 6

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 Personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Ta'lissera Bonding Ritual
bonuses.description: Whenever this Threat attempts a Resolve or Conviction test, and rolls a 6 on their Wrath die, then the test is automatically successful, regardless of how many icons were rolled.

bonuses.name: Team Leader
bonuses.description: When this Threat uses the Relentless Fusillade, Breach and Clear, or Recon Sweep ability, it also affects a single mob or up to 6 allies, who must also possess that ability.

abilities.name: Photon Grenade (2)
abilities.stats: Damage - / Range 8 / Blast (6) / Enemies hit are Blinded until the end of their next turn

abilities.name: Relentless Fusillade
abilities.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack with its Pulse Rifle, spend 1 Ruin to add bonus dice equal to the game's Tier to the attack, and improve the AP by 1.

abilities.name: Pulse Onslaught
abilities.description: When this Threat scores a Wrath critical on a ranged attack with a PULSE weapon, the attack inflicts a minimum of 1 Wound, regardless of the target's Resilience.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: FIRESIGHT MARKSMAN SHAS'LA
description:
Ensconced in cover far from the front lines of battle, a Firesight Marksman scans the battlefield, using advanced optical sights to select prime targets. Above him float the rest of his team—a group of Sniper Drones, each of them equipped with an underslung Longshot Pulse Rifle. The Longshot Pulse Rifle is a lethal weapon that can send its plasma pulse over a great distance. A well-placed shot is capable of taking out any target, and there are many accounts of Sniper Drone Teams single-handedly throwing enemy forces into disarray with their ability to rain down sniper fire from long range or clear skies. As a result, Sniper Drone Teams are a deadly addition to any cadre as they are adept at picking off enemy leaders or eliminating key infantrymen, such as those carrying heavy weapons.

Although the Sniper Drones are equipped with impressive artificial intelligence, it is the Firesight Marksman, a Shas'la, who is the brains behind the operation. They are masked by a small stealth field generator, meaning that they can secret themselves into dense terrain where they will blend in, minimising the threat of return fire. The marksman is equipped with a drone uplink, with which they command their deadly charges, seeking out the most vulnerable quarry, and a markerlight to mark priority targets for both the drones and the rest of the Cadre.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 8, Tech 6

bonuses.name: Ta'lissera Bonding Ritual
bonuses.description: Whenever this Threat attempts a Resolve or Conviction test, and rolls a 6 on their Wrath die, then the test is automatically successful, regardless of how many icons were rolled.

bonuses.name: Drone Uplink
bonuses.description: Allied DRONEs within 12m of this Threat at the start of its turn may add the game's Tier to any of their own skill ranks. Drones within that distance are not affected by the Threat Identification Protocol rule. In addition, Sniper Drones under this Threat's control add an additional +2 to their Ballistic Skill, and add the Mortal (1) trait to their Longshot Pulse Rifles.

bonuses.name: Marksman Stealth Field
bonuses.description: This Threat cannot be the target of a ranged attack unless it is the closest eligible target or within 12m of the attacker.

abilities.name: Uplinked Markerlight
abilities.description: When this Threat hits an enemy with a markerlight, spend 1 Ruin as a Free Action to mark the enemy an additional 1d3 times.

mobOptions: A Firesight Marksman has a Drone Controller and is accompanied by three MV-71 Sniper Drones.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: SHAS'UI IN XV15 STEALTHSUIT
description:
The XV15 Stealthsuit is the smallest of all the various T'au Battlesuit variants and is designed for use in operations requiring a high degree of stealth. Fire Warriors serving in a Stealth Team specialise in covert operations such as infiltration, sabotage, reconnaissance and ambush. Stealth Teams are essentially the Fire Caste's special operations units. They are the "lone wolves" of the T'au military, typically operating independently of their Hunter Cadre. Suddenly appearing, as if stepping out from nowhere, a Stealth Team unleashes a hail of gunfire to cripple or eliminate their selected targets. Theirs is a secretive way of war, as they infiltrate enemy lines, seeking vulnerable targets to destroy. In order to pass unseen into enemy territory, Stealth Teams use light-bending disruption technology embedded in their sleek Battlesuits to camouflage themselves. Additional cloaking fields deaden sound and shield them from heat-detecting sensors, allowing them to penetrate deep into hostile regions before launching precisely timed ambushes.

The XV15 Stealthsuit is designed to be worn by a single member of the Fire Caste and is the smallest of all the various Battlesuit variants of the T'au: a T'au in an XV15 Stealthsuit is hardly larger than a Fire Warrior in standard T'au Combat Armour; even though it offers far greater protection. XV15 Stealthsuits are currently being phased out of mainstream use and being replaced by the XV25 Stealthsuit.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 7, Stealth 8

bonuses.name: Battlesuit
bonuses.description: Due to advanced stabilisation systems, this Threat may make ranged attacks while in engagement range, as if their weapons had the Pistol trait. Weapons with the Blast trait may not be fired in engagement.

bonuses.name: Jump Jets (Stealthy)
bonuses.description: In addition to providing the wearer with a flight speed, this Threat may Fall Back from engagement range as a Simple Action, rather than as a Combat Action. This Threat's flying movement does not affect its Stealth Score.

bonuses.name: Stealth Field
bonuses.description: The Threat's Defence is increased by +2 (included), and the DN to observe or detect the Threat increases by +2.

bonuses.name: Ta'lissera Bonding Ritual
bonuses.description: Whenever this Threat attempts a Resolve or Conviction test, and rolls a 6 on their Wrath die, then the test is automatically successful, regardless of how many icons were rolled.

abilities.name: Vanguard
abilities.description: This Threat makes a normal move towards cover or concealment and then makes a Stealth test.

abilities.name: Silenced Burst Cannon
abilities.stats: 12 +1ED / AP - / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 6 / Assault, Rapid Fire [3], Heavy [4], Silent

abilities.name: Wall of Mirrors
abilities.description: At the start of any turn, if this Threat has a Stealth Score, you may spend 1 Ruin as a Full-Round Action to move to any location on the battlefield that is more than 9m from an enemy.

abilities.name: Sow Confusion
abilities.description: When this Threat scores a Wrath critical on a ranged attack, it may immediately move up to its Speed and attempt a Stealth test to hide.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: SHAS'UI IN XV25 STEALTHSUIT
description:
The XV25 Stealthsuit is designed to be worn by a single member of the Fire Caste and is one of the smallest of all the various Battlesuit variants of the T'au, as a T'au in an XV25 Stealthsuit is only a little larger than a Fire Warrior in standard T'au Combat Armour; even though it offers far greater protection. However, this perfectly suits the XV25's role as the preferred Battlesuit of T'au infiltrators and saboteurs. XV25 Stealthsuits are significantly smaller than the XV8 Crisis Battlesuits, and, because of this, carry less weaponry. What Stealthsuits lack in firepower, however, they more than make up for with the ability to move almost unseen by the enemy until the very last instant. XV25 Stealthsuits are a relatively recent development of the T'au Earth Caste and shares many of the same features of its predecessor in the T'au armoury, the XV15 Stealthsuit.

XV25 Stealthsuits differ from XV15 Stealthsuits mainly through the additional space provided due to the slightly larger and bulkier form of the suit. This extra space allows an XV25 to take a Battlesuit Support System to boost its combat effectiveness. Most XV25 Stealthsuits are armed with a Burst Cannon which is integrated into the suit's upper arm.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 7, Stealth 8

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: SHAS'UI IN XV8 CRISIS SUIT
description:
The XV8 Crisis Battlesuit is the mainstay general combat T'au Battlesuit utilised by the warriors of the Fire Caste of the T'au Empire. It mounts a vast array of fearsome ranged weaponry as well as a complement of technologically advanced support systems on a comparatively small and agile frame that offers the T'au pilot within exceptional protection. Of all the weapons systems employed by the T'au, the XV8 Crisis Battlesuit is easily the most distinctive and recognisable due to its reputation as an efficient and lethal weapon of war.

The XV8 Crisis Battlesuit strikes a perfect balance between offensive capability, armoured protection, speed, manoeuvrability, and utility. It is a towering T'au Battlesuit, easily twice the size of the Fire Warrior who wears it. A wonder of Earth Caste engineering, only the T'au could master the secrets of producing the dense nanocrystalline alloy that forms the thick protective armour of the XV8.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 7

T'au Flamer: 10 +1ED / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 3 / Assault, Flamer. A Crisis Shas'ui may take one of the following Support Systems, and may take additional support systems, each extra system replacing one weapon: Counterfire Defence System, Early Warning Override, Iridium Battlesuit Armour, Multi-Tracker, Shield Generator, Target Lock, Velocity Tracker.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: SHAS'UI IN XV88 BROADSIDE SUIT
description:
An XV88 Broadside Battlesuit is one of the most heavily armoured infantry units that can be fielded by the T'au Fire Caste, and as such are only worn by the most experienced of T'au veterans. Whilst similar in design to the more common XV8 Crisis Battlesuit, the Broadside sacrifices mobility and manoeuvrability to be armed with some of the most devastating weapons in the T'au arsenal. In this way, they can engage and destroy the heaviest of enemy targets. Each Broadside Battlesuit carries firepower comparable to that of a battle tank, and these incredibly resilient Battlesuits are most commonly deployed to provide punishing long ranged fire support to T'au infantry in battle.

XV88 Broadside Battlesuits are small enough to utilise cover well on the battlefield in comparison to other vehicles, which makes them ideal for supporting Fire Warriors with much needed anti-tank firepower on the frontline.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 3), Ballistic Skill 7

Twin High-Yield Missile Pods: 14 +2ED / Range 15-30-45 / Salvo 8 / Barrage, Blast (2), Mounted (Large). Twin Smart Missile System: 12 +2ED / Range 15-30-45 / Salvo 8 / Barrage, Blast (2), Indirect. A Broadside Shas'ui may take one of the following Support Systems and may take one additional support system replacing its Twin Plasma Rifles: Advanced Stabilisation System, Advanced Targeting System, Early Warning Override, Multi-Tracker, Velocity Tracker.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

description: Crisis Teams are normally led by a Shas'vre Team Leader, a veteran T'au warrior whose experience and wisdom are highly valued, though sometimes a Crisis Suit will operate as an individual, called a Monat for specialised missions. Shas'vre in Crisis Suits are often also called to serve as adjutants and bodyguards to T'au commanders; these bodyguards will not rest while their charge is in peril, and it is considered a grave dishonour for a bodyguard to survive when their charge dies.
