name: FIRE CASTE COMMANDER IN XV8 CRISIS BATTLESUIT
description:
A T'au Commander is the name given by the Imperium in Low Gothic to the two highest ranks of the T'au Fire Caste—Shas'O and Shas'el. All T'au Commanders possess the authority to lead a Hunter Cadre into combat. A T'au Commander is a hero of the T'au Empire -- he has dedicated his life utterly to the pursuit of the Greater Good. Each is wise and insightful, and an inspirational figure to his troops, whilst also being a battle-scarred warrior and a supremely dangerous foe to the enemies of the T'au.

As with most Tau Fire Warriors of the rank of Shas'vre or higher, Tau Commanders will often utilise an XV8 Crisis Battlesuit in combat. The Battlesuit is usually customised to a degree to suit their personal taste. However, due to a Tau Commander's previous experience in combat, they will be given access to "special issue" weapons, Support Systems, wargear or even prototype Battlesuits.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Leadership 11, Ballistic Skill 12

name: FIRE CASTE COMMANDER IN XV85 ENFORCER SUIT
description:
A T'au Commander is the name given by the Imperium in Low Gothic to the two highest ranks of the T'au Fire Caste—Shas'O and Shas'el. All T'au Commanders possess the authority to lead a Hunter Cadre into combat. A T'au Commander is a hero of the T'au Empire -- he has dedicated his life utterly to the pursuit of the Greater Good. Each is wise and insightful, and an inspirational figure to his troops, whilst also being a battle-scarred warrior and a supremely dangerous foe to the enemies of the T'au.

The XV85 Enforcer Battlesuit is a larger and sleeker variant of the standard XV8 Crisis Battlesuit that provides better protection and joint movement for the pilot and can mount additional support systems or weapons due to its more powerful reactor. It is produced in limited numbers and is issued almost exclusively to T'au Commanders. The XV85 is favoured by many as its distinctive design allows allies and enemies alike to quickly identify its wearer as a warrior to be feared and respected.

name: FIRE CASTE COMMANDER IN XV86 COLDSTAR BATTLESUIT
description:
A T'au Commander is the name given by the Imperium in Low Gothic to the two highest ranks of the T'au Fire Caste—Shas'O and Shas'el. All T'au Commanders possess the authority to lead a Hunter Cadre into combat. A T'au Commander is a hero of the T'au Empire -- he has dedicated his life utterly to the pursuit of the Greater Good. Each is wise and insightful, and an inspirational figure to his troops, whilst also being a battle-scarred warrior and a supremely dangerous foe to the enemies of the T'au.

The XV86 Coldstar Battlesuit is a variant of the XV85 Enforcer. Made for Tau Commanders, the XV86 is covered in fins which streamline it, allowing super-fast movement across the theatre of battle, annihilating enemies with sharp shocks from its burst cannon. The on-board Holophoton Countermeasures and telemetry suites feed the Coldstar and its Commander pilot a massive variety of information that would overwhelm the untrained mind - instead, in this case, it allows the Coldstar Battlesuit to soar over its foes with a grace that enemy targeting systems simply cannot hope to catch.

name: ETHEREAL CASTE ADVISOR
description:
An Ethereal is a member of the fifth caste of the T'au species, forming a ruling elite above the Fire, Earth, Air, and Water Castes that make up the bulk of the T'au population. Known as the Aun in the T'au Language, their name translates variously as the "Celestial" or "Ethereal Caste." Though their numbers are small compared to the other castes, the Ethereals are the rulers of the T'au Empire, and command near total authority and loyalty from every other T'au. Born to counsel, advise and steer their comrades towards the chosen path, the Ethereals embody the roles of royalty and the priesthood, and the deference paid to them is the closest thing to mysticism in T'au society.

For weighty decisions, a wise Ethereal will take counsel from the senior members of each caste, although ultimate sovereignty falls upon him and him alone. The Ethereals find themselves in a binding role -- guiding the other castes to work together for the Greater Good. Their unique role is a combination of spiritual and political command, and their declarations shape and steer every facet of the T'au Empire in an indisputably complete way. An Ethereal must be a consummate leader and motivator in every way: pushing the Earth Caste for more practical innovations, setting firm negotiation goals for the Water Caste to strive for, giving perimeters to the great fleets of the Air Caste and directing the sometimes-overzealous aggression of the Fire Caste.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Leadership 11, Persuasion 11, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 4 Personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Failure is Not an Option
bonuses.description: T'AU EMPIRE Threats within 12m of an Ethereal may use the Ethereal's Resolve and Conviction instead of their own.

bonuses.name: Inspire to Greatness
bonuses.description: At the start of the Threat's turn, it may select a single Mob of T'AU EMPIRE Troops within 9m, or up to 8 individual T'AU EMPIRE Threats. On their next turn, the selected Threats may re-roll a number of dice on their skill tests equal to the game's Tier.

abilities.name: Invocations of the Ethereals
abilities.description: As a Combat Action, an Ethereal may attempt a Persuasion test (DN 3) to perform an invocation. Invocations available: Storm of Fire, Sense of Stone, Power of Tides, Unifying Mantra, Zephyr's Grace. Attempting an Invocation inflicts 1d3 Shock on the Ethereal. The invocations remain in effect until the start of the Ethereal's next turn, but for each Exalted Icon rolled on this test, this duration is extended by one round. If a Wrath Critical is scored on an Invocation, the Ethereal suffers no Shock.

abilities.name: Shame
abilities.description: All T'AU EMPIRE Threats within 12m of the Ethereal when he dies must immediately attempt a Resolve test or be Pinned.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: EARTH CASTE WORKER FIO'LA
description:
The T'au Earth Caste is primarily made up of farmers, labourers, and technicians responsible for building the machines, cultivating the food, and erecting the dwellings that allow the T'au to survive. The Earth Caste also includes artisans, scientists, and engineers. The sophisticated machinery and technology that drive the T'au Empire are created by the foremost minds of the Earth Caste, including the legendary XV8 Crisis Battlesuit. The T'au of the Earth Caste are stouter of build than the normal T'au phenotype and tend to have calloused hands and a pragmatic outlook on life.

The Fio'la, or Worker, rank perform the routine and day-to-day labours required to maintain T'au infrastructure and technology. They are, however, not quite the same as the ordinary working masses found on Imperial worlds. Even the least of the Earth caste are practitioners of skilled trades, operating as part of work crews, labour guilds, etc., while drones perform the unskilled labour.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Tech 6

bonuses.name: Ta'lissera Bonding Ritual
bonuses.description: Whenever this Threat attempts a Resolve or Conviction test, and rolls a 6 on their Wrath die, then the test is automatically successful, regardless of how many icons were rolled.

abilities.name: Field Repairs
abilities.description: The Threat attempts to repair a DRONE, BATTLESUIT or T'AU EMPIRE Vehicle within 1m. This requires a Tech test with a DN of 3. Success restores 1 Wound, plus one additional Wound per Exalted Icon shifted.

abilities.name: Collaborative Effort
abilities.description: When this Threat makes a Tech or Medicae test, a number of EARTH CASTE allies equal to the game's Tier may assist, each one adding +2 dice to the test.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: AIR CASTE PILOT KOR'LA
description:
The Air Caste of the T'au traditionally functioned as messengers, but now fill the ranks of the T'au Protection Fleet (the Kor'vattra) and the T'au Merchant Fleet, working as pilots and starship crews. The Air Caste lives almost entirely off-world, and due to their constant exposure to zero and low-gravity environments have developed long, slender limbs and hollow bones and so possess a skeletal and muscular structure of reduced strength compared to the T'au genetic baseline.

Air caste pilots are amongst the few T'au outside the Fire caste who routinely engage in combat, though this is normally done from within the cockpit of an aircraft or within a voidship, rather than face-to-face on the battlefield as with the Fire caste. Nevertheless, boarding actions and crash-landings do necessitate that some Air caste pilots receive personal defence training and carry sidearms for protection.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 6, Pilot 6

bonuses.name: Void-Dweller
bonuses.description: The Threat ignores any difficulty increases caused by low- or zero-gravity environments. However, they suffer 1 Mortal Wound immediately upon a Complication on any Athletics test in normal gravity.

abilities.name: Three-Dimensional Awareness
abilities.description: When this Threat succeeds at a Pilot test while operating a FLYER, they may spend 1 Ruin as a Free Action. This adds +2 to the vehicle's Defence until the start of the Threat's next turn.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: WATER CASTE ENVOY POR'UI
description:
The T'au Water Caste is made up of merchants, diplomats, and administrators. They are responsible for maintaining effective interaction between the castes, as well as communicating with and supervising the integration of alien species into the T'au Empire. The Water Caste are consummate diplomats, manipulators and fences, able to procure a rare plasma weapon for a handful of Kroot toenail clippings or talk a drug-crazed mutant into quiet subservience before convincing it to savagely assault its former master.

Members of the Water Caste tend to be taller and more slender than other T'au, and their features are softer and more expressive. Water Caste T'au will frequently adopt the mannerisms and other cultural habits of the intelligent races they deal with, although this is often done to promote communication with these other species.

Water Caste members are bureaucrats, politicians, negotiators, and administrators. They are the merchants and diplomats of the T'au Empire, moving in and around the other castes to ensure that T'au society functions smoothly, always in the service of the Greater Good.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Insight 8, Persuasion 8

bonuses.name: Polyglot Hedron
bonuses.description: The Envoy carries an advanced translation device and is considered to speak and understand any relevant languages.

abilities.name: Silver Tongued
abilities.description: When this Threat rolls a 6 on their Wrath die when performing an Interaction Attack or other Interaction test, any future Interaction tests against the same target during this scene gain +2 dice.

abilities.name: Holographic Projector
abilities.description: The Envoy carries a holographic projector unit, which can project a lifelike hologram of others (such as a message from the Envoy's superior), or any other pre-recorded image. In combat, as an action, the Envoy can spend 1 Ruin to make an Interaction Attack which affects a number of enemies equal to the game's Tier.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: KROOT CARNIVORE
description:
The Kroot are a species of savage humanoids who are a member species of the T'au Empire who evolved from avian creatures. Kroot are tall aliens (a good half-meter taller than most humans), their avian ancestry giving them a bird-like beak and long quills protruding from their heads like hair. Smaller quills, possibly the evolutionary remnants of feathers, can be found scattered over their bodies.

A unique feature of the Kroot is that they evolve by selecting traits of their defeated foes to absorb by eating them. Due to this, the many Kroot warbands across the galaxy often look radically different. Kroot leaders are known as Shapers; they are generally the Kroot with the best ability for recognizing desirable traits in defeated foes and tell his Kindred (the word for a Kroot clan) what to eat to suit the task at hand.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Survival 6, Stealth 6, Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Arboreal
bonuses.description: This Threat ignores difficult terrain in forests and jungles and can climb at full Speed. In a forested environment, they add a +2d bonus to all Survival and Stealth tests.

bonuses.name: Keen Senses
bonuses.description: Kroot may re-roll 1s on all Awareness and Survival tests.

bonuses.name: Stealthy Hunters
bonuses.description: When this Threat is within cover, it adds +1 to its Defence and +1d to Stealth tests.

abilities.name: Ambush Predators
abilities.description: The Threat moves up to its Speed.

abilities.name: Feast
abilities.description: The Kroot stops to devour raw, bloody chunks of a foe it has just slain. This restores all lost Shock, and for the remainder of the scene, the Kroot adds +2d to all Determination rolls.

abilities.name: A Well-Laid Trap
abilities.description: When an enemy within 12m attempts the Charge action, before the enemy moves, the Kroot may spend 1 Ruin as a Reflexive Action. The Kroot may immediately make a Charge move of their own against the charging enemy, adding an additional +2d to their attack.

mobOptions: PACK HUNTERS: A mob of Kroot Carnivores adds +2 ED to the damage of their attacks against surprised enemies.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: KROOT SHAPER
description:
Shapers command kindreds of Kroot on the field of battle and perform most of the functions associated with interaction with other groups such as the T'au. However, more significantly, they play a vital role within Kroot society which shapes the fate of the entire species.

The Kroot have at some distant point in their past gained the ability to absorb the genetic characteristics of their prey, inheriting many of their physiological and anatomical features. This is achieved by way of the Kroot's unique DNA, which is able to store far more information than that of other species, allowing them to incorporate useful DNA strands into their own genotype in Lamarckian fashion.

It is the task of the Shaper to oversee this process. Shapers have the instinctive ability to sample and analyse the genetic characteristics of any creature they eat. They are able to isolate the prey's DNA so that it does not corrupt their own and interpret which of its characteristics might be favourable to Kroot evolution and which might be detrimental.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Medicae 7, Survival 8, Stealth 8, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Arboreal
bonuses.description: This Threat ignores difficult terrain in forests and jungles and can climb at full Speed. In a forested environment, they add a +2d bonus to all Survival and Stealth tests.

bonuses.name: Keen Senses
bonuses.description: Kroot may re-roll 1s on all Awareness and Survival tests.

bonuses.name: Stealthy Hunters
bonuses.description: When this Threat is within cover, it adds +1 to its Defence and +1d to Stealth tests.

bonuses.name: The Shaper Commands
bonuses.description: Allied KROOT within 6m of this Threat may re-roll any dice which roll a 1 on their attacks.

bonuses.name: Wisest of Their Kind
bonuses.description: Allied KROOT within 12m of the Shaper may use the Shaper's Resolve and Conviction instead of their own. Further, no Kroot will consume the flesh of a creature if the Shaper has decreed it forbidden.

abilities.name: Ambush Predators
abilities.description: The Threat moves up to its Speed.

abilities.name: Feast
abilities.description: The Kroot stops to devour raw, bloody chunks of a foe it has just slain. This restores all lost Shock, and for the remainder of the scene, the Kroot adds +2d to all Determination rolls.

mobOptions: A Kroot Shaper may replace their Shaper Kroot Rifle with a Pulse Rifle. They may replace their Ritual Blade with a Kroot Pistol and Grenade Belt. Pulse Rifle: 12 +1ED / AP -1 / Range 18-36-54 / Salvo 2 / Rapid Fire (1). Kroot Pistol: 12 +1ED / AP -1 / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 1 / Pistol. Grenade Belt: 12 +4ED / AP -1 / Range 20 / Salvo - / Blast (8). If a Kroot Shaper kills with a Ritual Blade, all KROOT within 6m automatically succeed at Resolve tests until the end of their next turn.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: KROOT HOUND
description:
Kroot Hounds are an evolutionary dead end of the Kroot species, xenos who are allied with the T'au Empire. They are quadrupedal, canine-like Kroot who excel at running down prey. They are the size of a large dog, with a series of sensory quills running along their spine. They have wiry frames, just like the related humanoid Kroot species, and possess a toughness that belies their apparent fragility.

Kroot Hounds are capable enough to fight enemies larger and stronger than themselves. They are usually deployed in packs and can have a Kroot Shaper amongst them to boost their fighting spirit. Using their agility, sharp claws, and powerful jaws, they are able to wound or kill almost any opponent. Kroot Hounds are ferocious in battle and are notoriously bad-tempered as beasts.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Survival 6, Stealth 6, Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Arboreal
bonuses.description: This Threat ignores difficult terrain in forests and jungles and can climb at full Speed. In a forested environment, they add a +2d bonus to all Survival and Stealth tests.

bonuses.name: Keen Senses
bonuses.description: Kroot may re-roll 1s on all Awareness and Survival tests.

bonuses.name: Stealthy Hunters
bonuses.description: When this Threat is within cover, it adds +1 to its Defence and +1d to Stealth tests.

bonuses.name: The Scent of Blood
bonuses.description: Kroot Hounds add +2d to Awareness and Survival tests to detect or track wounded creatures and add +2 to their Speed when they charge a wounded creature.

abilities.name: Ambush Predators
abilities.description: The Threat moves up to its Speed.

abilities.name: Feast
abilities.description: The Kroot Hound stops to devour raw, bloody chunks of a foe it has just slain. This restores all lost Shock, and for the remainder of the scene, the Kroot adds +2d to all Determination rolls.

mobOptions: PACK HUNTERS: A mob of Kroot Hounds adds +2 ED to the damage of their attacks against surprised enemies.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: KROOTOX
description:
Krootox are the result of a dead-end branch of Kroot evolution, but like the Kroot Hound they are used by their humanoid cousins' mercenary forces as fire support weapons. If not for the Kroot using them as beasts of war, the Krootox might have died out generations ago, but instead, they are a common sight all over the T'au Empire and beyond.

In battle a Krootox is used as a primitive mobile weapons platform. The Kroot latch a saddle to the back of the Krootox and are guided by a single Kroot rider. A Kroot Gun, effectively a larger version of the Kroot staff rifle, is mounted on the shoulder of the Krootox as a heavy weapon.

Krootox are most commonly seen individually accompanying a small group of Kroot warriors on the frontline, providing cover fire for the Kroot to advance under and close with the enemy.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Survival 6, Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Arboreal
bonuses.description: This Threat ignores difficult terrain in forests and jungles and can climb at full Speed. In a forested environment, they add a +2d bonus to all Survival and Stealth tests.

bonuses.name: Keen Senses
bonuses.description: Kroot may re-roll 1s on all Awareness and Survival tests.

bonuses.name: Krootox Rider
bonuses.description: A Krootox is ridden by a Kroot Carnivore. The Krootox and Rider take a single shared turn in combat, with one set of actions between them. The Rider may be targeted separately with a Called Shot, requiring +2 DN. If the rider is slain, the Krootox becomes Frenzied, and can only be calmed by another Kroot.

bonuses.name: The Scent of Blood
bonuses.description: Kroot Hounds add +2d to Awareness and Survival tests to detect or track wounded creatures and add +2 to their Speed when they charge a wounded creature.

abilities.name: Ambush Predators
abilities.description: The Threat moves up to its Speed.

abilities.name: Feast
abilities.description: The Krootox stops to devour raw, bloody chunks of a foe it has just slain. This restores all lost Shock, and for the remainder of the scene, the Kroot adds +2d to all Determination rolls.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: VESPID STINGWING
description:
The Vespid are a unique race of insect-like aliens who are members of the T'au Empire. In the T'au Language, they are called "Mal'kor." This derives from the T'au words for insect, "Mal," and air, "Kor." The soldiers of the Imperium of Man often refer to them as "Stingwings." The Vespids' homeworld is a gas giant also called Vespid, three light years to the galactic south of the T'au's D'yanoi Sept.

The Vespid Stingwings are Vespid auxiliary troops that serve alongside their Fire Caste and Kroot allies in the military forces of the T'au Empire in pursuit of the Greater Good. The Vespid provide auxiliary troops to T'au armies, who value them for their skill at negotiating dangerous ground at high speed.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Survival 6, Stealth 6, Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: Insectile Communication
bonuses.description: Vespid cannot speak or understand any languages other than their own, and thus cannot be affected by any abilities which rely on a common language.

bonuses.name: Multispectral Sight
bonuses.description: Vespid may re-roll all failures on Awareness tests and ignore DN increases due to darkness.

abilities.name: Rain of Fire
abilities.description: When this Threat fires its Neutron Blaster as part of a Sprint move, spend 1 Ruin to ignore the normal DN increase, and re-roll any dice on the attack which are failures.

mobOptions: Strain Leader: One Vespid within any group is a Strain Leader, who receives the following additional rules. COMMUNION HELM: The Wearer can understand the language of the T'au and can convey T'au speech to other Vespid nearby. The Wearer, and all Vespid within 12m, add +3 to their Conviction and Resolve. TEAM LEADER: When the Strain Leader uses the Rain of Fire ability, all other Vespid within 12m may benefit from that ability as if they had used it.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: SHAS'VRE IN XV-95 GHOSTKEEL BATTLESUIT
description:
The XV95 Ghostkeel Battlesuit is the pinnacle of T'au stealth technology, a Battlesuit created specifically for use behind enemy lines in the most gruelling conditions. These mighty Battlesuits loom several times the height of a Fire Warrior and mount a full array of repulsor jets. They are equipped with an arsenal of heavy weaponry and are supported by a wealth of high-technology hardware and counter-sensory warfare suites. XV95 Ghostkeel Battlesuits can tear apart entire armoured squadrons and massacre rank upon rank of enemy infantry in sudden ambushes.

The tactical applications of the Ghostkeel are many and varied, ranging from unleashing devastating strikes behind enemy lines to ambush-hunting alongside Hunter Cadres. XV95 Ghostkeel Battlesuits can be seen as the epitome of the T'au Mont'ka "Killing Blow" stratagem -- striking precisely where they need to with unerring accuracy and overwhelming force.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 10, Tech 9, Stealth 9

bonuses.name: Battlesuit
bonuses.description: Due to advanced stabilisation systems, this Threat may make ranged attacks while in engagement range, as if their weapons had the Pistol trait. Weapons with the Blast trait may not be fired in engagement.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 2 Personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Electrowarfare Suite
bonuses.description: When this Threat is targeted by a ranged attack, its Defence is increased by +2.

bonuses.name: Jump Jets
bonuses.description: In addition to providing the wearer with a flight speed, this Threat may Fall Back from engagement range as a Simple Action, rather than as a Combat Action.

bonuses.name: Ta'lissera Bonding Ritual
bonuses.description: Whenever this Threat attempts a Resolve or Conviction test, and rolls a 6 on their Wrath die, then the test is automatically successful, regardless of how many icons were rolled.

abilities.name: Vanguard
abilities.description: This Threat makes a normal move towards cover or concealment and then makes a Stealth test.

abilities.name: Wall of Mirrors
abilities.description: At the start of any turn, if this Threat has a Stealth Score, you may spend 1 Ruin as a Full-Round Action to move to any location on the battlefield that is more than 9m from an enemy.

abilities.name: Explodes
abilities.description: When a Ghostkeel is destroyed, roll 1d6. If you roll a 1, the Ghostkeel explodes. Ghostkeel explosion: 14 +4ED / AP -2 / Blast (10).

mobOptions: An XV-95 Ghostkeel may replace its Fusion Collider with a Cyclic Ion Raker: Cyclic Ion Raker: 15 +2ED / AP -2 / Range 18-36-54 / Salvo 6 / Mounted (Huge), Supercharge. An XV95 Ghostkeel may replace its Twin T'au Flamers with Twin Burst Cannons or Twin Fusion Blasters: Twin Burst Cannon: 12 +1ED / AP - / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 12 / Assault, Rapid Fire [3], Heavy [4]. Twin Fusion Blaster: 16 +10ED / AP -4 / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 1 / Assault, Melta. An XV-95 Ghostkeel may be equipped with an Early Warning Override or a Counterfire Defence System. A Ghostkeel has a Drone Controller and is accompanied by two MV-5 Stealth Drones.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: SHAS'VRE IN XV-104 RIPTIDE BATTLESUIT
description:
The XV104 Riptide Battlesuit is one of the latest T'au Earth Caste innovations, designed to combat the most dangerous enemies of the T'au Empire. Powered by an experimental Dark Matter Nova Reactor and equipped with an arsenal of highly advanced weapon systems, the XV104 Riptide is the pinnacle of T'au Battlesuit technology. Standing twice the height of an XV8 Crisis Battlesuit, its long, back-jointed legs hold up a heavily armoured torso that houses the Riptide's Dark Matter Nova Reactor—an experimental power generator that can be activated should the Shas'vre pilot require extra power to sustain his heavy rate of fire.

A Riptide's pilot is an elite Shas'vre—chosen to don the mightiest Battlesuit and fight for his Cadre mates; he is an exemplar amongst his peers. On the battlefield, a Riptide can jet quickly to plug gaps in T'au lines and give covering fire for its colleagues whilst shielding its allies with its armoured bulk.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 10, Tech 9

bonuses.name: Battlesuit
bonuses.description: Due to advanced stabilisation systems, this Threat may make ranged attacks while in engagement range, as if their weapons had the Pistol trait. Weapons with the Blast trait may not be fired in engagement.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 2 Personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Jump Jets
bonuses.description: In addition to providing the wearer with a flight speed, this Threat may Fall Back from engagement range as a Simple Action, rather than as a Combat Action.

bonuses.name: Nova Reactor
bonuses.description: At the start of each of the Threat's turns, it may make a DN 3 Tech test as a Free Action. If this test fails, the Threat suffers 1d3 Mortal Wounds (which cannot be ignored) and cannot use the Nova Reactor again during the scene. Otherwise, select one of the following: NOVA SHIELD: Until the start of the Threat's next turn, it may re-roll any failures when rolling Determination, and Wounds are cancelled rather than converted to Shock. BOOST: At the end of its turn, if the Threat didn't Sprint or Charge, the Threat may move up to its Speed. NOVA CHARGE: Until the start of the Threat's next turn, add +2 to the Salvo of an Ion Accelerator or +4 to the Salvo of a Heavy Burst Cannon.

bonuses.name: Ta'lissera Bonding Ritual
bonuses.description: Whenever this Threat attempts a Resolve or Conviction test, and rolls a 6 on their Wrath die, then the test is automatically successful, regardless of how many icons were rolled.

abilities.name: Heavy Burst Cannon
abilities.stats: 13 +2ED / AP -2 / Range 18-36-54 / Salvo 12 / Rapid Fire (6), Mounted (Gargantuan)

abilities.name: Branched Nova Charge
abilities.description: Once per scene, when the Threat uses its Nova Reactor ability, you may spend 1 Ruin. The Tech test is automatically successful, and two options from the list may be selected for that turn.

abilities.name: Explodes
abilities.description: When a Riptide is destroyed, roll 1d6. If you roll a 1, the Riptide explodes. Riptide explosion: 14 +6ED / AP -3 / Blast (12).

determination: Riptide Shield: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 14d6. This threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.
mobOptions: An XV-104 Riptide may replace its Heavy Burst Cannon with an Ion Accelerator: Ion Accelerator: 15 +3ED / AP -3 / Range 36-72-108 / Salvo 6 / Mounted (Gargantuan), Supercharge. An XV-104 Riptide may replace its Twin Plasma Rifles with Twin Fusion Blasters or Twin Smart Missile Systems: Twin Fusion Blaster: 16 +10ED / AP -4 / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 1 / Assault, Melta. Twin Smart Missile System: 12 +2ED / AP - / Range 15-30-45 / Salvo 8 / Barrage, Blast [2], Heavy [6], Indirect. An XV-104 Riptide may be equipped with up to three of the following: Early Warning Override, Counterfire Defence System, Multi-Tracker, Target Lock, or Velocity Tracker. A Riptide has a Drone Controller and is accompanied by two MV-84 Shielded Missile Drones.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: AUN'SHI
description:
Aun'Shi is a member of the T'au Ethereal Caste. A modest T'au hero of many battles, Aun'Shi longs for peace but is bound by duty to his comrades to wage war. Lionised by the Fire Caste as everything they believe a T'au leader should be, he is seen as a good luck charm by those Fire Warriors who have served with him. Aun'Shi is more comfortable in the company of Fire Warriors than many members of the Ethereal Caste and will frequently accompany a squad into battle.

Hailing from the proud martial Sept of Vior'la, Aun'Shi is an indomitable Ethereal whose iron will has steeled the resolve of multitudes of T'au across many frontiers. A dedicated student of the fighting arts for virtually all his life, he has a level of expertise with the Honour Blade that few T'au can match.

Thanks to his long career and many exploits, Aun'Shi is also seen by the Fire Caste as a sure sign of victory, and he is greeted everywhere he travels with many salutes and deep, respectful bows.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 11 (Passive 6), Leadership 12, Persuasion 12, Weapon Skill 13

bonuses.name: Academy Luminary
bonuses.description: While Aun'Shi is present in the scene, each time you spend a point of Ruin on an ability in a Threat's stat block, roll 1d6. On an Icon, that point of Ruin is refunded.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 5 Personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Failure is Not an Option
bonuses.description: T'AU EMPIRE Threats within 12m of an Ethereal may use the Ethereal's Resolve and Conviction instead of their own.

bonuses.name: Inspirational Defiance
bonuses.description: Allied T'AU EMPIRE Threats within 12m of this Threat automatically pass Resolve tests.

bonuses.name: Inspire to Greatness
bonuses.description: At the start of the Threat's turn, it may select a single Mob of T'AU EMPIRE Troops within 9m, or up to 8 individual T'AU EMPIRE Threats. On their next turn, the selected Threats may re-roll a number of dice on their skill tests equal to the game's Tier.

abilities.name: Invocations of the Ethereals
abilities.description: As a Combat Action, an Ethereal may attempt a Persuasion test (DN 3) to perform an invocation. See the invocations an Ethereal may attempt.

abilities.name: Shame
abilities.description: All T'AU EMPIRE Threats within 12m of the Ethereal when he dies must immediately attempt a Resolve test or be Pinned.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6. Aun'Shi may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: AUN'VA
description:
Aun'Va was the ethereal supreme of the T'au Ethereal Caste and Aun'O or head of state of the T'au Empire. He was an almost religious figure of awe for the T'au and was also known as the "Master of the Undying Spirit" to his people.

Replacing the aging Aun'Wei as the leader of the T'au Empire's governing Ethereal Council, he was said to be the oldest of the current Ethereals and it was easy to see his effect on the rapid expansion of the T'au Empire in the 41st Millennium. He sat upon the highest councils governing not just each of the T'au Septs but also the entire empire as a whole in his capacity as the T'au head of state or Aun'O.

Aun'Va stood and died as supreme Ethereal within the newly won Septs of the Third Sphere Expansion, Commander Shadowsun ever loyal at his side.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 11 (Passive 6), Leadership 12, Persuasion 15

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 6 Personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Failure is Not an Option
bonuses.description: T'AU EMPIRE Threats within 12m of an Ethereal may use the Ethereal's Resolve and Conviction instead of their own.

bonuses.name: Inspirational Defiance
bonuses.description: Allied T'AU EMPIRE Threats within 12m of this Threat automatically pass Resolve tests.

bonuses.name: Paradox of Duality
bonuses.description: Whenever Aun'Va suffers damage, reduce the number of ED on the attack by an amount equal to the game's Tier, to a minimum of 1ED.

bonuses.name: Through Unity, Devastation
bonuses.description: While an allied T'AU SEPT FIRE CASTE threat makes a ranged attack while within 6m of Aun'Va, if any of the ED roll an Exalted Icon, then the AP of that attack improves by 1 (i.e., from -1 to -2).

abilities.name: Invocations of the Ethereals
abilities.description: As a Combat Action, an Ethereal may attempt a Persuasion test (DN 3) to perform an invocation. See the invocations an Ethereal may attempt.

abilities.name: Serene Unifier
abilities.description: Aun'Va may attempt multiple Invocations as a Multi-Action, adding +2 to the DN for each Invocation after the first.

abilities.name: Shame
abilities.description: All T'AU EMPIRE Threats within 12m of the Ethereal when he dies must immediately attempt a Resolve test or be Pinned.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 3d6. Aun'Va may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: ETHEREAL GUARD
description: Aun'Va is always accompanied by two or more Ethereal Guards, who are charged with the Supreme Ethereal's protection.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Leadership 9, Persuasion 9, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: Sworn Protector
bonuses.description: When an ally within 5m is the target of an attack, this Threat may spend 1 Ruin to interpose and become the target of the attack instead, and then roll Determination against any damage received.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: COMMANDER FARSIGHT
description:
Shas'O Vior'la Shovah Kais Mont'yr aka O'Shovah or Commander Farsight is alleged to still be leading the Farsight Enclaves, although this would mean that he has lived for at least three centuries, considerably beyond the ordinary lifespan of Tau Fire Caste members. It may be that another has taken up his mantle, or that the real Commander is extending his lifespan through some technological process.

Controversial during the height of his career, O'Shovah was a highly aggressive and highly successful commander, and a master of the Mont'ka, yet his detractors saw him as wilful, reckless, and rebellious. Yet, for a time, he was one of Commander Puretide's greatest students and one of the greatest military leaders in the T'au Empire.

And then, after mysterious events on Arthas Moloch, O'Shovah broke from the wisdom of the Ethereals and struck out on his own, leading his forces to found what are now known as the Farsight Enclaves. Somehow, O'Shovah is still alive, centuries later, still bearing the strange alien blade he discovered on Arthas Moloch.

resilience.note: XV8 Crisis Battlesuit and Shield Generator: 5 AR/ *4 AR

skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Leadership 11, Ballistic Skill 12, Weapon Skill 11

Until the start of the Adversary's next turn, when the selected Threats make a ranged attack at an enemy within short range, they may re-roll any ED which roll a failure.

abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin as a simple action to select a number of Crisis Suits equal to the Commander's Intellect. Until the Commander's next turn, the affected allies may Fall Back from combat as a Free Action and may ignore DN penalties on ranged attacks up to the game's Tier.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. Commander Farsight may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: COMMANDER SHADOWSUN
description: Shas'O Shaserra, better known as Commander Shadowsun to the military forces of the Imperium of Man, and also called the "Spearhead of the Greater Good", the "True Disciple of Commander Puretide" and "Heroine of the Third Sphere Expansion", was the commander of the T'au Fire Caste's military campaign that carried out the T'au Empire's Third Sphere Expansion. After the alleged betrayal of Commander Farsight, the T'au Empire's ruling Ethereal Supreme Aun'Va selected a more-steadfast replacement to conduct the Third Sphere Expansion of the T'au Empire.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Leadership 11, Ballistic Skill 12, Stealth 12

name: DARKSTRIDER
description:
Sub-Commander Darkstrider, also known as El'Myamoto, is an unconventional T'au Pathfinder officer who has refused several promotions in order to remain with his Pathfinder comrades. Darkstrider excels in attacking from unexpected angles and using every element of the battlefield to his advantage. Though unpopular with many Tau Commanders for his borderline insubordination -- a trait unthinkable amid the traditionalist ranks of the Fire Caste -- Darkstrider always gets results.

From Gal'yth and Nep'tan to the bloody fields of the Zeist Campaign, he has led his warriors into the deadliest situations, always bringing them back alive and victorious. No matter the foe, Darkstrider uses his Structural Analyser and vast battlefield experience to spot their hidden weaknesses, then coordinates an audacious strike that will exterminate them wholesale.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 9, Leadership 8

bonuses.name: A Ghost Walks Among Us
bonuses.description: Darkstrider's Defence is increased by +2. In addition, Darkstrider adds +1 to their Speed and may move at full speed while they have a Stealth Score. These effects are included.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 4 Personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Drone Familiar Cluster
bonuses.description: Each time Darkstrider makes a ranged attack, he may re-roll a number of dice on his attack roll equal to the game's Tier, and that number of ED on the damage roll as well.

bonuses.name: Ta'lissera Bonding Ritual
bonuses.description: Whenever this Threat attempts a Resolve or Conviction test, and rolls a 6 on their Wrath die, then the test is automatically successful, regardless of how many icons were rolled.

bonuses.name: Fighting Retreat
bonuses.description: When allied T'AU SEPT FIRE CASTE Troops Fall Back while within 6m of Darkstrider, they may make a free ranged attack after they have moved.

abilities.description: This Threat makes a normal move towards cover or concealment.

abilities.name: Structural Analyser

Until the end of Darkstrider's next turn, all ranged attacks from Darkstrider and T'AU SEPT FIRE CASTE allies within 6m against the chosen enemies gain the Brutal trait.

source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: LONGSTRIKE
description:
Shas'la T'au Sha'ng of the T'au Empire, now better known as "Longstrike"—and bearing the titles of "Hammerhead Pilot," "Gunship Ace," "Titan-Slayer," "Terror of T'ros" and "Hero of T'au"—is a master gunship pilot and has quickly become the T'au Fire Caste's most heralded tank ace.

Since his first training session, he has exhibited an almost innate ability to handle a Hammerhead. With the start of the T'au Empire's Third Sphere Expansion, his skills were soon put to the ultimate test in the heat of battle.

Longstrike wears a unique experimental XV02 Pilot Battlesuit. This form-fitting prototype allows a pilot to work in tandem with his vehicle's AI by processing the cadre tactical network and incoming data quickly so that the pilot can react extremely rapidly to enemies attacking his vehicle or nearby units.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 9, Pilot 9

bonuses.name: Champion

bonuses.name: Ta'lissera Bonding Ritual

bonuses.name: Gunship Ace

bonuses.name: Targeting Array
bonuses.description: Once per turn, when Longstrike makes a ranged attack with a vehicle weapon, he may re-roll any failures on that attack.

bonuses.name: XV02 Pilot Battlesuit
bonuses.description: While Longstrike is piloting a Hammerhead gunship, there are no other crew roles in that vehicle. Longstrike increases the bonus for firing at Marked enemies to +3, and increases the Skill Ratings of the vehicle AI by an amount equal to the game's Tier.

abilities.name: Target Uplink
abilities.description: As a Simple Action, Longstrike may spend 1 Ruin and select a single T'AU SEPT Hammerhead, or a single group of up to 5 T'AU SEPT allies, within 6m. Until the start of Longstrike's next turn, when the selected allies make an attack, they add +2 dice to their attack.

mobOptions: Longstrike pilots a TX-7 Hammerhead Gunship.
source: Abundant Apocryphal Adversaries: The T'au Empire (Apocrypha)

name: CANOPTEK SCARAB
description:
A Canoptek Scarab is a small, silver, beetle-like Necron construct, about the size of a Space Marine's armoured fist. These robotic Scarabs are the most numerous and diverse of the Necrons' Canoptek machine servants. They are designed to break down organic and non-organic matter into raw energy, which can then be woven into fresh construct forms at the direction of the Scarabs' controller.

Essentially mindless feeding and replication machines of various sizes and functions, their swift, darting movements and their high-pitched chittering mimic in form and behaviour organic invertebrates but, directed by the will of a Cryptek or slaved to the more complex artificial intelligence of a Canoptek Spyder, they are capable of staggering feats of construction and destruction. It is for this latter function they are used by the Necron Lords as weapons of war -- an all-devouring tide of skittering metal launched ahead of a Necron phalanx that can break down tanks and fortifications and force an enemy to expend its firepower in frantic efforts to halt the onslaughts.

However, Canoptek Scarabs lack a true hive mind. A swarm of Scarabs has no more true intelligence than one Scarab alone—which is to say none. All they are driven by are simple instructions and even simpler instincts. Nevertheless, their highly sophisticated auto-routines and construct-patterns allow them to build Necron weapons and vehicles of immense power in a surprisingly brief time. Canoptek Scarabs are fearsome enemies in swarms due to their horrifying nature as mindless feeding machines.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Weapon Skill 6

abilities.name: Self-Destruct
abilities.description: A lone Canoptek Scarab may spend 1 Ruin when it attempts a melee attack; if the attack is successful, it inflicts 1d3+1 Mortal Wounds, and then the Scarab is destroyed and cannot benefit from Reanimation Protocols.

abilities.name: Reanimation Protocols
abilities.description: Roll 1d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 3d6. Ancient Machines.
mobAbilities: HUNGERING SWARM: This mob gains +2ED bonus melee attacks.

name: NECRON WARRIOR
description:
Necron Warriors are the primary infantry troops of the soulless, undying mechanical monstrosities known as the Necrons. They were created from the majority of the ancient humanoid Necrontyr species who agreed to be bound to the will of their Star Gods, the terrible entities known as the C'tan. The Necrontyr's consciousnesses were transferred into robotic bodies made of the living metal called necrodermis. Over a long period of time, the new unliving bodies dulled the Necrontyr's minds and their abilities to feel emotion or pleasure. Over many millennia, the ultimate outcome of this process of gradual desensitization was that the Necron Warriors became little more than soulless automatons, the warrior-slaves of the still-sentient Necron royalty and military elite who seek to rebuild their star-spanning empires across the portions of the galaxy now controlled by the "lesser races."

Hundreds of thousands of Necron Warriors form the cold heart of a Tomb World's armies. They are implacable, emotionless, and terrifying soldiers -- the inexorable emissaries of death itself. Yet on closer inspection of a Necron Warrior, aberrant details become visible that act against the image of the inevitable reaper. Its reactions, though precise, are slow. Its limbs, though strong and sleek, are pitted and corroded, covered with an oily fluid seeping from aged joints. Its movements are jerky, and every so often it struggles as corroded and eons-old engrammatic synapses misfire.

Grim and remorseless machine-creatures, each Necron Warrior carries the dimly echoed remains of a living mind bound into eternal servitude. They are implacable and ruthless killers, largely ignorant of their own nightmarish condition. But despite their shambolic gait, they are all but unstoppable; their bodies able to repair almost any harm done to them and compelled by the will of their lords, they are tireless as agents of destruction.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 8, Weapon Skill 7

name: NECRON IMMORTAL
description:
The Immortals were the favoured servants of the Necron dynasties in ancient days and now form the vanguard of their undying legions. When the Necrons first conquered the galaxy, they did so through the unfaltering and implacable onslaught of legion upon legion of Immortals. These were the very elite of the Necrontyr armies and are the true fighting strength of the Necron dynasties; hardened veterans of ancient wars born anew in tireless, undying necrodermis bodies.

Still able to think and respond with a chill echo of intelligence, their martial power remains undimmed, as does their unflagging loyalty. Within the engrammic circuitry of each Immortal, there lingers a spark of the mortal soldier he once was. Though heavily suppressed by the obedience protocols of his master, an Immortal can remember the triumph of the kill and the pleasure of humbling its foes. The transition from mortal flesh to undying alien metal has only deepened the Immortals' hatred of their enemies. Stripped of weaknesses such as remorse and pity, and bereft of any fear of death, an Immortal kills without hesitation.

For hundreds of Terran years, the Immortals were a scourge upon all who stood between the Necrons and galactic domination. Now, the Immortal legions are but an echo of what they once were, for countless trillions were destroyed in the final days of the War in Heaven. Yet billions more survived, and now wait only to be awakened from their Tomb Worlds to begin the reconquest of the galaxy for the Necrons.
skills: Default 7, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 9, Weapon Skill 8

abilities.name: Gauss Blaster
abilities.stats: 12 +1ED / AP -2 / Range 15-30-45 / Salvo (2) / Gauss, Rapid Fire (2)

abilities.description: This Threat's melee attacks gain +1 ED and AP -1.

abilities.name: Reanimation Protocols

RUIN: Disintegration Capacitors: When this Mob makes a ranged attack with Gauss Blasters, spend 1 Ruin to add the Mortal (1) trait to the weapon.
RUIN: Malevolent Arcing: When this Mob makes a ranged attack with Tesla Carbines, spend 1 Ruin to make Exalted Icons rolled inflict 1 Mortal Wound to an enemy within 6m of the initial target, instead of the normal Tesla effect.

name: FLAYED ONE
description:
Flayed Ones are twisted and ghoulish Necron terrors afflicted by an ancient infection that breeds a hunger for organic flesh in them. Flayed Ones act as specialised close combat troops. They appear from an unknown pocket dimension of their hideous kind to join the Necron armies in battle, though never by invitation from the Necrons themselves.

These loathsome creatures were once Necrontyr who managed to retain some of their original consciousness when they were transferred into their living metallic bodies of necrodermis, but were cursed with a terrible disease, manifesting a hunger for flesh that cannot be satisfied and that eventually drove them to madness.

Advancing before a Necron force, these stooped yet terrifyingly agile automatons excel at infiltrating and spreading terror like a plague within the ranks of their foes. They are quite capable melee fighters and make use of flensing blades that extend from their fingers and can flay a man alive in seconds. Thin and wiry, they habitually adorn themselves with the still-wet pieces of skin and hide they have stripped from their victims, leaving behind the skinned corpses to sow fear and confusion.

In such a state they are a terrifying sight to behold, so much so that enemy combatants lose their nerve when they see pieces of old squad-mates hanging from the undying machines approaching their lines. This is further amplified by the gloom and mist that follows them from the charnel dimensions they dwell within between battles.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Weapon Skill 9

name: HEXMARK DESTROYER
description:
A Necron Destroyer is a deranged agent of annihilation whose sole reason for existence is centred around an unshakeable yearning to quench the flames of life. A Destroyer cares not for borders or dynasty allegiance, nor does he make any distinction between the innocent and the damned -- all life is his enemy, and all living creatures are his prey. To this end, Destroyers regularly engage in modifications to their bodies that other Necrons would consider self-mutilation. In the case of the Hexmark sect of Destroyers, this takes the form of replacing their arms with precision ranged weapons, reinforcing their bodies, and replacing their original legs with a trio of blade-like limbs that allow them to scuttle through enemy forces as they fight.

Hexmark Destroyers were previously Deathmarks, master snipers amongst the Necrons, altered to be able to despatch multiple threats more quickly and easily. Emerging from dimensional oubliettes like ambush predators, they set upon their prey with each optical sensor focussed upon a single target.
skills: Default 9, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Ballistic Skill 12

bonuses.name: Hardwired for Destruction

bonuses.name: Inescapable Death
bonuses.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack, it ignores all modifiers to a target's Defence from cover or other environmental factors.

bonuses.name: Multi-Threat Eliminator

name: LOKHUST DESTROYER
description:
A Necron Destroyer is a deranged agent of annihilation whose sole reason for existence is centred around an unshakeable yearning to quench the flames of life. A Destroyer cares not for borders or dynasty allegiance, nor does he make any distinction between the innocent and the damned -- all life is his enemy, and all living creatures are his prey. To this end, Destroyers regularly engage in modifications to their bodies that other Necrons would consider self-mutilation. In the case of the Lokhust sect of Destroyers, this takes the form of replacing arms with weapons, legs with grav-platforms, and modifying heads and neural circuitry with advanced targeting systems.

The result is a single-minded killing machine able to track its quarry across any terrain and under any conditions, that quarry being any biological creature unfortunate enough to draw the Lokhust Destroyer's attention.

Ferociously quick, the most common use for Lokhust Destroyers is as mobile fire support platforms. Remaining at the forefront of the Necron force's bloody harvest, they reap a heavy toll on the enemy, the speed and ferocity of their attacks undiminished by their antiquity. Destroyers are equipped with a Gauss Cannon that is capable of extensive devastation and is especially effective against light infantry forces. Destroyers are even capable of reliably damaging light armoured vehicles. Heavy Destroyers take this obsession with destruction further, bearing heavier weapons upon bodies reinforced to bear and power them, and able to devastate even armoured vehicles.

name: OPHYDIAN DESTROYER
description:
A Necron Destroyer is a deranged agent of annihilation whose sole reason for existence is centred around an unshakeable yearning to quench the flames of life. A Destroyer cares not for borders or dynasty allegiance, nor does he make any distinction between the innocent and the damned -- all life is his enemy, and all living creatures are his prey. To this end, Destroyers regularly engage in modifications to their bodies that other Necrons would consider self-mutilation. In the case of the Ophydian sect of Destroyers, this takes the form of replacing their arms with Hyperphase blades and razor-edged claws, and their legs with whip-coil serpentine tails.

While most Necrons regard them as repugnant for their resemblance to the servile Canoptek Wraiths and reviled Flayed Ones, these murder-optimised machines are terrifyingly deadly. Tunnelling through solid Ferrocrete with the aid of dimensional displacement technology, these Destroyers burst forth to ambush and eviscerate their quarry.

A Destroyer cares not for borders or dynasty allegiance, nor does he make any distinction between the innocent and the damned -- all life is his enemy, and all living creatures are his prey. To this end, Destroyers regularly engage in modifications to their bodies that other Necrons would consider self-mutilation. In the case of the Skorpekh sect of Destroyers, this takes the form of replacing their arms with Hyperphase blades, reinforcing their bodies, and replacing their original legs with a trio of blade-like limbs that allow them to scuttle through enemy forces as they fight.

Skorpekh Destroyers favour overwhelming close-quarters violence to slaughter their victims, their large, powerful bodies whirling as they scythe through the ranks of the enemy.

bonuses.description: This Threat may re-roll all rolls of 1 on any attack it makes.
