abilities.description: A Skorpekh Destroyer is equipped with either a Hyperphase Reap-blade or a Hyperphase Thresher.

abilities.name: Extermination Protocols
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to add the game's Tier as ED to all the attacks the Destroyer makes this round.

abilities.name: Reanimation Protocols
abilities.description: Roll 3d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: CANOPTEK PLASMACYTE
description:
Canoptek Plasmacytes are subservient machines engineered to support the Necrons of the Destroyer Cult.

Their original purpose was to siphon corrupted energies and dangerous engrams from slumbering Necrons, but the Destroyer Cult have found a new use for the by-products of this process.

The energies contained within a Plasmacyte, twisted and corrupted by the cruel, malicious engrams they've extracted from dormant Necrons, can be injected into a Necron to drive them into a savage, destructive frenzy.. with only a small risk of a catastrophic failure in the Necron's systems.

Few free-willed Necrons would be willing to enter such a state, but nihilistic, hateful Destroyers find such a berserk state to be a small price to pay to see the living annihilated.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Tech 6

bonuses.name: Recall Protocol
bonuses.description: This Threat is not intended to engage in combat directly, and it will vanish into another dimension if it is more than 6m from any [DYNASTY] DESTROYER.

bonuses.name: Evasion Protocol
bonuses.description: When within 6m of one or more [DYNASTY] DESTROYERS, this Threat adds +3 to its Defence.

abilities.name: Infused Madness
abilities.description: Choose one [DYNASTY] DESTROYER within 3m. That [DYNASTY] DESTROYER suffers 1d3 Mortal Wounds and becomes Frenzied.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 3d6. Ancient Machines.

name: DEATHMARK
description:
A Deathmark is one of the highly skilled snipers and assassins of the Necron forces, appearing from apparently nowhere and striking with terrible precision. The name is fitting, for once given the "hunter's mark", a Deathmark's targets are almost certain to meet their deaths scant moments later. Like most Necrons, the Deathmarks' technology lies far beyond the realm of human comprehension and they can effectively phase in and out of normal space-time at will.

Their victims will assume that they have been ambushed and that the Deathmarks teleported onto the battlefield. The reality is that they were already there, waiting out of phase for just the right moment to slaughter their victims. Few enemy commanders encounter Deathmarks and live to tell the tale.

In appearance, Deathmarks are more akin to Necron Immortals in the craftsmanship of their mechanical bodies. They are distinguished by a single, large green-glowing optic sensor and the arcane orbs projecting from their spines. These orbs flare with an unnatural light as a Deathmark utilises its occult powers. In keeping with their role, Deathmarks display a propensity for stealth that is all but unique amongst the Necron ranks.
skills: Default 9, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Ballistic Skill 12

abilities.name: Hunter's Mark
abilities.description: The Threat marks one character it can see. This mark is invisible to everyone but the Threat, who can perceive it over any distance or through any obstacle. The mark fades after an hour or when the target is dead. Against a marked target, a Deathmark adds +4d to Awareness tests, and adds +3 ED to the damage of its attacks.

abilities.name: Synaptic Disintegrator
abilities.stats: 12 +1ED / AP -2 / Range 18-36-54 / Salvo (0) / Agonizing, Heavy (6), Sniper (2), Mortal (1)

abilities.name: Hyperspace Hunter
abilities.description: As a Ruin Action, the Threat may emerge from their dimensional oubliette, appearing anywhere on the battlefield. Regain 1 Ruin to have the Threat vanish, returning to that dimension.

abilities.name: Reanimation Protocols
abilities.description: Roll 1d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. Ancient Machines.

name: LYCHGUARD
description:
The Lychguard are the elite protectors and emissaries of the Necron nobility. In order to serve as a bulwark against those who would harm their charges, Lychguard were gifted with the highest quality living metal necrodermis bodies, equal in resilience and power to those inhabited by the Necron Lords and Overlords they protect. Lychguard are tall and broad, larger even than Immortals; as befits their status, Lychguard are marked out with tall crests or headdresses and often wear segmented metal tabards or capes.

In addition to serving as wardens, Lychguard often act as messengers and envoys for their masters. To better serve in this capacity, the personality and intellect of the Lychguard was preserved through the process of bio-transference to a much greater extent than the Necron rank-and-file. As with other Necrons, the Lychguard fulfil the same roles following the transfer of their consciousness into their undying form as they did in life, though the capability for disobedience has been removed.
skills: Default 9, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Weapon Skill 12

abilities.name: Guardian Stance
abilities.description: The Threat immediately moves up to its speed to place itself as close to a [DYNASTY] NOBLE keyword as possible and between that Noble and the enemy.

abilities.name: ACTION OPTIONS: Hyperphase Sword
abilities.description: A Lychguard may replace its Warscythe with a Hyperphase Sword and a Dispersion Shield.

abilities.name: Dispersion Shield
abilities.description: A Lychguard with a Dispersion Shield adds 2 to its Defence and Resilience, and it may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

abilities.name: Guardian Protocols
abilities.description: When an attack targets a [DYNASTY] NOBLE keyword within 6m, this Threat may spend 1 Ruin and use its Reflexive Action to become the target instead. The Threat rolls Determination against that attack without spending additional Ruin.

abilities.name: Reanimation Protocols
abilities.description: Roll 2d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 8d6. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: ROYAL WARDEN
description:
Royal Wardens are the captains who oversee the legions of Warriors and Immortals who make up the bulk of each Dynasty's armies. They ensure that their Lords' will is carried out, and while not blessed with the same sophisticated engrams as their masters, they retain enough initiative and judgement to command with ruthless, logical efficiency.

While they retain the capacity for independent thought, this is buried beneath layers of obedience protocols which render them unquestionably loyal.
skills: Default 9, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Intimidation 10, Leadership 11

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 2 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Relentless March
bonuses.description: [DYNASTY] NECRON Troops and Elites which begin their turn within 12m of this Threat add +1 to their Speed for that turn.

bonuses.name: Adaptive Strategy
bonuses.description: At the start of each of the Threat's turns, select one mob of [DYNASTY] NECRON Troops within 18m. That mob may Fall Back as a Simple Action during its turn.

abilities.name: Relic Gauss Blaster
abilities.stats: 12 +2ED / AP -2 / Range 15-30-45 / Salvo (2) / Gauss, Rapid Fire (2)

abilities.name: Disruption Field
abilities.description: This Threat's melee attacks gain +1 ED and AP -1.

abilities.name: Disintegration Capacitors
abilities.description: When this Threat makes a ranged attack, spend 1 Ruin to add the Mortal (1) trait to the weapon.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: NECRON LORD
description:
Only the most powerful and strong-willed of the Necron nobility had access to necrodermis bodies that were sophisticated enough to allow them to maintain their full sentience in the face of the growing dullness of their minds. A Necron Lord is a high-ranking member of a Necron dynasty's noble hierarchy and is usually placed by the dynasty's Phaeron or his own Overlord in control of an entire Tomb World. Clad in crumbling vestments and wielding ancient, arcane staff weapons, the Necron Lord is a chilling sight to behold on the battlefield as they direct their Necron Warriors in unnatural silence.

Each Necron Lord is a wilful individual with its own personality and goals. Many Lords desire to elevate their status within the Necron hierarchy, perhaps to one day rise to the position of Phaeron and rule over an entire dynasty. Others desire to expand the boundaries of their dynasty's domain through conquest.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Intimidation 11, Leadership 12

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Relentless March
bonuses.description: [DYNASTY] NECRON Troops and Elites which begin their turn within 12m of this Threat add +1 to their Speed for that turn.

bonuses.name: The Lord's Will
bonuses.description: At the start of each of the Threat's turns, select one mob of [DYNASTY] NECRON Troops within 18m. That mob adds +Tier bonus dice to all attacks it makes on its next turn.

abilities.name: ACTION OPTIONS: Hyperphase Sword
abilities.description: A Lord may replace its Staff of Light with one of the following weapons.

abilities.name: Resurrection Orb
abilities.description: Once per scene, this Threat may use its Resurrection Orb as a Simple Action. All [DYNASTY] NECRONS within 12m may immediately make a Reanimation Protocols roll, if they have that rule.

abilities.name: Resurrection Protocols
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled. Once per scene.

determination: Roll 8d6. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: NECRON OVERLORD
description: A Necron Overlord is one of the greatest and most powerful leaders of the Necron race, and the ruler of many Tomb Worlds. More powerful than even a Necron Lord, at a Necron Overlord's command are uncountable legions of Necron Warriors, terrifying war machines, and a vast array of devastating weaponry. Masterful generals and warriors, bedecked in ancient and powerful battle gear of such potency it might seem the product of magic rather than science, an Overlord's robotic body is the finest construct of its kind; armoured enough to withstand anti-tank weaponry and strong enough to crush the life from his foe with remorseless efficiency. The most powerful Necron Overlords are those that rise to the rank of Phaeron, ruling over an entire sector of the galaxy.

resilience.note: Necrodermis and Phase Shifter: 5 AR, 3* AR

skills: Default 12, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Intimidation 13, Leadership 14

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Relentless March
bonuses.description: [DYNASTY] NECRON Troops and Elites which begin their turn within 12m of this Threat add +1 to their Speed for that turn.

bonuses.name: My Will Be Done
bonuses.description: At the start of each of the Threat's turns, select one mob of [DYNASTY] NECRON Troops within 18m. That mob adds +Tier bonus dice to all attacks it makes on its next turn and may re-roll any 1s rolled.

bonuses.name: Undying Aristocracy
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's turn.

abilities.name: Tachyon Arrow
abilities.stats: 22 +4ED / AP -5 / Range Infinite / Salvo – / One Shot Only

abilities.name: ACTION OPTIONS: Hyperphase Sword
abilities.description: An Overlord may replace its Hyperphase Glaive with a Hyperphase Sword, Staff of Light, Voidblade, Voidscythe, or Warscythe.

abilities.name: ACTION OPTIONS: Gauntlet of Flame
abilities.description: An Overlord may replace its Tachyon Arrow with a Gauntlet of Fire, or with a Resurrection Orb.

abilities.name: Resurrection Orb
abilities.description: Once per scene, this Threat may use its Resurrection Orb as a Simple Action. All [DYNASTY] NECRONS within 12m may immediately make a Reanimation Protocols roll if they have that rule.

abilities.name: Resurrection Protocols
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled. Once per scene.

determination: Roll 8d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: LOKHUST DESTROYER LORD
description:
A Necron Destroyer Lord is a sentient member of the Necron elite, a former Necron Lord or Overlord, who has fallen prey to the madness of the Necron Destroyers. Even the Necron nobility are not safe from the madness that consumes the Destroyers. When a Necron Lord or Overlord succumbs, a great threat to all life is born.

While many Necron Lords and Overlords are afflicted by "eccentricities," the insanity that consumes the mind of a Destroyer Lord is something else entirely. Like other Destroyers, Destroyer Lords modify their bodies and minds, so that they might be better suited to their overarching purpose, to cleanse the stars of all life. While this most often includes the attachment of an anti-gravitic suspensor platform in place of legs, Destroyer Lords tend to forgo the ranged weaponry favoured by other Destroyers in favour of melee weapons.

resilience.note: Necrodermis and Phase Shifter: 5 AR, 3* AR

skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Weapon Skill 12

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: United in Destruction
bonuses.description: [DYNASTY] DESTROYER Necrons within 12m may re-roll all 1s rolled on their ED.

bonuses.name: Hardwired for Destruction
bonuses.description: This Threat may re-roll all rolls of 1 on any attack it makes.

bonuses.name: Repulsor Platform
bonuses.description: When this Threat makes a normal move, it may also Aim.

bonuses.name: Royal Armouries
bonuses.description: The Lokhust Destroyer Lord is equipped with a Phylactery or a Resurrection Orb:

bonuses.name: Phylactery
bonuses.description: When this Threat rolls Determination, it may roll +Tier additional dice.

bonuses.name: Resurrection Orb
bonuses.description: Once per scene, this Threat may use its Resurrection Orb as a Simple Action. All [DYNASTY] NECRONS within 12m may immediately make a Reanimation Protocols roll, if they can.

abilities.name: ACTION OPTIONS: Hyperphase Sword
abilities.description: A Lord may replace its Staff of Light with one of the following weapons.

abilities.name: Resurrection Protocols
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled. Once per scene.

determination: Roll 10d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: SKORPEKH DESTROYER LORD
description:
A Necron Destroyer Lord is a sentient member of the Necron elite, a former Necron Lord or Overlord, who has fallen prey to the madness of the Necron Destroyers. Even the Necron nobility are not safe from the madness that consumes the Destroyers. When a Necron Lord or Overlord succumbs, a great threat to all life is born.

Skorpekh Lords have fallen far from their noble beginnings, allowing an obsession with slaughter to twist their bodies and minds. Lurching forward on tripod bodies, their Enmitic Annihilators blast victims messily apart as their claws and blades lash out to reap a crimson harvest on the battlefield.

resilience.note: Necrodermis and Phase Shifter: 5 AR, 3* AR

skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Weapon Skill 12

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: United in Destruction
bonuses.description: [DYNASTY] DESTROYER Necrons within 12m may re-roll all 1s rolled on their ED.

bonuses.name: Hardwired for Destruction
bonuses.description: This Threat may re-roll all rolls of 1 on any attack it makes.

bonuses.name: Second Strike
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

abilities.name: Resurrection Protocols
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled.

determination: Roll 10d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: CRYPTEK TECHNOMANCER
description:
A Cryptek is one of the technologists and engineers of the Necron race, and they are responsible for studying and maintaining the technology of the Necron dynasties. A Cryptek's powers seem to resemble witchcraft, akin to the abilities of psykers and sorcerers found across the galaxy. However, while psykers channel the energies of the Warp to accomplish their seemingly supernatural feats, a Cryptek uses highly advanced knowledge of science and technology to manipulate the universe's fundamental forces.

Technomancers are a clade of Crypteks who specialise in repairing and augmenting Necrons in battle. They can be found marching behind the ranks of Warriors and Immortals, keeping them functional as quickly as they fall to enemy fire, or floating upon a Canoptek construct-platform that speeds them to where they are most needed. Their role is not dissimilar to the combat medics of other species, though far more efficient.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Tech 12

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions, and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Technomancer's Regalia
bonuses.description: The Threat is armed with either a Canoptek Cloak or a Canoptek Control Node:

bonuses.name: Canoptek Cloak
bonuses.description: The Threat gains a Speed of 10 (Flight). It may also attempt a Tech test as a Simple Action to heal 1d3 Wounds (+1 per Shift) to a [DYNASTY] NECRON within 3m.

bonuses.name: Canoptek Control Node
bonuses.description: While a friendly [DYNASTY] CANOPTEK unit is within 12m, it adds +2 bonus dice to all attacks.

abilities.name: Rites of Reanimation
abilities.description: As a Ruin Action, select one [DYNASTY] NECRON Troop or Elite within 12m which is currently self-repairing: that [DYNASTY] NECRON immediately returns to life with 1d3 Wounds. You may select a Mob of [DYNASTY] NECRON Troops within range instead; the Mob regains 1d3 slain members.

abilities.name: Resurrection Protocols
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled. Once per scene.

determination: Roll 6d6. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: CRYPTEK CHRONOMANCER
description:
Chronomancers are Crypteks who have mastered the manipulation of time itself. Through their cunning and artifice, they can distort the flow of time, speeding it up, slowing it down, or freezing it to hinder their foes and aid their allies. The most capable of them can splinter and fracture the normal orderly passage of time, creating deadly discontinuities that tear foes apart as their bodies age at different rates or are pulled between contradictory timelines.

Chronomancers are clad in Timesplinter mantles, defensive devices which protect the wearer in the most devious of ways. In addition to accelerating the wearer's movements, they divert incoming attacks by releasing flickering moments from alternate timelines.

They carry Chronometron devices, which allow them to shift the normal flow of time, making subtle but potent alterations to the immediate future. To defeat the enemy, they bear Aeonstaves or Entropic Lances.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Tech 12

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Timesplinter Mantle
bonuses.description: The Chronomancer increases its Defence by 2 (included above), its Speed by 3 (included below), and allows it to roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

bonuses.name: Chronometron
bonuses.description: At the start of the Threat's turn, select one [DYNASTY] NECRON Mob, or a number of [DYNASTY] NECRON Troops or Elites equal to the Threat's Intellect. The selected [DYNASTY] NECRONS add +1 to their Defence and +2 to their Speed.

bonuses.name: Temporal Displacement
bonuses.description: Enemies may not roll Determination against damage inflicted by an Aeonstave.

abilities.name: ACTION OPTIONS: Entropic Lance (Melee)
abilities.description: A Chronomancer may replace its Aeonstave with an Entropic Lance.

abilities.name: Resurrection Protocols
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled. Once per scene.

determination: Roll 5d6. The Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: CRYPTEK PLASMANCER
description:
Plasmancers are architects of destruction, who have learned to harness the fundamental energies of the universe and unleash them upon the enemy. Their bodies crackle with electrical discharges which lash out at any who stray too near.

Occasionally known as Harbingers of Destruction, Plasmancers can conjure and direct devastating blasts of furious energy and pulses of searing actinic radiance. Theirs is not a subtle art, for they care little for the myriad forms in which energy can be stored, contained, or employed: their only concern is unleashing it upon the foe.

The craft of a Plasmancer means that they are continually gathering a potent electrostatic charge, and thus must engineer themselves to levitate above the ground using hypermagnetic suspensors or contragravitic impellors to avoid the charge discharging into the ground needlessly.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Tech 12

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions, and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Harbinger of Destruction
bonuses.description: At the start of each of this Threat's turns, roll three d6. For each Icon rolled, inflict one Mortal Wound upon the closest enemy within 24m.

bonuses.name: Energy Manipulation
bonuses.description: Whenever this Threat makes an attack with its Plasmic Lance, it may add one of the following weapon traits to the attack: Arc, Luminagen, Melta, Rad (1), Supercharge, or Tesla.

abilities.name: Living Lightning
abilities.description: When an enemy takes a Charge action and finishes their move within 6m, or when an enemy makes a melee attack within 6m, this Threat may inflict 1d3 Mortal Wounds to that enemy as a Reflexive Action.

abilities.name: Resurrection Protocols
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled. Once per scene.

determination: Roll 5d6. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: CRYPTEK PSYCHOMANCER
description:
A Psychomancer is a Cryptek who specialises in understanding and manipulating the minds of others. Their science influences synaptic patterns and neurochemical reactions, as well as conjuring holographic phantasms which play upon the primal fears and atavistic reflexes of lesser beings.

Psychomancers are also known as Harbingers of Despair, and they are employed not only for their keen insights into the minds of the enemy, but for their ability to shatter morale and sow terror during battle.

In battle, the floating Psychomancers shroud themselves in holo-illusions and neurostatic phantasms that make them, and the other Necrons nearby, appear nightmarish spectres of death. No two individuals will see this 'nightmare shroud' the same way, for it draws upon the unique fears and basic animal dread of each viewer to shape their own personal vision of terror.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Intimidate 12, Tech 12

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Harbinger of Despair
bonuses.description: The Threat may target multiple enemies when making an Intimidate interaction attack, using the highest Resolve from amongst all the targets and adding +2DN for each enemy beyond the first. On a successful Intimidate Interaction Attack, all affected targets suffer the Fear condition, or the Terror condition if three or more Icons are shifted on the attack. These Fear and Terror conditions last only until the end of the affected characters' next turn.

bonuses.name: Nightmare Shroud
bonuses.description: While an enemy is within 12m of this Threat, they add +2DN to all Resolve tests, and suffer 1d3 Shock whenever they suffer a Complication on a Resolve test.

bonuses.name: Dread Weapon
bonuses.description: Enemies struck by an attack from the Psychomancer's Abyssal Staff reduce damage with their Resolve, rather than their Resilience.

abilities.name: Abyssal Staff (Ranged)
abilities.stats: 8 +1ED / AP – / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 3 / Assault, Agonizing, Inflict (Pinned)

abilities.name: Resurrection Protocols
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled. Once per scene.

determination: Roll 5d6. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: CRYPTOTHRALL
description:
Cryptothralls are vaguely humanoid Necron constructs used as slaves and protectors by Crypteks. A Cryptothrall is a subservient automaton, more akin to the Canoptek constructs such as Scarabs than a true Necron, and their actions are governed entirely by engrammatic compulsions and synaptic imperatives.

A Cryptothrall's arms end in scything mono-edged blades, while their heads contain a potent energy weapon. These weapons are brought to bear against those who would attack a Cryptek without doubt or hesitation, for a Cryptothrall has no concept of such things—it is an extension of its master's will, nothing more.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 8, Weapon Skill 8

bonuses.name: Systematic Vigour
bonuses.description: While this Threat is within 6m of a friendly [DYNASTY] CRYPTEK keyword, it adds +Tier bonus dice to all attacks.

bonuses.name: Second Strike
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty by 2 DN as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

abilities.name: Defensive Stance
abilities.description: The Threat immediately moves up to its speed to place itself as close to a [DYNASTY] CRYPTEK keyword as possible and between that CRYPTEK and the enemy.

abilities.name: Protector
abilities.description: When an attack targets a [DYNASTY] CRYPTEK keyword within 6m, this Threat may spend 1 Ruin and use its Reflexive Action to become the target instead. The Threat rolls Determination against that attack without spending additional Ruin.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: TRIARCH PRAETORIANS
description:
The Triarch Praetorians are a specialised caste of Necrons who serve as the judges and enforcers of ancient Necrontyr law. They are tasked with ensuring that every Necron dynasty upholds the terms of the ancient codes of law of the Necrontyr Empire to ensure that they are never forgotten nor ignored.

Unlike other Necrons, Triarch Praetorians are not vassals of a particular Necron Lord or Overlord. As in ancient times, they possess the right to censure nobles who act against the interests or dictates of the Triarch and the Necrontyr codes of honour. From their initial creation in the eons before the War in Heaven to the end of the 41st Millennium, their task has remained unchanged, and they strive endlessly to see the Necrontyr Dynasties of old restored.

Luckily for the rest of the sentient races of the galaxy, Triarch Praetorians are a rare sight on the battlefield.
skills: Default 9, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Weapon Skill 12

bonuses.name: A Purpose Unshakeable
bonuses.description: Triarch Praetorians automatically succeed at all Resolve tests, and any effect targeting their Resolve automatically fails.

abilities.name: ACTION OPTIONS: Particle Caster
abilities.description: A Triarch Praetorian may replace its Rod of Covenant with a Particle Caster and Voidblade.

abilities.name: Judgement of the Triarch
abilities.description: When the Threat makes a shooting or interaction attack, spend 1 Ruin to add +Tier bonus dice to its attack and the next attacks of all other TRIARCH Threats within 15m.

abilities.name: Reanimation Protocols
abilities.description: Roll 2d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 8d6. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: CANOPTEK WRAITH
description:
A Canoptek Wraith is an automated robotic Necron construct that serves as the eyes and ears of the central operating system of any Tomb World, patrolling for intruders and inspecting the Necron sanctuary's ancient systems for signs of damage and decay. Its primary tool is its Phase Shifter, a Dimensional Destabilisation Matrix that allows a Wraith to phase in and out of sync with the normal space-time continuum. Though the primary purpose of this device is to allow a Canoptek Wraith to reach into and repair solid machinery, it is equally effective when used to deal with intruders who have breached the protections of a subterranean Necron stasis facility. In such a case, a Canoptek Wraith can phase its claws and tendrils inside an opponent, and resolidify them to sever arteries, nerve clusters and other vital pathways without leaving an external mark of what caused the victim's death.

While a Necron Tomb World slumbers fitfully in eternal stasis, the Necron constructs known as Canoptek Wraiths serve as its eyes and ears. They flit silently through the dusty halls of the Necron installation, patrolling for intruders and inspecting the ancient systems for damage and decay.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Tech 8, Weapon Skill 8

bonuses.name: Systematic Vigour
bonuses.description: While this Threat is within 6m of a friendly Necron with the CRYPTEK keyword, it adds +Tier bonus dice to all attacks.

bonuses.name: Wraith Form
bonuses.description: This Threat may move freely through all obstacles and terrain features. In addition, it increases its Defence by +2 (included above) and it may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

abilities.name: ACTION OPTIONS: Particle Caster
abilities.description: A Canoptek Wraith may additionally take a Particle Caster or Transdimensional Beamer, and/or replace its Vicious Claws with Whip Coils.

abilities.name: Reanimation Protocols
abilities.description: Roll 3d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. It may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: CANOPTEK SPYDER
description:
Canoptek Spyders are massive robotic Necron constructs, their immense weight effortlessly propelled by sophisticated anti-gravitic engines. Their bodies are large and rounded in the shape of a hooded carapace, to accommodate the internal systems that construct Canoptek Scarabs as needed. This is combined with their multiple limbs and many compound visual sensors which stare out from a featureless, metallic block to give an arachnoid aspect that enhances the fearful appearance of these monstrous robots.

All Canoptek Spyders have a Fabricator Claw Array that allows them to effect repairs on a Necron tomb's systems, and these also make for frighteningly destructive weapons. Unlike their Necron masters, Canoptek Spyders never sleep, but wile away the aeons servicing the structures of their Tomb World, guarding their slumbering superiors and maintaining the complex stasis machines that house them.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Tech 10, Weapon Skill 8

bonuses.name: Support Systems
bonuses.description: A Canoptek Spyder can be equipped with either a Fabricator Claw Array, or a Gloom Prism.

bonuses.name: Fabricator Claw Array
bonuses.description: The Canoptek Spyder may take a Full Action to repair 1d3+1 Wounds on a NECRON Vehicle within 3m.

bonuses.name: Gloom Prism
bonuses.description: As a Reflexive Action, if an enemy PSYKER attempts to use a psychic power, the Canoptek Spyder may attempt to Deny the Witch, but using its Tech skill instead of Psychic Mastery.

bonuses.name: Monstrous Creature
bonuses.description: This Threat is immune to the Fear, Terror, Pinned, and Staggered conditions.

abilities.name: Terrifying Presence
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Terror Test.

abilities.name: ACTION OPTIONS: Particle Beamer
abilities.description: A Canoptek Spyder may additionally take one or two Particle Beamers.

abilities.name: Scarab Hive
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin as a Simple Action to spawn a Mob of 5+Tier Canoptek Scarabs within 6m, or to add that many Scarabs to an existing Mob within range.

abilities.name: Explodes
abilities.description: When this Threat is destroyed, roll 1d6. On a roll of a 6, each creature within 6m suffers 1d3 Mortal Wounds.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 10d6. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: CANOPTEK REANIMATOR
description: Canoptek Reanimators stalk the battlefield, projecting beams that swarm with nano-scarabs that rapidly repair any Necrons they reach. They have limited armaments to defend them from threats, but their primary function is to restore and reanimate the forces they are around to support.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 7, Tech 7

bonuses.name: Monstrous Creature
bonuses.description: This Threat is immune to the Fear, Terror, Pinned, and Staggered conditions.

bonuses.name: Twin Atomiser Beams
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty of ranged attacks by 2DN, as though it had the Dual Wield Talent.

abilities.name: Terrifying Presence
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Terror Test.

abilities.name: Reanimation Beam
abilities.description: As a Simple Action, select a single [DYNASTY] NECRON mob, or a group of up to 6 [DYNASTY] NECRON Troops or Elites. Until this Threat's next turn, the selected [DYNASTY] NECRON add +1 to the result of all dice rolled for their Reanimation Protocols (i.e., 1-2 is nothing, 3-4 is one Icon, 5-6 is an Exalted Icon).

abilities.name: Reanimation Prioritisation
abilities.description: As a Reaction, when a [DYNASTY] NECRON Troop or Elite within 12m is targeted by an attack, this Threat may spend 1 Ruin, and select a [DYNASTY] NECRON Mob or up to 6 [DYNASTY] NECRON Troops or Elites, and affect them with the Reanimation Beam action (above).

abilities.name: Explodes
abilities.description: When this Threat is destroyed, roll 1d6. On a roll of an Icon, each creature within 6m suffers 1d3 Mortal Wounds.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 8d6. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: C'TAN SHARD OF THE DECEIVER
description:
A C'tan Shard is all that remains of the once mighty Star Gods of Necron antiquity. They are now only echoes of their former selves, splinters of energy that survived their Necron servants' ancient betrayal and were enslaved in turn.

The Deceiver, also known as Mephet'ran or Mephet'ran the Deceiver, is the C'tan or Necron Star God of trickery, lies, manipulation, and deception. Many millions of standard years ago, it was the Deceiver that presented himself before the ruling Necrontyr Triarch and offered the Silent King Szarekh knowledge of the biotransference process, granting the Necrontyr bodies of Necrodermis to help them fight against their ancient enemies, the Old Ones.

Despite its legendary guile, in the end Mephet'ran was betrayed and tricked like his fellow C'tan by the revolting Necrons, his essence shattered into fragments, each entombed within a Tesseract Labyrinth. However, recent, scattered events hint at the fact that one or more of the C'tan Shards of the Deceiver might still be at large in the galaxy.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 14 (Passive 7), Persuasion 16, Deception 16

bonuses.name: Bending Reality
bonuses.description: A C'Tan Shard adds 1 to Ruin at the start of each of its turns.

bonuses.name: Caged God
bonuses.description: This Threat's Resilience can never be reduced by an attack's AP.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 6 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Monstrous Creature
bonuses.description: This Threat is immune to the Fear, Terror, Pinned, and Staggered conditions.

bonuses.name: Misdirection
bonuses.description: This Threat is always considered to be in cover. This effect is included in the Threat's Defence, above.

abilities.name: Grand Illusion
abilities.description: Anyone able to see the C'Tan Shard must pass a DN5 Terror test. The C'Tan Shard then conjures illusions upon the battlefield. Select three NECRON Threats or Mobs on the battlefield; the first time a selected Threat or Mob is attacked, the C'Tan Shard may spend 1 Ruin to reveal that it was an illusion. That Threat or mob is removed from the battle and reappears somewhere else as the illusion is revealed.

abilities.name: The Deceiver
abilities.description: The C'Tan Shard makes a Deception interaction attack, which may affect multiple targets as per a Multi-Attack. The targets of the C'Tan Shard's Deception interaction attack do not have to be able to see or hear the C'Tan Shard directly, as it conjures illusions to affect them.

abilities.name: Reality Unravels
abilities.description: When this Threat is destroyed, roll 1d6. On a roll of an Icon, each creature within 6m suffers 1d3+3 Mortal Wounds.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 11d6. Living Metal. C'Tan Shards may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds, and any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: C'TAN SHARD OF THE NIGHTBRINGER
description:
The Nightbringer, known by the ancient Necron name of Aza'gorod, is one of the C'tan, and was once the mighty Star God of death, darkness, and destruction. Legends tell of the Nightbringer as the first and most powerful of the C'tan, and in ancient Necrontyr hiero-scripts it is depicted as an ever-hungering god of death, feasting upon the pain and anguish of entire species.

The Nightbringer's C'tan Shard usually manifests as a dark, towering cloaked reaper that shines with dark light, with gray and black colours like the traditional human mythological image of death known as the "Grim Reaper." It is an image that resonates deeply in the primal subconscious of many "lesser races," and all who look upon the shard feel the cold fingers of death upon their throats.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Intimidation 14, Weapon Skill 16

bonuses.name: Bending Reality
bonuses.description: A C'Tan Shard adds 1 to Ruin at the start of each of its turns.

bonuses.name: Caged God
bonuses.description: This Threat's Resilience can never be reduced by an attack's AP.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 6 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Drain Life
bonuses.description: Enemies struck by a C'Tan Shard of the Nightbringer's attacks may not roll Determination to resist any of the damage inflicted.

bonuses.name: Monstrous Creature
bonuses.description: This Threat is immune to the Fear, Terror, Pinned, and Staggered conditions.

abilities.name: Death Incarnate
abilities.description: Anyone able to see the C'Tan Shard must pass a DN7 Terror test.

abilities.name: Reality Unravels
abilities.description: When this Threat is destroyed, roll 1d6. On a roll of an Icon, each creature within 6m suffers 1d3+3 Mortal Wounds.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 11d6. Living Metal. C'Tan Shards may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds, and any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: C'TAN SHARD OF THE VOID DRAGON
description:
Mag'ladroth is named "the Void-Dragon" in Aeldari Mythology, which portrays it as a figure of oblivion, wanton destruction and devastation. It was a master of the material realm and its warriors were practically invincible during the War in Heaven.

In the final years of their Great War against the Old Ones, the C'tan were losing, overwhelmed by the psychic might of their foes. Using machineries conceived by the Void Dragon, the Necrons planned to turn the tide of the war by cutting off the Old Ones from the source of their psychic power: they would forever separate realspace from the Warp with an unbreakable barrier.

The Void Dragon was eventually shattered into shards and enslaved by the Necrons. There may be a connection between this entity and the Dragon of Mars, which was imprisoned beneath the surface of Mars by the Emperor of Mankind before the Age of Strife.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Tech 14, Ballistic Skill 14, Weapon Skill 14

bonuses.name: Bending Reality
bonuses.description: A C'Tan Shard adds 1 to Ruin at the start of each of its turns.

bonuses.name: Caged God
bonuses.description: This Threat's Resilience can never be reduced by an attack's AP.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 6 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Matter Absorption
bonuses.description: When this Threat destroys a Vehicle, then until the start of its next turn it does not need to spend Ruin to roll Determination, and it may re-roll any dice which roll 1.

bonuses.name: Monstrous Creature
bonuses.description: This Threat is immune to the Fear, Terror, Pinned, and Staggered conditions.

abilities.name: Terrifying
abilities.description: Anyone able to see the C'Tan Shard must pass a DN5 Terror test.

abilities.name: Canoptek Tail Blades
abilities.description: When this Threat makes a melee attack, spend 1 Ruin to make an additional melee attack using its Canoptek Tail Blades.

abilities.name: Reality Unravels
abilities.description: When this Threat is destroyed, roll 1d6. On a roll of an Icon, each creature within 6m suffers 1d3+3 Mortal Wounds.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 11d6. Living Metal. C'Tan Shards may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds, and any Wounds negated by Determination are ignored instead of being converted to Shock. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: ANRAKYR THE TRAVELLER
description:
Anrakyr, also called Anrakyr the Traveller, is a nomadic Necron Overlord who wanders from Tomb World to Tomb World across the galaxy, aiding the Necron cause wherever and however he can.

Few Necrons awaken from stasis-sleep with a fully functioning consciousness. Most arise addled by the long slumber, their wits and reason slow to come fully online. Not so for Anrakyr -- he rose from dormancy during the Necrons' Great Sleep with his mind intact and a great purpose foremost in his mind to reunite the Necron dynasties.

Embracing this as his destiny, Anrakyr the Traveller, as he came to be known amongst others of his kind, abdicated all responsibilities to his own Tomb World of Pyrrhia before leading an undying army into the stars to fulfil the self-appointed mission of rebuilding a united Necron realm that continues to this day.

resilience.note: Necrodermis and Phase Shifter: 5 AR, 3* AR

skills: Default 12, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Intimidation 13, Leadership 14, Tech 13

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 7 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Implacable Conqueror
bonuses.description: Friendly NECRON Troops within 12m may add +Tier to their Speed when they Charge.

bonuses.name: Lord of the Pyrrhian Legions
bonuses.description: All NECRON Troops within 12m of Anrakyr add +Tier bonus dice when making melee attacks.

bonuses.name: Relentless March
bonuses.description: [DYNASTY] NECRON Troops and Elites which begin their turn within 12m of this Threat add +1 to their Speed for that turn.

bonuses.name: My Will Be Done
bonuses.description: At the start of each of the Threat's turns, select one mob of NECRON Troops within 18m. That mob adds +Tier bonus dice to all attacks it makes on its next turn and may re-roll any 1s rolled.

bonuses.name: Undying Aristocracy
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's turn.

abilities.name: Tachyon Arrow
abilities.stats: 22 +4ED / AP -5 / Range Infinite / Salvo – / One Shot Only

abilities.name: Mind in the Machine
abilities.description: As a Ruin Action, Anrakyr may attempt a Tech Interaction Attack against an enemy vehicle, with a DN equal to the vehicle's PILOT's Resolve or Pilot skill. If Anrakyr succeeds, in addition to any other effects, Anrakyr may make a single ranged attack with one of the vehicle's weapons.

abilities.name: Resurrection Protocols
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled. Once per scene.

determination: Roll 8d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: ILLUMINOR SZERAS
description:
Illuminor Szeras is an enigmatic Necron Cryptek Technomancer. He is one of the most reviled beings in the galaxy. Both hated and envied by the other Necrontyr, it was Szeras' twisted genius that ultimately made the process of biotransference a reality, and condemned the whole Necrontyr civilisation to an eternal, cybernetic undeath as the Necrons. Uncaring, the megalomaniac Szeras only saw the sacrifice of his people as the first step of his own ascension to C'tan-like godhood.

In the 41st Millennium, Szeras still labours toward that goal, seeking to unravel the last mysteries of life that escape him. Despite being distrusted and reviled by the majority of his peers and Necron royalty, Szeras' knowledge is so vast, and the help he can grant so potent, that few Nemesors refuse his assistance nor its price when offered.
skills: Default 12, Awareness 13 (Passive 7), Tech 15

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions, and has 7 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Empyric Overcharger
bonuses.description: When any enemy PSYKER is within 12m, each time they attempt to use a Psychic Power, they suffer a complication for any Wrath die that rolls a 1 or a 6.

bonuses.name: Atomic Energy Manipulator
bonuses.description: When Szeras kills an enemy with a melee attack, he may immediately use his Mechanical Augmentation action as a Free Action.

abilities.name: Mechanical Augmentation
abilities.description: As a Simple Action, Szeras may select a single NECRON Elite or NECRON Troops mob within 6m. That mob may add +2 to their Strength (and melee damage), +2 to their Toughness (and Resilience and Determination), or +2 to all ranged attacks. Each mob may only be augmented once.

abilities.name: Rites of Reanimation
abilities.description: As a Ruin Action, select one NECRON Troop or Elite within 12m which is currently self-repairing: that NECRON immediately returns to life with 1d3 Wounds. You may select a Mob of NECRON Troops within range instead; the Mob regains 1d3 slain members.

abilities.name: Resurrection Protocols
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled. Once per scene.

determination: Enduring Will. Roll 10d6, and re-roll up to Tier dice. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: IMOTEKH THE STORMLORD
description:
Imotekh, also known as Imotekh the Stormlord or simply the Stormlord, is the phaeron of the Sautekh Dynasty and perhaps the strongest and most accomplished Necron Overlord in the galaxy at the end of the 41st Millennium.

Imotekh rules over a Necron stellar empire currently comprising 80 Tomb Worlds. Renowned for his supreme strategic genius and pride, he has led successful campaigns across entire sectors to expand his growing realm against the lesser sentient races of the galaxy.

resilience.note: Sempiternal Weave, Phase Shifter: 7 AR, 3* AR

skills: Default 12, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Intimidation 13, Leadership 16

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 9 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Relentless March
bonuses.description: [DYNASTY] NECRON Troops and Elites which begin their turn within 12m of this Threat add +1 to their Speed for that turn.

bonuses.name: My Will Be Done
bonuses.description: At the start of each of the Threat's turns, select a mob of SAUTEKH NECRON Troops within 18m. That mob adds +Tier bonus dice to all attacks it makes on its next turn and may re-roll any 1s rolled. As a PHAERON, Imotekh may select two mobs rather than one.

bonuses.name: Hyperlogical Strategist
bonuses.description: While Imotekh is on the battlefield, each time you spend a point of Ruin, you can roll one d6: on a 5+, that point of Ruin is refunded.

bonuses.name: Phaeron of Sautekh
bonuses.description: As a SAUTEKH NECRON, Imotekh adds +1 to his Resolve (included below), and treats any ranged attack he makes at Medium range as if it were at Short range.

bonuses.name: Undying Aristocracy
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's turn.

abilities.name: Lord of the Storm
abilities.description: Once per scene, Imotekh may spend one or more Ruin to call the Storm as a Full Action. Select one enemy within 48m. Roll 1d6 for each Ruin spent – on an Icon, the enemy suffers 1 Mortal Wound. Then, roll 1d6 per Ruin spent for each enemy within 6m of the selected enemy; on an Exalted Icon, that enemy suffers a Mortal Wound.

abilities.name: Resurrection Protocols
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled. Once per scene.

determination: Roll 8d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: NEMESOR ZAHNDREKH
description:
Zahndrekh is a Necron Overlord and Nemesor of the Sautekh Dynasty who was once counted amongst the greatest generals of the lost Necrontyr empire. It was through his campaigns of conquest that his Tomb World of Gidrim rose from a small and insignificant planet on the fringes of the galaxy to become the iron-handed ruler of a dozen star systems.

Whilst possessing a grand and calculating military genius, many among the Necron nobility believed that Zahndrekh did not grasp reality as it truly is. Many thought his mind suffered damage during the Necrons' Great Sleep, and as a consequence he is trapped deep in the past, in the Wars of Secession that wracked his corner of the ancient Necrontyr empire.

resilience.note: Necrodermis and Phase Shifter: 7 AR, 3* AR

skills: Default 12, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Intimidation 13, Leadership 15

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Counter Tactics
bonuses.description: Each time a Player Character spends a point of Wrath while Nemesor Zahndrekh is present on the battlefield, the GM gains 1 Ruin.

bonuses.name: Eternal Madness
bonuses.description: Each time Zahndrekh makes a melee attack, he may re-roll any ED on the damage roll.

bonuses.name: Relentless March
bonuses.description: [DYNASTY] NECRON Troops and Elites which begin their turn within 12m of this Threat add +1 to their Speed for that turn.

bonuses.name: My Will Be Done
bonuses.description: At the start of each of the Threat's turns, select one mob of SAUTEKH NECRON Troops within 18m. That mob adds +Tier bonus dice to all attacks it makes on its next turn and may re-roll any 1s rolled.

bonuses.name: Nemesor of Sautekh
bonuses.description: As a SAUTEKH NECRON, Zahndrekh adds +1 to his Resolve (included below) and treats any ranged attack he makes at Medium range as if it were at Short range.

bonuses.name: Undying Aristocracy
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's turn.

abilities.name: Transient Madness
abilities.description:
As a simple action, select a single mob of SAUTEKH NECRONS Troops within 9m. The mob makes a DN3 Conviction test: if they pass, they may select one of the following effects. If they fail, roll 1d3 to determine which bonus they receive instead. This effect lasts until the start of Zahndrekh's next turn.
1. Avenge the Fallen: The mob adds +2d to melee attacks.
2. Quell the Rebellion: The mob adds +2d to ranged attacks.
3. Solarmills? Charge! The mob adds +1 to Speed when they Charge.

abilities.name: Methodical Destruction
abilities.description: When an enemy suffers one or more Wounds from an attack by a SAUTEKH NECRON Threat, spend 1 Ruin. For the rest of the Round, SAUTEKH NECRONS add +2d to attacks against that enemy.

abilities.name: Resurrection Protocols
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled. Once per scene.

determination: Roll 9d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: ORIKAN THE DIVINER
description:
Orikan, also known as Orikan the Diviner, is one of the most powerful of the Necron Crypteks, and is a potent Chronomancer. Millions of years ago, he was the astromancer of the Necrontyr empire's ruling Triarch, and one of the Silent King Szarekh's most trusted counsellors.

Orikan was the only one to then oppose the proposal of the C'tan Mephet'ran the Deceiver to grant the Necrontyr immortality through the process of biotransference, as he foresaw it would end in disaster, but his lone voice of dissent was ignored by the Triarch. Driven by loyalty to his race, Orikan submitted to the process and became one of the undying Necrons.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 16 (Passive 8), Tech 14

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Timesplinter Mantle
bonuses.description: The Chronomancer increases its Defence by 2 (included above), its Speed by 3 (included below), and allows it to roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

bonuses.name: Immortal Pride
bonuses.description: Psychic powers which target this Adversary increase in Difficulty by +Tier. In addition, all NECRONS within 12m may re-roll their dice on Resolve tests.

bonuses.name: Master Chronomancer
bonuses.description: At the start of the Threat's turn, select one NECRON Mob, or a number of NECRON Troops or Elites equal to the Threat's Intellect. The selected NECRONS add +1 to their Defence and +2 to their Speed.

bonuses.name: Prescient Strike
bonuses.description: Orikan may take the first turn in any round, without spending Ruin to do so. He may Keep the Initiative without spending Ruin.

bonuses.name: The Stars are Right
bonuses.description: At the start of each Round, roll 1d6. If the number rolled is lower than the number of Rounds which have elapsed during this combat, then Orikan transforms into his Orikan Empowered form. Any Wounds suffered or Personal Ruin spent carries over.

abilities.name: Staff of Tomorrow
abilities.description: The Staff of Tomorrow ignores Invulnerable AR, and enemies struck by it may not roll Determination against damage inflicted.

abilities.name: Resurrection Protocols
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled. Once per scene.

determination: Roll 5d6. The Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: ORIKAN EMPOWERED
description: When the stars align, Orikan the Diviner transforms into his Empowered form, a being of terrible power whose physical attributes are vastly enhanced. Any Wounds suffered or Personal Ruin spent carries over from Orikan the Diviner.
skills: Default 12, Awareness 16 (Passive 8), Tech 14

bonuses.name: Champion, Timesplinter Mantle, Immortal Pride, Master Chronomancer, Prescient Strike
bonuses.description: As Orikan the Diviner.

abilities.name: Staff of Tomorrow
abilities.description: The Staff of Tomorrow ignores Invulnerable AR, and enemies struck by it may not roll Determination against damage inflicted.

abilities.name: Resurrection Protocols
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled. Once per scene.

determination: Roll 11d6. The Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: TRAZYN THE INFINITE
description:
Trazyn, also known as Trazyn the Infinite, is a Necron Overlord and the self-proclaimed Archaeovist of the Solemnace Galleries on the Necron Tomb World of Solemnace.

Trazyn is a preserver of histories, artefacts and events, and often "liberates" what he wants from other alien races or even his fellow Necrons so that the treasures may be preserved in his galleries.

Often performing his work through mindshackled cat's-paws and surrogate body hosts, recent times have forced him to take a more active role in acquiring additions to his galleries lest the historical treasures be lost in the flames of war forever.

Trazyn only wages war in order to maintain and expand his collection, often disregarding strategic and tactical considerations in order to do so.

resilience.note: Necrodermis and Phase Shifter: 5 AR, 3* AR

skills: Default 12, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Intimidation 13, Leadership 14

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 5 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Relentless March
bonuses.description: [DYNASTY] NECRON Troops and Elites which begin their turn within 12m of this Threat add +1 to their Speed for that turn.

bonuses.name: My Will Be Done
bonuses.description: At the start of each of the Threat's turns, select one mob of [DYNASTY] NECRON Troops within 18m. That mob adds +Tier bonus dice to all attacks it makes on its next turn and may re-roll any 1s rolled.

bonuses.name: Undying Aristocracy
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 point of Ruin at the start of each of this Threat's turn.

abilities.name: Empathic Obliterator
abilities.description: Each time an enemy is slain by the Empathic Obliterator, all enemies within 6m suffer 1d3 Mortal Wounds.

abilities.name: Surrogate Hosts
abilities.description: When Trazyn is slain, either add 1 to Ruin, or select another NECRON Adversary or Elite in the scene. The selected NECRON is immediately replaced by Trazyn, who has suffered 10 Wounds.

determination: Roll 9d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds. Enduring Will: Trazyn may re-roll up to Tier dice on any Determination roll.

name: VARGARD OBYRON
description:
Obyron is a Necron Lychguard who serves as the "Vargard," or primary protector and bodyguard, of Nemesor Zahndrekh, the Necron Overlord of the crownworld of Gidrim of the Sautekh Dynasty.

Having served with Zahndrekh since his first campaigns when they were still Necrontyr, Obyron is devoted to the execution of his duties, and is the primary reason why Zahndrekh is still alive to this day.

Yet Zahndrekh has one defence greater than all others -- Vargard Obyron himself.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Intimidation 11, Weapon Skill 14

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin actions and has 4 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Relentless March
bonuses.description: [DYNASTY] NECRON Troops and Elites which begin their turn within 12m of this Threat add +1 to their Speed for that turn.

bonuses.name: The Lord's Will

abilities.name: Honourable Combatant
abilities.description: When Obyron is engaged in combat, he may issue a challenge as a free action. If the challenge is accepted, Obyron adds +Tier bonus dice to all melee attacks he makes, but he may only attack the enemy he challenged until either he is victorious or defeated.

abilities.name: Cleaving Counterblow
abilities.description: Whenever Obyron is the target of a melee attack, he may use this Reaction. After the enemy has completed their attack, Obyron may make a single melee attack against that enemy, as a Reflexive Action. Obyron may not apply other combat options to this attack. Obyron may use this ability a number of times each round equal to the game's Tier.

abilities.name: Guardian Protocols
abilities.description: When an attack targets Nemesor Zahndrekh within 6m, Vargard Obyron may spend 1 Ruin and use his Reflexive Action to become the target instead. Obyron rolls Determination against that attack without spending additional Ruin.

abilities.name: Resurrection Protocols
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 4d6 when this Threat dies; it heals 1 Wound for each Icon rolled. Once per scene.

determination: Roll 9d6. Ancient Machines. Living Metal. Excess Icons rolled heal previously suffered Wounds.

name: LEGIONARY
description:
The Adeptus Astartes were created as the Emperor's ultimate fighting force. Implanted with the gene-seed of the Primarchs, the Space Marines stand seven Terran feet tall, with thickened bones, two hearts, hyper-dense muscles and all manner of special organs that allow them to survive and fight in the most hostile conditions. They feel little pain and heal wounds at a remarkable rate.

Their will is hardened by constant training and fighting, and they battle with dedication and zeal, brooking no hesitation, mercy or cowardice. All of these things combine with the best weaponry and armour in the galaxy to make the Space Marines the most fearsome warriors of the Imperium.

The Chaos Space Marines have all of these strengths and skills as well, to which are added the power of Chaos and a brutal devotion to the Dark Gods. Ever since the Horus Heresy, Space Marines of every Legion and Chapter have been tempted by the path of Chaos, whether for selfish reasons or great ideals.

Sundered from the Imperium, having turned their backs on the Emperor, these warriors know that there can be no peace for them, neither forgiveness nor absolution. They are wholly committed to the path they now tread, for good or ill, and they can expect no quarter from former Battle-Brothers.

name: CHOSEN
description:
The Chosen of a Chaos Space Marine warband are the most battle-hardened of the Heretic Astartes and are functionally equivalent to the Veteran Marines of the Adeptus Astartes.

The most experienced and dedicated Chaos Space Marines are known as "Chosen." Even at a glance, it is obvious that they are favoured amongst the bitter brotherhood of Chaos, for their baroque armour is embellished with forbidden runes and their grimacing helmets give them the aspect of raging daemons.

Equipped with the finest wargear the warband can provide, the Chosen are even more hard-bitten and callous than other Chaos Space Marines and think nothing of sacrificing the lives of their comrades to increase their own standing with the gods.

Chosen have many centuries of combat experience to draw upon and are typically found in the vanguard of any attack, fighting from the front where they can earn the most glory and take the greatest spoils. Sometimes the Chosen will use their battle skills to infiltrate enemy lines and set up ambushes or outflank an enemy army to launch surprise attacks on the opposition's strongpoints.

Confident in the extreme, and contemptuous even of those that march to war alongside them, the Chosen bow only to the gods themselves and to the Chaos Champions who command their allegiance.

Like Chaos Champions, there are many Heretic Astartes who may be called Chosen; dedicated, deadly soldiers. Often, Chosen will band together with other such veterans and may be defined as much by the wargear they wield and the tactics they prefer as their dedication to a particular Chaos God.

name: RAPTOR
description:
Chaos Space Marine Raptors are the dedicated assault infantry of the Chaos Space Marine Traitor Legions. Raptors consider themselves to be elite shock troops similar to the warriors who comprise the Loyalist Space Marine Assault Squads, although they are far more egotistical and self-centred.

As Raptors are used to strike at the weakest point in an enemy line, this tactical usage has been expanded into an outright philosophy dedicated to the concept of preying on the weak, making them vicious hunters.

The cruel terror troops known as Raptors consider themselves the elite of the Heretic Astartes warbands. Their murder squads epitomise what has become of the Assault Marines of the Traitor Legions.

Though they were once rare and highly valued Imperial troops, the Raptors have fallen to their own pride and lust for violence. They now roam the galaxy as merciless hunters, relishing the fear they cause as they plummet screaming out of the skies.
skills: Default 7, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 9, Pilot 8, Weapon Skill 9

name: WARP TALON
description:
A Warp Talon is a Chaos Space Marine Raptor whose long exposure to the Immaterium has corrupted his physical form, enabling him to move through the veil of reality and slice between dimensions.

Warp Talons are capable of striking at their enemies as if appearing from nowhere before slinking back into their nightmarish home dimension.

When a pack of Warp Talons emerges from the Warp, it appears to those on the battlefield below as if daemonic warriors have burst out from nothingness into fiery, vengeful life.

Like the stuff of nightmares, they plummet downwards in an explosion of Warp fire, tearing into the foe with murderous intent.

determination: Daemonkin. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: HAVOC
description:
Some Heretic Astartes squads carry a high proportion of heavy weapons to lay down supporting fire for their brethren. Known as Havocs, these squads provide devastating anti-infantry and anti-armour firepower and dominate large swathes of the battlefield with their merciless volleys of fire.

Such is the blood-pounding thrill of pouring heavy fire into the enemy ranks that many Havocs become obsessed by the power their weapons afford them. They see themselves as gods of the battlefield, blasting the insect vermin of the enemy into oblivion with each twitch of the finger. Over time, a Havoc Squad that lingers within the Warp may find their heavy weapons becoming a part of them, extensions of their own physical body that can never be laid down or relinquished.

Casings blend with flesh, blood plasma becomes highly volatile, and ammunition hoppers become hungry second mouths that snap and growl for more bullets. Eventually, Chaos Space Marine and weapon become one and the same entity.

This is the way of Chaos -- where the Warp bleeds into realspace, it is not nature that defines form but deadly psychic compulsion -- the ugliness in a Havoc's soul is made manifest in the flesh for all to see.
skills: Default 7, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 9, Weapon Skill 9

abilities.name: Unrelenting Devastation

threatOptions: HEAVY WEAPONS: Any Havoc may replace their Havoc Autocannon with one weapon from the Heavy Weapons list.

name: OBLITERATOR
description:
An Obliterator is a Chaos Space Marine, often a former Techmarine, who is believed to have been affected by a so-called "technovirus," a daemonic, Warp-powered virus that transformed these once-loyal servants of the Imperium into bloodthirsty mutant weapons of Chaos. They are monstrous hybrids of Human, Daemon and machine. An Obliterator is able to absorb any weapon into its body that is held for too long. These unfortunates can spawn these weapons from their very flesh, and also grow ammunition for them. Chaos Obliterators are biologically fused to their suits of Power Armour.

As a result of their mutation, Obliterators are no longer even remotely sane. This insanity could be caused by the constant mental and physical trauma of absorbing weapons into the Obliterator's body or being biologically welded by his own body to his armour. This insanity is also possibly caused by the Machine Spirits of his weapons and armour fusing into a destructive daemonic entity after infection by the virus. Obliterators are rarely part of an existing Traitor Legion or Renegade Space Marine warband; they prefer to sell their services to the highest bidder amongst the forces of Chaos in return for access to the archaeotech that they crave.

The monstrous warriors of the Obliterator Cults amongst the Heretic Astartes are a blasphemy against nature and Machine God alike. Their forms are so altered, so thoroughly conjoined with the tools of war, that every cell in their bodies thrills with a spark of mechanical life. The technomagi of Mars dream of achieving such a symbiosis, but in truth, only their Heretek brothers in the Dark Mechanicum have mastered the complete fusion of metal and flesh.

It is only the changeling power of the Warp that allows this process to take place, melding the inert and the animate together on a spiritual level in order to form something far greater than mere cybernetics. Because of their Chaos-born powers, Obliterators are capable of not only absorbing weaponry into themselves, but also of manifesting munitions from their titanium-laced flesh.
skills: Default 7, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 11, Tech 9, Weapon Skill 8

name: MUTILATOR
description:
A Mutilator is a vile Chaos Space Marine whose intense lust for battle and quest for the simple purity of the blade have warped his physical form until he has fused, body and soul, with his melee weaponry.

The exact origins of Mutilators is not exactly clear. It is generally believed that the first of their number were originally Terminators of the Traitor Legions who specialised in close-quarters fighting, but as with all who harbour an obsession within the Warp, they grew to become the incarnation of the murderous desires in their hearts.

Like their brethren Heretic Astartes, they adopted an obsession with the Warp that mutated them into mindless killing machines, becoming one with the axes and swords that they hold dear. Those who dedicate themselves to the act of killing in melee cannot help but be affected by it.

The satisfying impact of a bludgeon smashing into an unprotected head, the yielding of flesh to the point of a blade or an axe's bloody bite -- even the most faithful Space Marine cannot deny that these acts bring a rush, or even a thrill, to the mind and body alike. A lifetime of unrelenting battle can breed a dangerous need for such acts of violence, and when that period spans several Terran centuries, the effects upon the psyche can be dramatic.

For those who seek refuge in the Immaterium, this psychosis is magnified beyond all reason. Such warriors might begin their descent into madness by constant maintenance of their weapons in between battle, by chaining themselves to their favoured wargear, or by outright refusing to let go of their favoured tools of war under any circumstances. These dangerously focused individuals are easy prey for the corruption of Chaos.

Before long, a warrior who yearns too much for the visceral charms of battle may find that he has fused with his weapons, the blade becoming part of him as a hand would be to a normal man. Over time, these assault specialists come to identify more with their weaponry than with their fellow Battle-Brothers. Disillusioned by the fickle nature of Mankind, they instead strive for the simple purity of the blade. As the years take their toll, such individuals leave their humanity behind altogether, becoming living weapons.
skills: Default 7, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 11, Tech 9, Weapon Skill 8

name: POSSESSED
description:
The Possessed, also known as Possessed Chaos Space Marines, Daemonkin and "The Secondborn," are those Chaos Space Marines who have entirely forsaken their Humanity and given up their souls and bodies to the Daemonic servants of the Chaos Gods.

Their body has been possessed by a Chaos Daemon, who keeps its Human shell alive using the energy of the Warp. The Possessed feel no pain and their bodies can be warped and mutated to suit the purpose or whim of the Daemon that inhabits them.

For some of the more extreme devotees of the Ruinous Powers, simply offering their souls up to the service of the Chaos Gods is not enough. Those who thirst for power at any cost will offer themselves wholly to Chaos, becoming willing hosts for the immaterial entities of the Warp.

Such a possession is a lengthy and agonising experience, as the Daemons within them infest their physical forms and reshape them to better suit their particular needs. Those who offer themselves up for possession usually spend solar months in rituals of debasement and scarification, offering up blood sacrifices and preparing their bodies to harbour a daemonic entity.

Though the personalities of these half-mad supplicants are subsumed forever within the power of the possessing Daemon, mass possessions are nonetheless great celebrations for the devotees of Chaos of the spiritual union between mortal and Daemon, material and Empyrean. They are marked by the more lustful amongst the devotees of Chaos with orgies of feasting and other depravity, and by the more devout with solemn hymnals of impurity.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 11 (Passive 6), Ballistic Skill 10, Leadership 9, Weapon Skill 11

abilities.name: Sea of Mutations
abilities.description: The Daemon warps its host's form, preparing it for battle. Before the first round of combat, this Threat appears to be an ordinary Chaos Space Marine, but it swiftly transforms into a hulking monster. Anyone who sees the transformation must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Veteran of the Long War

abilities.name: Painful Lessons

name: CHAOS TERMINATOR
description:
A Chaos Terminator is a Chosen Chaos Space Marine who wears a suit of Tactical Dreadnought Armour (Terminator Armour) and serves as one of the Traitor Legions' most powerful infantry shock troops.

Sundered and cast out from the Imperium of Man, having turned their backs on the Emperor of Mankind, the Chaos Space Marines of the Traitor Legions know that there can be no peace for them, no forgiveness nor absolution. They are wholly committed to the path of damnation that they have trod for millennia, for good or ill.

These genetically-enhanced transhuman warriors have all the strengths and skills of their Imperial counterparts, to which are added the power of Chaos and a brutal devotion to their patron Chaos Gods.

Since the time of the Horus Heresy the Chaos Terminators' brutal reputation as fearsome, unrepentant killers has spread throughout the galaxy. Chaos Terminators form the elite of their masters' Heretic Astartes warbands, for though they are ponderous compared to their standard Power Armour-clad comrades, nothing short of a dedicated anti-tank weapon can stop a Terminator in full stride. These seasoned killers often act as the personal guards of an esteemed Champion of Chaos, enforcing the commands of their leader with pitiless efficiency and taking their pick of the spoils after each victory.

They tend to be egotistical, brutish and crude, using their physical prowess and the favour of their lord to intimidate other members of their warband. Far from resenting such behaviour, most Chaos Space Marines simply plot to bring about the day when they can abuse such power for themselves.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 11 (Passive 6), Ballistic Skill 10, Leadership 9, Weapon Skill 11

description: Brimstone Grenadiers have an unhealthy penchant for explosive slaughter and think nothing of wielding unstable explosives capable of showering their victims with unclean alchemical acids and poisons, or even swallowing them up in roiling clouds of infernal warp sorcery.

description: Amongst the Militarum Traitoris, strength and brutality count for more than discipline or loyalty. Many are the Thugs amongst their ragged ranks—violent men and woman who have become virtual ogres thanks to their inner savagery and the taint of heresy.

description: Trench Sweepers are that rarest of things - a traitor still loyal to their comrades. Retaining something of their former discipline, they focus on shielding their direct superiors during the advance, before surging ahead to clear a bloody path at close quarters.

name: TRAITOR ENFORCER
description:
Traitor Enforcers—sometimes mockingly called Traitor Commissars—are the sadistic discipline officers found within Traitor Guard forces.
Allegedly, some did begin as Astra Militarum Commissars, tempted or broken by the dark works of Chaos. Others are bullies and petty tyrants, risen through the ranks due to their cruelty and brutality, garbed in a mockery of the uniforms of Commissars. Their discipline comes from cruel malice, and each is driven only by their own petty ambition and their fear of their superiors. They understand that their loyalty is dependent on their continued usefulness.
skills: Default 6, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Intimidation 8, Leadership 8
