name: TRAITOR OGRYN BRUTE
description:
The Ogryn (Homo sapiens gigantus) are a huge and physically powerful Abhuman mutant subspecies of Humanity, often employed by the Imperium of Man as shock troopers in the Astra Militarum's Militarum Auxilla.
Ogryns possess many traits prized by the Imperium; they are brutally strong and completely loyal, although extremely limited intellectually, which restricts their battlefield role to simple and direct assaults.
They hail from a series of cold and barren planets across the galaxy that possess high gravity, such as Anark Zeta, which is why they appear larger, heavier and bulkier compared to baseline Humans.
Ogryns compensate for their mental deficiencies with overwhelming physicality -- the brutish creatures stand around 10 Terran feet (3 metres) tall and can shrug off wounds that would kill an Imperial Guardsman several times over. These qualities mean that Ogryns make exceptional shock troops and are often deployed on the front lines of battle by Imperial commanders.
On the other hand, Ogryns are known for their inability to understand complex commands and tactics. This simple-mindedness has also contributed to the big Abhumans' reputation as being notoriously easy to corrupt to the service of Chaos. These simplistic Abhumans dwell on worlds far from the Emperor's light, and often fall into the worship of the Ruinous Powers. The servants of Chaos also sometimes forcibly conscript Ogryns into their ranks.
Known as Ogryn Brutes, the servants of the Dark Gods will utilise crude surgical procedures, forbidden combat drugs and sorcerous rituals in order to control the beasts and set them upon their enemies.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 5 (Passive 3), Intimidation 7, Weapon Skill 7

abilities.name: Dual Attack

name: FELLGOR BEASTMEN
description:
Beastmen (sing. Beastman) (Homo sapiens variatus) are Abhumans descended from baseline Human stock who combine the physical appearances of Humans and certain Terran animals, usually ungulates like goats or rams.
Beastmen do not necessarily look alike, and different animal traits can manifest themselves in each individual, but apart from this form of phenotypical variation they are a genetically stable Human subspecies and are considered to be a form of Abhuman rather than an actual mutant.
Fellgor Beastmen are ill-disciplined brutes who follow only the strong. They constantly fight amongst themselves when not on the hunt or at war. Their herds are merely a grouping of warriors led by a powerful Beastlord.
They have superior hunting skills, strength and endurance compared to other Beastmen, and are convinced that the gods of Chaos favour them. They possess an advanced human cunning and a greater intelligence than many of their fellows. Like all Beastmen, they possess keen senses, but their warp-enhanced abilities are sharper than those of their lower kin.

description: Serving as obscene preachers to their kin as well as malevolent advisors to Ironhorns, Shamans are capable of wielding the raw power of Chaos. It is also Shamans who take the lead in the Fellgor Ravagers' bloody ritual sacrifices before the pack's herdstone.
skills: Default 4, Athletics 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Psychic Mastery 7, Stealth 5, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: BESTIAL RAIDERS
bonuses.description: Add +2 to the Threat's Speed when they Charge.

bonuses.name: Bloodsense
bonuses.description: When one or more enemies are Wounded, and there's at least one FELLGOR Threat present, add +1 to Ruin at the start of the round. FELLGOR Threats add +2 to their Resolve when one or more enemies are Wounded.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Feral Ambush
abilities.description: Make a normal move and then make a Stealth test, gaining a Stealth score.

abilities.name: Shaman
abilities.description: The Shaman attempts to activate a psychic power. The Shaman knows Smite, Psyniscience, Deny the Witch, and the Fellgor Powers: Mantle of Darkness (DN 4, Action, Instant, Self, CHAOS/PSYCHIC - The Shaman wreaths themselves in a shroud of gloom. The Shaman and all FELLGOR within 3m cannot be targeted by ranged attacks unless the attacker is within 6m. Potency: *[2] Affected creatures gain +1 Speed. [1] Affected creatures gain +1 dice on Stealth tests.), Apoplectic Rejuvenation (DN 5, Action, Instant, 6m, CHAOS/PSYCHIC - The Shaman channels dark power into one of their kin. A single Wounded FELLGOR ally within range heals 2d3 Wounds. Potency: [1] +1 Wound healed.), Curse Weapon (DN 4, Action, 1 Round, 18m, Multi-Target Yes, CHAOS/PSYCHIC - The Shaman directs an entropic curse to unmake the weapons of the enemy. The weapon of one visible enemy within range gains the Volatile (3) trait until the start of the Shaman's next turn. Potency: *[2] Weapon also gains Unreliable 3 trait. [1] Increase Volatile trait rating by +1.).

abilities.name: Frenzy
abilities.description: When this Threat is reduced to 0 Wounds, it becomes Frenzied for one final turn before being removed.

name: FELLGOR TOXHORN
description: Even more than the rest of their kind, Toxhorns take particular joy in destroying the technology of their foes. They revel in decay and unleashing the chemicals and toxins that accelerate it, whether against machine or living being.
skills: Default 4, Athletics 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Stealth 5, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: BESTIAL RAIDERS
bonuses.description: Add +2 to the Threat's Speed when they Charge.

bonuses.name: Bloodsense
bonuses.description: When one or more enemies are Wounded, and there's at least one FELLGOR Threat present, add +1 to Ruin at the start of the round. FELLGOR Threats add +2 to their Resolve when one or more enemies are Wounded.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: Toxic Blessings
bonuses.description: This Threat is unaffected by the Poisoned condition and ignores penalties for being Wounded.

abilities.name: Feral Ambush
abilities.description: Make a normal move and then make a Stealth test, gaining a Stealth score.

abilities.name: Pox Bomb (2)
abilities.stats: 5 +4ED / AP -1 / Range 20 / Blast (4), Fleshbane, Inflict (Hindered 2), Mortal (1)

abilities.name: Frenzy
abilities.description: When this Threat is reduced to 0 Wounds, it becomes Frenzied for one final turn before being removed.

determination: Toxic Blessing. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6, re-rolling any die which rolls 1.

name: FELLGOR VANDAL
description: Wielders of immense, two-handed mancrushers, Vandals have a simple task among the Fellgor Ravagers—smash apart anything and anyone they or their Ironhorn wish. With every hammering strike they pulverise armour, bone and flesh.
skills: Default 4, Athletics 6, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Stealth 5, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: BESTIAL RAIDERS
bonuses.description: Add +2 to the Threat's Speed when they Charge.

bonuses.name: Bloodsense
bonuses.description: When one or more enemies are Wounded, and there's at least one FELLGOR Threat present, add +1 to Ruin at the start of the round. FELLGOR Threats add +2 to their Resolve when one or more enemies are Wounded.

bonuses.name: Champion
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

abilities.name: Feral Ambush
abilities.description: Make a normal move and then make a Stealth test, gaining a Stealth score.

abilities.name: Mancrusher
abilities.stats: 11 +6ED / AP -2 / Range 2 [M] / Brutal, Reaping, Overwhelm, Unwieldy (2)

abilities.name: Devastating Onslaught
abilities.description: Each time the Vandal Charges or makes an All-Out attack, add the Reaping trait to their Mancrusher.

abilities.name: Frenzy
abilities.description: When this Threat is reduced to 0 Wounds, it becomes Frenzied for one final turn before being removed.

name: CHAOS CULTIST
description:
Chaos Cults are the most dangerous of all those organisations that plot to overthrow the rule of the Imperium of Man from within.
All planets and civilisations belonging to the Imperium can harbour Chaos-aligned organisations, which themselves are as diverse in practice and membership as is imaginable. From the blood-soaked sacrificial cults of Feral Worlds to the philosophical secret societies of more advanced planets, the temptations of Chaos can capture all.
Chaos Cults are dedicated to the worship of one or all of the Ruinous Powers. Billions of these warped men and women who have willingly sold their souls to the Chaos Gods also exist within the Eye of Terror, making up the twisted populations of the Daemon Worlds.
Chaos Cults can be found on nearly every type of Imperial world and have an extraordinary diversity of membership, belief and practice.
From the bloody Human sacrifices practiced on some Feral and Feudal Worlds, to the more philosophical arcane secret societies that infect the jaded aristocracies of Hive Worlds, the temptations offered by Chaos can corrupt people of any station or origin.
Chaos Cultists are found in almost every Chaos force of any size, having either been recruited from the local population or brought to the world from the Warp as the slaves and servants of the Chaos Space Marines.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Ballistic Skill 5, Deception 5, Stealth 5, Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: RITUAL KILL
bonuses.description: Each time a Cultist (or Mob of Cultists) kills an enemy, add +1 to their Resolve and add 1 to Ruin.

abilities.name: Tide of Traitors
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin at the start of a Round to roll a number of d6 equal to the game's Tier. A number of Chaos Cultists equal to the total rolled enter the battlefield.

threatOptions: Any Cultist may replace their Autopistol with an Autogun or Stubcannon: Autogun: 7 +1ED / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 3 / Rapid Fire (1). Stubcannon: 9 +1ED / Range 9-18-27 / Salvo 1 / Brutal.
mobOptions: SPECIAL WEAPONS: One Chaos Cultist in every ten may replace their Autopistol with one of the following: Flamer: 10 +1ED / AP – / Range 4-8-12 / Salvo 1 / Assault, Flamer. Grenade Launcher: As Grenade / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo - / Reliable. Frag Grenade: 10 +4ED / AP – / Blast (6). Krak Grenade: 14 +5ED / AP -2 / Blast (4). Heavy Stubber: 10 +2ED / Range 18-36-54 / Salvo 3 / Heavy (4).

name: ACCURSED MUTANT
description:
The Imperium of Man greatly fears mutation. First off, many such growths are physically alarming, causing natural revulsion in those who witness them. Beyond simpler signs of mutation are grotesqueries such as insectoid claws, tentacles or fanged maws where no mouth ought to be.

Rampant growth of meat and bone can create twelve-foot-high monstrosities whose fists are capable of bending plasteel, and whose mass can absorb bolt shells that would fell an ordinary person. There have also been many recorded instances of mutants whose flesh has melded with machinery or other inorganic technology, often through the reality-warping power of Chaos.

Yet it is not just the appearance or abilities of mutants that rankles the right-minded citizens of the Imperium, for those whose physical forms are marred by Warp energies often harbour deviant intent, spreading bloodshed and mayhem.

Worse still, the most afflicted become willing pawns of the Dark Gods, foul agents of corruption actively dedicated to spreading ruin and overthrowing the Imperium.

Accursed Cultist Mutants are Chaos Cultists who are heavily mutated by Chaos. More than the mere mutant dregs who populate the benighted depts and sumps of many a hive world, Accused Cultists are horrifying devotees of the Dark Gods.

Accursed Cultists have myriad and terrifying origins – whether born of rituals, experimentation, or the predation of Daemons, these aberrations are herded into battle as shock troops, their tainted flesh regenerating grievous wounds with unnatural vigour. Once they reach close quarters, Mutants flail and lash at the enemy with claws or tendrils.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: ACCURSED HORDE
bonuses.description: At the start of each round, roll a number of d6s equal to the game's Tier. A number of Accursed Mutants arrive on the battlefield equal to the number of Icons rolled. They may form a new mob or join an existing one.

abilities.name: Mutant Horrors
abilities.description: Anyone who sees the Accursed Mutants must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Frenzied Demise
abilities.description: When slain by a melee attack, this Threat inflicts one Mortal Wound on one engaged enemy.

determination: Unnatural Regeneration. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 5d6. Regain 1 Wound for each Exalted Icon rolled.
mobBonuses: MUTANT TIDE: After an attack is made against this mob, for each an Accursed Mutant is slain, roll 1d6. For each Exalted Icon rolled, one Accursed Mutant is returned to the mob.

name: ACCURSED TORMENT
description:
Accursed Torments are Chaos Cultists who have mutated to so great a degree that they are little more than twisted monstrosities driven by agony and hatred. So little of their humanity remains that there is little to distinguish them from Chaos Spawn.

These hideous abominations are possessed by one or many daemons, and it is impossible to tell how much of the original host remains. Each has a scroll or parchment nailed to its form, upon which are written words in evil tongues to prevent the bound daemons from fully-manifesting.

Accursed Torments are often found alongside their lesser kin, towering abominations amidst teeming hordes of slavering monsters.

Mutation
During arcane rituals, the most devoted among a Chaos Cult have evil symbols carved into their flesh or tattooed onto their skin. Should the correct words of invocation be said in battle, these icons appear to draw empyric power to them, which twists the flesh of the Devotee and horrifically mutates them. This does not satisfy the dark cravings and power lust of some. Depraved prayers are written upon flayed skin and nailed into the tormented flesh of these individuals, then daemons are summoned and bound into their mortal bodies.

During battle, CULTIST Threats may 'mutate' as a result of the GM spending Ruin. By spending 1 Ruin at the end of a round, one of the following occurs:
A number of Chaos Cultists equal to the game's Tier mutate into Accursed Mutants.
A single Accursed Mutant mutates into an Accursed Torment.
A single CULTIST Threat heals 1d3+Tier Wounds and recovers all Shock.

When mutating into a different type of Threat, the Threat heals all Wounds and Shock. If part of a Mob, the Threats separate from the Mob (and, if their new form are also Troops, may form a new Mob immediately). When an Elite Threat mutates (or an Accursed Mutant mutates into an Accursed Torment), they may immediately roll on one of the Mutation tables in the Wrath & Glory core rulebook.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: CHAMPION
bonuses.description: The Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: MUTANT RABBLE
bonuses.description: MUTANT Threats within 6m of this Threat are Frenzied.

abilities.name: Abomination
abilities.description: Anyone who sees the Accursed Torment must make a DN 5 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Unleash the Daemon
abilities.description: When this Threat makes a melee attack, spend 1 Ruin to instead make a number of melee attacks equal to the game's Tier.

abilities.name: Frenzied Demise
abilities.description: When slain by a melee attack, this Threat inflicts 1d3 Mortal Wounds, divided amongst any Engaged enemies.

determination: Unnatural Regeneration. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6. Regain 1 Wound for each Exalted Icon rolled. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: CULT DEMAGOGUE
description:
Heresy, false belief, political corruption, the danger of religious schism, treachery, apostasy, rebellion, and disorder are all utterly corrosive to the unflinching order that sustains Human interstellar civilisation. Unity of purpose is needed if the Imperium, indeed Humanity, is to survive in such a hostile universe. Since the dark days of the Age of Apostasy, it has been the sacred task of the Ordo Hereticus of the Inquisition to sustain that order by any means necessary.

The foes of that order are diverse and widespread, from the false Adeptus Ministorum priest to the dissolute noblemen, demagogues and seditionists of every stripe, the mutant skulking in the shadows, and those who would sell out Humanity to the alien or worse.

Cult Demagogues are heretic priests and orators whose words convince others to embrace Heresy as well and soon leads to the formation of a Chaos Cult, which the Demagogue may command. Some of these demagogues are firebrand zealots driven by dark inspiration. Others are cruel schemers whose vile ambitions lead others into damnation. Amongst the most abhorrent, however, are apostate priests: those of the Frateris Clergy who have turned their backs upon the Emperor's Light for their own twisted goals and taken much of their flock with them.
skills: Default 7, Awareness 8 (Passive 4), Deception 9, Leadership 8, Persuasion 10, Stealth 9

bonuses.name: CHAMPION
bonuses.description: The Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: FAITHFUL FLOCK
bonuses.description: DARK COMMUNE Threats within 6m automatically pass Resolve tests.

bonuses.name: HERALD OF RUIN
bonuses.description: At the start of each round this Threat is alive, the GM gains +1 Ruin for every 6 HERETIC Threats alive in the scene.

abilities.name: For the Dark Gods!
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. This Threat makes an All-Out Attack as a Ruin Action.

abilities.name: Prayers to the Dark Gods
abilities.description: The Cult Demagogue may attempt a Persuasion test as a Simple Action to perform a Chaos Prayer. The Cult Demagogue knows Dark Zealotry and one other Prayer.

abilities.name: Ruinous Invocation
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. This Threat attempts to activate a prayer or dark ritual.

abilities.name: Sacrifice
abilities.description: When this Threat is the target of a ranged attack, select a HERETIC Threat within 3m. That Threat becomes the target of the attack instead.

name: MINDWITCH
description:
Many Chaos Cults include powerful sorcerers or witches, renegade psykers who have devoted themselves to the Dark Gods. These beings are often twisted and inhuman, altered through mutation, arcane technology, profane rituals, or worse.

In some cases, their power has ravaged their body such that they are little more than a swollen head mounted on an armature, connected by arcane tubes and cables to a mindless slave. These disembodied wyrds are known as Mindwitches, and each is a being of formidable power, able to torture the minds of their victims and weave vortexes of empyric energy.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Psychic Mastery 9

bonuses.name: CHAMPION
bonuses.description: The Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: WARP TOUCHED
bonuses.description: Whenever a Mindwitch rolls a Psychic Mastery test, they gain bonus Wrath dice equal to the Tier of the game.

abilities.name: Blasphemous Power
abilities.description: The Mindwitch attempts to activate a psychic power they know.

abilities.name: Maleficarum
abilities.description: The Mindwitch attempts to activate a psychic power they know. The Mindwitch knows Smite, Deny the Witch, Psyniscience, and the Dark Commune powers (Heinous Deluge, Malefic Vortex).

abilities.name: Psychic Storm
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. This Threat attempts to activate a psychic power or Deny the Witch.

name: ICONARCH
description: Iconarchs have the blessing and the curse of carrying their Cult's spike and flame-billowing censer-icon to war. This great symbol radiates with the mutating power of the warp, affecting the foes and devotees of Chaos alike.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Intimidation 6

bonuses.name: CHAMPION
bonuses.description: The Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: CHAOS ICON
bonuses.description: HERETICS within 18m of the Iconarch add +2 to their Resolve and may re-roll any 1s rolled when they make attacks.

abilities.name: Ruinous Deterioration
abilities.description: Until the start of the Iconarch's next turn, any attack made by a HERETIC within 6m inflicts +Tier ED.

abilities.name: Ruinous Invigoration
abilities.description: Until the start of the Iconarch's next turn, HERETICs within 6m gain +Tier Resilience.

name: BLESSED BLADE
description: The most devoted and skilled of the Cult Demagogue's followers, Blessed Blades serve as their fanatically loyal bodyguards. They will gladly die to protect their charge and have been silenced either by ritual or blade to ensure they never speak over their master.
skills: Default 5, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Intimidation 6, Weapon Skill 7

bonuses.name: CHAMPION
bonuses.description: The Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin.

bonuses.name: CUT THEM DOWN
bonuses.description: Enemies engaged with the Threat attempting to Fall Back must pass an Agility test (DN 2+ Double Tier); failure means that they cannot Fall Back this turn.

name: CHAOS HOUND
description:
Chaos Hounds, also known as Warhounds of Chaos, or simply Chaos Warhounds, are large, mutated canid or lupine animals that stalk the darker parts of many worlds in search of prey. They are often rounded up by Chaos cults, Beastmen herds, and other servants of the Dark Gods as hunting beasts.

The red, glinting eyes of Chaos Warhounds peer from the treeline, and saliva pools upon the litter-strewn ground as they taste the air for the scent of their next victim. Many a lone Enforcer on night-time patrol has shivered at the sound of baleful howling in the distance, only to be confronted by the low growling of the pack of Chaos Hounds that has crept up behind him whilst he was distracted.

Drawn to the lure of fresh meat, warhounds often prowl near isolated communities, searching for lone or vulnerable creatures to attack. These slinking predators have an innate kinship with Beastmen, and freely wander through the filthy and bonestrewn encampments that serve as lairs for those bestial abhumans.

Gradually the warhounds become as much a part of the herd as any Fellgor. Some Beastmen deliberately rear these vicious attack beasts, training them for battle, though they can never be truly tamed. Through all manner of cruel mistreatments the warhounds are conditioned to display particular characteristics, such as aggression and speed—not that they need much encouragement.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Weapon Skill 6

bonuses.name: ANIMAL
bonuses.description: A Chaos Hound is unable to take any actions which would require the use of hands.

abilities.name: Haunting Howl
abilities.description: Anyone who hears the Chaos Hounds must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

abilities.name: Pounce
abilities.description: Make a Charge action with the Chaos Hound. During this attack, the Hound's Slavering Jaws attack gains the Inflict (Prone) quality.

mobBonuses: PACK OF HOUNDS: When a Mob of Chaos Hounds make a melee attack, their damage is increased by +2ED.

name: CHAOS SPAWN
description:
A Chaos Spawn is a mindless mutant creature who once belonged to one of the intelligent mortal races of the galaxy and who has become so mutated through their servitude to Chaos that they devolved into a twisted and insane abomination.

Those seeking immortality and power through the ultimate attainment of Daemonhood in service to the Ruinous Powers face the constant possibility of being reduced to Chaos Spawn, either by accumulating too many mutations or being cast aside by their Chaos patrons as unworthy of further advancement because of their consistent failure to serve the will of the Chaos Gods.

More simply, they may lack the inherent qualities required for successful leadership of other Chaos servants and thus be of no further use to their patrons. Chaos warband members who are transformed into Chaos Spawn will either be abandoned by their former comrades or kept as pets or as cannon fodder, to be herded into battle along with the rest of the Lost and the Damned.

Although physically powerful and extremely resilient, Chaos Spawn are insane, mewling creatures with no mental powers or self-awareness. Their former intelligence has been sacrificed to their failed ambition. Many a Chaos Champion of great promise has ended up as a seething mound of bone and blubber, monstrous and screaming with lunatic rage.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 6 (Passive 3), Weapon Skill 9

bonuses.name: BEAST
bonuses.description: A Chaos Spawn is unable to take any actions which would require the use of hands.

bonuses.name: CHAMPION
bonuses.description: The Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin. Also, see.

bonuses.name: CREATURE OF CHAOS
bonuses.description: The GM gains 1 Ruin at the start of each of a Chaos Spawn's turns.

bonuses.name: LASHING AND FLAILING
bonuses.description: Any creature Engaged with a Chaos Spawn at the start of their turn must pass a DN 3 Athletics test; if they fail, they are knocked prone.

bonuses.name: MINDLESS
bonuses.description: A Chaos Spawn is unaffected by abilities that target the mind, and never needs to make a Resolve Test.

abilities.name: Abomination
abilities.description: Anyone who hears the Chaos Spawn must make a DN 5 Terror Test.

abilities.name: Mutated Beyond Reason
abilities.description:
At the start of each of the Chaos Spawn's turns, roll 1d3 to determine the nature of its attacks.
1: Razor-Sharp Claws: 12 +3ED / AP -4 / Range 2 [M] / Overwhelm
2: Grasping Pseudopods: 12 +3ED / AP -2 / Range 4 [M] / Reaping or Inflict (Restrained)
3: Toxic Haemorrhage: 10 +3ED / AP -2 / Range 2 [M] / Fleshbane, Inflict (Poisoned 5)

abilities.name: Surge of Mutation
abilities.description: The Chaos Spawn may spend 1 Ruin to move 2d6 metres towards an enemy and make a melee attack against them. Roll 1d3 to determine which melee attack it makes.

determination: Hideous Regeneration. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. Regain 1 Wound for each Exalted Icon rolled.

name: EXALTED CHAMPION
description:
For every Chaos Lord making their grisly mark upon the galaxy, there are dozens, if not hundreds, of common Chaos Champions vying for the favour of the Ruinous Powers. Each is an exceptional warrior; whether they are known for their martial prowess or sheer animalistic brutality, the most elite of the Chaos Champions, known as "Exalted Champions," inevitably leave a trail of corpses in their wake.

In seeking out and slaying the most vaunted of enemies, Exalted Champions hope to draw the eye of the Dark Gods. They do so with good reason -- from the perspective of a power-hungry madman, at least. Unlike so many other deities given obeisance across the galaxy, who remain distant and unknowable, if they exist at all, the Ruinous Powers of Chaos are very real entities, and willing to reward or punish their supplicants on the whim of the moment.

An Exalted Champion that proves a capable pawn in the Great Game will find themselves rewarded with abilities far beyond those of even the most accomplished mortal. Warp-given "rewards" usually appear first as blemishes or stigmata, then, as time passes, as strange protuberances or abilities that become ever more pronounced over the passage of time.

Their nature is sometimes suited to the recipient's personal agenda -- a bloodthirsty butcher may become possessed of insane strength, whereas a leader of warriors might find their commands obeyed without question. Other times these "gifts" of the Dark Gods might be hideously disfiguring, or even physically crippling, for what the Ruinous Powers consider a blessing might be seen by mortals as the vilest curse.
skills: Default 9, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 11, Leadership 10, Weapon Skill 11

bonuses.name: ASPIRE TO GLORY
bonuses.description: While allied [LEGION] Threats are within 6m of the Exalted Champion, they add +2 ED to the damage of their attacks.

bonuses.name: CHAMPION
bonuses.description: The Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin. Also, see.

abilities.name: Combi-Melta
abilities.description:
Boltgun: 10 +1ED / AP – / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Brutal, Rapid Fire (2)
Meltagun: 16 +2ED / AP -4 / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 1 / Assault, Melta

abilities.name: Exalted Pact
abilities.description: When the Exalted Champion invokes a Dark Pact, all [LEGION] Threats affected by Aspire to Glory (above) may also benefit from that Pact Boon.

name: DARK APOSTLE
description:
Dark Apostles make up the priesthood of the Dark Gods. Just as the Chaplains of the Loyalist Space Marines uphold the creeds of their Chapters, the Dark Apostles devote their lives to the propagation of the unholy word, actively spreading the worship of Chaos across the galaxy. Their efforts do not go unrewarded - Dark Apostles are surrounded by daemonic auras of protection that shimmer and writhe as they chant their blasphemous prayers.

The Dark Apostles preach that, compared to the blood and thunder of their own faith, the falsehoods of the Ecclesiarchy are but cobweb-thin tissues of superstition. These are more than idle words -- most Dark Apostles can act as direct conduits through which the Ruinous Powers can speak to mortal men.

It is not unknown for a Dark Apostle to suddenly straighten, his eyes glazing over as his mouth spits guttural and blood-flecked gibberish. Those who can understand this glottal tongue claim that it is the language of the gods themselves.

The Dark Apostles sit high in the esteem of their brethren, and their intense charisma and burning conviction inspires men to great and terrible acts. The often harsh yoke of the Imperium fosters great resentment in those of weak character, and Dark Apostles are experts at fanning those sparks into raging blazes.

When these preachers of terrible truths infiltrate an Imperial world, hidden Chaos Cults are brought together and long-fostered alliances are brought to terrible fruition. It is never long before the bodies of Adeptus Arbites, Judges and aristocrats alike, are strung from spire and cable.
skills: Default 9, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Leadership 10, Persuasion 11, Weapon Skill 11

bonuses.name: DEMAGOGUE
bonuses.description: While allied [LEGION] or HERETIC Threats are within 12m of the Dark Apostle, they may use the Dark Apostle's Resolve instead of their own.

bonuses.name: CHAMPION
bonuses.description: The Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin. Also, see.

abilities.name: For the Dark Gods!
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. This Threat makes an All-Out Attack as a Ruin Action.

abilities.name: Prayers to the Dark Gods
abilities.description: The Dark Apostle may attempt a Persuasion test as a Simple Action to perform a Chaos Prayer. The Dark Apostle knows Dark Zealotry and one other Prayer.

abilities.name: Ruinous Invocation
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin. This Threat attempts to activate a prayer or dark ritual.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 7d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: MASTER OF EXECUTIONS
description:
Masters of Executions are Chaos Space Marine warriors who have given their entire existence to the art of killing with melee attacks and now bestride battlefields like gods of war, that use warp-enhanced senses to seek their prey. They sometimes lead the forces of Chaos to battle.

Masters of Execution specialize in the slaying of enemy champions, sacrificing them to the Dark Gods in a ritual that sees his hunger for death grow even stronger. Through sorcerous rituals, they are able to attune their murderous senses to the currents of the Warp, allowing them to see the souls of their foes. Some even go so far as to gouge out one of their eyes to allow currents to coalesce in the raw and empty socket. Thus, even on the most anarchic battlefield, a Master of Execution can pick out his prey. Within a warband, Masters of Execution are often used to mete out punishment to those who seek to usurp the rule of a Chaos Lord, often in the form of a gladiatorial duel. Their expertise is evident from the gruesome array of skull and bone trophies they keep on their armour.
skills: Default 9, Awareness 13 (Passive 7), Weapon Skill 13

bonuses.name: TROPHY TAKER
bonuses.description: Each time the Master of Executions slays a player character or Adversary Threat, add 1 to Ruin.

bonuses.name: CHAMPION
bonuses.description: The Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin. Also, see.

abilities.name: Warp-Sighted Butcher
abilities.description: When an enemy moves within 6m, the Master of Executions may interrupt that movement to Charge that enemy as a Reflexive Action.

name: WARPSMITH
description:
A Warpsmith is a fallen Chaos Space Marine Techmarine who now serves the Ruinous Powers or their own cruel ambition.

Though each Warpsmith is an expert in battlefield repair and siege craft, his true calling lies in the soul forges of the Warp, especially those in the Eye of Terror. There, the spirits of captured Imperial machines are driven to madness as their physical forms are rebuilt into bestial and terrifying new shapes.

The Warpsmiths preside over their infernal industry as pioneers of mechamorphosis, as they watch Daemon Princes thrust Lesser Daemons into the cogs of giant, mechanoid birth-factories that crank out new Daemon Engines from their cable-lined wombs. When the time for conquest is finally at hand, entire armies of these growling battle engines stomp and soar into the material world under their command, the Warpsmith's bitter ambition writ large and set loose upon the Imperium of Man.

Warpsmiths tend to be obsessive characters who believe that Mankind's ambition is limited by his mortal nature. Daemons are ultimately insubstantial of form, and machines, though physically indomitable, are all but inert. Because of this, all Warpsmiths are engaged in an eternal quest to combine the strengths of all three of these elements -- mortal, daemon and machine -- whilst eradicating their weaknesses.
skills: Default 9, Awareness 13 (Passive 7), Ballistic Skill 11, Scholar 10, Tech 12

bonuses.name: CHAMPION

abilities.name: Enrage Machine Spirits
abilities.description: As a Ruin Action, Choose a CHAOS vehicle within 3m; on that vehicle's next attack, it gains +Tier bonus dice.

name: MASTER OF POSSESSION
description:
A Master of Possession is a Heretic Astartes Chaos Sorcerer who is well-versed in the forbidden art of using living hosts to contain the Daemons of the Warp and often serve as the leaders of Daemonkin warbands.

These techniques can also be used to create Daemon Engines by binding Daemons into machine hosts, a process at which Masters of Possession are almost as skilled as Warpsmiths.

Masters of Possession are also potent psychic sorcerers whose abilities can provide substantial support to Chaos Space Marine forces in battle.

Masters of Possession lead warbands of devoted warriors in pursuit of untold power. These sorcerous figures have mastered the darkest and most blasphemous lore: the art of using hosts of living flesh to house Daemonic spirits. It is they who perform the profane ceremonies of binding that imbue the Daemonkin with their Warp-born power.

Gouging a breach in the fabric of realspace through the use of sorcery, the Master of Possession draws a willing entity from the Immaterium, channelling its terrible energies into the body of a supplicant or the chassis of a war machine. So thoroughly are these dread figures steeped in blasphemous sorcery that where they walk, reality itself recoils.
skills: Default 9, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Scholar 11, Psychic Mastery 11

bonuses.name: RITES OF POSSESSION
bonuses.description: Enemy PSYKERS within 12m suffer Complications on Psychic Mastery tests for each Wrath Die that rolls 1, 2, or 3.

bonuses.name: CHAMPION
bonuses.description: The Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 3 personal Ruin. Also, see.

abilities.name: Staff of Possession
abilities.description:
17 +3ED / AP -1 / Force
A PSYKER struck by a Staff of Possession immediately suffers Perils of the Warp, adding +Tier to the tens die.

abilities.name: Malefic Sorcerer
abilities.description: The Master of Possession attempts to activate a psychic power they know. The Master of Possession knows Smite, Deny the Witch, Psyniscience, and two powers from the Malefic discipline.

abilities.name: Sacrificial Dagger

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 6d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: CHAOS SORCERER
description:
A Chaos Sorcerer is a powerful form of psyker found among the Chaos Space Marines and the other mortal forces of Chaos.

Instead of the subtle psychic manipulation and divination used by the Farseers of the Aeldari or the strength-boosting powers of the Space Marine Librarians, the sorcerers of Chaos wield death, destruction, and mutation, the mightiest powers of the Warp.

Sorcerers of Chaos shape destiny itself with arcane rituals and unspeakable pacts forged with the malefic entities -- the Daemons -- of the Empyrean. In truth, "sorcery" itself differs from other forms of psychic ability because it often requires interacting and cutting deals for knowledge and/or power with the entities of the Warp in the pursuit of one's own selfish gain.

Through the knowledge gained by such pacts, sorcerers channel the soul-blasting energies of the Warp into potent hexes and blasts of wyrdflame, and they mould the fabric of the material universe with little more than a hate-filled curse.

Because of their constant exposure to the power of Chaos, sorcerers are inevitably haunted by the prospect of eventually succumbing to crippling mutation or insanity. Though they believe they are above mortal concerns, the truth is that they, too, are only pawns, raised up and then expended by the Dark Gods for their own amusement.
skills: Default 9, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Scholar 11, Psychic Mastery 11

bonuses.name: ABHORRENT RITES
bonuses.description: Chaos Sorcerers gain additional Wrath dice on their Psychic Mastery tests equal to the game's Tier.

Power Axe: 17 +5ED / AP -2 / Force

name: CHAOS SORCERER IN TERMINATOR ARMOUR
description:
The first Chaos Sorcerers emerged from the ranks of the Thousand Sons before and during the Horus Heresy. The Thousand Sons sent their Librarians to other Legions teaching them to wield psychic powers to support their battle-brothers, creating the Librarius divisions that still exist to this day. As the Heresy began, many of these Librarians in the Traitor Legions started dabbling with profane warp-craft and making deals with daemons.

Most Sorcerers are granted gifts by their god, which further enhance their psychic powers. They are also often selfish madmen, believing themselves superior to all others and on a mighty quest for power and knowledge to increase their mental fortitude and develop new ways of using their powers. Often the visions given to Sorcerers are unattainable, subsequently driving them to extremes in their desire to achieve these goals.

Sorcerers often take part in Daemonic Pacts to increase their powers through the use of Daemonic energy. This pact bargains some form of service or payment in return for a part of the Daemon's power. The Sorcerer can use this power to unleash staggering psychic powers, in the same way as Daemons use it to maintain their grip on reality. The greatest Sorcerers have dozens of daemonic pacts to increase their powers to unimaginable ends. While this can be useful and attractive, eventually a price must be paid by the Sorcerer.

In addition to their warp powers, Chaos Sorcerers remain powerful combatants, often wielding force weapons and clad in mighty armour bedecked in talismans and etched with vile runes. Some few have managed to secure ancient suits of Tactical Dreadnought Armour, also known as Terminator Armour.
skills: Default 9, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Scholar 11, Psychic Mastery 11

name: CHAOS LORD
description:
A Chaos Lord is one of the most powerful of the Champions of Chaos who often serves as the commander of a Chaos Space Marine warband and the other forces of Chaos.

The greatest of the Champions of Chaos become Chaos Lords and are often granted hideous mutations and physical alterations by the Ruinous Powers to further their cause. Chaos Lords are so powerful as to be able to bind the other forces of Chaos to their will, although this often brings a dangerous position as advancement among the forces of Chaos is commonly achieved through the death or murder of another Chaos Lord or Champion.

Some Chaos Lords lead through brute strength, others through cunning and some are maniacs bent solely on self-aggrandisement. Others are true-believing worshipers of Chaos and possess a zealous dedication to the cause of the Dark Gods.

A Chaos Lord is ultimately always a tyrannical warrior-king who lives to bathe in the blood of worlds. He strives to bring whole star systems to their knees in the name of his patron deities. Typified by merciless ambition and fierce pride, many of these champions of disorder were once noble Chapter Masters and captains of the Adeptus Astartes, but long Terran years of unremitting war have twisted their souls beyond recovery.

It takes a being of exceptional willpower and personal magnetism to unite the warbands of Chaos Space Marines lurking in the Warp, and even then, a would-be warlord cannot be everywhere at once. Only those marked for greatness by the gods themselves can claim support from Heretic Astartes, mortals and Daemons alike.
skills: Default 11, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Ballistic Skill 13, Leadership 12, Weapon Skill 13

name: CHAOS LORD WITH JUMP PACK
description:
Chaos Lords are not necessarily those who rose through the ranks properly in a hierarchical fashion but are often those most blessed by the Chaos Gods or simply the most powerful or charismatic. The greatest Chaos Champions become Chaos Lords and are often granted with mutations and alterations by the gods to further their cause. Chaos Lords are so powerful as to be able to bind the forces of Chaos to their will, although this often brings a dangerous position as advancement is commonly achieved through killing their leader. Some Lords lead through brute strength, others through cunning and some are maniacs bent on self-aggrandizement. Others are truly worshipers of Chaos with a zealous dedication to the dark gods.

Champions often come with a mark of one of the four Chaos Gods. Champions of Khorne are savage and value physical strength and combat over cunning and strategy. Tzeentchian champions are often very knowledgeable and many of them are sorcerers. Champions of Nurgle are the most distorted and physically corrupted of Chaos' followers, their bodies dulled from pain enabling them to endure physical injury with little trauma. Slaaneshi champions are often those who seek the most intense pleasures possible and are often physically the fastest Chaos warriors due to their hyper-sensitive minds.
skills: Default 11, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Leadership 12, Pilot 12, Weapon Skill 13

name: CHAOS LORD IN TERMINATOR ARMOUR
description:
It takes a being of exceptional willpower and personal magnetism to unite the warbands of Chaos Space Marines lurking in the Warp, and even then, a would-be warlord cannot be everywhere at once. Only those marked for greatness by the gods themselves can claim support from Heretic Astartes, mortals and Daemons alike.

All Chaos Lords are imposing in stature. In the case of Chaos Space Marines, their genetically-enhanced transhuman physiques have been made even more impressive by the protean caress of the Warp. Their wargear is often as outlandish as their physical appearance; a Chaos Lord may hack his foes apart with a massive chainaxe, blast them with an ancient combi-weapon, or slice open their vehicles with a screaming Daemon Sword.

Regardless of affiliation, these conquerors of worlds invariably prefer to lead from the front. There, the visceral thrill of war is strong enough to eclipse any glimmering sense of betrayal they may feel as they rend their Loyalist brothers limb from limb.

name: HERETIC ASTARTES DAEMON PRINCE
description:
In order to attract the attention of their patrons, Chaos Champions have to perform great and terrible deeds. They sacrifice enemies and allies alike for their ambitions and risk their demise at the hands of both their foes and gods. The few that manage to avoid death and spawndom are changed beyond recognition.

While Daemon Princes come in various shapes, most are of hulking stature, displaying numerous mutations such as horns and wings. Even more notable are the supernatural powers they wield, some of which are associated with their patron god. What they maintain of former selves are the driving ambition and ruthless cunning which helped them earn their ultimate reward.

In the 41st millennium, most Daemon Princes hail from the ranks of the Chaos Space Marines, warriors with the capability and motivation to slay the populations of entire worlds, although the oldest managed to ascend during the savage age long before mankind left ancient Earth.
skills: Default 10, Awareness 11 (Passive 6), Leadership 13, Weapon Skill 13

bonuses.name: DAEMON OF TZEENTCH

bonuses.name: DAEMONIC AURA

name: HELBRUTE
description:
A Helbrute is a twisted mockery of the Space Marine Dreadnought he used to be, combining the firepower of a small tank with the mind of a frenzied psychopath. A Helbrute is piloted by a warrior who, like his Loyalist Dreadnought counterparts, has suffered extreme bodily damage in combat.

The critically injured Heretic Astartes is then bound into an amniotic sarcophagus at the combat walker's heart, connected by cybernetic nervous system implants and a Mind Impulse Unit to the controls of the war machine.

However, while Loyalist Adeptus Astartes consider it an honour to serve their Chapter for eternity as a Dreadnought, Chaos Space Marines consider such a fate to be little more than a living death -- a torturous, mocking punishment from the Ruinous Powers.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 7 (Passive 4), Ballistic Skill 9, Weapon Skill 9

name: DEFILER
description:
A Defiler is a massive Daemon Engine in the service of the Heretic Astartes of Chaos and it is a truly potent beast of war, mounted upon six massive spine-legs. It is twice the size of most other Daemon Engines and is possessed of a temper to match.

Each Defiler is roughly tank-sized, and both extremely violent in its actions and indiscriminate with who bears the brunt of its wrath. Whether using its massive Battle Cannon to destroy entire formations or ripping apart enemies with its massive claws, this engine of war acts as a harbinger of utter devastation to its foes.

Though their origins are lost to the ages, Defilers were created sometime after the end of the Horus Heresy in the early 31st Millennium on the orders of Abaddon the Despoiler to supplement the forces of the Traitor Legions, whose remaining Chaos Dreadnoughts were no longer the reliable heavy support units they had once been before their transformation into the insane cybernetic servants of the Ruinous Powers.

Defilers are truly massive beasts of war, twice the size of most other Daemon Engines and with a temperament to match. The ground shivers and melts as they stalk towards their foes on six massive, segmented legs, their great pincer-arms twitching and snipping with an impatient need to slice through warm flesh.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 10, Weapon Skill 10

name: FORGEFIEND
description:
A Forgefiend is a Daemon Engine used by the Chaos Space Marine Traitor Legions and the forces of the Dark Mechanicum. The Forgefiend was devised by Dark Mechanicum Warpsmiths to sow death and destruction amongst enemy forces from afar.

The Forgefiend is roughly centauroid in form and stands on four powerful legs. The daemonic beast's two arms are replaced with twin weapon-mounts that carry hell-forged parodies of Imperial armaments.

When a Daemon Engine is forged in the citadels of the Warp, part of the fire that burns there is transferred into the heart of the engine itself.

It is this brimstone-scented furnace that powers the engine's mechanical motion, but also that provides the baleful energies it pours into the ranks of its foes.
skills: Default 4, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 10, Weapon Skill 8

When this Threat is destroyed, roll 1d6. If you roll a Complication, the Threat explodes:
Forgefiend Explosion: 12 +5ED / Blast (10)

determination: Daemonic Determination. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 12d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.
threatOptions:
A Forgefiend may replace both its Hades Autocannons with Ectoplasma Cannons. It may replace its Daemon Jaws with an Ectoplasma Cannon.
Ectoplasma Cannon: 15 +3ED / AP -3 / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 0 / Blast (6), Heavy (12), Supercharge

name: MAULERFIEND
description:
A Maulerfiend is a Daemon Engine used by the Chaos Space Marine Traitor Legions and the forces of the Dark Mechanicum. Unlike its counterpart the Chaos Forgefiend, the Maulerfiend was designed by the Warpsmiths of the Dark Mechanicum for close-range combat. Maulerfiends thunder towards their foes like giant attack beasts loosed from the leash. The eyes of these beasts glow with the balefire of the Warp as ectoplasmic drool drizzles down through their great fanged maws.

The Maulerfiend's primary limbs end in prehensile, clawed Power Fists powerful enough to tear an Astartes Dreadnought limb from limb. Should a Maulerfiend catch a squad of less protected warriors, they will scissor them apart or simply squeeze them into paste with a flex of their claws and a growl of satisfaction.

The Maulerfiend is also known as a "Stalker-tank" or a "Scaler" to Imperial troops, as these multi-limbed monsters have the strength and agility to climb even the most sheer of walls, and no place is truly safe from a Maulerfiend that has taken the scent of its prey.
skills: Default 4, Athletics 8, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 8, Weapon Skill 10

bonuses.name: MONSTROUS CREATURE
bonuses.description: This Threat is immune to the Fear, Pinned, and Staggered conditions.

bonuses.name: REND AND TEAR
bonuses.description: This Threat reduces the Multi-Attack penalty for melee attacks by 2DN and may use a different melee weapon for each attack in the Multi-Attack.

abilities.name: Terrifying Presence
abilities.description: Anyone that can see this Threat must make a DN 3 Terror Test.

abilities.name: Daemonforge
abilities.description: When the Threat makes a shooting or melee attack, spend 1 Ruin to add +Tier dice to the attack.

abilities.name: Explodes
abilities.description:
When this Threat is destroyed, roll 1d6. If you roll a Complication, the Threat explodes:
Maulerfiend Explosion: 12 +5ED / Blast (10)

determination: Daemonic Determination. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 12d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.
threatOptions:
A Maulerfiend may replace its Magma Cutters with Lasher Tendrils.
Lasher Tendrils: 15 +3ED / AP -2 / Blast (6)
The Maulerfiend cannot be harmed by its own Lasher Tendril attacks.

name: VENOMCRAWLER
description:
Pounding forwards upon bladed limbs come the horrors known as Venomcrawlers. Grotesque amalgams of metal, flesh and daemonic entities, these monstrosities hiss and snarl as they scuttle towards their prey. Fleshy tongues flap from snarling maws and Soulflayer tendrils lash back and forth, all tasting the air for the scent of their enemies' fear.

Upon locking onto their target, the Venomcrawlers emit an ear-splitting screech. Pent-up Warp energy is channelled into their Excruciator Cannons, coalescing into hails of solid shot that rip through entire ranks of armoured foes with ease.

With their guns still screaming the Daemon Engines close ground on their victims, using their eviscerating claws to prise open vehicles and skewer those within. Soulflayer tendrils thrash frantically, mangling bodies and flensing them of their essence. As the Venomcrawlers continue to butcher, their fanged mouths gape ever wider, drawing the souls of those slain into their vast mechanical abdomens.

Venomcrawlers are uniquely valued both off and on the battlefield. Not only can their repositories of stored Warp energy be siphoned in order to create fresh Daemon Engines, but they can be used in the thick of combat to weaken the fabric of reality. Masters of Possession are particularly adept at drawing upon this reservoir to lure the daemonic servants of the Chaos Gods into existence. At battle's end these daemons are hastily consumed by the Venomcrawler, their essences used to replenish its depleted Warp stores.
skills: Default 4, Athletics 8, Awareness 10 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 8, Weapon Skill 8

bonuses.name: MONSTROUS CREATURE
bonuses.description: This Threat is immune to the Fear, Pinned, and Staggered conditions.

bonuses.name: RESERVOIR OF DAEMONIC ENERGY
bonuses.description: Any allied [LEGION] PSYKER within 9m of this Threat may add +2 dice to any Psychic Mastery test.

abilities.name: Terrifying Presence

Venomcrawler Explosion: 11 +4ED / Blast (6)

determination: Daemonic Determination. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 11d6. Daemons can roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: HAARKEN WORLDCLAIMER
description:
Before every doom, there is a portent, before every apocalypse a sign. Haarken Worldclaimer is that dark omen given form, and the otherworldly destruction he heralds is the coming of the Warmaster of Chaos himself -- Abaddon the Despoiler, Lord of the Black Legion.

Haarken Worldclaimer takes a heinous joy in his role as the mouthpiece of Abaddon, for it is he that proclaims the death of worlds. He does so not with some quotidian threat or hollow boast, but by driving a spear of terror and confusion deep into the heart of citizen and soldier alike.

In such a fashion, he prepares the way for the coming of the Black Legion, his Raptor hosts descending on tongues of flame to bring panic and despair with each murderous onslaught.

Long ago, the Traitor Legions learned the value of fear. A planet undermined by doubt -- or better yet, paralysed by it -- is one already half-conquered. Worldclaimer is a scholar and collector of dark knowledge as well as a leader of men, and he knows the power of words well chosen.
skills: Default 11, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Ballistic Skill 13, Leadership 12, Weapon Skill 13

bonuses.name: LORD OF CHAOS
bonuses.description: While allied [LEGION] Threats are within 6m of this Threat, they add +Tier dice when making an Attack.

bonuses.name: BLACK LEGION
bonuses.description: When the Threat makes a ranged attack at close range, or a melee attack when Charging, it gains +2 bonus dice. It also has +1 Resolve (included).

bonuses.name: CHAMPION
bonuses.description: The Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 7 personal Ruin. Also, see.

bonuses.name: HEADTAKER
bonuses.description: Each time this Threat kills a player character, or an Adversary Threat, he immediately gains 1 personal Ruin, and adds +6m to the range of the Herald of the Apocalypse rule.

bonuses.name: HERALD OF THE APOCALYPSE
bonuses.description: Enemies within 6m of this Threat add +1 to the difficulty of all Resolve tests.

bonuses.name: LORD OF TERROR
bonuses.description: When an enemy within 6m makes a Resolve test, they treat any Wrath die result of 1, 2, or 3 as a Complication.

abilities.name: Lord of Raptors
abilities.description: As a simple action, select BLACK LEGION allies within 6m equal to his Intellect. Until the start of this Threat's next turn, they can re-roll all failures on attacks. Raptors may also re-roll ED.

abilities.name: Chance for Glory
abilities.description: When the Chaos Lord makes an attack, you may spend 1 Ruin to take a Chance for Glory. If he does so, then until the start of his next turn, all of his attacks, and any attacks made by allies affected by Lord of Chaos (above) inflict +Tier ED.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 8d6. The Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: ABADDON THE DESPOILER
description:
Abaddon, also known as "Abaddon the Despoiler," once named First Captain Ezekyle Abaddon, whose preferred title is "Warmaster of the Imperium Nihilus," and is sometimes called by others the "Warmaster of Chaos," is a Chaos Lord and the greatest Champion of Chaos Undivided in the galaxy.

Abaddon is the master of the Black Legion of Chaos Space Marines and is rumoured to be the clone-progeny of the Warmaster Horus, the greatest Traitor in Imperial history, and at one time his most favoured son as the first captain of the Sons of Horus Legion.

Abaddon is now infamous for leading Black Crusades, the terrible military campaigns during which the normally fractious forces of Chaos unite under his leadership and launch a massive attack against the Imperium from within the Eye of Terror.

What few realised at the time was that these campaigns were part of an overall strategic plan called the "Crimson Path" intended to lead the forces of Chaos from the Eye of Terror all the way to Holy Terra itself, which reached its fruition in the final days of the 41st Millennium. Abaddon intends to succeed where his predecessor Horus failed, breaking the Imperial Palace wide open and tearing the Emperor's rotting corpse from the Golden Throne.
skills: Default 13, Awareness 14 (Passive 7), Ballistic Skill 15, Leadership 14, Weapon Skill 15

bonuses.name: THE DESPOILER
bonuses.description: While allied CHAOS Threats are within 6m of Abaddon, they add +1 to Speed when Charging, and may re-roll any dice which roll 1 when making an attack.

bonuses.name: CHAMPION
bonuses.description: The Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 13 personal Ruin. Also, see.

bonuses.name: BLACK LEGION
bonuses.description: When the Threat makes a ranged attack at close range, or a melee attack when Charging, it gains +2 bonus dice. It also has +1 Resolve (included).

bonuses.name: MARK OF CHAOS ASCENDANT
bonuses.description: Abaddon has all four Marks of Chaos.

bonuses.name: PARAGON OF HATRED
bonuses.description: Abaddon adds +2 to Speed when he Charges and reduces the DN increase for a Multi-Attack in melee by an amount equal to the game's Tier.

bonuses.name: TACTICAL DREADNOUGHT ARMOUR
bonuses.description: A warrior in Terminator Armour ignores the Heavy quality on any weapons they wield.

abilities.name: Eternal Vendetta
abilities.description: Select a single enemy before the first round of combat. Any BLACK LEGION ally within 6m of Abaddon may re-roll failures on ED against that chosen enemy.

abilities.name: Talon of Horus (Shooting)
abilities.stats: 12 +2ED / AP -1 / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 4 / Assault, Brutal, Heavy (3), Rapid Fire (4)

abilities.name: Lord of the Traitor Legions
abilities.description: As a simple action, select HERETIC ASTARTES allies within 6m equal to his Intellect. Until the start of Abaddon's next turn, they can re-roll all failures on attacks. BLACK LEGION allies may also re-roll ED.

abilities.name: Crimson Path
abilities.description: When Abaddon makes an attack, you may spend 1 Ruin to walk upon the Crimson Path. If he does so, then until the start of his next turn, all of his attacks, and any attacks made by allies affected by The Despoiler (above) inflict +Tier ED.

abilities.name: You Have Not Seen the Last…
abilities.description: If Abaddon would be slain, he is instead restored to 1 Wound, and he withdraws to his ship by teleport, swearing revenge. Add 2 to Ruin.

determination: Dark Destiny. Roll 10d6. Abaddon may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds. For each Exalted Icon rolled, recover 1 Shock.

name: HURON BLACKHEART
description:
Lufgt Huron, also known as "Huron Blackheart" and the "Tyrant of Badab," was once the Chapter Master of the Astral Claws and self-claimed Imperial governor of the world of Badab Primaris in the Maelstrom Zone of the Ultima Segmentum.

But ultimately, Huron was corrupted in his ambitious pursuit of power and he tainted most of his Chapter as well, leading them into an open rebellion against the Imperium of Man, known as the Badab War, which lasted from 901-912.M41.

Badly wounded at the end of his rebellion and bound to machines which keep him alive and forever in pain, Huron is now a scarred creature of hate. His machine claw clicking, he has strode to battle time and again, followed by his Daemonic companion the Hamadrya, and each time the agony of his existence grows and the spite within him deepens.

Reborn as the Chaos Lord "Huron Blackheart," he is an inhuman servant of Chaos who now lives only to bleed the Imperium he once served. Master of the warband of piratical Chaos Space Marines called the Red Corsairs and Lord of the Maelstrom, he is the dark-souled king of an empire of monsters.

Dwelling within the swirling madness of the Maelstrom, Blackheart has slowly built an empire amongst the Renegades and Heretics of that great Warp rift that will soon rival the strength of the forces of Chaos that call the Eye of Terror home. Reaving into the Imperium at the head of a fleet of Renegades and Traitors, he has grown in power even as the light of the Imperium has grown dim and tattered.
skills: Default 11, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Ballistic Skill 13, Leadership 14, Weapon Skill 13

bonuses.name: LORD OF CHAOS
bonuses.description: While allied [LEGION] Threats are within 6m of this Threat, they add +Tier dice when making an Attack.

bonuses.name: REAVER LORD

abilities.name: The Tyrant of Badab

abilities.name: The Hamadrya
abilities.description: Huron can draw upon the power of the bizarre creature that accompanies him as a Ruin Action. By spending 1 Ruin, Huron gains the PSYKER keyword until the start of his next turn and may immediately attempt to use one Dark Hereticus psychic power, with a Psychic Mastery of 13.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 9d6. The Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: FABIUS BILE
description:
Fabius Bile, also called the "Clone Lord," the "Primogenitor," the "Manflayer" and "the Spider," is a Chaos Space Marine Apothecary and Chaos Lord, originally the Chief Apothecary of the Emperor's Children Legion, who has repeatedly attempted to use his extensive knowledge of cloning and genetic engineering to create superhuman beings under his control.

The goal of his quest for knowledge is to match and then exceed the Emperor of Mankind's original scientific achievement in creating the Primarchs and the transhuman Adeptus Astartes, in the hope of creating a truly perfect Human form.

Travelling the galaxy more widely than any other Chaos Lord of the Traitor Legions, Bile has earned a number of epithets and aliases from those who have suffered the effects of his vile experiments. On Dimmamar, Bile was known as the "Chem-master", for there he changed the atomic composition of the air until the population was forced to ingest his transformative serums or slowly suffocate.

On Arden IX and in the Bray System he is "Manflayer," for there he would wear the skins of those who opposed him as a great stitched cloak, forcing the skinless survivors to carry the garment behind him like a bridal train.

To the wretched tribes living among the ravaged hives of Paramar V he is the "Clone Lord," for he vat-grew obedient twins of every firstborn child and replaced them with their doppelgangers the better to guide the planet's descent into darkness.
skills: Default 11, Awareness 12 (Passive 6), Ballistic Skill 13, Leadership 12, Weapon Skill 13

bonuses.name: CHIRURGEON
bonuses.description: At the start of each turn, Fabius Bile regains Wounds equal to the game's Tier.

bonuses.name: CHAMPION
bonuses.description: The Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 5 personal Ruin. Also, see.

bonuses.name: SURGICAL PRECISION
bonuses.description: When Fabius Bile makes a melee attack, the attack scores a Critical Hit if the Wrath die rolls a 4, 5, or 6.

abilities.name: Enhance Warriors
abilities.description:
Select a number of UNDIVIDED HERETIC ASTARTES allies equal to Fabius Bile's Intellect and roll 1d3 to determine how they are enhanced.
1. +2 Strength (increases melee damage)
2. +2 Toughness (increases Resilience, Determination, and Max Wounds)
3. +2 Weapon Skill

abilities.name: The Chirurgeon (weapon)
abilities.description:
10 +1ED / AP -1 / Reaping
When Fabius Bile makes a melee attack, he may make up to Tier attacks with The Chirurgeon as well.

abilities.name: The Chirurgeon
abilities.description: As a Ruin Action, attempt a Medicae test with a DN of 3 on an UNDIVIDED HERETIC ASTARTES ally within 3m. If successful, the ally heals 1d3+Tier Wounds, and regains all lost Shock.

abilities.name: You Have Not Seen the Last…
abilities.description: If Fabius Bile would be slain, it turns out that this was just a clone, and the real Fabius Bile is still out there. Add 2 to Ruin.

determination: Spend 1 Ruin to roll 8d6. The Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.

name: VASHTORR, THE ARKIFANE
description:
Vashtorr, also known as Vashtorr the Arkifane, who bears the titles of "Master of the Soul Forges" and the "God in the Machine," is the Greater Daemon of Chaos who rules over the Forge of Souls where Daemon Weapons and Daemon Engines are forged within the Immaterium's Realm of Chaos. Vashtorr serves Chaos Undivided and claims to have no connection to any of the four major Chaos Gods, having come into existence in the Warp as a result of mortals' obsessive pursuit of technological innovation at all costs -- especially inventions that resulted in unexpected and terrible consequences.

Vashtorr is the Daemonic demigod of inventors, engineers, scientists and artisans. He is curiosity and innovation shorn of moral conscience and driven to its darkest extremes. Empowered by the ceaseless inquiring of mortal minds, Vashtorr embodies the mortal need to understand and then enslave natural forces to their will, and to eventually achieve technological apotheosis at any cost.
skills: Default 12, Awareness 13 (Passive 6), Scholar 13, Tech 13

bonuses.name: A GHOST IN THE MACHINE
bonuses.description: When an enemy within 18m attempts to make a ranged attack against Vashtorr, count all the range values of their ranged weapons as half (round up) their normal values.

bonuses.name: CHAMPION
bonuses.description: This Threat may take Ruin Actions and has 13 personal Ruin. Also, see.

bonuses.name: DAEMONIC AURA
bonuses.description: Vashtorr has an Armour Rating of *4 in addition to its armour listed above.

bonuses.name: LORD OF TERROR
bonuses.description: When an enemy within 6m makes a Resolve test, they treat any Wrath die result of 1, 2, or 3 as a Complication.

bonuses.name: MONSTROUS CREATURE
bonuses.description: This Threat is immune to the Fear, Terror, Pinned, and Staggered conditions.

bonuses.name: UNHOLY MECHANISMS
bonuses.description: While an allied DAEMON ENGINE is within 6m of Vashtorr, it adds +Tier ED to the damage of all of its weapons.

abilities.name: Daemonic Terror
abilities.description: Anyone who can see this Threat must make a DN 5 Terror Test.

abilities.name: Agonise Machine Spirits
abilities.description: Tech Interaction Attacks from Vashtorr may target Vehicles, rolling against the Pilot skill of the vehicle's PILOT. If successful, in addition to other effects, the vehicle is Restrained.

abilities.name: Cogitated Fates
abilities.description: As a Ruin Action, Vashtorr may select a single CHAOS vehicle, a CHAOS MONSTER, up to 5 CHAOS elites, or a CHAOS mob within 12m. On the selected allies next ranged attacks, they gain +Tier bonus dice.

abilities.name: Forge-Hot Demise
abilities.description: Vashtorr's physical form detonates. This is a Blast (6) centred on Vashtorr's body, inflicting 13 +6ED damage with AP -1, and the Inflict (On Fire) quality.

determination: Body of Unholy Artifice. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 9d6. The Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds and may re-roll any die which rolls 1.

name: PLAGUE MARINE
description:
Plague Marines are those Chaos Space Marines who have wholly dedicated their lives and souls to the service of the Chaos God Nurgle.

Within their corpulent and disgusting power armour their bodies are bloated with disease, swollen with corruption and rank with decay even as they no longer are capable of feeling pain, the greatest mutational "gift" given to them by the Plague Lord.

The first Plague Marines were warriors of the Death Guard Legion, trapped in the Warp upon their starships when the virulent Destroyer Plague struck their fleet. Mortarion and his Legion offered themselves up to the service of the Lord of Decay in return for their lives and the end of the constant suffering caused by the unnatural disease.

Their bodies became bloated and swollen with the corruption festering within them, but they no longer felt the agony of the Warp-pox and did not die from its horrific symptoms.

Since then, many Heretic Astartes have dedicated themselves to Nurgle, though few achieve the vaunted ranks of the Death Guard. Those who truly wish to join this most foetid of cadres must first swear loyalty to the Primarch Mortarion -- only then will Nurgle bestow upon them the corrupting ague that created the Plague Marines.
skills: Default 7, Awareness 9 (Passive 5), Ballistic Skill 9, Weapon Skill 9

abilities.name: Boltgun
abilities.stats: 10 +1ED / AP – / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Brutal, Rapid Fire (2)

abilities.name: Cloud of Flies
abilities.description: When this Threat is the target of a ranged attack, they may spend 1 Ruin as a Reflexive Action. Against that attack, and until the start of the Threat's next turn, the Threat and all NURGLE allies within Contagion Range gain +2 Defence as if in heavy cover.

bonuses.name: CHAMPION
bonuses.description: This Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 Personal Ruin. Also, see.

bonuses.name: Contagion: NURGLE'S GIFT
bonuses.description: If a creature is within Contagion Range of this Threat, they reduce their Resilience by 1, and they roll 1 fewer dice when rolling Determination.

threatOptions:
PESTILENT PANOPLY: A Plague Marine may replace their Boltgun with a second Plague Knife. These knives gain the Paired quality.
SPECIAL WEAPONS: A Plague Marine may exchange their boltgun for one of the following:
Blight Launcher: 13 +4ED / AP -2 / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Assault, Barrage, Blast (6), Inflict (Poisoned 4)
Plague Spewer: 12 +2ED / AP -1 / Range 4-8-12 / Salvo 2 / Flamer, Heavy (6), Poisoned (4)
Meltagun: 16 +2ED / AP -4 / Range 6-12-18 / Salvo 1 / Assault, Melta
Plague Belcher: 10 +1ED / Range 4-8-12 / Salvo 1 / Assault, Flamer, Inflict (Poisoned), Spread
Mk I Plasma Gun: 15 +4ED / AP -3 / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Rapid Fire (2), Volatile (d6)
MELEE WEAPONS: A Plague Marine may exchange their boltgun for one of the following:
Bubotic Axe: 13 +5ED / AP -2 / Inflict (Poisoned 4), Rending (1)
Mace of Contagion: 13 +5ED / AP -1 / Inflict (Poisoned 4), Unwieldy (2)
Flail of Corruption: 14 +4ED / AP -2 / Range 2 [M] / Brutal, Inflict (Poisoned 4), Overwhelming
Great Plague Cleaver: 16 +6ED / AP -3 / Range 2 [M] / Brutal, Inflict (Poisoned 4), Unwieldy (2)

name: POXWALKER
description:
Shambling across the battlefield in reeking hordes, Poxwalkers engulf their enemies in a rotting tide. They are the cursed victims of Nurgle's plagues, transformed into the unliving weapons of the Death Guard and other servants of the Plague God. Amongst the countless diseases propagated by the Death Guard and Chaos Cults of Nurgle, none is more fearsome than Nurgle's Rot. This perfect plague is both spiritual and physical in nature, inflicting a drawn-out and horrific decline upon the victim that eventually erodes their soul, while leaving their body as a plague-ridden husk.

Victims of the Walking Pox find their bodies rotting and shutting down until death eventually takes them. Yet this is not the end. The sufferer remains cruelly conscious and aware, unlike a zombie, trapped within their corpse as it reanimates with a rictus grin and staggers off in search of the living. Their flesh mutates even after death, sprouting bloated, pulsating tentacles and horn-like growths from their skulls similar to those of Nurgle's Daemonic Plaguebearers.

Simply hearing the mindless, groaning cacophony of the Poxwalkers is enough to infect the souls of all but the most faithful Imperial citizens, leading to massed outbreaks even within fortresses and cities that appear inviolate.
skills: Default 3, Awareness 4 (Passive 2), Weapon Skill 5

bonuses.name: Contagion: NURGLE'S GIFT
bonuses.description: If a creature is within Contagion Range of this Threat, they reduce their Resilience by 1, and they roll 1 fewer dice when rolling Determination.

bonuses.name: MINDLESS
bonuses.description: This Threat automatically passes Resolve tests.

bonuses.name: CURSE OF THE WAKING POX
bonuses.description: Enemies slain while Poisoned by this Threat will become a new Poxwalker in the following round.

mobAbilities:
UNENDING HORDE: Each time a member of this Mob is slain, roll 1d6: on a 6, that Poxwalker is returned to the mob.
MUTANT STRAIN: When the mob makes an attack, spend 1 Ruin. The mob's attacks gain the Mortal (1) quality, but if a Wrath Complication is rolled on the attack, 1d3 Poxwalkers are slain.

name: BLIGHTLORD TERMINATOR
description:
Blightlord Terminators are an elite formation of shock troops utilised exclusively by the Death Guard. Bound as they are to their Cataphractii warplate, these deadly warriors stalk relentlessly towards the foe's battlelines with their deadly array of virulent weaponry mowing down the enemy's ranks with contemptuous ease. At the last, the Terminators break into a lumbering charge, hefting huge weapons with which to hack and bludgeon the enemy. Flails of corruption entangle weapons and limbs in sizzling, corrosive barbs. Bubotic Axes and Baleswords tear ragged wounds into which a thousand poxes seep. By the time the Blightlord Terminators stomp on in search of new victims, nothing remains of their enemies but maggot-riddled corpses.

Combining the protective powers of Cataphractii war plate with the diseased resilience bestowed by Nurgle's gifts, Blightlord Terminators are terrifyingly hard to kill. They take great pride in this fact, advancing contemptuously into the teeth of the fiercest firestorms, mocking their enemies' attempts to lay them low.
skills: Default 8, Awareness 11 (Passive 6), Ballistic Skill 10, Leadership 9, Weapon Skill 11

abilities.name: Combi-Bolter
abilities.stats: 10 +1ED / AP – / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 4 / Brutal, Heavy (3), Rapid Fire (3)

abilities.name: Break their Spirits
abilities.description: Spend 1 Ruin after killing an enemy with a melee attack to force all enemies within 6m of the slain foe to take a Fear Test with a DN of 2 +Tier.

bonuses.name: CHAMPION
bonuses.description: The Threat may use Ruin Actions and has 1 personal Ruin. Also, see.

bonuses.name: Contagion: NURGLE'S GIFT
bonuses.description: If a creature is within Contagion Range of this Threat, they reduce their Resilience by 1, and they roll 1 fewer dice when rolling Determination.

bonuses.name: CATAPHRACTIII TERMINATOR ARMOUR
bonuses.description: A warrior in Terminator Armour ignores the Heavy quality on any weapons they wield.

determination: Disgustingly Resilient. Page 91. Spend 1 Ruin to roll 9d6. This Threat may roll Determination against Mortal Wounds.
threatOptions:
PESTILENT PANOPLY: Any Blightlord Terminator may replace their Balesword with one of the following.
Bubotic Axe: 14 +5ED / AP -2 / Inflict (Poisoned 4), Rending (1)
A Blightlord Terminator may replace both his combi-bolter and Balesword with a Flail of Corruption:
Flail of Corruption: 15 +4ED / AP -2 / Range 2 [M] / Brutal, Inflict (Poisoned 4), Overwhelming
COMBI WEAPONS: Any Blightlord Terminator may exchange their Combi-Bolter for a Combi-Weapon, combining a Boltgun with a weapon from the Special Weapons list.
Boltgun: 10 +1ED / AP – / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Brutal, Rapid Fire (2)
HEAVY WEAPONS: One in five Chaos Terminators may exchange their Combi-Bolter for one of the following:
Reaper Autocannon: 14 +1ED / AP -2 / Range 18-36-54 / Salvo 4 / Heavy (8), Rapid Fire (2)
Blight Launcher: 13 +4ED / AP -2 / Range 12-24-36 / Salvo 2 / Assault, Barrage, Blast (6), Inflict (Poisoned 4)
Plague Spewer: 12 +2ED / AP -1 / Range 4-8-12 / Salvo 2 / Flamer, Heavy (6), Poisoned (4)

name: DEATHSHROUD TERMINATOR
description:
The Deathshroud, or Deathshroud Terminators, known as the "Pale Harvestmen," the "Scythes of Nurgle" and the "Eyes of Mortarion," are Chaos Terminators of the Death Guard Traitor Legion who serve as the Daemon Primarch Mortarion's elite warriors.

Every one of these plague-ridden Heretic Astartes are redolent with a miasma of fear and menace. Such a reputation is richly deserved. Swollen with unnatural power, the Deathshroud tower over their enemies. Rusted gauntlets and squirming tentacles clutch huge battle scythes known as Manreapers, cursed weapons that slice heads from shoulders and limbs from torsos with every swing. Clouds of plague flies boil around the Deathshroud, while vile smog spills from vents in their armour to choke and blind their foes.

The warriors of the Deathshroud are sublimely skilled, whirling and striking with a speed that belies their massive, distended frames. Yet it is not merely their abilities in battle that make them so feared. The Deathshroud are the handpicked champions of Mortarion, his dark emissaries, and wherever they go they bear the authority of their gene-sire with them.
skills: Default 9, Awareness 11 (Passive 6), Ballistic Skill 10, Leadership 9, Weapon Skill 13

abilities.name: Emissaries of Death

name: BIOLOGUS PUTRIFIER
description:
The great labour of the Death Guard is to spread Nurgle's bounteous gifts to every corner of realspace. The Biologus Putrifiers have a vital role to play in this process, for it is they who refine the batches of diseased slurry brewed by the Foul Blightspawn and distil them to utmost potency.

Biologus Putrifiers bear a unique mutation: lidless, milky eyes that grow like cysts concealed beneath their flesh. Known as "occulobes," the gaze of these foul orbs can penetrate armour, flesh and bone to perceive every nuance of an infection's spread through a living body.

Driven by an obsessive desire to test their plague-batches to perfection, Biologus Putrifiers take a very active role in spreading disease upon the field of battle. From their backs dangle racks of Blight Grenades, churning with the latest strains of noxious plagues to issue from the disease factories.
skills: Default 9, Awareness 13 (Passive 7), Scholar 11, Medicae 10, Tech 10

abilities.description: As a Ruin Action, this Threat or one DEATH GUARD ally within 7m immediately makes a ranged attack with a Blight Grenade (if they have one). They may even do this if engaged in melee, and they will not be affected by the grenade.
